description:
Came here four days ago on Friday: stayed for three hours just eating and talking. (:

My partner and I spent the day at the Golden Gate park getting into the California Academy of Sciences for free and got a back-end tour of the place by my friend that works there.. and then we went to the Conservatory of Flowers.

It was a really nice day. 

And then we came here for the paella. He's been here before (and two of my friends really like this place as well). We got the seafood one with a pitcher of sangria. We also got the potato tapas.. with the garlic sauce (it was bomb). I highly recommend the potatoes. 

Is it the best paella? Maybe not (def not, but it's pretty good). I felt like it was missing a little something (but, that might just be my taste buds). 

I'm really curious to taste what the sausage one tastes like..
author: Lilian L.

description:
Although often crowded here, the establishment is a nice little place to grab a bite with friends. I came at night on a weekend, and boy was this place rowdy (perhaps too much so). It honestly felt like bar vibes--it was hard to hold a conversation with my friends over the consistently loud chatter of other tables. There was also live music, with two musicians rotating around the tables playing songs, which contributed to the noisy sounds. 

On the bright side, the food was fairly good and super cheap. I opted for a meat platter along with several tapas, including fried cod, asparagus, cabbage, and calamari. The meat from the meat platter (chicken, carne asada, etc) was unfortunately very dry and hard to chew. The potatoes that formed the base of the dish, however, were delicious and well flavored. The tapas were all very good, with the fried cod especially standing out, as it pairs deliciously with the spinach sauce it comes from. 

The sangria is a must order drink! Delicious and lightly fruity. Definitely explains why the atmosphere here is so lively. Grab a single drinkf or $5 or a pitcher for $19--the prices are even more reasonable during happy hour.
author: Karen Y.

description:
Randomly found this place while walking around Mission. We didn't even check reviews before walking in, but no regrets. We had their lobster paella and some sangrias. Lobster tasted fresh and sweet, paella was cooked and seasoned to perfection. Portion was more than enough for 2 people (we had leftovers), but were also tiny people who don't eat much, haha. The lobster portion was also very generous for the price I'd say. 

It would be a nice place for a date, but it does get very loud in there. The restaurant is quite small so maybe call ahead if you have parties larger than 4.
author: Elle T.

description:
I've been coming to this little Spanish restaurant in The Mission for several years now. It's one of the few places that I never get tired of and am happy to keep coming back to. 

The place is compact but they're able to accommodate parties of up to 20 people in their private room or upper level. 
The place is tastefully decorated in a Flamenco theme and a large poster of none other than Penelope Cruz in Volver by Almodovar. The best of modern Spanish cinema. 

You always get a basket of bread and butter to start with. That alone is so comforting and good. I usually go through about 2 baskets per meal. 

During happy hour, you get a great deal on their awesome pitchers of Sangria. Tastes like juice but you get a nice buzz after one glass. 

There are so many great appetizers (tapas) to choose from. I usually get the grilled asparagus w lemon cream, grilled garlic mushrooms, garlic prawns, little Spanish chorizos, crunchy cabbage, and the creamy spicy potatoes (patatas bravas). 

If you've got time and an appetite, order a Paella. It's a saffron rice casserole topped with different meats or vegetables enough for 2-8 people depending on the size. It takes about 30 minutes to make. 

My favorite one is the Matanzas which has chicken, pork, and sausage. Served with a lemon wedge- squeeze it over the paella for an extra kick.
If you want to get really fancy, you can have the seafood paella with shrimp, calamari, mussels, and even lobster tails for an extra charge. 
It's so good, you'll want to scrape off the last bit of rice stuck to the pan. 

Try the traditional Spanish dessert- Crema Catalana. It's similar to a Crème Brûlée.  

After ordering all that food and drink, you'll be amazed at how little you'll pay per person compared to other restaurants in the area. 

Once in a while, you may get treated to live music by a solo mariachi singer with a guitar and a nice pair of lungs that fills the entire restaurant with his Mexican Rancheras. Feel free to tip him as he passes by your table. 

Call ahead for reservations.
author: Mitzi G.

description:
I really love this restaurant! We went around Mission district, this day was holiday, so many people there and hard to find a empty table. One of my friends knows this restaurant, and we finally got a seat there.
Reasonable and very very delicious, you can enjoy Spain there definitely.
author: Shun Y.

description:
Came here for paella. Got the seafood paella.

Also got some tapas: jamon iberico + rabbit stew + garlic shrimp and sangria

Will start with the tapas. The jamon iberico was very low quality (comparing to what I had in spain so I might be a bit spoiled). You get only a couple of cuts and it was just ok. It's not really fatty and much more salty than others ones I've had. The rabbit stew was pretty standard I thought, some decent homey flavor, nothing special though. The garlic shrimp was probably my favorite tapa. Considering I like both garlic and shrimp, it was expected. I liked dipping the bread into that sauce. (They give you bread with the spicy mayo sauce that is usually dripped on patatas bravas).

The paella, wow....so disappointing. There wasn't much flavor, the texture wasn't right. The seafood was small. There was no crust in the paella, normally there are some mildly burnt pieces but here it had none. The other rice just seemed to be very soggy and somehow still not full of flavor. The shrimp was also really tiny and therefore a bit more dry (didn't even finish the seafood in the paella).

Sangria also didn't seem like it was fruity enough so not sure how long it was marinated for.
author: Victor D.

description: Great paella and cute ambiance. Service was a bit slow, but overall nice dinner spot in the Mission.
author: Margaret F.

description: The food was good. Sad, that I was not able to try paella since I was told it takes an hour to be served. We try the calamari, Croqueta de Pollo, Salchichas which was very good. It can be more that 30 mins. wait when is busy.
author: Ana C.

description: Came here on cinco de mayo with a friend.  When we got there, there was actually a really long line.  We probably waited about 30 mins.  We then go seated and the waitress asked if we wanted to sit in the "cave" (i mean i didn't really want to stare at my friend in a cave in the dark....haha) or at a regular table.  We chose the regular table.  We started off with a pitcher of red sangria (pretty good, but tastes too sweet) then we ordered potato pancake, garlic shrimp, this beefy stew(which was too salty), and grilled asparagus which was a little too bland but it was veggies.  Definitely would come back here to try other things.
author: Irene M.

description:
I really liked this tapas bar! This is located in the Mission District and the inside is pretty vibrant. To start--get the sangria! It's delicious and refreshing. They also give you bread with salsa brava to start. I loved it! 

This has an extensive list of paellas and tapas. We had the mushrooms with garlic, calamari, chicken with garlic, and ropa vieja. Each was a great amount to get a taste of everything. I thought the chicken was very flavorful (maybe a little salty, but not tooo bad). I really enjoyed the ropa vieja (one of my favorite dishes) and the chicken. This is a fun spot to go to in the Mission District! I'd definitely come back again. I want to try their own tapas dishes--they have things for both vegetarians/meat eaters. 

At the end of the night, we were greeted with a random band who came in to perform. It was a nice end to a lovely evening!
author: Natalie M.

description: Came here on a Saturday night with a party of 4. Long wait of about 45 minutes despite being #3 on the list. The inside is cozy and vibrant with a laidback, no frills vibe. Prices were reasonable for tapas. $19 for a sangria pitcher. The sangria was a little too sweet for my taste, but got me sufficiently buzzed. Although the tapas we got were quite tasty, the main course/highlight was of course the paella, which was unremarkable and bland. I was pretty disappointed and left feeling bloated yet still hungry.
author: Bowen J.

description:
I came here on a date and we ordered the adobo chicken combo plate, potatoes bravas, and the queso manchego. The sauce the chicken was in was AMAZING - I ended up putting it on everything I ate. Rich, flavorful, and just a tad spicy! The potatoes were perfectly cooked and were served with heaping amounts of a spicy tomato mayo - I could have eaten them for days. The manchego reminded me of a  cheap manchego I'd bought before at Costco (it may have been the same one), so I didn't love that. 

The meal came with bread, the spicy tomato spread on the side, and we ordered a pitcher of sangria as well. The sangria was delicious and not overly strong - a very tasty addition to the meal overall. This place is great, and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone who wants some Spanish tapas in the mission.
author: Chelsey B.

description:
Delicious food, unique experience, epic place to take a date! The food is authentic, the atmosphere is the same. Don't get me started about the Sangria, absolutely incredible. 

All in all, I'd bring my date here again, this place is amazing. They even have guys playing music walking table to table.

5 Stars
author: David B.

description: Always s good place to go when in the gentrified Mission for Tapas and Sangria.  The ambiance has a southwestern vibe.  Servers have remained the same throughout the years.  They will recognize you if you frequent this place....they really will so be careful on who you come with!  Music can be heard overhead but have to decipher in between the noisy acoustic chatter.  In the evening a 2 to 3 person mariachi band comes around and you donate whatever amount you wish into a sombrero. Although one time to sing Feliz compleanos they had the audacity to ask for $10.00. Price at this place is fairly modest and actually competitive for SF dining.  Parking of course is a hit and miss - SF parking, grab it if you see it.  Happy Hour is until 7 PM every day for their killer sangria at 10 buckaroos which is the reason to come early!  Suggestions:  for seafood lovers the Seafood platter best deal and best dish.  For tapas:  patatas brava, garlic chicken, meatball abondigas, mussles, asparagus, mushrooms, tortilla de patatas.  Paellas are also very good.  Should you want your own dish you can have that too.  No reservations accepted nowadays and should you come for dinner, expect to wait.  But.  A couple tables outside so order you sangria and start there.  Have fun!
author: Theresa M.

description:
I came here with a party of 14 and they insisted we order the paellas right away as we were just sitting down and getting the menus and only gave us 2 menus for the table. 

When they eventually brought out our food, they had messed up the order by bring out the wrong paella and missing one altogether. Instead of trying to remedy the situation they insisted on arguing first that the seafood paella they brought out was their meat paella and then that what they brought out was all that we ordered. Disappointing to say the least, one would think they would offer to expedite the correct order or figure out a solution but no such luck. The solution was to order additional dishes and wait. To top it off they ended up missing a few of the side dishes we had ordered as well.
author: Kory H.

description:
I've tried a few places for tapa in the city, and so far this is my favorite! The restaurant is super loud though. 
Below's part of the list we used to order from:
1. Tortilla de Patata-Patato & Onion omelet
2. Alcachifas a la Plancha- grilled artichokes
3. Champinones al Ajillo-mushrooms sauteed with garlic & olive oil
4. Calamares a la Plancha-Sauteed calamari
5. Pescado Rebozado con Aioli- Deep fried snapper strips with homemade garlic mayonnaise
author: Fiona K.

description:
SUPER SHADY SERVICE ON MULTIPLE LEVELS.

Came here the other night with a few friends.  When we arrived, the main dining area was full, so we were asked whether we would rather sit upstairs or in the "private dining area."  We chose the private dining area- hey, they made the suggestion, so why not take them up on it!

After choosing what we wanted and waiting for about 15 minutes, we finally got up and went to the main part of the restaurant (which you  need to exit to the street to access) to remind the hostess that we were there and waiting to order.  She was very gracious, apologetic, and sent someone over right away.

Throughout the rest of the night, we had to get up a couple more times to remind the hostess or our waitress that we wanted to order more, which was annoying, but understandable as it's easy to forget about tables that aren't in your line of sight.

What make this a one star review, is 
1) the waitress was EXTREMELY HOSTILE towards us.  She started off friendly, but maybe she felt like we weren't ordering enough food, or maybe she resented that she had to come over to the private dining area, and her tone and body language got more aggressive and rude as the night went on.  This made us very uncomfortable.
2) with all that in mind, we left a pretty bad tip- the total check came out to around $83, and we left $10 extra.  (We normally leave 20%, but the combination of the waitresses hostility and needing to track her down multiple times throughout the night made us decide to leave an amount that reflected the service.)  When I saw my bank statement today, the restaurant charged me $8 more than what the total bill came to, which was most likely added to the tip.

Guests beware, and be sure to keep your receipts.
author: Emma A.

description:
My husband and I LOVE this place! When in the city, we try to come here for paella, tapas and sangria. It is a very small cute place with great service. The neighborhood....ehh...but so worth the trip! 

We had the kids with us this time so we couldn't order our regular spicy dishes. We decided on both the seafood paella and the squid ink paella since we were also with another couple and their toddler. Order those right away because as stated in the menu, it can take 30 mins to come out. It is well worth the wait! And do yourself a favor, get the sangria to go with it! Great sangria! I dream about it often. Between the two paellas, we liked the squid ink a tiny bit more than the seafood, which was surprising to us because we love seafood. 

For the kids we got the garlic chicken and potatoes with garlic sauce. The chicken melts in your mouth. Kids loved it. Of course being kids they wanted French fries, so the closest thing we could find were potatoes. They were excellent potatoes! I wish we could have ordered more, but trying to wrangle my kids while eating is quite a feat! LoL 

If anyone thinks there's a better tapas place, please let me know! For now, this is my go to spot!
author: Vanida B.

description: One of my favorite Spanish restaurants! Great service and excellent quality food. I highly encourage you to get the Paella de mariscos and also tortilla de papa. Finishing it all off with a nice pitcher of Sangria. So yummy!!! Will be returning
author: Melissa M.

description:
Not too shabby! I came with a group of 8 people for tapas--you can make a reservation in advance to ensure seating which is nice :)

Sangria is a must when I get tapas with friends so we took a couple pitchers. For food, we ordered a bunch of stuff, like (vegetarian) patatas bravas, patatas aioli,  championes al ajillo, esparagos a la plancha, (meat) croquettes de pollo, gambas a la plancha [shrimp], calamares fritos, and croquette de bacalao. 

Definitly get the croquettes, which are potatoe-y protein things of goodness! Also, the patatas bravas and aioli are a must--they give you the bravas sauce with bread as an appetizer which is also super nice. Love coming with a group but it's definitely on the pricier side of your typical tapas place. However, the food is pretty good and it's a good option to try if you're with a group!
author: Nerissa C.

description:
This is the loudest restaurant I've been too
Service was terrible the waitress only came once 
To take our order then after that I had to raise my hand for service which made me very unhappy 
On top of that she wasn't friendly at all!!
I felt like she didn't deserve a tip but I did anyway!!!i 
The salad   wasn't fresh it had only a few tomatoes and lots of onion it didn't even fit the plate looks like they count the pieces of lettuce they sell u FYI it wasn't a house salad lol  
Anyways food was awful it was like they poured the whole bottle of oil there was so much grease I  couldn't eat it !!
I'm never ever cuming back this place was horrible
author: Jossi A.

description:
I love tapas! It's like getting to pick and choose for a giant sampler platter. I came with a rather large party and got a small taste of everything. But it was enough to make me want to come back. 

The bread! The sauce! The shraaamp! Squid ink paella was fantastic. Plenty of shrimp, calamari, clams. Deep seafood flavor.  

Let's come here, split a pitcher of sangria and try to eat everything on the menu.
author: Deanna L.

description:
An unassuming spot on the Mission serving GREAT Spanish and tapa dishes!

We walked into this cozy restaurant with friendly servers and decided to give it a try.  Little did we know, this popular place gets BUSY but we arrived earlier at 6 and were seated right away.

We decided to try out several dishes:
- Spanish sausage tapa dish - yum!  very good 
- Squid tapa dish - perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfection with a slight crunch 
- Shrimp scampi tapa - good but shrimp is shrimp.  Would have picked something more special.
- Rabbit stew - excellent flavors with a kick in spices.  Rabbit meat cooked perfectly with meat that fell of bones!
- Mussel tapa dish - this is my favorite!  seasoning was perfect and the sauce was - oh - so - good that we used this dish as the dipping sauce for their breads and cleaned out 2 baskets of their food bread.  Yes even their bread and butter is yummy!
- Squid ink paella - excellent dish.  We ordered the paella for 2 for the 4 of us to share.  I would suggest you order a smaller paella dish but definitely try out their tapa dishes.

- Sengria -  Very good

Overall great dining experience with excellent food.  Friendly and knowledgeable servers.  We will definitely be back.
author: Winnie W.

description: The batatas bravas are delicious. The champiñones al ajillo and gambas al ajillo are also very good.
author: Luz C.

description: While my favorite paella place was down for construction (picaro), they suggested their sister paella location, esperpento, a place I've been going . I really enjoyed the atmosphere because of how genuine the establishment is to spanish culture. The paella is a must get as well as the grilled artichoke. Wine paired with everything as well as a pitcher of sangria is a necessity.
author: Jamie Z.

description: SO glad we stumbled upon this place and I can't wait to go back. Having lived in Spain for a year, I will say the vibe is pretty close to authentic, but the real star is the simple and delicious food.  If you're a seafood fan, you cannot go wrong here.  The grilled artichoke was so good that we ordered it TWICE in one meal!  I don't eat mussels, but my cousin and my friend couldn't get enough of the mejillones, and I was huge fan of the clams.  Both kinds of croquetas were delicious as well.  The house wine is the cheapest you'll find in SF and is quite tasty.  Portions are a good size, and since it's tapas, you can always keep ordering more-- they come out pretty quickly.  Looking forward to my next visit!
author: Rachel M.

description: Great food!!..Terrible service!!..My fiancé and I love this place..Sad to say their service has gotten really bad. We were there on 5 de Mayo.It was busy and loud as usual,but we don't mind it.My fiancé got us a table and then told the waitress he was coming to help me out of the car because I'm handicap. They gave our table to someone else!!..How rude!..My fiancé approached the waitress about this and she just said he wasn't there..and walked off!!...We we're given another table. Our tapas and food was served alongside with delicious Sangria. The food is always amazing. After waiving down the waitress about a dozen times(we would wave down any waitress/waiter at this point)we paid for the check.The waitress then comes and demands 15%!!..My fiancé explained how he's always generous when it comes to tipping and how the service doesn't meet up to that. He asked to speak to a manager that never came.
author: Cindy G.

description: We came on a Friday evening at around 5:30, the restaurant was not busy at all , it took about 30 mins to place our order, we ordered the seafood paella, we hen it took around 30 more mins to get our food, we finally get it and the paella rice was undercooked and no flavor what so ever! I asked them if that's the way the paella should be and they said no that they would cook it a more . Which I said yes please. Overall the food was horrible no flavor what so ever! Extremely disappointed that n the food! Not sure if it was just not a good day for the chef.
author: Maria L.

description: Very poor service, the attitude is rude and un welcoming of restaurant staff. The bill is altered and  waitresses feel they could incorporate their own amount of what they should be tipped on credit card and are not honest about it with customers. That is Fraud
author: Jazmin P.

description: I have been going to this place no less than 10 times in the past 5 years. I used to like their food but just never liked the service. My expectations aren't high but every single time I went to this place, I found out that they charged more tip than what I wrote on the receipt. I decided to give them one more chance so I went again last week after 1 year and took a picture of the receipt with tip. Not surprised when the credit card charge got adjusted it was again a bit more than what I wrote. It's always that older Spanish speaking waiter that has been there forever and often does sneaky things. It just leaves a bad taste in your mouth. Will not go back for any reason.
author: Vivian F.

description: We've been on holiday in Aptos/Santa Cruz/San Francisco for more than a fortnight now. This is the best meal out we've had. We ate tapas. The patatas bravas were just right; the prawns, for once, tasted as they should; the green beans in garlic were great, a bit caramelised. Everybody else seemed to be having a good time too. Reinforced my wish to speak Spanish!
author: Paul H.

description:
3.75 Stars just like the app says.

I am torn between a 3 and 4 star review. 

Esperpento is such a fun and cute place. Great place to go on a date, as a couple, or as a group. It is loud. It is busy. And it gets crazy!! 

The food on the other hand is good but not great. The Paella is good but the quality of the parts is just okay: Chicken was okay (not very flavorful and texture was rubbery). Prawns were okay ( not super fresh and lacking in taste). Octopus was okay ( it was tender by way of cooking the heck out of it). 

Definitely the stars of the night , besides their pretty good Sangria, were: 

Patatas Bravas: Wonderfully fried potatoes in their wonderful spicy sauce (same sauce served with their bread).

Grilled vegetable salad. Great mix. Wonderfully grilled with that lovely Aioli on it again.

Jamon Iberrico: Wonderful spanish cured ham served with french bread and cheese. 

Things I would pass on: Grilled Artichokes ( too fibrous and not enough flavor)

Desserts were okay: Mousse de Chocolate was sweet but nothing special.
Arroz con Leche was actually good. Good texture and nicely flavored with cinnamon...quite refreshing after the meal.

Prices for Esperpento are amazing for the Mission district!!!

Paella for four, Two bottles of Sangria, Four appetizers, two desserts! $160....makes up for many short comings.

Tip: Dine upstairs if you want less noise. Make a reservation ( yeah I know they dont always pick up their phone...be persistent!!!)

Lastly....this isnt the cleanest restaurant or Kitchen.....just sayin
author: David G.

description: **Warning** seems like this restaurant adds their own tips as other yelpers have experience. Went this past weekend, left tip in cash and just checked my credit card statement and they added their own tip. I just open a dispute with my credit card company, what they are doing is fraud!!
author: Rene H.

description:
Drove an hour to come here on sunday but apparently they're closed on sundays even though on yelp they write it's open. Super disappointing. 

Update: went back 1 week ago and i received really oily food. The service was horrendous as well. We were the 3rd party in the restaurant and it took 30 minutes for us to get served while the waiters were standing in the bar avoiding all sort of eye contact.
author: Roy S.

description: Great pa'ella, I loved and i enjoyed everything single piece of food when my boyfriend show me this place. I'm a Spain food lover.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Amazing authentic Spanish food IF you know the right things to order! (ie. morcilla, patatas bravas, queso manchego, gambas, etc.)
A lot of their chicken dishes are decent but not authentic Spanish food, so therefore, pretty mediocre.
The aioli is to die for!!
The busy and small environment can lead to slower service but well worth the wait. Esperpento is an experience! Do not be in a rush if you plan to eat here. Make reservations on the weekends.
author: Lindsey M.

description:
Oh Esperpento, my sweet Esperpento, why do you have to have so much good things on your menu? Since they claim they are small plates, I usually order a butt load and don't feel bad eating that much b/c they are small plates/tapas. But in reality, you really end up eating a lot, getting drunk, and not even spending that much $$$ for what you get! 

All the tapas range from 5-7 dollars and can be shared between a big group. They aren't the biggest portions, but you should be good with getting 1-2 plates (per every person in your table) and a paella to share. When ordering paella, their serving can feed twice the amount of people it is designated for. For example: a serving for 2 can serve 4 people and a serving for 4 can serve 6-8 unless you are super hungry or just order the paella.

Here are some dish suggestions: 
Gambas al Ajilo: Very tasty garlic sauce and the shrimp is so moist and flavorful. 
Patatas Bravas: Potatoes are well cooked and seasoned. 
Ropa Viejo: The sauce could use a little more chorizo flavor, but the meat is on point. 
Artichokes: Very crispy and thinly sliced artichoke dish! Nothing special, but good veggie dish.
For Paella, the negro is super tasty but might not be for all people as the flavor is super distinct. And the paella de mariscos (which I usually get) is packed with seafood. If you want lobster, it's a little more expensive, but heard it's worth it! It is not the best paella but it is decent! 
AND DON'T FORGET THE SANGRIA : 17 FOR A PITCHER? SOLD! small fruit is a plus :)

The Jamon Serrano isn't that great, they already serve bread with their garlic sauce in the first place. Also, Their seating process is a little disorganized and it can take them a while to seat people even if there is space. You have to be super pro active with one of the hosts to make sure you get seated at the proper time. With the occasional guitar performance and Spanish singing paired with the wonderful ambiance, this place is a great gem in the city! Great for big groups and family, and just to get drunk and full!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: Came here with a friend on Wednesday night around 5:30 and no waiting to be seated. We ordered about 4 plates of tapas, quest manchego, patatas bravas which was delicious, almejas a la plancha clams that left me drooling and another meat dish I cannot remember because I unfortunately didn't get to try it. House wine is only $5 which is my bad at all considering most other restaurants charge way more. Overall, amazing place I want to go to try the paella's because they all looked amazing.
author: Talissa C.

description:
A+, 5stars, excellent food experience.

Highlists: 

Patatas Bravas: Similar to country fries
Salsa Bravas: spicy, tangy aioli. Go buy a container of this stuff to go! $5, worth every penny
Arroz Negro: Squid Ink Paella is to die for! Yummmmm

I wanted to check this place out for the sole purpose of trying out the Arroz Negro, I'm a fan of squid ink dishes and this place did not disappoint. $4.50 Sangrias, $5-$10 tapas including calamari, Patatas Bravas, grilled asparagus etc.

The only downside I experienced is when the bill came. The total included a hand written gratuity on the receipt. I repeat, it was handwritten, when everything else was printed. First reaction, oh hell nah! Hahaha I don't mind paying gratuity, even if the norm is 6or more people, yet there was only 5 of us. I brought it to their attention and asked for them to either take it out or include that in my bill as a printed item on a receipt. They came back and it was removed. Other than that scandalous mishap, our dinner was excellent
author: Jan R.

description: Over twenty years I have been coming here and it is still as great as the first time. Love it but go early or the wait can be long. I look forward to another twenty years!
author: Nathalie L.

description:
I've been here twice and I do like the food.  However, I didn't appreciate being disrupted during my meal to pay money for the bandolero multiple times.  It's great that he plays music inside and outside of the restaurant, but to tap me on the shoulder and put your hat for donations was a little too much.  

While the food is good, the service is on the slow side.  During my last visit with a party of 4.  We all ordered water and 1 coke.  10-15 minutes later, we all got our water and no coke.  We had to get up and ask about the coke.

We ordered the blood sausage (can't remember actual name), garlic shrimp, patatas bravas and the lobster paella.  The complimentary bread with their signature sauce is really good.  They use the same sauce with their patatas bravas and it's amazing.  The lobster paella takes a long time to prepare so be sure to wait at least 30 minutes.  Don't expect a lot of lobster.  For a party of 4, each person gets half of a tail so in total, it's 2 lobster tails cut in half for 4 people.

For dessert, we ordered their version of the creme brule.  I probably wouldn't order this again because the texture was a little weird to me and it wasn't that great.  

Overall, the food is good and being with good company makes it better.  I think this restaurant would be perfect if the service was more on point and if I wasn't disrupted to pay the guitar guy.
author: Rachel L.

description: There's two young waitress that told me I couldn't go throw the kitchen to go use the restroom... I love the food here but this one girl was so rude
author: Francisco A.

description:
I love this restaurant! I've been here 3 times now and can't believe that I haven't wrote a review yet.

Paella- 2 people serving honestly serves 4 especially when you're gonna order small dishes. We got the seafood and meat paella  and it was aromatic and very tasty, loaded with shrimps, mussels and meat.

A few of my other favorites:

Sautéed oysters are to die for, seriously, it's like tasting the ocean (it might sound stupid but honestly so good).
Mushrooms cooked with butter & garlic, just delightful.
And definitely the fried potatoes with sauce (always get spicy sauce because it's the best!)

Seriously love this place, the atmosphere is great, service is great, people are friendly and food is awesome!
author: Alyssa H.

description: We pick this place as our family day food hunting. The quality of the food is good, the portion of the food it good. The price of their food is reasonable. Also some ppl will come here to singing in front the restaurant, then you have time to enjoy some music. We order their popular seafood rice very delicious, also I really like their house made spicy mayo very good.  Anyway I had  a good time with my family by last nite food is so good!!! Will come back!
author: Yueming G.

description: Yummy! I don't know why this place got 3.5 stars. Everything is delicious. Get a pitcher of sangria. You won't regret it. The seafood paella is to die for. It takes about 30 mins to cook it but don't worry. Just order some tapas while waiting for it. We went there for my wife's birthday and ordered 5 tapas and a seafood paella. It was too much  We took the paella to go. I want to try one of their desserts next time.
author: Mehmet S.

description: Very quiet Tapas bar.  Delectable delights to choose from.  An eclectic diverse crowd of mid to older age groups.  We indulged in lobster, garlic shrimp, oxtail soup, and grilled trout.  $10 Gappy Hour pitchers of Sangroa made the we hole experience well worth the trip.  Aust try in the Mission District!  Affirdable, great service, and great good!
author: A A.

description:
Wonderful local place. Authentic, delicious and so reasonably priced. Had sautéed oysters? Grilled calamari, grilled artichokes, a stewed chicken dish(don't remember the name) tortilla-a Spanish style egg and potato "omelet". Tasted as good as the one my mother used to make. 
Very friendly staff. I didn't get to try the sangria or paella but would want to the next time I'm in SF.
author: jackie r.

description: For the past few years a coworker has been telling that this her favorite Spanish Restaurant and that I should try it.  I'm usually off on Sunday and Monday when they are closed. Today I was walking around and noticed it was open. I stopped and looked inside and noticed 3 tables were occupied. Took a look a the menu posted on the window. Items on the menu sounded nice and reasonable too.  I  walked away but decided to go back and take advantage that was open.  I went in and was greeted a nice woman that said that they were closed but she will accommodate  me. I didn't realize they close at 3 pm. (reopens at 5 pm for dinner). I got there a few minutes after three.  Talk about customer service, I was impressed.  I was given the menu along with a basket of small wedges of fresh sour dough bread. It came with small soft butter containers, not the usual cold and hard ones.  I ordered the grilled snapper with a salad and spinach béchamel.  Nice size snapper and well seasoned. Fresh salad consisted of small chunks of romaine lettuce, red onion slivers and slice tomatoes. Not sure what kind of salad dressing it was served with. It was subtle, not overbearing .  The spinach béchamel was a creamy and tasty sauce.  It was overall delicious.  I did not felt rush to eat my meal, despite the fact that they were closed.  My bill was under $16 including a Spanish beer.  I will definitely go back.
author: Hum V.

description: I've been coming here since I was 19. As a local we love seeing places like this. Tapas are amazing totally affordable. Great atmosphere the staff is really nice. Parking is a little bit of trouble but other than that this place is perfect. I only take my true love ones here.
author: Sasha M.

description:
Dining at Esperpento will assault your senses - sound, taste, smell, and sight. I guess you could feel the food too if you really wanted to, and it would probably be great x]

The service here was friendly and helpful. Whether we had questions on what to order or wanted to know more about a certain ingredient, the waiters always helped us with a smile. The atmosphere was casual, inviting, and fun without being kitschy. A big party near us was happily celebrating something while a man played guitar and sang Spanish songs. Just a very nice environment to be in.

JAMON IBERICO (Iberican Ham):
If you've had this before, you know it needs no introduction. Well-aged, smooth, and buttery, the marbled parts of it will melt in your mouth. It's on the sweeter rather than saltier side and goes well with just a simple slice of bread.

GAMBAS AL AJILLO (Garlic Shrimp):
Maybe the only dish we tried that I'd suggest skipping. The flavor was a bit forgettable and there are many more interesting things to try.

BOQUERONES EN ACEITE (White Anchovies in Olive Oil):
If you love anchovies or similarly strong fish as much I do, this will be a treat. The anchovies are filleted and served simply with olive oil, some salt, parsley, and lemon. That's all they need to highlight the fresh fish flavor.

PATATAS BRAVAS (Spicy Potatoes):
This dish is a MUST here or at pretty much any tapas restaurant, but especially here. Esperpento serves them as a good-sized portion of fried, cubed potato smothered in their pimenton-based sauce. The sauce is creamy, spicy, smoky, and really damn addicting. You'll probably want to be ahead of the game and just order 2 of these to start with, since you'll end up doing it later anyway. They sell the sauce separately as well, and we ended up buying one (we use it to dip bread in and it's amazing every time).

SANGRIA:
At $15 a pitcher, it's a good deal. Theirs is on the sweeter side but still very tasty, especially paired with the heartier tapas fare like patatas bravas.

Overall: We shared a couple other dishes, but these are the ones I remember most clearly. Most things are about $5-10, so spend carefully or it could add up. Still, it's better priced than many other places. Even with the high number of tapas restaurants in SF, I'd highly recommend Esperpento and would happily return.
author: Ankita A.

description:
My friend recommended this place and initially I was a little hesitant because of the mediocre rating, but I was really pleasantly surprised! 

The bread and spicy dipping sauce are amazing. The spicy potatoes are great- have great flavor and good heat to them, peppers and garlic shrimp were tasty, and the seafood paella was so good! 

I liked every dish that came out and I LOVED their sangria! It was really smooth-normally it has a bit of a bite to it.

Service wasn't good but I was there for the food, so not a big deal.
author: Mandi W.

description:
Horrible service!  Karina, our waitress was horrible. First of all she wanted us to order something else other than the paella, even though we wanted the paella. We would ask her for drinks and appetizers and they will never arrived, so we will ask a different waiter, she had a horrible attitude toward us, that made our dinner uncomfortable. We asked for the manager and she don't even care about our complaints towards  this waitress. 
Worst service ever! Not recommended! They don't care about their customers! Oh and because we were a party of 6 the tip was already included! They did not deserved a  tip at all!!!!! Karina, change your attitude if not work somewhere else! Not serving people!!!!! Worst dinner ever!!!!!!
author: Adriana M.

description: Amazing authentic Spanish cuisine.  Ten dollar happy hour sangria with paella is perfect.
author: I Z.

description:
service is horrendous!  i put a reservation for 15 & told the reservationists that there might be 20, she said no problem.  we get here & we were given 12 seats & our waitress instead of smoothing things over said "why are you blaming me!". very confrontational!  horrible, horrible service!

avoid this place at all cost!!!
author: Jenny T.

description:
The anchovies-filled olives were a-mazing. As in the best olives I've had since I stayed with my brother when he lived in Spain. 
And the thing about olives is; they're only as good as the produce you use.
This is a really good sign.

I came here with a friend for Saturday lunch. At which point we discovered the happy hour sangria. Seriously. It's worth coming here just for that and some olives.

As we were in Rome, we decided to get the seafood paella, which was also good; good quantity for two people, authentic enough to fool me, and enjoyable.
Took a while to arrive, but not unreasonably long. Just make sure not to be in a hurry I guess.
author: Mattis E.

description: Really the food is good, we loved, but I give 1 star  for the organization and the manager, was terrible, the person who is responsible for entering people at the tables, is very disorganized, made us wait half an hour more, because he entered another couple before us, and they had arrived later, are extremely disorganized, I explained to the manager my nonconformism and he never apologized, the paella was delicious and sangria too!
author: Johanaa M.

description:
The bread and salsa brava was delicious. Everything else was pretty mediocre. My garlic chicken was dry and full of gristle and bone. My partner's chicken adobo had great sauce, but the chicken was full of gristle and fat.

It's possible we just ordered the wrong thing from the menu, but I won't be returning.
author: Coleman B.

description:
I've previously eaten here 3 times before and they have all been good experiences, until today. Today was Saturday night so it was more busy than usual. 

My first advise is to avoid being seated on the 2nd floor/loft area if you can. Service was extremely poor. We were seated without being given menus for 8 minutes. I had to walk downstairs and ask the boss lady for some water, but she blatantly brushed me off by nodding her head and then looking away. The waiter never came by to check on us (refill waters, ask for further requests), except to drop off our food. Overall, the food is about a 6-7 out of 10, but if I have to deal with the same service again, I will never come back. 

The Sangria was very tasty, so I would definitely recommend that. We got the fried red snapper tenders, they were a bit chewy - either overcooked or not fresh. The waiter recommended the chicken/beef combo stew and it ended up being too salty. The sea food paella (4 person serving) was more than enough food for the 3 of us. Like I said, I've had better experiences here, but everything just went wrong tonight. This is disappointing since this has always been my go to paella type of place.
author: Sum L.

description: My favorite. Love the ambiance and the food. I try to make my way here every time I'm in town.
author: Andrea M.

description:
Worst service Calamari was so chewy. Only thing we really liked were the potatoes and free bread. 
Brought out a wrong dish. Took 20 min to get any order. Physically wrote in a service charge without explanation because a 6th person joined us after we had already finished dinner.
author: Nicole M.

description: PAELLA! SANGRIA! HAPPY HOUR! TAPAS! Stumbled into the restaurant after class one night with some classmates. It was about 730pm or so on a Wednesday night. We clearly missed happy hour where a pitcher of sangria is half off. We were seated immediate but all their tables are small... very intimate. So i would call ahead and make a reservation if you have a large group. Also, order the Paella with your drinks as it will take about 20 minutes. We ended up with 2 pitchers or 3 of sangria, 1 seafood paella and 6 tapas. We finished everything and it was really good. I will be back.
author: Jan H.

description: Very good squid ink pasta and sangrias.  Happy hour is a plus and it is not so crowded if you get there early enough..  All tapas are excellent!
author: Stacy G.

description: Would do 3.5 * if I could. This place is pretty darn good. If you come a few times, you figure out what is great and not so great, so by your second or third trip, you can select just the great tapas, nabbing a solid meal for WAY cheaper than nearby restaurants. We especially love the garlic shrimp, garlic chicken, and pork. Not a fan of the clams,  mussels, or chicken croquettes, which were pretty bland. The bread with a spicy dipping sauce is soooo good! Bonus: come during happy hour for the $10 pitchers (read: carafes) of sangria. It's legit. You will get tipsy from that stuff!
author: Natahley B.

description: Came here last night for a friend's birthday and loved it. Get there early to snag a table. I recommend getting the pitcher sangria, patatas bravas,croquetas de pollo and the flan. The staff could be a little more attentive, but mean well.
author: Laurisha C.

description:
I came here with a friend who was visiting and wanted to try tapas. This place is a new favorite in the mission because of it's neighborhood atmosphere and good food. My favorite dishes were the ropa vieja, patatas bravas, camillones.

The atmosphere is perfect for dates or groups. The only annoying thing is that guitar players will play them ask you for tips. If I recall correctly this is done in Spain. 

A word of warning the wait can be long if you come and it's crowded. SF life I guess.
author: Corey H.

description: Shitty service. Made a reservation to show up& have them say they didn't have a table for me because it was busy and I'd have to wait. Isn't that why I made a reservation? To not wait. Staff is as rude as can be. Slow and poor service. Good food. Shitttt service. Not worth the wait or arrogance.
author: Nancy I.

description: a SOMA food destination. Very consistent. The Iberia ham is the best Ive had locally. Loved the grilled prawns. The house wine is very good as well. I prefer the main dining because the overflow room lacks the ambience of the main dining. Gotta be lucky on parking on a weekend.
author: edgar v.

description: Three words: Squid Ink Paella.  Prepare to look like you've been changing your engine oil, but so worth it for mineraly, seafoody, deliciousness.  Comes with a good amount of squid, clams, white shrimp, and I think some bay scallops (maybe not).  Anyhow, you do have to order that first (then you browse the menu for other tapas).  I recommend the garlic shrimp, oxtail stew, green beans.  Don't recommend, calamari (too dried and flavorless), artichokes (I am PRETTY sure they left the unedible parts of the flower on there...)  C'mon, I cannot digest that, I am not a koala.  Lastly, don't forget your pitcher of Sangria.  Yes, pitcher.
author: Karen Y.

description: Authentic feel and great food. Don't expect to get out quick when ordering paella. Love it
author: Scott M.

description: This restaurant serves Spanish tapas. I had been to Picaro before. Esperpento and Picaro offer pretty much the same culinary experience. I came here for a birthday party. We were in a smaller room just for the party. I had some of the seafood paella, potatoes bravas, cabbage, albondigas, garlic chicken, and flan. Great place to have a get-together. Altogether for around 20-30 people, the bill came to $450.
author: Denise C.

description:
The father son wait staff on a Thursday night obviously didn't want to be here. It's as if they are tired of the restaurant grind and just what you to leave... Or not leave, since we literally piled our finished plates on top of one another to show that we wanted out, and they STILL did not pick them up.

Maybe this is their first restaurant jobs. But the way the father hovered over the computer system calculating the days takings and ignoring incoming customers you would think that he was over the whole "hospitality" life. The only one paying attention was the busboy, who was the one who brought our checks.

1 star for cheapish sangria. 1 star for the tapas sizes. Ugh.
author: Andy A.

description:
This is one of those Spanish tapas places that have great colorful art inside is casual and the food is packed with lots of spices & garlic.

There is live music on Friday & Saturday nights, the spanish guitar players do expect tip and come to your table so have some change ready. 

Order a pitcher of sangria and lots of tapas to enjoy this place to the fullest. My favorite to eat here is the grilled artichoke. The fried calamari and the patatas bravas also good. 

We did wait a bit until we got a waiter but once he was there he was very attentive and nice.
author: Suna L.

description:
I was in the area to watch a show. Our group of 5 didn't really have a restaurant picked out for dinner. When we stumbled upon Esperpento, we thought perfect! I love tapas! We went back in July of 2013. It wasn't busy when we walked in (around 6p on a weekday), so we were seated immediately.

*Sangria ($17) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco#p7j9TD1iS-vnpZ0UlFS5lA
A girlfriend and I basically shared this. It was light and refreshing.

*Gambas al ajillo ($7) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco#069FaGjGgV3pack88yLyNg
*Calamares plancha ($6.50) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco#hjQBRSjkZYOAf0vmZtw5pw
*Ropa vieja ($5.50) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco#ldZ8rQ5JcKrqtI8JRd7czw
*Esparragos plancha ($5.25) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco#VfO6E75ie4fLCxrtqHkFoQ
*Croquetas de pollo ($5) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco#_yPQVI2739YwtssGBynQuw
*Side of rice with tapas ($1.75) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco#-MUgRjvdnuIjESKl1Bb3GA

I went with some people who don't necessarily do everything family style, so the above six dishes were for me and the roommate. Of course, I offered some to everyone because I love to share. I really loved the calamares plancha and the gambas al ajillo. The calamari was tender and the shrimp were nice and garlicky. I love asparagus, so the esparragos plancha was great as well. Had a nice char.

The rest of the group ordered dinner plates, so we also had the following:
*Carne asada dinner ($9.50) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco#zU_VmQvRCbO8iJxFfzNMZg
*Pollo al ajillo dinner ($8.50) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco#cqFSEVtIz25bQaZvB466AQ
*Grilled quail dinner ($8.50) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco#VGsp7S_v_DZlIYOJeWbKVA

The one thing I wanted to try, but didn't, was their paella. I do love a good paella. Maybe next time Esperpento!
author: Elena N.

description:
I had my 30th birthday dinner here and I was not disappointed. I tried really really hard to pick the perfect place... Success!!

I made a reservation just one day in advance for Saturday night. There were about five of us. 

We ordered lots of sangria (and one boozy lady had a bunch of other cocktails). We ordered lots of veggie tapas (and some boozy friends had some fishy tapas, which they seemed to like). I am vegetarian - no meat, no fish, dairy ok - and enjoyed the Spanish tortilla, manchego cheese, spinach, veggies, lots and lots of little bread, and other yummies. 

There were at least two other birthdays, and the mariachi man was kept busy singing to all of us. There were lots of special occasions and it felt like a P.A.R.T.Y. Everyone had fun, I think (except maybe the girl who got splashed when the waiter popped her champagne bottle directly on to her -- and everything else nearby).

A good time was had by all of us, at least. And when we walked the few blocks to the flamenco show I would not be surprised if we were a teeny bit wobbly. So really what I want to tell you is that if you want to plan a birthday dinner, this is the place.
author: Dana G.

description:
Tapas tapas tapas! 

Came here with two other friends and had a great dinner over small bites and big conversation. The overall restaurant, has a very homey and family feel. You can't help but feel an energy with the mariachi setting the mood. For our meal we had:

1. Alcachofas a la Plancha (Grilled Artichoke)
2. Boquerones en Aceite (White sardines in Olive Oil)
3. Croquetas de Bacalao (Salt Cod Croquetas)
4. Patatas Aioli
5. Albondigas (Meatball Stew w/ Saffron)
6. French Bread w/ Salsa Brava (1st Order Complimentary)

All were enjoyable, but the surprising star for me were the sardines! I loved the sour and salty combo and our table enjoyed it so much that we ordered another. Also, that salsa brava is delicious. I could spread that on anything and eat it up. Also, make sure to order the sangria, as it is a great element to tie the whole meal together.
author: Vincent L.

description: They took in my last minute order for New Years Eve, which was amazing! Also, the staff is super friendly and it doesn't get as crazy crowded as other places offering paella in the Mission. Love them and their staff, if anything parking can get a little tricky, but for the food, I'd go back here again.
author: Carolina S.

description:
Love this place! We always order a ton and have lots of leftovers.

Word to the wise, don't get the patatas bravas. Get the Parrillada De Carne! So many amazing meats on a bed of patatas bravas. You get way more potatoes and amazing meats and that amazing sauce.

The paella is decent - not the best I've ever had, but it's quite tasty and worth an order. The croquettas were a bit subpar. Albondigas (meatballs) are good. Champinones Al Ajillo (mushrooms) are good. Rabo Toro is good (oxtail stew). The sangria is sweet and quite tasty but not strong or good quality.
author: Brooke T.

description: Love this place.  From 4-7pm a liter of sangria is only $10.  We got two and we were feeling pretty good at the end of the meal.  Ordered two tapas and they were both amazing.  Spicy shrimp and spicy fried potatoes.  Oh that sauce they put on top of the potatoes is delicious.  The same sauce they provided for you with the free basket of bread.  Seriously, you can just go get a liter of sangria and just eat the bread.  Price is super fair.  If you are out in the mission and want some sangria this is the place to go!
author: Uinii H.

description: My boyfriend and I came here for the paella and it did NOT disappoint! Everything about the food/service/drinks was phenomenal. The atmosphere was quite cozy as well, which made it a comfortable environment. It was pretty busy the whole time we were there, even though we came relatively early in the evening (~5). Overall a great experience - would definitely recommend!
author: Taylor F.

description: Not the best experience. Waited more than 1hr to gave us a table. They gave us a table that was placed in a separate room in a separate building with extra limited space. (I know the restaurant is small but this was extremely small). Restroom wasn't even available in the building, we had to walk out and enter to the restaurant to use the restroom. 30mins later no waiter showed up, so we left the place with no food, drinks or even water. Bad business
author: Juan G.

description:
Loved this place! 

Came here on a busy Friday night, was lucky to get a table because a large party was leaving. 

Food was great and came out delicious and fast. 
Great place if you're Vegetarian & treat yourself with a glass of sangria. 

Prices are affordable if you stick to the small plates.
author: A C.

description:
I opened this place for myself a couple of years ago. Loved it from day one.
Perfect combination of good food and very reasonable prices.
Came there last Friday night after a year of absence and was unpleasantly surprised.
Prices went up for about 40% and quality went down quite a bit.
For instance my favorite quale used to be  $5 and done very juicy and tender. It's $7.50 now and was like a piece of rubber.
Rabbit stew was $5.5 and it's $8 now.
A couple of bucks isn't a big deal you may say but percentage wise it's a big jump.
Place was absolutely overcrauded and understaffed. We waited for about half an hour until server shows up.
Shrimps in paella were overcooked and tasted lake a paper.The rest of food wasn't good at all.
I'm giving 2 stars just because of great memories I have about this place and hope to see it back in my places to eat list.
author: vladimir g.

description: Great food. Slow service during peak Friday dinner hours, which I guess is to be expected. Must try the paella and get a variety of tapas while you wait for it. They are all so yummy. Nothing will disappoint!
author: Emma T.

description:
I felt like I was back in Spain, the food was very authentic. The only "give-out" was a Mexican mariachi... wish it was a real Spanish guitar. Oh, well, I'll get what I can. 

The place is tiny, gets very loud and cozy inside. They have a few tables outside, which can be enjoyed - weather permitting. 

Now, that you should come for (and I will be back for) - authentic tapas and Sangria! They have a lot of seafood prepared different ways, a few stews, vegetables, salad (which, I will guess, is one of the few "Americanized" dishes - didn't see any house salads in Spain).  Also, Paella - this was the crown of our dinner - black (squid) ink paella (!!!) with calamari, octopus, shrimp and other seafood. 
From tapas - the one to remember - scallops and potatoes. 
Come in, grab a table, get some Sangria, and enjoy like it's always a siesta!
author: Marianna K.

description:
Knowing really well the Spanish Tapas concept including some of the most traditional dishes from Spain this place surprised me since the first day.

We will not find there a trendy environment of a kind of new wave Spanish food based on tapas but instead you find the type of tapas you can get in a popular tapas place in Madrid, Valencia and many other cities in Spain.

The environment, the smell and the flavors you get are genuine. You will definitely feel the sensation you're somewhere in Spain.

Considering all the above referred characteristics, the friendly attendance and the amazing prices I have no clue into say this is the best Spanish food place I have been in US.
author: Nuno S.

description: I love this place have been coming here for over 20 years. It can be a wait to get your order in but once you do the food comes flying and it is delicious. Great prices and the staff has always been really nice. They explained the menu in regards to my allergies and took care of me. The local tech bros may review this place negatively but hey who cares about them. Hopefully everyone will treat them bad and they will go away.
author: Hackey S.

description:
Came here with two of my friends when we were pretty buzzed after a few too many drinks. I remember the tapas being really good, although I dont remember what we specifically ordered. 

We had a total of 5 plates among 3 of us, with a jug of sangria. The bill worked out to be about $22 per person which is pretty decent for the amount of food and drinks.

Would definitely love to come back here again to try the paella.
author: Christina N.

description:
Bad, bad, bad. We went there after a matinee a the Marsh. Service......bad. Food..........worse. Tapas were old and microwaved. 
albondigas in saffron "sauce" were watery and obviously had been premade and frozen and then nuked. String beans sauteed in olive oil and garlic were tasteless except for the overheated olive oil taste. We had the potato tortilla (which I have had before) This time it was mushy and soooo hot that it was obviously made earliier and also microwaved. We also ordered pork skewers on rice. It came when were done with the rest and ready to leave. it was old,dry and chewy. We should have refused it as we were really ready for the check. When my friend told the server about it she said "Sorry" so never,ever,ever again
author: Nancy P.

description:
Originally, my friends and I thought we would have a night out, including a nice dinner in the Mission. But we didn't make a reservation anywhere because we just wanted to wing it. Unfortunately, our first choice, a restaurant a couple blocks away, was completely packed, and the wait was going to be 1.5 hours. So we stumbled on this place by accident. And what a wonderful accident it was! There was only a very short wait (like ten minutes) for a table of four on a busy Saturday night.

To start, I recommend the Sangria - not the glass, the pitcher. At first, I thought there was not enough fruit or alcohol. But I simply asked for more fruit, which they brought out in a bowl, and believe me, there was definitely alcohol in there, which will sneak up on you if you're not careful.

For tapas, we ordered the Gambas al Ajillo (Garlic Shrimp). It was probably my favorite dish of the night! Juicy shrimp in a warm garlic sauce that is actually perfect for dipping the bread that they bring you. We also had the Croquetas de Pollo (Chicken Croquettes). Normally, I'm not a fan of croquettes, but these just melted in my mouth, and the sauce was amazing as well. Finally, we had the Patatas Aioli (Garlic Mayonnaise Potatoes), which they mistakenly thought was Patatas Bravas (Spicy Potatoes), so we actually got to try both.

For our entree, we ordered the Paella de Mariscos for two. There was a bit of a wait for it, but it was well worth the wait! Seasoning was absolutely perfect, and they were very generous with the seafood. The only downside was that we couldn't finish it in one go, so we had to take it home and of course it wasn't as good the next day.

All of the food was reasonably priced. The restaurant had a very authentic feel and we even had a small band come around the tables and play at one point during the meal. Also, our server was very warm and friendly. He did mess up a couple of our orders, and it took a while for things like drink refills, but we still loved it all. I'm really glad the other place was packed and that my friends and I were able to try something more off the grid.
author: Eryn H.

description:
A casual, unassuming spot. We ordered lots of different dishes but I wasn't overly impressed by any of them. 

We had reservations for an early dinner, 5pm on a Sunday night but that was completely unnecessary. We were one of the first customers, but it was filled up by the time we left around 7pm.

MUST-HAVES: Chorizo Salteado "Cantimpalitos" (sauteed spanish sausage)!

ENSALADAS Y TAPAS VEGETARIANAS (Salads & Vegetarian Tapas)
* Tortilla De Patata ($6) - 2.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco?select=Ja-Czgol4Jt-HA4BcXiJLA#sgA_zhH3U30OuV0jiesGjw
This didn't have much texture. The tortillas and the potatoes were all too soft and could have used much more crisp. Everything blended together, and the flavors were bland.

* Ensalada De Pimientos De Pimientos Rojos (roasted red bell peppers w/ vinaigrette, $5.50) - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco?select=Ja-Czgol4Jt-HA4BcXiJLA#RXie5QdNMO3yaxxd64fpAw
This really didn't stand out much at all. The peppers were very soft, not much flavor. A more sharp balsamic would've been great.

* Alcachofas A La Plancha (grilled artichokes, $5.50) - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco?select=Ja-Czgol4Jt-HA4BcXiJLA#5SEacBrS8VRblRPTfMNiBA
My boyfriend's dad and his girlfriend very distinctly remembered this dish from a previous dinner here as the best thing they had. I don't usually like artichoke at all, and I did find this somewhat appetizing. It was served in a unique way, sliced very thinly and grilled to have some crisp. It wasn't as amazing as they made it out to be, but still good.

* Patatas Bravas (spicy potatoes, $4.75) - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco?select=Ja-Czgol4Jt-HA4BcXiJLA#Mn2oGtLO-3ycPCMxt_5bcw
The sauce was thick and very spicy, and this was the best part of this dish. The potatoes looked promising and crisped, but they were actually pretty soft and soggy.

PESCADOS Y MARISCOS (Fish & Shellfish)
* Cola De Langosta (grilled lobster tail, $9) - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco?select=Ja-Czgol4Jt-HA4BcXiJLA#rAevVfv4h_AhoHrw-nv3Qw
The texture was crunchy and this had pretty good flavor. It didn't stand out as particularly fresh, though.

AVES Y CARNES (Poultry & Meat)
* Pinchos Marranos (pork kebabs, $5) - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco?select=Ja-Czgol4Jt-HA4BcXiJLA#OUv8dQ2ybzPZ-PmHPx_edA
The pork had decent flavor, but it was very dry! The rice was also very dry and didn't stick together, which made it very difficult to eat.

EMBUTIDOS Y QUESOS (Cold Cuts, Sausages, & Cheese from Spain)
* Chorizo Salteado "Cantimpalitos" (sauteed spanish sausage, $5) - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco?select=Ja-Czgol4Jt-HA4BcXiJLA#QJOA7JU54ZwermfrJUFWuw
cross-section: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco?select=Ja-Czgol4Jt-HA4BcXiJLA#SN79AC2zLRf_lXCwgrk9bw
This looked plain but was probably the best thing we got! The chorizo had a ton of flavor packed into a little bit of space, and the texture was moist. I loved cutting through the kind of tough skin and my knife bursting into the meaty part.

PAELLAS
* Paella Hortelana (vegetable paella, $18 for two) - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/esperpento-san-francisco?select=Ja-Czgol4Jt-HA4BcXiJLA#Ja-Czgol4Jt-HA4BcXiJLA
Maybe we needed to get seafood to fully represent their paella, but I didn't think this was all too impressive. The veggies were all too soft and overcooked, and there were no crisped parts of the paella, which is usually my favorite part!
author: Ziyan C.

description: The food itself is excellent. I've been coming to this restaurant now for a few years. The only reason I keep returning is my 87 y/o grandmother loves it and it's only a few blocks from her home. But the service has gotten worse and worse to the point where my grandmother even lost patience. I have a toddler and always take a stroller; they have always kindly placed it in the back out of the way but our last trip, the older lady looked at me crazy for bringing it in (older lady) No water refills after 3 requests, rude and insensitive staff. We always go during lunch and weekdays so never when it's busy. This place needs some serious waiter training or replacement because it's gotten intolerable. I don't think I'll be going back. Time to look for a new Spanish tapas place....it will be worth the drive.
author: Izzy B.

description: The food is good, but the problem is the restaurant manager's organization skills. He deals with customers and seats everyone as they wait outside. There is a clip board that people put their name on to be seated. He doesnt go by the list... he seats anyone who bitches the most about waiting too long. The paella's take 30 mins to cook so if someone is seated ahead of you you will be waiting over a hour at least. I don't know this guys name but he's horrible and doesn't care about how long people wait. I can say this is the most disorganized restaurant I have been too. Too bad bc the food is good they simply don't care about how they get people to their table as long as their busy they won't change.
author: Hyman R.

description:
Got a minor case of food poisoning after eating here last night. I do not have a weak stomach at all and that's probably why it was only a minor case, but I still had to miss work today because of it. Assuming it was the snapper and clam stew that did it so I would stay away from this. Super sad that I got sick because I still want the Paella. Oh well. 

Came here before going to see a movie at the Alamo. Wanted the paella but ran out of time so we ordered tapas. Service was pretty good especially if you are a Spanish speaker. Food came out incredibly fast which was great and most things were tasty but not spectacular.
author: Austin Q.

description:
Pros: Love their seafood paella & sangria. The tapas are decent, I've had better. 

Cons: Small space & so so service.
author: Andy B.

description:
Redemption! Finally got the paella... 9 months later. Decided to give this place another try (after some bad service from another place around the block... Deja vu, long story. And a separate review, of course). Believe in second chances.

The seafood paella was AMAZING. 35min-wait according to our server.. Paella came out in 45min. Okay fine, not too bad.. Compared to the former over-1hr-wait and no turnout. The sangria, just as I remembered, was SPOT ON.

Want the paella? Go during the day for shorter wait times and make sure to sit orchestra level. Getting seated in the balcony? They'll forget you're even in the restaurant. You might as well be wearing a cloak of invisibility.

Lesson learned.
author: Angela Camille D.

description:
Pay with cash or keep the receipt!!!! 
They will charge you more tip than you write down. A tip they don't deserve by the way because the service is incompetent at best. It's a shame too, because the food is honestly delicious.
author: Lena T.

description: I have been coming in this place for years and I really love their food- very affordable prices fresh authentic- pretty much close to the Spanish food! I'm from Spain and I can recognize the right taste but every single time I visit with family or friends THE SERVERS AreSUPER RUDE! I never get introduced to the menu , they almost don't speak English - my friends are from all over and they need to understand the menu!!! The manger herself- NEVER PAYS ATTENTION TO OUR WATER OR BREAD REQUEST AND SHE IS VERY INSULTING and rude: we asked for extra bread and she said we already brought u a lot we don't have bread! I don't want to talk even about the rude angry old man - it a torture to deal with him- super rude always and angry - like we are in his house or so ! IM A REGULAR GUEST BRINGING BUNCH OF PEOPLE TO THIS PLAce and deserve some respect!!!!
author: Tina J.

description: Are you serious? $3 for each extra bread when it's supposed to be free? Or am I being ripped off? Never in my life have I gotten charged for asking to refill my bread basket.
author: H H.

description: Shared delicious birthday lunch with a couple of friends. Ordered: Potatoes Brava, Fried calamari, Albondigas soup, and a meat and fish Paella.  Excellent and fast service.  We will be returning ASAP.
author: Laura P.

description: No concept of honoring a reservation!  Came in on time.  There was a person seated at a table that clearly was for the number of ppl at our party.  The conclusion is that they gave it away.  Waited 20+ minutes to get seated.  Not even an apology.  Could be forgiven if they even showed concern for the customer. Would never return here again.
author: Mar C.

description:
Came here with friends on a Saturday night. The food was decent (as far as I'm concerned, you get what you pay for.) I was less than happy to see the restaurant had ended up serving themselves to a greater tip than we denoted on our receipts. It's only a few extra dollars in the grande scheme of things, but an extremely dishonest and shady thing for a business to do. 

Will not be returning.
author: Audrey H.

description: Go to spot. Wait is always long for seating and food but it's worth it. Prices are great especially for the mission these days. Their seafood and meat parrilladas are the best also the dressing they give with their potatoes and bread is delicious. Worth a try. Love it.
author: Nicole J.

description:
Friday night in the Mission, ready for dinner at 8pm, 2 hour wait at Limon. Where to go??
We were the first party of 4 on the waitlist, so ordered sangria and sat outside in the (ridiculously-cold-why-aren't-I-wearing-a-down-jacket) spring eve. We were ushered inside a mere 45 minutes later (I-own-wool-sweaters-why-are-they-in-my-closet-and-not-on-my-body) and seated at the window. We were promptly forgotten, so flagged down our waiter a mere 45 minutes later (about-to-eat-the-tablecloth). 

We'd come for the paella, but since we weren't able to order until 9:30pm and it was a 60 minute wait for the paella, we decided to get a mess of tapas. We tried: morcilla (blood sausage), gambas al ajillo (shrimp in butter), judias verdes rebozadas (green beans), patatas bravas, arroz, butifara con judias blancas (catalonian sausage with white beans), and parrillada de carne (a giant platter of grilled meats - chorizo, chicken, carne asada). A major theme here is the spicy sauce that comes with just about everything on the menu - it's delicious, perfect with the crispy, fried patatas, and great for sopping up with bread. All of the food was savory, rich with flavor, and decidedly delicious. 

However, the restaurant was incredibly loud and service was incredibly slow. The mariachi guys aggressively come around to the tables demanding tips, which feels awkward during a nice dinner (we tipped 3 times but that apparently wasn't sufficient?). We got much more attention from them then we did our waiter, who forgot our water, wine and paella order. If you decide to come here, 1) make a reservation well in advance, 2) decide what you want before sitting down, 3) order your (hour-to-prepare) paella before anything else, 4) be prepared to yell at the top of your lungs in order to be heard, 5) get really drunk and REALLY enjoy your food.
author: Ray J.

description:
Aight food (tried tapas and a combo plate can't speak to the paella) but service is rather slow and became rude when we asked to split checks. Understand that it's a hassle for servers, but have never had someone tell us "this is strange, we never do this" (after asking for an additional split receipt for a company proof) and proceed to straight up slam the bill on our table without another word. 

There's a band that plays every hour or so and comes around asking for tips. The music is nice but just be warned you will have a bag shoved in your face during the meal. 

Definitely are tapas place that are much more higher end and after this meal am thinking they are worth it.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I always return to this place when I go to the city for the paella and grilled artichokes.  Also, enjoy the Sangria, garlic shrimp and so much more.
author: Lorraine G.

description:
Might as well grab your passports, because this restaurant (almost) takes you to Spain.

I studied abroad in Spain for a semester, and I'd like to think that that makes me somewhat qualified to speak on the authenticity of a Spanish restaurant in San Francisco. 

I had an extremely pleasant time at Esperpento; everything was delicious and it brought me back to my time in Spain. My friends and I got there a little after 7 p.m. on a Friday, just before the restaurant got packed. We were immediately seated at a small table, but all of the tables are kind of smushed together so it was close quarters with our neighbors. 

The menu is pretty extensive, especially with its tapas selection. We ordered: morcilla (blood sausage), jamon iberico (ham imported from Spain), calamares fritos (calamari), chorizo, and patatas bravas (spicy potatoes). They all came about 20 minutes after waiting. 

I have to say: none of them disappointed. 

The morcilla is a little less seasoned in comparison to what you'll actually find in Spain, but when you dip it in the spicy sauce, it gives a good kick of flavor. Esperpento evidently takes a lot of pride in this sauce--and for good reason--as they use it as a complement for almost every tapa. The patatas bravas are probably the best that I've ever had! 

My favorite tapas of the night were the patatas bravas and the calamares fritos. 

We finished off with the Paella Negro, which is known for its black color due to the squid ink. It's not the best paella that I've had, but when you squeeze the lemon on top of the black rice, it's a pleasant bite. 

As for the service, I can understand why people have complained about the waiters/waitresses not being as attentive. There were a few times that we had to ask our waiter to refill our water cups. But other than that, the staff was perfectly friendly. I do have to say that being approached more than once by the live music performers was a little much, but it contributes to the lively atmosphere of the place. 

Whenever I'm missing Spain, I'll be sure to come back to Esperpento again!
author: Jane H.

description: We had oxtail stew (Rabo de toro) and steak milanesa. The oxtails were drowning in a pool of vegetables and bland. The steak was tough. The service was awful; our server kept ignoring us and never checked on us when our water cups were empty. It took 10 minutes to get the check from her.
author: Djl D.

description:
A large group of us went to Esperprento to grab ourselves our tapas. We had a lot to choose from, but some were better than others.

The verdict:
- Spicy cheesy potatoes: Very spicy and cheesy. Can't really go wrong here.
- Seafood platter: Lots of small shrimp, very little fish. What was here was good, but more fish would be nice.
- Anchovy olives: Didn't really care for them. 

We got a few other things, but they forgot one of our orders. Food was solid overall, but there wasn't a lot of it. It was so-so overall.
author: Casey S.

description:
I've been here several time and the food is always excellent! The meats here are always unique tasty. Last night was great, Tuesday nights aren't crowded and we got a table right away. We orders a few tapas and paella. This visit we started with the chorizo, a lot of tiny little flavorful sausage. I think every time I've come here I've had the Patatas Bravas, always perfectly executed with spicy sauce. This was the first time I tried the chicken croquettes they were light and delicious. The Paella Matanza was, as always, sublime. 
One note, the service here is never perfect.  It's not bad service, it's just a little slow and distracted.
author: Gary B.

description:
YUM! I love tapas! I chose this spot for date night last Friday. Can't believe this was only my first time here. The restaurant itself is kinda small but it definitely has that home-y and warm vibe. 

I thought there was going to be a wait since there tons of people outside but good thing there was only two of us so we were seated right away.

We ordered: the seafood paella, sauteed calamari, spicy potatoes, and my favorite- the sauteed cabbage (I'm a huge fan of cabbage fyi). Everything tasted so amazing! For once, I didn't need to add extra seasoning to my food. I'm going to try to make that cabbage dish at home. so so good!
author: Dara S.

description: This place is the WORST! Please take your money to the hard workers at Picaro's on 16th and Valencia and not this garbage of a place. They are rude and have no concept of customer service. I have never had a good experience here and will never return to this awful place. There was a HAIR in our paella and instead of acknowledging that it was one of their servers their response was that the cook is bald!! They tried to say the hair was one of ours even though we don't have that color hair. This place is a joke! If you want the sangria and food they have here do yourself a favor and go to Picaros which is the exact same BUT with WAY BETTER SERVICE!
author: Cynthia C.

description: Not as good as all the reviews that I have read. Albondigas were cold, but the garlic shrimp and clams were ok.
author: Josephine H.

description:
The food is absolutely amazing. I've been here 3 times now and I always get sangria and garlic chicken and patatas aioli. AMAZING! However, the service is always super slow. Every time I come here, it's like pulling teeth getting the bill. We had to ask three times for the bill in my most recent visit.
