I'd say the food is totally worth the slow, sometimes negligent, service. But I would love to see the service be a bit more attentive next time :) three stars for now, but I'll definitely be back.
author: Amy P.

description: This place is the best. I love that everything is so fresh and flavorful. Most weeknights, they have happy hour with $10 pitchers of sangria, and there's no beating that in the city.
author: Ashley M.

description:
The food wasn't bad, but honestly I was a bit disappointed due to the mainly good reviews it got. The service was very fast, but as I'll mention below that may not have been a good thing since some of the food didn't taste fresh.

My friend and I ordered 4 tapas dishes. I'll go over each of them:

Jamon Serrano en Pan con Tomate (ham on bread with tomatoes): this was pretty tasty. The ham seemed like it was very good quality. The bread wasn't as great as I would have liked, tasted pretty soft, not like a high quality bread with a crispy outside and soft inside.

Escalivada (eggplant): I really love eggplant, but honestly this dish disappointed me. It was a bit bland and tasted like it had been heated up, not made fresh.

Morcilla (blood sausage): I had been looking forward to trying this for the first time and it was really tasty! No complaints here.

Champiñones al ajillo (mushrooms with garlic): Another dish I was disappointed by. The flavor was fine, nothing to special, but it didn't taste very fresh. I would sometimes get cold pieces like the food had been heated unevenly.

The food was fine, but I've definitely had better and I probably won't return.
author: Lucy C.

description:
Had a ladies night out dinner two weekends ago on a Friday night. Made reservations the day before for 5 at 7p with no problem. Got to the restaurant and my name wasn't on there. Turns out the woman got my name wrong but luckily my phone number was correct. Phew! 

We were seated immediately upstairs. Looked over the menu and knowing paella took some to cook we put that order in first. Started with a pitcher of sangria. Best sangria I've had in a while! Or was it just Friday and I needed a drink? Lol 

Ordered 
Mejillones a la vinaigrette - steamed mussels 
Calamares a la plancha - grilled calamari
Patatas bravas - spicy potato goodness. That sauce tho! 
Rope Viejo- beef stew 
Paella de carnes - opted for the meat only as my friend is allergic to clams. Ordered the serving for 4. Could easily feed 6 or maybe it's cause we had the tapas beforehand. Still made for delicious leftovers the next day! 

Almost forgot. There complimentary bread that comes with this orange sauce. So yummy! 

Everything was delicious!! Definitely satisfied my craving for Spanish tapas. 

Sitting upstairs can't speak for downstairs. It's quite warm so be prepared if you get hot easily wear lighter clothing. There was also a large fan up there but where I was sitting I barely felt it.
author: Erica M.

description: The food is to die for - better than sex! ;-) The service sometimes leaves things to be desired but I've been going for 10+ years and love, love, love the food!! Make sure to eat the blood sausage, garlic prawns and the Sangria!! If it don't put a smile on your face - give me a bad review ;-)
author: A C.

description:
I came to SF for an interview today and met up with my cousin right after.  She took me here since I don't really eat tapas.  The restaurant had a nice home-y feel and there was live music.  Well, it was just one guy with a guitar, but it did add to the experience.  Anyways, we weren't all that hungry and didn't order much.  We had the sangria (absolute YUM), the potatoes with garlic aioli, fried calamari, this crostini thing with cured ham on top, and the paella turista.  

Now, let's get into some quick detail...

Potatoes with garlic aioli - potatoes were perfectly crispy and the sauce was good, but I got tired of it quickly because of the mayonnaise.

Fried calamari - SKIP! It was undercooked and you can taste the flour.

Paella turista - I didn't like the shrimp... It tasted... bland and maybe some chorizo would've added some extra flavor.

That crostini - yummy but eat it fast because it gets soggy!!

I definitely want to come again and try out different items on the menu.  It's pretty extensive and there were a lot of options that looked better than what we chose.  Next time for sure.
author: Kenitha Y.

description:
The best paella I've ever had. Girlfriend has been here dozens of times, but that was over 10 years ago. First visit for me.

We had mushroom and shrimp tapas, nicely prepared and fresh but not much different from good tapas anywhere. Then the paella arrived...

Amazing. Awesome. Stunning. You get the idea. Best paella E-V-E-R. Not syrupy (why do some places serve it that way?) Not greasy. Just fabulous. Absolutely loved it. 

I didn't try anything else on the menu, and don't intend to. Just paella, every time I come back.
author: Dave M.

description:
"Yay! I'm a fan." is right! Esperpento has such a variety of tapas, and all at a reasonable price! I came here a few weeks ago for my cousin's birthday, and I was instantly glad that there were so many of us. We were able to order almost every item on the menu (I love to try everything if I can). Everything was delicious! Including the sangria! 

I can't wait to come back
author: Lisa N.

description:
Esperpento has authentic, well-priced and delicious tapas that I'll keep coming back for. The only reason they aren't perfect is the service. I would recommend only coming here during "off hours." My boyfriend and I came here for a very late lunch/early dinner at around 4 pm on a Saturday and the service was MUCH faster and MUCH more attentive than our first time here. I would definitely avoid the peak hours because on days where they have tons of people-- it gets hot, and you will probably be sitting at your table for a long time. Also, during peak hours they definitely will not refill your bread. (This may have been because of the holiday.) 

Patatas bravas were amaaaaazing. The spicy aioli that comes with it can be smothered on everything. (And they know it-- which is why they serve it with the bread too.) I would recommend them highly. You know, everything we've ever tried here tastes good. We loved the clams a la plancha, and we loved the chorizo as well. I'm not a huge fan of tapas in general, but I have gotten full of a decent, well-priced amount of them here. Definite recommend, but like I said-- GO DURING LUNCH or when it's not crowded!
author: Christa Lei S.

description: Excellent food love the sauteed calamari and superb potatoes and spinach. Good service. Very noisy at night and crowded but food is always wonderful and the prices reasonable. Never had a bad plate!
author: Alex B.

description:
Love love love this place! The food is incredibly delicious, fresh and satisfying.

I never get a big plate - there are just too many yummy tapas to commit to one thing.

Grilled calamari, fried calamari, grilled asparagus, fried anchovies, anchovy stuffed green olives!!!! Grilled artichoke, the mushrooms - all yummalicious! - the only things I won't recommend are the spinach bechamel (just way to much bechamel) and anything with meat because I don't eat it. 

The Spanish beers are even a delight, perfectly balanced with all the food.

Only issues are that it's super loud in thee if it's even a 1/4 full and the service isn't great, especially if they're busy which makes sense. But it's worth shouting over and waiting for your food. Totally worth it.
author: H. H. M.

description: Food was mediocre and too watery and plated terribly. Ordered the pollo ajillo and beef chicken  and sausage stew. stew  was fine. Waited forever for them to come ask for the check and had a hard time getting the waitress to understand my order. Won't be coming back
author: Daniel B.

description: It's  hard to write a review for this restaurant because I like the food here a lot and I also think the staff is great, the only problem seem to be the owner who does not care about his clients. Despite the fact that I have been a client for years I have never received a reply to my emails and phone calls, even though when it was concerning a credit card overcharge. I am a big fan of Tapas, I love morcilla, tortilla de papas, olives, pulpo, paella and most of the dishes this restaurant has to offer but such a lack of service turnes an easy five star review into a 2 star one. Well 2 stars because I am generous the owner deserves no stars at all. Jerk.
author: Sylvester C.

description: I had tapas lunch here with a friend, and we thought we ordered too much food, but ended up eating most of it (perhaps over-eating:)... The food was a mix of good to meh. We got the patatas bravas (average), pimientos (oily but good), grilled calamari (great), tortilla de patata (average), cod croquettas (yummy), string beans (average). Nice service, nice open atmosphere and decor.
author: Abeer H.

description: This place has been my favorite for many years ...my sons decided to invite to dinner for Mother's Day yesterday May, 10th. But for the time the service was awful we understand it was busy but not once did someone approach our table and ask if we needed anything had to constantly put our hand up to be noticed to get our our taken, more bread, more sangria  at one point my son stopped a waiter who had just finished attending another table and asked for more bread the guy gave us a dirty look and walked away. When time came to pay my daughter in law and 2 sons decided they did not deserve our tip when we got our receipt back with $10 change on receipt with $19.50 circled. My daughter went to counter and asked what that 19.50 was for? Waiter said for our service! We all said you gave very bad service! At the end we thru the extra $10....he had the nerve to stand at our table to request the $19.50!!! Unbelievable!
author: Gamino T.

description:
Bring friends or bring the family, just bring somebody to help you order plenty from the menu. Savory tapas are heavenly here - the Sangria exceptional! Is there anything more you need to know? Oh yea, there's live music occasionally. 

Monday's are Paella specials, so check the menu to see what's on for the day. Since we visited on a Sunday, my group of three made a varied selection of meats, fish and veggies. 

Judias Verdes Rebozadas
Crunchy, plenty of sautéed garlic & onion lightly salted

Boquerones Fritos 
Thinly sliced and lightly oiled. The zesty garlic & parsley tone down an otherwise overpowering fish

Gambas Al Ajillo
I have had better, they were a 'lil tough

Patatas Bravas 
Tender potatoes with herbs, drizzled in a spicy cream sauce. The sauce is the same that's served with the bread. It's good! 

Champinones Al Ajillo
I relished the succulence of the mushrooms and was pleased they were still tender and chunky

Calamares Fritos
Light crisp texture, sadly they were over salted

Chorizo Salteado "cantimpalitos" 
Magnificent! juicy bite size bits of spicy meat...Mmmm

Queso Manchego 
A firm cheese that pairs well with the chorizo

Jamon Serrano
It was alright, I'd rather have the  prosciutto sans bread

By all means order the Sangria, it's worth sharing and then getting some more. This place is always busy, so call ahead or be prepared to wait a few minutes. The service is decent. I don't think I ever needed to ask our waitress to remove plates or bring water, but she wasn't the most sociable either. Because of the cozy space it tends to be noisy, especially if there are live musicians. Don't worry, huddle together pass the chorizo and talk louder like everyone else. 

Bon Appétite
author: Jaylena P.

description: Love Esperpento! Always have the Papa Bravas but have tried most everything! The Spanish sausage, thinly sliced artichokes sauteed in Olive oil and garlic, the stews. Parking is not too bad on the side streets. Decor reminds me of being in Spain with fans and shawls on the walls. The service has always been helpful, knowledgable and friendly. The food is authentic, they even have sausages from Spain available for purchase in a cold case.
author: Judy W.

description: I love the atmosphere; it's so cozy and warm that it feels you leaving like a meal at someone's home. The food was good, however not spectacular. I'm vegetarian so i had potatoes and the mushroom dishes. Potatoes were good, as is the spicy sauce; the mushrooms were tasty but a little too oily. The bread basket was soo tasty but they didn't offer to refill. They didn't offer to refill water. Actually, the service overall was a bit strange. When we first entered, we stood there for a minute completely ignored. We called at a waiter, who ignored us for a sec then came to help. He said he'd have a table for us, looked around, then walked away. A woman came to help and did the same. I mean, there were at least 3 empty tables. We finally got seated, after they pulled two tables apart and added a third chair to one, where my party of 3 sat. They left us with menus, and I had no silverware or plate. I took the set from the empty table nearest, and a couple minutes later yet another random person came with another plate. Well, too little too late. The waiters were very nice, but when talked to they would ignore you then come a few moments later which was irritating. They lacked communication as well. I'm not sure if I would come back but I definitely wouldn't tell anyone to stay away.
author: Mai S.

description:
The Sangria here puts the S in Esperpento.  Wait.  Esperpento starts with an E.  I'm confused. Ok, ok, the sangria here puts the S in my Slurred Speech after drinking at Esperpento.  Better? Ok.

My wife describes the sangria ($4.50 per glass or $17 per pitcher) here as sweet with a mild after-taste compared to some other tapa bars.  Along with the Sangria are quite a few tapas on the menu to choose from.  We settled on:

Chorizo Salteado "Cantimpalitos" sauteed spanish sausage $5.25 - these were little bite sized sausages that come out charred.  These were tasty and a decent appetizer.

Patatas Bravas spicy potatoes ($4.50) - These potato wedges come with a mildly spicy sauce.  I really liked this tapa. Actually went well with the chorizo we ordered.

Mariscada seafood platter griddled seafood platter with calamari, jumbo tiger clams, mussels, scallops and snapper ($26) -  the difference between this and the paella is it doesn't have the burnt bottom like the paella, a little more variety of seafood, and about 20 less minutes to prepare.  I thought it was ok, just didn't move me in anyway.  Maybe next time I'll wait the extra 20 minutes...

The service was ok.  The waitress was friendly but didn't come around often.  But overall it was acceptable.  Ambiance was nice.  Great place to be able to enjoy your food and have conversation without the volume level being loud.

A cool spot for a little food, a few drinks, and tapas.  And for $46 for our total bill, these days Esperpento put the "i" in inexpensive.. Oops. There's no "i" in Esperpento.. Nevermind.
author: Michael L.

description:
Asian people be aware, they having something against Asians. We have been here twice and the same treatment. 

Food is ok but service sux azz. If you will. We had to ask for additional hot sauce 4 times before they gave it to us and the restaurant was emptied at 2pm it's not like it was bz. 

I hope this restaurant owner would take another look at who is working for them. 

Will never come back again. You've lost my business.
author: Neo N.

description: Every dish was excellent.   The portions were large for tapas,  so lucky was us we have leftovers
author: Francie M.

description:
This is my absolute favorite tapas place in the city! I've gone here a few times. It has lots of great vegetarian options - including a vegetarian paella, which is to die for! 

It can get pretty busy/crowded, so I would recommend making a reservation or going on a weekday. There are also some great bars nearby, so you can easily walk-in put down your name and then hang out at a bar while waiting for your name to be up.
author: Kavita P.

description:
I have loved this place for years, and I had not gone for dinner in over 10 years . I was not surprised that people have discovered this gem . 
The service : 
It is a small place and usually crowded . Very clean . The bathroom needs some help
. They sat us quickly and the waitress' were very kind and prompt . 

The food : 
Bread and butter/spicy sauce : yummy can't get enough! But wait if you don't know only the first basket is free . WTH ! 
Carne Asada dinner combo :  we ordered this for the kids they loved it and what a deal at $9.50 . 
Papas Bravas : spicy delicious sauce you can just dip your bread for ever 
Championes  Al ajillo : yummy ! A must get ! I love the flavor in these mushrooms
Paella de mariscos :  we ordered the size for 2 and it is more then enough for 2 . I love the seafood medley and the rice crispy on the bottom  such a great combo . Must get ! 

This is an authentic Spanish  restaurant and the mariachi playing add to the atmosphere . 

I would rank this 4.5 only taking a .5 away because now they charge $1.75 for bread ! WTH ! This was always unlimited before and with kids bread is a necessity for a peaceful dinner .
author: S R.

description: The patatas bravas here are excellent! The pallella is good. I had the oxtail soup and that was tender and delicious. The sangria is nothing special. But, I would recommend it if you're in the area.
author: Betty V.

description:
Suprisingly filling given how small and flat these plates look. 

The tapas were awesome, tried blood sausage. Was a bit squeamish but I trusted my friends. 
Quail leg plate was really good.
author: Mimi C.

description:
The service was really fast and the waiters were very polite. Food was pretty good, but for tapas the portions felt large.
My only complaint was that they leave the front door wide open, which made me a little chilly! also my table was wobbly.
Over all a good experience. Order the Sangria!!
author: Isabelle G.

description:
First time here and everything I tried was delicious. Came on a Saturday night, it was super packed, the guy at the front said it'd be at least a 30 min wait..... 10 min later we were seated. We ordered a pitcher of Sangria to start off and we just had tapas. 
Grilled Jumbo Shrimp. Garlic Shrimp, Garlic Mushrooms, Grilled Artichoke, Potatoes with sauce and a beef/chicken plate that I can't remember the exact name. Everything was so good! 
I would love to come back and try their Paella and other tapas. The sangria was very tasty and the service was great.
author: Irma R.

description:
Went here with my boyfriend (who is from Spain and knows quite a bit about Spanish cuisine). Made reservations, but when we arrived there were quite a few empty tables. We had to wait a anyway since it seemed no one was paying attention. 

The first thing that threw me off beside the dirty menu I was handed was the extremely loud Mexican band making the rounds. Having grown up listening to this type of music, I usually don't mind it, but they were pretty bad, and they felt the need to hang around the table that was right next to us all night. It made it nearly impossible to have a conversation. One of the guitar players was so close I was afraid he was going to hit me in back of the head with his guitar!  

I ordered a Verdejo and my date ordered a Sangria. Not once were we asked if we would like a second glass or a refill of water. We also ordered a variety of tapas to share. Disappointed with some of them. 

Patatas Bravas- pretty good, but the sauce on it seemed mayo based. Perfect spice, but not what the sauce is traditionally made of. 

Gambas al Ajillo- again not authentic in our opinion. It seemed more like a shrimp scampi dish you would find at Olive Garden or someplace else. The sauce was okay for dipping, but not what you would find in Spain

Rabo de toro- extremely fatty. More fat on it than meat and the broth was just swimming with it as well. It had good flavor, but it reminded me more of a Mexican soup than a Spanish one. The spices used in it seem more in tune with a posole than Rabo de toro. Disappointing. I picked some meat off, but left the rest, including the greasy broth. 

Albondigas- we had heard wonders about these, but I think they were my biggest disappointment. All you could taste was oregano!  It tasted like someone has accidentally dumped a load of it into the meat and left it as is. You couldn't taste anything else. Again, reminded me of Mexican cooking and not Spanish since that spice is not widely (or heavily) used in Spanish dishes.

Escalivada- eggplant with peppers and onions. Well, it was suppose to have peppers, but we didn't really see any. Extremely greasy including the dish. So greasy that when we picked up the dish to move it, it slipped out of my bf's hands and landed on the table. 

Two good things- the Croquetas de bacalao and the Crema Catalana. The croquettes were delicious and served with a yummy Spinach bechamel. The Crema Catalana is suppose to be similar to a creme brûlée, but better in my opinion. 

With all this, it was pretty affordable, but not something we would go back to. While the croquettas were good, my boyfriend makes WAY better ones at home. I'll just save my cravings for his home cooking, or our yearly trip to Spain. 

Two stars for the croquettas and dessert.  If I could give one and a half I would. Everything else, including the service should get one or less.
author: Diana G.

description: What I like the most from this place is the taste of the food & the Sangria, the service is a little slow sometimes, the last time I went there to get lunch the waitress gave me a change that belonged to someone else. Other than that I think is a very good environment, and I always enjoy the soft Spanish music in the back :).
author: Jath R.

description:
The food is pretty good. You won't be disappointed but you won't be amazed.

The reason for the hit in stars?
Their service is pretty bad. It was such a struggle at lunch to get our server to come over and see us. It got so bad, I had to go up and ask for bread. And then I had to get up and ask him to take our drink orders. 

I am usually a patient guy. In fact, my key phrase is no worries. But that day, I had some worries. Once I saw two parties that arrived after us get drinks and bread, I knew we were getting ditched.

Will you regret coming here? Probably not.
Are there better places for tapas? Yes, there is.
author: Noe F.

description: Esperpento boasts Iberian charm as a great local Mission District eatery.  I had the culinary pleasures of Spain at my fingertips. As I awaited my Almejas a la marinera I sipped some sangria and took a moment. I looked at the classic Spanish mosaic street signs on the walls and the cured meats and aged cheeses in the deli case.  It took me right back to my time road tripping through Spain right after college.  The food came out right in time with just enough sangria left for the main course, a nice bowl of clams in a traditional red sauce, with a basket of bread.  I couldn't have been happier and by the looks of the atmosphere in the dining room, everyone seemed to agree.  Now, this is a tapas place, and for those of you with an appetite, there are loads of small plates and mains to choose from especially paella for two.  I found my tapas of clams and glass of sangria filled me up for only 14 bucks.  It's safe to say I was more than satisfied and I think you will be too with whatever you decide to eat or share with friends!
author: A G.

description: Food here is good. Loved their patatas bravas and boquerones and sangrias. However the service was pretty slow.
author: Silvia P.

description:
Went to this place on Saturday October 8th, 2916 to celebrate my best friend's birthday. We had a reservation for six people made a few days before. The place as super crowded and loud. It happened to be an incredibly hot and humid day of San Francisco's Indian Summer.
Ventilation at this tapas bar is virtually nonexistent, and certainly not nearly enough for a place that hosts so many customers. I had a very difficult time breathing. Our table setting was incomplete, with missing knives and condiments. It took forever to get anyone to take our order. The waiters kept all passing the buck, like it's none of their business. When someone finally did take our order, he never returned to check on the status of our food, nor to see if we needed more water, sangria, or bread. It turned out he went home sick, but we were only informed of this when we ourselves were getting ready to leave. When I complained to the hostess about the poor service and lack of table settings, she acted like it was not a big deal and certainly not her problem. Our main dish, the seafood and meat paella arrived not 30 promised minutes after the order was placed but more like an hour and ten minutes! When it did finally arrive, the rice was dry and burned on the bottom. The tiny amount of seafood was sper dry and the entire dish contained no spices or salt even. I was very disappointed, since I am very familiar with what an authentic seafood paella is supposed to taste and look like, and believe me, this was not it by a long shot. However, hunger won out and our small group ate this poorly prepared dish. The tapas, which we got before were done well, I must admit, however even with this there was a gliche, as we did not get two out of the five we ordered, because they had forgotten about it , and we had to remind them, after we ate the main course.  Both the water and the Sangria were served at barely the room temperature. No one even bothered to check whether we wanted water with ice or not, and just brought us iceless lukewarm water. We had to ask for a refill. The noise level was horrendous, as the place is rather small and should not be open to so many people. In addition to the natural noise of so many customers, there was also additional noise from the two guitar players that took turns playing and singing rather loudly and off tune in an atmosphere that was already way too loud and hectic. 
In short, I would not recommend this place to anyone, despite its popularity specifically and mainly because of very poor service and lack of empathy for such service. I believe that the food may have been lacking in quality perhaps because the kitchen staff was also understaffed that evening. I will definitely never set foot on this place again, and am looking forward to reviewing it on social media!
author: Elina S.

description:
All imma say is ....DO NOT come here on a hot day....
Food is okay. Pretty usual tapas etc etc 
But definitely get AC....plleeeaasee
author: Eddy M.

description: Wow this place gets busy on a friday night. Luckily I made reservations so they had our table ready when we arrived. There was already a wait list building up at the door. The food was very tasty. The squid ink paella was big! I enjoyed that, the clams in garlic and white wine was tasty, the calamari stir fry with marinara and onions was super tasty but a bit on the small side. The mushrooms were good and I also liked the crema dessert, tasted a lot like creme brulee. It was bustling loud in the restaurant but  what I appreciated the most was how nice and chill the staff was. They did not rush us though they were super busy and so many people waiting for a table. They let us take our time and I saw many tables turn around really fast around us so the wait for most was not super long, it seemed. I will definitely be back.
author: Ravenous T.

description: Great food and great service, we always enjoy going there, the tapas are great, I love the rabo encendido (oax tail), the sausages, the paella and of course the sangria, friendly atmosphere and close to everything, parking at 21rst street garage makes it easy to go.
author: Carlos S.

description:
Best tapas in the Bay Area for my money. It's all about the food and here it's awesome. You can find more expensive Tapas but why when Esperpento is so good?

The morcilla is particularly outstanding- a must have.
author: Michel F.

description: Hubby and I came here with some friends a few months ago. We absolutely loved it. We ordered the paella and a few different tapas. The food was amazing. We also got Sangria. They have the best Sangria. I've tried the Sangria at a few other Spanish/Tapas places in SF and nothing compares to theirs.
author: Shakila H.

description:
Went for a work lunch... Got there at 12 and had a table of 10. 

Bread and sauce was good/fresh! Ordered a few tapas and lunch combination plates; the food was good and had sizable portions.

The main dish we ordered was the "mariscada" which was loaded, could have used just a little more flavor but we used the "sauce" to dip the fish in. 

Between 9 of us the bill came out to 23 bucks a pop and we all left stuffed. 

You'll be happy with this place! Try it!
author: Josue O.

description:
Raving about food!! Followed by comment about small seating spaces. Telling you that food here was delicious!! Followed by not remembering if the service was or not. 
But anyways, the tapas here are great! But i would suggest having a reservation cause it's always full!
author: Raquel R.

description:
The food itself is rather good.  We enjoyed the mushrooms, chicken croquettes, garlic clams and the patatas bravas. The paella was OK too.

The service, however, is another story.  We had 8:30 reservations and weren't seated until after 9pm after checking in with the host a few times. He clearly did not have a firm grasp on the chaotic situation known as the restaurant and even as tables opened up instead of having people seated was bombarded by people trying to put their names down instead.  Many times re-set tables would be left unseated for 10+ minutes.. 

On top of the incompetent host, the wait staff also left much to be desired.  They were strictly focused on their own tables.  If we asked a waiter (who wasnt our assigned guy) for a fork (which two of our settings were missing)  they would say - "You need to ask your waiter" instead of OK no problem. This happened many times and our waiter himself was impossible to find .. 

To be fair, this place was packed to the rim - the prices are pretty good, with a pitcher of sangria + paella and about 7 tapas the bill came out to be less than $100, so especially for SF standards the price is right, which is why I think it's so packed.. but service definitely suffers..immensely.
author: Melody T.

description:
Decided to have some tapas and took Granma out for a mothers day lunch.  
Pluses
The garlic chicken was tasty and the oxtail stew
Grill mussels were excellent and so were the fried anchovies
The choriz and the black sausage were good too
Seafood paella was good but by the time it came we were full from the tapas.
Minuses
The tables and decor are beginning to look old
Some of the stables are really close to each other.
Parking can be an issue in the evenings
Overall a very good experience, small taps are great to try out with more variety.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I made reservations for here for my mom's birthday and she was craving paella. We came on a Sunday and there wasn't many people. Once we got seated our waiter told us that if we wanted to order paella it would take at least 30 minutes. I wished the menu online stated that it would take 30 mins... unless I somehow did not see it. We ordered the meat and seafood combo paella for 4.

My whole family ordered their own lunch serving... and I was like we should just order tapas since we have paella!! But no... no one ever listens to me! And by the time the paella came they were full -_- I ordered the grilled vegetable salad which was so good. I mean it was so simple yet really flavorful, probably because of the garlic and aioli. My family shared the grilled calamari tapas, really good too. I had some of my dad's salmon which was good too but I liked the calamari better. But I hate how it's so oily :(

I was so impatient for the paella to come LOL i swear every 5 minutes I kept turning around to see if our paella was coming. There was 6 of us and we ordered the paella for 4 and it was still too much that we had to take some home, but then again we were kinda full already. I don't eat meat so I was literally picking out all the seafood out of the paella haha. The seafood was good, but the paella was just okay. It was kinda soggy. I was like digging the plate to get the best part of the paella, the burnt crispy edges haha. I personally like the paella from Cha Cha Cha's.

I was hoping they would do something for my mom's birthday but they didn't :(
author: Kimberly T.

description: Absolutely love the authenticity in these Tapas! Absolutely not cool with the fact that they are closed on Sunday's Booooo. Oh and the fact that the young male with the stretch earlobes demanded a larger amount in his tip that we were financially able to give him.
author: Jennifer M F.

description:
Unassuming little spot in the heart of the Mission that's been around for literally as long as I have, since it was founded the year I was born! The menu is pretty no-frills, but there's a ton of variety and choices, including lots of vegetarian options. We got seven dishes and a paella for two to share between four people, and ended up with enough leftovers for a full meal.

* Squid ink paella: I looove all things squid ink, and this did not disappoint! The seafood was nothing to write home about, but the overall flavor of the dish was great if you like the umami of squid ink and the portion was huge.
* Alcachofas (grilled artichokes): okay - personally not a fan of how fibrous they were.
* Tortilla de Patata (potato and onion omelet): worth ordering, and a dish that seems to be pretty hard to find in SF!
* Croquestas de Pollo (chicken croquettes): probably not something I'd order again, the filling was somewhat mushy and I'm not sure what the role of the chicken was.
* Rabo Toro (oxtail stew): best part was by far the broth, but all of it was good.
* Calamares a la Plancha (grilled calamari): well cooked, but could have used a little more flavor.
* Salmon Strips: nothing to write home about, but a good balance for all of the other heavy dishes we got.
* Chorizo Salteado "Cantimpalitos" (sauteed Spanish sausage): so so good - definitely worth trying!

Overall the food was good, not stellar but definitely worth coming back for. The sangria was fantastic though, and the $10 happy hour pitchers are unbeatable. The prices are lower than most other tapas places in SF too and the wait wasn't bad at all for a Saturday night walk-in.
author: Chloe E.

description: My boyfriend took me here last night the wait was about half an hour for two people at 8:45 and the place was packed so I knew it had to be good! The sauce for the bread is amazing! We were told the paella would take 40-50 minutes so we got an appetizer to hold us up. The inside is so cute theres an intimate cute seat for two under the stairs I want next time! Sangria, mussels and paella was all delicious. The lobster tasted fresh. Left full and happy and without a super expensive bill!
author: Geena G.

description:
The paella is really good here. It does take an extra 30 minutes for it to come out but it is delicious! We got the lobster for 2 and it was generous portion. However, they only gave two lobster tails, one for each.

The other really good thing here was the potatoes with the orange sauce. I'm not sure what it is but it was really good. I wanted to get seconds but didn't since we were still waiting for the paella. 

They have a sign that they only take cash. Luckily there's a Wells and a Chase not too far away.

Overall, great paella place in the Mission but it is cash only.

Pros:
-Generous portions
-Tasty paella
-Tasty potatoes

Cons:
-Cash only
-Service was a little slow even though there weren't that many people there when we were there
author: Paul U.

description: First time in this restaurant.   I definitely would not come back.   Really noisy, cannot have a conversation.   The paellas were overcooked and dry.   Also they had Mexican music. really loud.   In a spanish restaurant?  really?  I was not amused at all
author: Juan V.

description:
Worst meal I can recall spending significant money on. We left feeling robbed and unhappy,
Ordered Paella and was told 35 minute wait. About an hour later we received the worst paella of my life - over cooked, cold, bland, terrible. The shrimp isn't deveined so I hope you like shrimp poop. The mussels were gritty. Nothing but the calamari rings were actually cooked with the rice, just overcooked additions thrown on top.

Bland bland bland.  We barely touched it, was asked if we wanted it to go, we said no. No inquiries as to if there was a problem. Anyone who has had a satisfactory paella before could look at it and see clearly it's terrible. It was like they forgot about it and overcooked it and then forgot about it after taking it off the heat. And forgot to season it with anything, and then threw some unclean seafood items on top and peas on top and called it a day.

I'm a quarter Spanish and a quarter Basque, but could have been pleased by an average paella, but this was truly criminal.

The lady waitress was nice, but if your guests don't touch something and don't want it to go and it looks like shit - say something, offer something, or expect angry customers leaving that will then talk about how terrible your restaurant is.
author: Jane H.

description:
Food was delicious. Everything we ordered was perfect. Favorite item was the "PARILLADA" plate. It had just about every type of meat you could possibly want. 

The free starter bread was bomb. especially the sauce. Ugh, I could eat that for days. 

The service was great a first until our waiter Alex disappeared and we had to fend for ourselves flaggin down any other waiter for service. The place is small and cramped, not really good for groups over 6 people. 

be careful, when the bill came they tried to add a handwritten "service charge" yet our party was only 5 people, we asked them to remove it and if it was to remain, that it should be pre-printed, computer generated...

they were trying to scam us acting like we were a party of 6, they were so scandalous. good thing we reviewed the bill that's why they getting 3 stars.
author: Mike C.

description:
Authentic paella . Delicious !
Although we came yesterday Monday , according to Yelp it was open but it was closed.
Glad we came came back again today.
author: Bashar A.

description:
I came about 45 minutes before closing on a week day and they sat us with no problem.  The only downside was that it was too late to order paella.

We ordered a whole bunch of tapas dishes and literally everything we ate was amazing.  Let's do a play by play so you can really understand how good it was.  First, bread and a spicy aioli sauce to dip in.  Simple but really really good, even after we got our food, we asked for more bread and dip.  The sauces in all the seafood plates are highly dippable and the spicy dip is highly spreadable on anything.

Next was grilled clams in olive oil and parsley.  We couldn't decide between the clams with marinara sauce or olive oil and the waiter suggested the olive oil.  The sauce was ridiculously flavorful.  If everything else weren't so good, I would've been content to eat a whole plate of bread dipped in that sauce.

Jamon Serrano.  What to say here?  It's salty cured meat on a piece of toast.  What is there not to like?  We had also ordered anchovies, so slap one of those on top of the jamon and slather some of that spicy dip and it's even better.

Oxtail stew was savory and comforting.  The chunks of meat were so tender, they fell right off the bone.

Grilled quail with rosemary potatoes.  The skin was perfectly crisp and the flavor was on point.  The potatoes were also the bomb diggity, exploding with flavor.

Grilled artichoke was one of my favorites.  The pieces are sliced through the whole artichoke, not just the heart, so you can see the layers of leaves.  The grill flavor was wonderful.  I have never seen this before and will probably order this over and over again.

Grilled scallops came with three large pieces on a skewer with yellow rice.  The flavor was good but the portion was a little skimpy.

All in all, we were totally stuffed.  Did we over order in a panic that the kitchen was going to close?  Maybe.  Do we regret it?  Not one bit.  The service was great and not once did we feel rushed.  The kitchen closed at their stated closing time but all the other patrons in the restaurant continued to hang out and enjoy their wine.

This is the best tapas I've had since eating in Spain and most of the dishes are very reasonable priced.  This is our new favorite place.
author: Emmi D.

description:
I think this place is a much more authentic style spanish/tapa food than lolo which is around the corner.  I wasn't very hungry so ordered only small tapa's: 

Anchovies in olive oil and citrus, not sure what the spanish name for it was.  It was exactly how I thought it would taste, fishy, oily and a light hint of citrus.  Kind of meh tasting by itself but I ended up putting it on my free bread with some of the red hot sauce that the bread came with and it complimented each other very well, even though the bread was a bit tough.

Brocheta De Vieiras: scallops with onions on a stick/skewer.  The scallops were on the smaller side but they were cooked perfectly.  Nice grill marks, still plump and had good flavor where most scallops I usually try are bland.

Almejas A La Plancha grilled clams with garlic. "guindilla" parsley and olive oil.  My first bite of the clams was extremely salty.  The so salty that it feels like it burns your tongue kind of salty.  But my friends were eating it just fine and they didn't seem to find it salty at all.  Confused, I tried another one, crazy salty again, my friends must be insane.  My friends eat the rest and leave one more for me, reluctantly I try it again, and its not salty at all and quite tasty...Why couldn't the others taste like the 3rd one?

Overall for the price I think my dining experience was just A-OK.  Would I come back? Maybe...when i'm much more hungrier and can try a larger variety of the menu.
author: Mike K.

description: Ok I really love this place, food is good the first Time we went there and the 2nd, third time which was today, they have a horrible horrible service. First of all, we were waiting at the for for a few minutes, no one is paying attention to us and greeted us. Then we decided to take take a seat and grab the menu ourselves. Then right after someone came to us and gave us water. After 10 minutes that no one even bother went to us, we just left. If you don't have enough people to work, just close.
author: Range B.

description:
-Tapas tapas tapas! On a Wednesday evening it was PACKED! It was SO HOT in there!!! Place was CRAMPED. Ugh not very enjoyable.

-Service was super slow. My group and I sat upstairs and the waitress only came by when food was ready. Pray that you get a table downstairs, or just go in small groups.

-Food took so long to come. Heck, water took 20 minutes! I was so hungry... bread wasn't going to do. Oh did I mention free bread and butter :)

+Tapas came fast... 10 mins ish? Small plates but very good. Garlic shrimp was good. The leftover oil made a great bread dip. The spicy potatoes were good too! Paella took waaaaaaay longer than the stated 30 minutes. When it arrived, it was pretty good but I wasn't happy with how oily it was. The rice was like slippery thanks to the oil.

I wouldn't come back here because of the environment and such oily foods... Food overall was delicious though don't get me wrong but not my style.
author: Benita M.

description: Go for Paella Monday !!  The seafood dish is the best and specially love the crispy rice that coats the pan!!  Well done.
author: Mike M.

description:
This place is delicious...we ordered the chorizo, some patata thing I can remember the name of, the garlic shrimp and the sangria. We loved it all! And the price is very reasonable. 

The ambience is nice too, there was a mariachi playing and singing all night. 

If I was from the area, I would definitely frequent this spot!!
author: Lauren K.

description:
I had been to this place about 3 times before with friends.  Yes, it is a long wait (30 min to 45min) but we thought it was so worth, (their paella is delicious!). On the other hand, the service is very poor; servers barely check on their tables, take about 20 min to bring more bread or water.  Once again, we didn't mind the poor service, since the food was so good! And always made sure to give a good tip to the server.  Last time I was at this place, my group consisted of 4 adults, 1 toddler and 1 new born.  Everything went on as usual, until the server gave us the check, everything looked fine until I noticed the server crossed off the total and added her own 20% gratuity by hand and circled the new total!   ( again- we always make sure to tip at least 18% for our server)  if she wouldn't have done this, YES! We would have left a good tip, only because the food made up for her  shitty  service , but the fact that she demanded to be tip  this amount pissed everybody off. We ended up leaving her cash, but was not the amount she asked on the check. She had the guts to follow us out and asked for her money. We could not believe what this server did. 
Will not be coming back to this place, and make sure to revise your check before  paying !
author: Cathy V.

description: Local Spanish tapas restaurant in the Mission District. We were relatively new to the cuisine and I was glad our waiter was nice enough to recommend us some of the more traditional dishes. We had blood sausages or what's known is morcilla. I wasn't a fan, it was dry and a little mushy, but you should try it to see what it's like for yourself.
author: Zorayr K.

description:
So I am super torn about this review.  The three stars are for the food itself, and not the service.  Service & experience would not get one star from me.  

A friend brought me here, one of her favorite Spanish restaurants.  So we drove up to SF from the South Bay to go eat here.

First off, we had a reservation, but the table they wanted to put us at, was literally squished in between two other tables where it would not accommodate both of us to actually sit at the table, even after asking to move to another table were told that was the only one available.  Very awkward!  They moved us to another table, but only because someone else cancelled a reservation.  Seriously, not a great way to start.  

Okay, so now we are at a comfortable table.  It took about 20 minutes for a server to come and get our order.  We ordered everything up front.  Then waited another 30 minutes for our drinks.

I am not sure if they were understaffed, but it definitely wasn't running efficiently.  There was a large party upstairs that were very upset.  Not sure what happened, but it was looking like the customer & the manager were going to get into a fist fight!

We got our appetizers after about 40 minutes.  And they were good.  We got potatoes, calamari and asparagus.  I would have passed on the asparagus though, as its not in season so just kind of blah.  But the potatoes and calamari were very good.

We eventually got our main dinner, lobster paella.  And it really was good.  I could eat the rice alone, it had so much flavor in it.  

The food was definitely good (the three stars is completely based on the food), but the service (again, not sure what it is like normally and hoping it was just an off night), and probably won't get another drive from the South Bay out of me to come here.
author: Buffy M.

description:
I've been here a handful of times, with a year or twos time in between In hopes of improvement. Sadly, it only went further down hill. 
My 4 roommates and I made a reservation for Valentine's Day at 7:30 on a Tuesday - when we got there they were not that busy. 
The worst part about this place is the service. And I mean the food isn't great either... but the service here is so bad it started to become comical. It's like the waiter and 2 waitresses look at the ceiling when they walk because they refuse to acknowledge ANY requests. 
We ordered vegetable platter to start.. and then we never saw our waitress again. We waited so long we had to literally stand in front of their monitor and ask them to continue taking our order. That was an ordeal in itself. 
They didn't refill water or bread THE ENTIRE TIME. Everyone literally brought out their own water bottles and sat them on the table until those were empty too and they STILL DIDNT COME. 
We put in an order for veggie paella and some other stuff, which the waitress didn't repeat back or really say no much about so we had no idea what she actually heard while pretending to listen to us. 
They left dirty/used/empty plates and containers all over our table the entire night, by the last dish we literally had to clear our own table to make room for our food that took 45 min to cook...
Don't ever go here. The sangria looks tempting but it'll only be better than the service by a hair. And not the 4 strands of long brown hair that was in the paella....
author: Emma G.

description: Food is decent for the price. But the seating order is ridiculous. We waited patiently for a table of 2 and were passed up by someone with the same amount of people. He didn't even explain why. I guess making a reservation is useless too if they do this type of seating order.
author: Jackie S.

description:
Situation:
- Dinner on a Sunday night with friends
- Ordered the Patatas Bravas and Pollo Adobo
- Friends ordered the Paella and Sangria

Pros:
- Great service 
- The tapas and the paella come in large portions
- The Patatas Bravas were excellently spicy
- Bread comes with the meal

Cons:
- The Pollo Adobo was good, but not great
author: Dipesh G.

description:
Quality is what you would expect for the price, but it's a good deal! Get the bistec, it's around 12 bucks and you will be very full. 

The only down side to this place is they have these performers that play SUPER loud and come around to the tables and ask for donations. If I was going to the restaurant to hear the super loud, just ok music, then maybe I would be inclined to donate, but when you are out with your gfs and the guy with the guitar stands over you and lingers longer than an awkward moment, it makes you not want to come back. I came here around 2 years ago, and the ambiance was different. It looks cleaner now. I would still go back for the bistec meal, and creamed spinach. The paella is pretty good, but not amazing. If you just want a fix, and you want the cost to be reasonable and the place isn't super crowded then this is your place.
author: Evelyn J.

description: Not sure how this place got such good reviews but as a "foodie" and someone who works in the industry I was very disappointed. Service was non- existent and the food was pretty bland and awful. Overall a huge disappointment, will not be back!
author: Nicole V A.

description:
The tapas here were decent. We ordered the shrimp, salt cod croquetas, fried salmon strips, and asparagus for tapas, in addition to paella. I especially liked the shrimp, which were full of flavor and had a nice spicy kick, but the salt cod croquetas were bland and not very good.  Salmon strips were different but also a bit underwhelming. Also ordered the meat and seafood paella, which was very mediocre and underwhelming. I would not order this again. 

Service was slow but acceptable, and food was brought out in ample time. Ambiance was busy but quite loud. Overall, this place is decent, but certainly nothing to write home about.
author: Ronnie S.

description:
The ambiance here is great. The food is great. What more can you ask for?

I ordered the garlic shrimp, which came with rice soaked in a light flavorful oil. Paired with some wine, it's one of the best dishes I've had in any cuisine.

Definitely recommend dropping by if in the area.
author: Henry L.

description:
30-June, Sunday
There was definitely an abundance of saffron throughout the duration this meal, I can only imagine how pigmented my stomach lining must have became afterwards.

The seafood Paella was very fresh, and they definitely did not skimp on the shell-fish, the saffron rice was intensely aromatic and rich in flavor, and was definitely a good value for the price (the portion was immense, and easily provided left-overs for the following days to come)

-Rabbit Stew: flavorful, slowcooked. Tasted similar to poultry but slightly more rich a tad more gamey.

-Albondigas meat-balls in a saffron based stew has a subtle earthy flavor to the base, with a lot of aromatic.
author: Ty T.

description:
What I love here is the quality of food, quality of wine and quality of service. The prices make me want to run back! 

A small tip: if you use a card to play, the little folder swallows the card when you get it back and you can end up leaving without it very easily. Be warned
author: Kevin F.

description:
Though we'd been here once before nearly two years ago, this was an occasion recent enough to decently recount. Only craving a "luner" (lunch + dinner), my date and I trekked nearby into the Mission District for something simple. Tapas it would be at Esperpento!

We started with a pitcher of sangria. Never a bad way to start! Sharing everything, we ordered Jamón Serrano (sort of like thicker prosciutto), Boquerones Fritos (deep fried anchovies), and Gambas Al Ajillo (garlic shrimp) as appetizers -- my favorite to try were the anchovies. All were very good.

Our main dish for 2 was the Paella De Monte Or Caza, which consisted of rabbit, quail, hints of herbs, mushroom, and asparagus. While I thought the rabbit seemed a bit dry, the quail was moist and decent. And, for someone who's not a fan of mushrooms, those things actually tasted surprisingly great.

The actual Esperpento restaurant has two levels of seating, though it's mostly on the ground floor. Not too fancy, more focused on flavor. Some dishes are more hit or miss, but many hits.
author: Garett T.

description:
Good food.  Fun environment although a bit noisy.  
Like any tapas place, the more people you bring the more opportunity to widen your selection of dishes.
author: Tim L.

description: Went in for there paella and wine night special, which I believe happens once a week, can't remember what day. Was really excited since it had been a really long time since I'd had paella. Unfortunately didn't even get a chance to try it since they only sat then ignored us. I couldn't even tell you if they have clean cups and/or water, since they didn't even bother to give us that while waiting to even receive a menu. Sounds like pretty basic stuff even if a restaurant is busy doesn't it. I don't mind waiting when I notice a restaurant is busy so long as I'm at least acknowledged. After being seated we even attempted to flag two different people down to simply look over the menu as we waited to get our order taken, but got a "I'm not a waiter" response from both as if handing us a menu was going to cause their arm to fall off. We eventually chucked it out to being discriminated for being Latin since it seemed most of their customers were Caucasian. We got up and left, very disappointed. After all, they are located in a Latin neighborhood.
author: Jessica Y.

description:
It's always pretty tasty, but the service is never great. Like, sometimes it is actively bad. I've had to get up and ask a waiter to come wait on my table multiple times.

But! Otherwise, the food is fine and the sangria is good. Despite it all, I'll probably be back just because I like tapas so much.
author: Kate M.

description: I loved this place! There was no wait and the food came super fast. There was so many sauces that you could have with bread it was amazing.
author: Aksh V.

description:
I'm a big fan of seafood, especially lobster. So when my friend Daniel L. suggested that I try their popular Lobster Paella, I knew I had to check this place out before leaving SF. I love my paellas, whether it be the traditional Valenciana or the Mixta (meat & seafood, the best of both worlds!). I've been craving for a paella fix for quite some time since my last binge, the added tapas menu sealed the deal for me. 

We made reservations on my last night in SF. Our reservation was for 7:45pm but we had to wait a while because our table was still occupied. No biggie, I was still stuffed from my snack a couple hours earlier at Hog Island Oyster Co. Our server was very apologetic & even gave us free Sangria for the wait, sweet!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=jZq2dxyRcUoJfO78-c4rhQ

Overall, the food was okay. There were a couple items that I liked & would probably order again. But the overall experience and 30min wait for the paella left me a bit disappointed. Everyone was done with their appetizers and entrees, but I was still waiting on my paella. 

 The restaurant is not that big, pretty crowded w/tables being closely spaced, to the point that my chair would get kicked by servers during passing (I even got an elbow to the shoulder as one server was carrying plates of food pass me). My point: There's just no room for an in-your-face Mariachi band. 

Street performers needs to be just that, street performers. Yes, Esperpento lets this Mariachi band in to play music (per some of the regular patrons). Free entertainment for the restaurant. I don't mind them playing music, but when it's blaring right next to my ears and raining spit while I'm eating....that's when I get irritated. The worst part is that they rudely walked around to each of us at our table & shoved their tip bag in our faces, saying nothing more than "tip please"... WTF?!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=HE6VEuaHiQjV2zXNnNhBww

Okay, now that I've got that out of my system, let's talk food. I'll start with the good (indicated w/ *):

* MEJILLONES A LA VINAIGRETTE ($6)
Steamed mussels in a spicy-garlicky butter sauce. The sweet shallots & chili flakes complimented the very plump, well-cooked mussels. I should've ordered 2 of these. I also wished that there were bread to sop up all of that goodness on the bottom of the bowl.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=1WsMI5GslpqXbI4oiE8_nQ

* ALCACHOFAS A LA PLANCHA ($5.50): 
Thinly sliced artichokes are grilled with garlic and parsley. My 2nd favorite dish of the night. The artichoke was nicely charred and crisp, the perfect salty-garlicky treat! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=I0vZXzmJZ7dIvAz-6Xy0mg

* CALAMARES A LA PLANCHA ($6.50)
Tender calamari pieces were tossed in an olive oil/garlic/parsley mixture & grilled to perfection. So tender! The grilled onions & tomatoes lacked seasoning, a pinch of salt would've made it perfect.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=WqgbuGA270_uGnUJXyd5Fw

CALAMARES FRITOS ($6.50)
You all know how much I love my fried calamari, I couldn't pass this up. Wish I did though because it was a soggy-greasy mess. I prefer my fried calamari to be crisp and not soft.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=2xCaESzL1G46CYLw79RJ2w
 
PAELLA DE LA LANGOSTA/LOBSTER PAELLA ($28 for a portion big enough for 2, $50 for 4 people & $75 for 6):

Ours had 2 small lobster tails (split into 4 halves), clams, calamari & peas.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=ruJ0AaBcoJjfsl4_PX_x0Q

This was suppose to be my entree. It was the last to arrive bc it took more than 30mins, so by then we were all done with everything else & just sat around waiting. It turned out to be a disappointing dish, not worth the wait.

The lobster tails were overcooked & dry. It was funny to see some of us fighting to get the meat out from the shell, it was pretty tough & stringy! 

The calamari was thin, it's like chewing on rubber bands. In this pic, you can see how thin the calamari rings were, almost the same diameter as the peas.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=TUVOMbKAbk_dJCHvVJZsNg

The most essential part of a great paella is the rice, the protein & veggies only adds flavor to the dish. The 'socarrat' is what I look forward to in a well-made paella. It's the crusty-crunchy rice layer that forms at the bottom of the pan, where all the flavors of the ingredients are the most concentrated. This is only possible when the pan is cooked over very high heat or an open fire. Cooking in an oven will only give you soggy risotto like this:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=qRbH0Pxi8M67mihOp63fjQ

I didn't get a saffron kick at all. If there were any saffron in the pan, it was very weak. The paella was more like a risotto dish. Thank god for post-dinner Fernet shots at The Rockit Room!
author: Cin T.

description:
This review is long overdue. I went here with a few local friends before going out and I was impressed that the food was good and not terribly pricey. We split a bunch of tapas.

I know we had a chicken dish, spicy potatoes, some paella and a few other items. We ate here about four months ago so I'm blanking on what we ordered.

I didn't have any sangria but it looked really tasty. It's not too big inside but we didn't have any trouble finding a table on a busy Saturday night with a total of four people. 

When my other tapas places are crowded, I'll stop here. I definitely want to go back and try the sangria if anything else.
author: Amy J.

description: Food is delicious and for the price I can see myself going back, but some of the waitress aren't that great. We were stuck with this older Spanish woman who kept messing up our older. Her service was slow and she tried to over charge us for the service charge even though there was only four of us in a group. Next time I will personally request a different waitress.
author: James W.

description: Great, simple food--good service, great prices (for San Francisco). We didn't try many dishes on the menu, but we loved every one we tasted.
author: Alan H.

description:
"Sorry, we're going to need ANOTHER table (AGAIN)." One may think it's because we have more people, but in our case it's ALWAYS b/c my friends and I order a plethora amount of food that leaves the wait staff and other patrons (o_O).

Our dinner on Monday, 2.21.11 was no exception. I realize this review is bit dated but as I was looking through my notes on my BB, I realized that I never wrote a review for Esperpento (Yes, I'm a nerd and take notes.) That night, we (party of 6) walked in w/o reservations at 6 PM and were seated upstairs w/ only a 2-3 min wait. We knew our table may not be large enough for all our food so we asked if we can add the empty table next to us to our table which our waiter was more than happy to oblige.

F O O D / D R I N K S:
*3 PITCHERS OF SANGRA ($17/ea): Smooth and full of fruity flavors and notes w/ a touch of an acidic bite. The bits of apple and oranges gave it an extra burst of sweetness. 

*PAELLA DE LA LANGOSTA - Lobster Paella (Serving for 4 - $50): DISAPPOINTING!!!

I'm no Paella expert but I've had paella enough times and watch enough Food Network and Travel Channel to know the components that make a good paella. Other Yelpers have raved about Esperpento's paella but that night our paella was a complete fail. 

RICE: The rice was firm but had a creamy risotto like consistency (not dry and separate the way it should be). It was flavorful and had soaked up all the liquids and aromatics (i.e. onions, garlic, saffron and other herbs) but it also had an off putting fishiness to it.

SOCARRAT: Perhaps the heating source wasn't sufficient or the incorrect pan was used, but the paella lacked the golden caramelized bottom crust which is quintessential to a good paella.  

TOPPINGS: The lobster (4 lobster tails halved) was overcooked, dry, stringy and bland and the calamari had a prominent fishiness to it. We utilized all 10 lemon wedges to add some moistness and to hide the unappetizing fishy flavor. 

TAPAS: Serving size per a tapa was 2-3 people so we ordered 2 orders for some dishes.

*2 JAMON SERRANO - Cured Ham on French Bread ($6) SIMPLY DELICIOUS! Crusty bread topped w/ a salty and fatty slice of ham w/ thick slices of tomatoes for sweetness and tang.

*2 PATAS BRAVAS -Spicy Potatoes ($4.50): YUMMY! The potatoes had a super crisp exterior w/ a pillowly soft interior. The spicy aioli was rich and creamy w/ nice kick of heat.

*2 CROQUETAS DE POLLA - Chicken Croquettes ($5): SAVORY & COMFORTING! The croquettes were fried to a golden brown w/ an extra crisp crust and filled w/ a savory creamed chicken mixture. The accompanying creamed spinach sauce added a tangy zip and an extra layer of richness.

*CALAMARES A LA PANCHA - Grilled Calamari ($6.75): GOOD! The calamari was perfectly grilled to a sweet tenderness and was flavorful w/ a subtle smokiness.

*MEJILLONES A LA PLACHA - Grilled Mussels ($7): GOOD! The sweet and tender mussels were bathing in a savory and rich broth w/ herbaceous notes brightened w/ the splash of lemons. Our complimentary crusty bread was perfect for dunking and soaking up all the brothy goodness.

*GAMBAS AJILLO SHRIMP - Garlic Shrimp ($7): GARLICKY GOODNESS! The tender and sweet shrimp albeit small were bathing in garlic sauce which was buttery, robust and full of bold garlicky flavor.

*RABO TORO - Oxtail Stew ($7): COMFORTING! The oxtail was fall-off-the-bone tender and was in a rich and savory broth. The broth had a depth of flavor as if the oxtails, veggies and herbs had been simmering for hours.

*ROPA VIEJO - Beef, Chicken & Chorizo Stew ($5.50): OK. The beef and chicken were dry and there was a lack of chorizo to give the stew a rich and smoky flavor.

*CHAMPINONES AL AJILLO - Mushroom w/ Garlic ($5.25): DELISH! The mushrooms were tender and meaty w/ a distinct garlic flavor that wasn't overwhelming and sprinkles of parsley for a pop of freshness.

*ASPARAGUS A LA PLANCHA - Grilled Asparagus Ala Plancha ($5.25): PERFECTLY COOKED! The large spears were vibrant green and tender, yet had the crisp al-dente bite to it. The spicy aioli gave it a layer of creaminess w/ a slight kick and the lemons a citrus punch.

S E R V I C E:
Our waiter was friendly, down-to-earth and attentive. 

Our food came out quickly w/ only a 5 min wait for our first dish while the others quickly followed suit.  The paella took the longest at about 30 mins.

A M B I A N C E / D É C O R:
Rustic and casual Spanish feel w/ bright yellow, red and pink hues, country wood tables and chairs, Spanish abstract art and tchotchkes. It's  very lively especially when the Mariachi Band makes its rounds so it's a fun atmosphere for groups.    

P A R K I N G:
Difficult street parking, however, there's a parking garage on 2 blocks away on 21st/Valencia. 

Esperpento is a good alternative to Cha Cha Cha w/ very solid dishes full of vibrant flavors. I would come back again but would skip the paella.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Delicious paella, very good service, reasonable prices and nice environment. Recommend it :)
author: Tamara M.

description:
You know that overused Yelp cliche, "I really wanted to like this place"? Well, I really wanted to hate this place.

Made a reservation for 6 @ 7pm on a Sunday night. We got there just  before 7pm and from the street we saw a similar sized group just walk in. When we walk in, that other group gets seated at a nice big roomy table. I go to give my name and the waiters/host huddle amongst themselves and tells us about 15-20 minutes even with my RESERVATION. I overheard that the other group was a walk-in W/O reservations. Really? When a table finally opened up they put two tiny circular tables, that's meant for 2 people, together right in between some pillars. Really? Talk about squished, but whatever. 

The interior - . (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=tTwO84P0Yj2JMAJqzK7F5A)

Their Spanish food was their saving grace. There was even a guitarist that plays some songs, so have some dollars ready.  

Food for 6 - 

BREAD AND OLIVES - on the house. 
SANGRIA - 2 x $17 - I liked the fresh bits of apples and orange. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=eJPF_iAO9z1fnU_-r9n_Jw)
PARRILLADA DE CARNE - $22 Griddled meat platter. Nothing says  SF tapas than stuffing chorizo down your mouth!  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=Z6f2SsKYZhiO0LlItZN1GQ)
LOBSTER PAELLA for 6 - $74 - There were 11 half-tails so almost everyone got a full tail. Really good flavor on the rice, not too runny and salty. Clams, calamari, and like 1 or 2 shrimp. (w/flash - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=Z1i71eccBxCSAZzaAoOhDg) w/o flash (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=HcWp41IuOtFMSWcgX44b1g)
-----------------
w/ tax and tip = $28 per person.

Yes, I'd bring friends here and I have to agree with Daniel L that if you're going to be doing paella in the city. This is your place.
author: Earl G.

description:
It was good, but not amazing.  The spicy potatoes that everyone talks about really are baked to perfection, but the spicy part of it is just a sauce, the same sauce that comes out with the bread.  So it's like I got two things that were starchy with the same sauce, back to back.  Now that I know, I'll probably try a different dish.

We got the lobster paella.  This was pretty solid...the rice was well flavored with seafoody tastes mmm.  It was big enough for 3 of us to share alongside the couple of sides that we got.  The cabbage side that we got was simple, but exactly what we expected, but nothing special.  All in all, I'd come back it the other spots on the street that I want to try had too long of a wait.  But nothing I'd need to come back to.
author: starrynight c.

description:
When I think back on my evening at Esperanto, I can only smile. It was an evening filled with yummy sangria, paella and amazing company. It was truly a good meal bookended with the delicious tapas and amazing flan. :) 

My friend had made a reservation at Esperpento for 7:30pm and because I had run into some traffic getting into the city, the reservation was pushed back to 8pm without any hassle it seems. We got to the restaurant by 8pm and waited for about 15 minutes. We were seated and because it was Monday night, ordered the paella special. The paella on Monday nights came with a pitcher of sangria AND a dessert flan! What a great deal! There were 5 people in the party so we ordered the paella for 6 and two tapas to share while we waited for the paella to finish cooking (it takes about 40 minutes understandably). 

The sangria was good and pretty strong for my tastes; definitely not watered down though I wished it was more chilled. My friends ordered some blood sausage and fried cheese and both dishes were amazing! I LOVED the texture of the blood sausage and wished there was more! 

Seriously though, the start of the meal was that paella. We ordered the seafood paella and it did not disappoint. It arrived to our table, steaming hot and we dug in. There were so many plentiful pieces of seafood (clams, mussels & shrimp). I love love loved each bite and we all devoured the contents of the big skillet ravenously. It was, hands down, the best paella I've ever had and my the meal got a big thumbs up from my Columbian friend so that's saying something. 

Bottom line: The dim lighting, close seating and light music made the restaurant very romantic and intimate. The food is amazing and I would love to come back if I'm ever in the city again...but maybe only on a Monday night. haha

Yelp 2015 Challenge: 5/100
author: Sandy L.

description:
Everything I ate was tasty, yet not exceptional; I did not have flashbacks to Spain, which I visited this year.  Everyone was nice and helpful.  Some previous reviewers mentioned being treated differently because they are Asian, and even though half our party was Asian, we all were treated quite well.

We ordered patatas bravas, garlic shrimp, calamari, asparagus, artichokes, jamon, manchego, little sausages, cabbage and more.  The cabbage was nice and spicy and everything else was good, but the quality of most things, like the manchego and jamon could have been better.  I just remember the jamon tasting much better in Spain and I've had better manchego here; readily available.  We all had fun and enjoyed the music and food.  I really give them 3 1/2 stars.
author: Delicious B.

description: Have been a regular here for a while, I have tasted pretty much everything in the menu. Paella is the way to go if you have the patience to wait for it to be cooked for an hour. Second favorite plate is their milanesa and if you add it with rice and potatoes is delicious. Sangria is a must here. Long waits during the weekend, during weekdays they are open from 11 to 3 and then they reopen for dinner at 5pm to 10pm. One of my favorite restaurants in the Mission.
author: Suzy R.

description:
Overall the food was actually pretty good.  And the ambiance was very chill and open and definitely fostered good times with good company!

I actually don't think I have anything negative to say about the place, so if you are in this area of the city, give it a look!
author: Eddie M.

description:
I absolutely love Esperpento! I'm really surprised it doesn't have 4+ stars. 

I came here for their paella this past weekend. I walked in here at 6pm on a Saturday night and it was surprisingly empty. The place filled up pretty quickly around 7 though. 

My family and I ordered the Lobster Paella for two and it was DELICIOUS. It comes straight out in the paella pan, with plenty of perfectly cooked rice, 4 (!!) lobster tails, plenty of calamari and clams. All that for only $38! I couldn't believe it. I've had one other place make it with more flavor, but the paella still tasted amazing here. It's definitely enough to split among 3 people. And the lobster was probably the JUICIEST lobster I HAVE EVER EATEN! I couldn't get enough. 

I also ordered a few tapas and vegetable plates. I recommend it all! I started with the garlic mushroom and grilled asparagus. Both were delicious! Didn't know such a simple vegetable could taste so spectacular. The garlic flavor in the mushrooms was simply heavenly and I loved the sauce the asparagus came with. 
The tapas were a hit as well. We ordered a quail, which was cooked and seasoned to perfection, and the ox tail stew. The stew was definitely more of a soup than a stew but tasted delicious nonetheless. My uncle wasn't a fan because he thought it was too soupy, but I loved the simple, clean flavors of the dish. 

Will be back!
author: Carolyn L.

description:
I have visited a couple of times on dates. I arrived with the expectation that it's Spanish cuisine and the Spanish like to take their time. Thus, I didn't get as frustrated as others when we waited for our Paella for a bit. 

The second visit was much better than the first, it seemed as though the seafood was overcooked the first time. Slightly rubbery.

I can strongly recommend the Jamon Serrano. Superb!
author: Richard C.

description:
I don't know how this Spanish tapas place has only 3.5 stars. So, I thought I'd put my two cents in.

Esperpento is a cute, little restaurant nestled in the Mission, not a far walk from the Bart station and literally a block away from Mission St. Location is so important to me. The restaurant's decor is eclectic and rustic, and definitely adds a cultural vibe to your dining experience. (I also love these things.)

When it comes to the food, the menu can be slightly overwhelming, but they do organize all small plates according to category (meat, vegetarian, etc.). The paella is delicious, too, but seldom do I/we order it. What you MUST get: Patatas Bravas (the sauce is to die for and I still have yet to find a restaurant that tops this recipe) and Alcachofas (grilled artichokes prepared in a way you wouldn't even think, and it's garnished simply with garlic and lemon)!! A dinner for two almost always costs $30 for us; a few small plates and baguettes really fill us up!
author: Rachel D.

description:
I had high hopes for this place being situated in the Mission district with other fine establishments.  It was literally impossible to find parking but I won't hold that against Esperpento.  I was smart and made reservations ahead of time to avoid the long queue.  It's really loud inside so it's hard to have a conversation with friends / date.  Adding to the noise is the live 2 man band that plays Spanish music.  I guess that's a plus for some!

Onto the juicy items (no pun intended).  My group ordered a combination of tapas and a chicken paella as the main event.  While the waiter said the chicken paella will take 30mins to cook, it came out almost 1.5 to 2 hours later.  The paella wasn't very tasty too.  I had to squeeze lots of lemon juice onto it for taste.  To add salt to the wound, the paella was burnt at the bottom of the paella pan so about 10% of it was cancerous.  I've had different paellas in Spain and none had that issue.  Paella is two thumbs down.

For all tapas we ordered, they were all ok or decent.  The jamon serrano (Spanish Prosciutto) went well with the bread provided.  The ox-tail stew reminded of Chinese ox-tail stew but with less flavor.  I actually thought the spicy potatoes were actually good.
author: Ronald L.

description:
Had family friends visiting from So. Cal and wanted to take them to a good eats that would have them coming back to the Bay Area again, and again, and again.  (yea, I'm selfish, like that).  Called restaurant that morning to book reservations for 6 people - would they be able to accommodate this group at last minute?

Oh yes, give us your name and we will expect you.  

Wow.  Ok, let's see if they are good to their word.  Arrived at said place, a few minutes before our rsvp time.  Gave them my name, kind greeter (?) acknowledges our reservation, offers us a drink (heck yea - sangria please), and asked us to wait a few minutes while they get our table set up.  Took roughly 5 painful minutes before we were seated.  Now, other establishments would not seat us until all parties were present.  Not so with this place.  They seated us peeps that were present, while we waited for others.  In the meantime, while multitasking (read: wait and read menu) - we decided to order a few tapas to get the night started.  Man, oh man, oh man!!!  Deliciouso.  Ok, wait.  Let me start backwards.  Sangria - Yum!  Right mixture of fruits and wine, but careful..keep drinking that stuff and you'll be wobbling out of the restaurant.  It's a creeper, that one!  

Tapas: Pollo Al Ajillo (garlic chicken), Croquetas De Pollo (chicken croquettes), Albondigas (meat-balls stew with saffron), Rabo Toro (Ox-Tail Stew), Pollo Adobo (Spicy Exotic Chicken), Calamares Fritos (fried calamari), Almejas A La Marinera (clams in spanish " marinara " sauce, with sauteed onions, garlic, parsley and white wine), and Mejillones A La Vinaigrette (steamed mussels in picaro's vinaigrette) - were the picks from menu for this hungry group.  Our favorites were the Ox Tail, the Chicken Croquettes, the calamari, and the meat balls with saffron.  Now, the other selections were good as well - but these were the stand outs.
