Pretty delicious tapas and paella. The calamari friti was light and crispy, and was probably my favorite thing. Oh, and the roasted potatoes. Funny how something so simple can be so utterly delicious. 

We also had spicy shrimp, eggplant (good except it came cold and i was dying for some warm eggplant), paella, and sangria. Someone at the table ordered the rabbit soup. I don't even eat rabbit and could not help but think how good it looked. 

We went on a Wednesday night and the place was packed. A bit too noisy for me, and the guitarist on top of it was too much, although it was lovely to listen to him. All in all, I'd go back!
author: Nikki G.

description:
My husband and I went to eat lunch here for Valentine's Day. The restaurant was easy to find in the Mission district and there was ample parking in the garage nearby (2 bucks an hour). The place was quaint and a casual place. Service was good.

For starters, we had jamon serrano (with toasted french bread, tomatoes, olive oil), manchego cheese (which we ate with the jamon serrano), and calamares a la plancha (grilled calamari with onions and tomatoes). All the tapas came with french bread and some butter. 

Of course a paella was a must have and we ordered the special, the lobster paella. The paella was very good and had tasty rice; the paella had two split lobster tails, calamari, clams, piquillo pepper,  peas. The size was plenty for three people.

We will definitely come back here. Prices were good, the size of the dishes were ample for sharing; service was good (servers were attentive).
author: Brenda R.

description:
Tapas Galore!

Came here for a staff dinner. It's a small place, so come early or make reservations if you want to avoid the wait. Our reservation was on the top floor, seating 11 people.

We ordered:

Tapas
- Chorizo Salteado "Cantimpalitos" (sauteed spanish sausage)
- Albondigas (meatballs stew with saffron)
- Patatas Bravas (spicy potatoes)
- Calamares A La Plancha (grilled calamari)
- Mejillones A La Plancha (grilled mussels)

Paella Rice Dish
- Paella De Carnes (meat including chicken, pork ribs, chorizo) 
- Paella De Mariscos (seafood including calamari, shrimp, clams, mussels)

Drinks
- A couple Sangria pitchers

My favorite tapas were the spicy potatoes (it comes with a killer spicy orange sauce) and the grilled mussels (comes in a buttery sauce). They bring out an endless supply of bread, so dipping it in the leftover sauces made it even more delicious.

The paella takes about 30 minutes to make (they notify you before) so ordering a bunch of tapas is like ordering appetizers before your meal. The paella is a nice way to seal off your meal and getting you really full.

The Sangria was good, although I've had better. Needed more fruit. Overall it was a good experience and I'd take a couple friends or dates here.
author: Andrew C.

description: The food is great, and it's reasonably priced.  The only complaint I'd have is that the service is pretty slow (and they seem to run out of bread sometimes).  It's a great place to go if you have some time to chat for a bit.
author: James T.

description: This place reminds me of the restaurants I went in my 5 yeas living in Barcelona. They are not fancy but get to the point: Great tapas at a reasonable price and friendly service. I love their tortilla de patatas, jamón serrano en pan con tomate, The cantipalitos, the olives with stuffed anchovies, the morcilla and, of course, their Sangria!. I recommend this place for lunch or dinner when visiting sunny mission.
author: Carolina F.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night with some friends at around 8pm. Surprisingly the wait want to long for not having reservations, though we did sit in a very squished corner. 

For stars because our waiter, Oscar, was hilarious! And the sauce for our potatoes beavas was mm mmm mm. The vegetable paella was also delicious though I wish I had a little more time to enjoy it (I was rushed by another engagement).

One thing that I didn't like was thatthe live band was a bit loud and thus hard to hear your table mates.
author: Christina C.

description: OMG ... I love this place, so much fun. Food is incredibly good. Sangria -  very fresh and super good. The owner is very funny and super nice , great costumer service. I will definitely come back to this place....... Can't wait.
author: Tetyana G.

description:
Not sure why reviews aren't as great as the dinner we experienced. For a table of three, we ordered plenty of tapas to share: 

spicy potatoes (amazing sauce!!)
garlic shrimp (great for bread dipping)
anchovies in olive oil (evoo + red wine vinegarette + garlic and herbs, delicious)
yellow rice
deep fried red snapper (ok)
deep fried anchovies (score!!)
calamari (we love food deeply fried)
ropa vieja (needed some red meat goodness)
Artichoke (the winner tapas dish)

A carafe of red sangria and live band to make us happy. Great dinner and very reasonably priced.
author: Ramona P.

description:
Party of 3 went on a Saturday at around 5:30pm.  We were seated in less than 5 minutes.  We ordered the following:

*Morcilla (blood sausage) -- t'was my first time to try it and i loved it!  

*Iberico - i liked it but i probably won't order it again 'coz it's kinda pricey relative to the other items in the menu... it still feels good to be able to relate to Anthony Bourdain when he talks of Iberico ham and blood sausages

*Calamares ala Plancha (grilled calamari) - tasted fresh, perfectly seasoned and grilled

* Patatas bravas (spicy potatoes) - not as spicy as i expected so it worked well for me

* Pollo al ajillo (garlic chicken) - the sauce was yummy!  my husband loved it...

*Paella "turista" (combination meat and seafood paella) -- generous serving, more than enough for our party

*Flan (caramel castard) - i've had better flans but their version was not so bad.

*Sangria jar - i am not into alcoholic beverages so i wouldn't know the good from the bad... but John and Mabel thought it was pretty good.

Overall, it was a great dining experience.....great food, great crowd, great service, great prices.  We would love to go back there again and again and again and again and again and again.... catch my drift?

PS - Make sure to bring quarters for the metered parking.
author: Janice T.

description: Good food. Good ingredients, tasty, reasonably priced (no Tapas hype premium). Authematic Spanish decor. Worth the trip here .
author: Jim B.

description:
Came here with one of my best friends to catch up over tapas and sangria. There was a small crowd outside, but since we were just a party of 2, we were lucky enough to snag 2 seats upstairs. Upstairs, there was just one large party celebrating a birthday and a couple small tables, but boy, was it hot up there! They had 2 or 3 fans blowing though, which helped a little.

We ordered a pitcher of sangria to start, which was delicious. Then we had the popular patatas bravas, which was outstanding as well-- the potatoes were very crispy and topped with a creamy, spicy, garlicky sauce. The spinach bechamel was lacking flavor-- even after adding salt, it was pretty forgettable. 

We also ordered a paella, which takes 40 minutes for them to prepare. This was the most disappointing-- when it finally came out, the entire bottom was burnt! The burnt flavor pretty much permeated the entire dish, but we didn't want to wait another 40 minutes for a new paella so we didn't bother telling anyone. Well, no one came by to check on us anyway, so we weren't too pleased with the service.
author: Kavita S.

description: Great food especially the seafood paella and meat paella, worth the wait. Also the patatas bravas, calamari, and the salmon
author: Daisy B.

description: I love love love this place. I never had a disappointing meat here. The tapas are great especially the patatas bravas and the paella is sooooooo good. Everytime I make it to the city I try to go here for dinner....
author: Omar J.

description:
I don't know what happened to this place. The food remains wonderful. The environment, wonderful. But service has dropped to the floor. 

First, I love this place, have come many times. I always bring out of town guests here. It's my and my wife's go-to place on many an afternoon in the Mission.

But today we came in and were ignored. The wait staff walked past us without even a glance or word. Should we seat ourselves? Wait to be seated? We finally sat ourselves at a three-top, and it pained me to notice that three tables were vacant but unbussed. By some miracle we were given menus. After ten minutes went by, I set the timer on my smartphone for 2 minutes, swearing to walk out if no one took our order. The timer went off, I stood to leave, but my wife resisted. This drama drew a waiter to our table and so we ordered. 

(Of course, I still remained without placemat or silverware, which I had to beg from another waiter.)

Okay, it was a holiday. Perhaps they were short staffed. But I've worked in restaurants, from dishwasher to waiter, and you always ALWAYS do your best to make the guest feel welcome. 

"Sorry, we're understaffed today. Just give us a minute and we'll get you seated."

"Sorry to make you wait. How can I help you today?"
 
A little goes a long way. At Esperpento, I felt like the waiters were in surly mood and were taking it out on the guests.

I finally did something I have NEVER done in 51 years of living. I left only ten percent for the tip, with a note about the terrible quality of service. Like most people who've done restaurant work, I usually leave 20%.
author: Andrew D.

description: I have been coming here for the last five years since I came to San Francisco. Fresh and delicious tapas all the times. Paellas are great or even the trout, quail and the grilled artichokes. Waiters are always nice. Good parking Close by. Price is very reasonable.
author: Ago P.

description: Esperpento is my favorite tapas place in SF. I love the casual and loud atmosphere as opposed to other tapas bars in the city that try too hard to be fancy and uptight. Patatas bravas are always delicious, gambas al ajillo, mussels, clams, and chorizo are some of the items I usually order from here. The sangria is always yummy and the paella is delicious!
author: Krizia M.

description:
Esperpento was my first Tapas Bar experience and the very first time I had Blood Sausages.  Now, I'm addicted to Blood Sausages because of them.  Realistically, out of all the Tapas plates that we ordered (we did order quite a few), that was only thing I remember most.

If I ever come back to Esperpento, I'm definately shooting on of their Paellas. They look so awesome from the pics I've seen on Yelp.  Oh and maybe 2 or 3 orders of Blood Sausage =)
author: Rodney H.

description: I love this place. Its really the only Spanish restaurant that replicates real tapas from Spain. And I love that you can purchase items to take home. I just returned from a trip to Spain and this place always fulfills my cravings. I like that its casual as well, it truly feels like a little place you'd find in Barcelona or San Sebastian. The wine that they have is great too and its so inexpensive. I highly recommend this cute little place!
author: Aubrey A.

description: Been here 3 times but last night was the worst service. Took my friend for her bday. She has never tried spanish food before and i really want her to try their famous paella. Arrived at 10 pm. Got seated but service never came. When he finally came i said can we order the paella coz i know it takes a while fir it to cook and he said oh they wont cook paella anymore coz theyll be closing in 45 mins! So explained them why i took my friend there bla bla bla but no luck!!! So we rush and put all our orders together! Even our desert! So in the end they also forgot our desert!!! Seriously!!!! Never again
author: Neng A.

description:
I love everything about this lovely, and authentic restaurant. The food is fantastic (don't miss the spicy potatoes no matter whether you think you like spicy or potatoes!) 

We come here with family members rom Costa Rica every Easter, and no one is ever disappointed. It's true that it's also the best Sangria I've ever had too, and magically, I've always been able to find parking right in front. 5 stars!
author: Joan C.

description:
So sad to have to drop to 2 stars,but the last visit just was not up to par by any shade of imagination. 4 of us went and orderd 6 small plates. None were fantastic and 2 of them were borderline gross. The chicken dish was so full of little bones a baby would have choked. There was no care put into this dish although the sauce tasted nice, the bones made it scary. Then there was the clams. Again the sauce was nice,,but the clams were dry and so small you cant even consider them to be a 1/2 bite.. the amount of bread given was so pathetic.. the butter pats were almost bigger than the bread. The artichokes were ok,but not as lovely as I remembered and the eggplant was well... not good. Overall the food was very low quality and not put together like the time before. 
We were treated nicely and it is a cute place,but so so sad to say,, we will not be returning.
author: Ann L.

description: I loved the charming old-looking deco and layout of the restaurant, and the menu was pretty interesting. However, I wasn't impressed with the Paella or the spicy potatoes. The rice on the paella was a bit overcooked and not really well seasoned and the spicy potatoes had some grainy stuff on them, which made them very uncomfortable to eat. I loved the asparagus dish though and I probably would have given it a higher score if service would have been better.
author: Karla D.

description:
We came here with our group of 20 to celebrate my wife b-day, everything was fine from the reservation to the flexible adjustment needed to add more tables days before the actual dinner date, the welcome was "ok" and had our table ready for us for the time we agree on. The waiter was very unprofessional, came to us straight to ask for the order or drinks we want, when we barely got our menus, and he didn't have the decency to bring us some water or care to ask if we have any question of their menu. Not event to present himself that he will be taking care of us, when we start our orders half of the group was sitting on the table and the other half was coming a little late, told to the manager that they will eventually come and to keep our tables, suddenly the manager want it to have a moment with me to tell me that my table of 20 should at least consume $300 worth of food( witch she could have told us when we made the reservations, and this is probably against the law) , and that we haven't met the requirement and to make our friends order more food cuz some of then have only order drinks (bullshit), just because the waiter deserver a better commission from our table( yeah right!!). He even when gossip that we order paella for two  persons instead of one paella for one individual, when on the menu specify that the paella feed 2  or more people!. 

Overall we pass the $300 bill with out any pressure plus tips added( not deserved).The paellas, tapas, sangria and other appetizer where good, we didn't worry much about their service since they didn't show up often to see how we do, just to pick up the plates that were finish, none of my group will ever come back to this place at all thats for sure, sorry to said this but they didn't care much on us from the start, we didn't get the attention that we deserved when we bring new people to their place and trying to bring up their business( your welcome)
author: Celso G.

description: Food was good but the service not so much and the place is very small good for 2 people tops but for family or a group they will cramp you in a tight space not good for kids at all no kid cups and a very limited number of high chairs I was on a waiting list basically but when another group walked in they gave them the high chair I was waiting for the food wasn't that great to put myself threw this again but even if the food was delicious I wouldn't come back to get placed in a corner with no light
author: Jacqueline M.

description: Went to SF to visit a friend of mine and he took me to have dinner here one night. Prior to this, I hadn't had Spanish food in almost a year. I was extreme excited to go since he said that this was a really good place. We ordered a few tapas and finished off with Paella Negra and a plate of grilled meat. Oh my goodness, the food was superb! It was so good to have Paella Negra after a year of not having it and this one was definitely top notch. Would definitely recommend this to anyone and everyone in the Bay Area or visiting the Bay Area.
author: Cat D.

description:
Maybe it was the $4 wine, maybe it was the chatty ladies obviously having a great time catching up or maybe it was the amazing tortilla potato pancake we had but I feel like this is the best place to have Spanish food in the city!  We even got a to-go bag of grocery items (paella rice and choriza) after our meal.

We went late on a Tuesday night and waited about 30 mins. The atmosphere was light and fun, and why wouldn't it be with $4 Tempranillo? They were out of paella for the night already so we just ordered tons of tapas. We loved the Almejas A La Marinera (Clams in Marinara sauce) even though my boyfriend usually doesn't like marinara sauce. It was so good that we kept ordering more bread to dip in the sauce. That dish was basically licked clean! The abondigas were pretty good too and the pimientos were basically exactly the same as we had in Barcelona. Finally, the Tortilla was great. It was not nearly as intimidating as the one we had in Cordoba, Spain but just as tasty!!

I also saw that they had a 2 for one drink deal if you order paella on Monday night. I will be bak!
author: Kara Y.

description:
paella with meat and seafood. GREAT
we came here on a Monday.  Thats when they have the paella special..order any size any kind of paella and you get a free dessert to share and sangria for free. 

The paella was pretty good.  it wasnt salty enough but you can add your own salt.  the saffron smells so good on the rice.  pretty big shrimps and there were also quite a few pieces of calamari and muscles.  i didn't see much meat cept one or two piece of pork?  and there was also a couple of chicken wings mixed in there???

the crema catalania was good.

atmosphere..very crowded but feels super homey

the service was HORRIBLE though. we repeatedly asked for more bread (for a big group of 8 or something, we didnt have enough carbs) so it came only once at the beginning and after we asked them for more...the waited was never to be seen again. if they passed by theyd look away from us and once or twice i got their attention and the server told me to ask the other servers. hmmm shadyyy

Tapas=== aww their veg platter was sooo good, i also like the other tapas we got..sausage and salmon, but the ropa viejo..not so much

our bill was also late and took a good half hour after we asked for it for them to finally bring it to us
author: Karina H.

description:
4 1/2 stars for this spanish tapas restaurant

Grub Crawl 10-26-2010 second stop 

the menu consisted of 7 items and bread

every item offered was devoured literally in a few minutes with it being set down on the table. I have eaten here prior to the grub crawl maybe about 4 yrs back, just to let you know the spot has not changed, food is excellent, price is always in good means, service also excellent.

here are some of the items we were able to sample during the grub crawl

Champinones al Ajillo/Garlic Mushrooms - full flavored, juicy and not rubbery when biting down
Ensalaa de Pimientos Rojos/ red bell pepper salad - this one I can honestly say I could make at home but I give it a passing grade
cantimpalitos/ chorizo- mini chorizo same size as lil smokies the kind u get a luckys or safeway but 10 times better haha

every dish just as good as the first for a group of 12 they acutally had room for us straight down the center, the waiters were on point gettting us sangrias quickly, food great for groups portion wise not so great but taste wise good on every bite

food ****
price (grubcrawl 10-26-10 second stop all included price 3 restuarants 1 price)
service *****
ambiance **** spot was homey, loud, walls also loud pictures very different
author: Clarence A.

description: Great place to go with friends. This place has tapas for a very reasonable price. The food is good with stews, seafood and grilled items. The noise level was very loud and with a mexican guitarist. The Sangria was disappointing though but the food made up for it. The waitress was helpful in recommending dishes and the kitchen held off sending all of the plates all at once.
author: George F.

description: I went again recently; the food hasn't changed but the service and attitude have gotten worse.
author: Peter H.

description:
I don't really know how to rate this restaurant because I'm not really a fan of paellas to begin with. My boyfriend is all about exposing me to new foods and so we thought this would be a great place to go for some authentic Spanish cuisine. We ordered a few appetizers (forgive me I forget what they were) and I remember them being just decent. After a long wait (we were forewarned by the servers about the long wait time) our mixed meat paella was brought out to us. It was just ok. I feel like there were some spices (and flavor) missing which could have made the meal better on the whole but it was definitely edible. I remember we ordered a large caraffe of sangria and that satisfied me. 

In short, the menu is huge, the sangria is awesome, it's a great place for groups, and the atmosphere is VERY loud. If you like paella I'm sure you're going to love it here.
author: Tommy C.

description: I love Picaro! The food is so good that the horrendous service doesn't matter. Unfortunately I can not say the same thing about Esperanto.        They have an identical menu to Picaro, except each such is at least a dollar or two cheaper. Clearly the same recipes too. The cook really makes the difference. The gambas al ajillo only tasted of cooked wine. Morcella was bright red in the center. My husband really wanted the all meat paella and it was also not good. In fairness I have never had paella with meat. It's not paella with out seafood and I'm not even a big seafood eater. The rice tasted of tomatoes and was very mushy. The liquid was really greasy too. The worst part was the meat. Pork ribs need to be cooked for a long time. You can't put a raw one in with paella and expect it to be edible. For chicken they give you a flavorless chicken wing and only one. The whole dish had no flavor and looked really gross. I know it's a thing in the States to over cook rice but this was not even close. At least the  morcella was cooked through. It still wasn't good though! We also got the potatoes aioli. They were good but could not salvage this meal. Service was nonexistent. They never cleared a plate or refilled a glass. The guy with the curly hair darts around purposely trying to avoid his customers.        Most people seemed to be ordering the lunch special so maybe those are better. FYI Picaro is a bit more expensive for tapas but they do the sangria for 10 bucks a pitcher. If you plan on drinking at all you'll save money going there instead, plus the food comes out much better!
author: Corey Jace W.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday dinner. There were 2 waitresses working who were polar opposites of each other. One was friendly and attentive. The other looked and acted as if a cactus crawled up her ass.

I'm far from being a vegetarian, but since the birthday girl was, we tried to pick a place that would have a lot of choices for her. When one of the "vegetarian" items clearly states 'anchovies,' I start to question how legitmate their other vegetarian options are. Most of the dishes seemed to just have a ton of aioli slathered on top.

Sangria was good, I'll give them that. Although when we tried to correct the bill (to their favor since we noticed a sangria order was left off), it was difficult to get anyone to acknowledge us; had to walk it up to the counter; and even then was told to wait because I think they assumed I wanted to order something when we really could've all walked off without trying to reconcile the bill in their favor.  Too bad, seemed like a fun place too.
author: Mercutio k.

description: Mehhhh. Tapas are mediocre but for some reason there's always a wait. Their sangria is good. Paella was bland and not memorable. All around mediocre.
author: Michelle K.

description: Recommended by a friend as an alternative to Cha Cha Cha.  Food is decent and the sangria not bad, but the service sucks.
author: Kevin G.

description:
I made a reservation as I was taking the boyfriend out for a celebration; we got there early and they sat us in the balcony immediately. Cool, but I was worried about a potential lack of service. Turned out I didn't need to! The service was perfect, and the food was just as glorious as I expected. It's a very similar (potentially identical) menu to Picaro.

Do yourself a favor and order a pitcher of the sangria and a plate of patatas bravas. Those things are made of pure cracksauce, I'm sure of it. Also, after you finish your sangria, eat the fruit in the glass! It's awesome.
author: Lia S.

description:
Went here about a year ago.....at 2 pm on a Sat.  We had tapas, the restaurant wasn't 
packed, due to the good memory we returned as a treat for my husband on Father's Day.  I will not be returning again.  Had a 7 pm reservation....waited outside on the curb until 7:30.  The restaurant was packed and extremely noisy.  Tables were so packed together that the waitress was leeeeeaning across behind me to put things on another table.  My sister kept getting shoved by people coming in so we requested a change to a table that opened up that was against the wall.  Some resistance and non sympathy from the manager type across the room, (who also completely ignored us when we tried to gain her attention across the sea of closely packed tables), but in the midst of me talking to her our waitress (the only nice thing about the place was our waitress) changed us to the less crashed into table. SOOOOO LOUD!!!!!! (oh, am I repeating myself?)  We ordered 3 tapas while waiting for a seafood paella.  Very good anchovy stuffed olives, excellent grilled asparagus, blah white bean salad.  Wish I'd passed on the Paella though.  My sister said she got a small squid that had a very fishy flavor and I had a mussel that tasted VERY bad....I couldn't face continuing to eat the paella, had a bit of the rice that seemed a bit too grease filled, very unappealing. Fortunately I didn't get sick.  Oh, we did get the house red, a Spanish wine, absolutely deilcious!  Anyway, as my idea of a good restaurant is good conversation, remarkable food, peaceful atmosphere, friendly/helpful wait staff....and this place was the opposite on all levels....can't believe I had to pay for such a horrible experience!...I will not be returning ever!
author: Chico F.

description:
Love love LOVE this place. Great aesthetic. I love the hodgepodge decor and tight seating. This place is great for parties - they have a small extra room next door to the actual restaurant for privacy. The food is well priced so you can stuff yourself and get a good sangria buzz going and not go broke in the process. Get the grilled artichokes.

Only downside: I fucking hate mariachi bands like what the fuck GET OUT you're SO LOUD.
author: Caroline J.

description:
Esperpento is a Mission gem!  Great Spanish theme with tapas that I hadn't seen since Spain. It's cozy and has a really great atmosphere and great paella!  

Great place to go with a couple other people.  We ordered one seafood paella and four tapas dishes that we split amongst the 3 of us. There are so many fun dishes it's great to taste a little of everything. This place really makes eating out fun.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Great place to eat at for authentic Spanish dishes! I have came here multiple times already for their delicious food! They have a large selection of tapas, and different types of paellas to choose from. Their spicy potato, calamari and the Serrano ham over french bread are great things to try here. You can order different sized paella based on how many people are in your party. The paellas do take a while to make though but there is note already telling you that on the menu ahead of time. The seafood paella in my opinion is the best, and is definitely worth the wait. You can pass time quickly with the tapas. The squid ink paella, as enticing as it sounds, is not as flavorful as its seafood counterpart but still pretty good. 

We had reservations, and did not have to wait too long to be seated. I have come here without reservations before (arrived close to 6:00pm) and surprising was seated immediately. However, making reservations is the best way to get a seat here in this restaurant.

There is a live Spanish band that comes in also to play music and entertain everyone.

The only reason I did not give this place 5 stars is because of the location! They are located in the Mission district and man is it hard to find parking. Otherwise, everything else about this restaurant is great!
author: Elaine W.

description:
I went to Esperanto for the first time looking for a quick fix of tapas. I was planning to go to Cha Cha Cha but they didn't open until 5pm. Yelp led me to Esperpento not too far away for tapas and Sangria. 

Yelp also led me to their  Patatas Bravas and the Garlic Shrimp which were both delicious. The patatas bravas were a nice level of spicy, and the potato skins were crispy and delicious. Garlic shrimp was also delicious and the sauce was perfect for dipping complimentary bread it. 

Sangria was also good, but then again, I've never met a Sangria I didn't like. 

Overall totally tasty. I don't think it beats Cha Cha Cha in my book, but if you're looking for a quieter, conversation friendly tapas bar, Esperpento is the place to go.
author: Claire G.

description:
Me. 
5 Cute Guys.
Dinner. 
Esperpento.

I was envisioning "Male Harem."  What I got was "Gossip Girls."


Cravings:  "Ooh they have anchovies!"  "What are you - pregnant?"

Online dating:  "He didn't hear back from any of his matches.  He thinks it's the site.  I think it's him." 

Cars:  "I have a Prius.  This acceleration issue could be a good thing."  "You have serious anger management issues." 

Roommates:  "I hate the way he breathes."

Parents:  "We all turn into them."  "Well I hope I turn into Mom and not Dad."

Britney:  "She is a trailer park WHORE!"


This said over three carafes of yummy sangria, a large paella, and tapas galore!  Of the many tapas that we tried, I LOVED the Garlic Shrimp (swimming in garlic and oil and liberally sprinkled with chili flakes) and Grilled Asparagus (thinly sliced with garlic and parsley).  The Potato Espanola was tasty too and you can never go wrong with Manchego Cheese.

We exceeded our fried food quota with the Calamari, Anchovies, and Chicken Croquettes.  They were good but less gossip worthy were the Patatas Bravas (greasy) and the Mushrooms (undercooked and underseasoned).  The rice in the Meat Paella was a bit bland for me but it was chock full of chicken, chorizo, and blood sausage so we scarfed it up. 

We ended our meal with some Sugar and Spice.  The sugar came in the form of flan and and a wonderfully rich and creamy Chocolate Mousse. 

The spice came thusly:  "Oh he has class.  Too bad it's all SECOND."

(All this food and fun was only $35 apiece!  Pseudo-male harem not included.)
author: Amy C.

description:
I've lived and/or worked close to this restaurant for about three years and have gone countless times for lunch. I simply don't understand why it isn't rated higher.

Every dish I've had off the lunch menu had been excellent, the rabbit stew and carne asada in particular. The portions are always enough for me to leave satisfied.

On top of that, they have great sangria! And who dislikes sangria? People I wouldn't like to spend time with, at least. Having half a carafe at lunch probably isn't the best idea for productivity but whatever...
author: Pierre B.

description: The food is great; HOWEVER, had dinner here tonight and saw a cockroach walking on the wall next to our table. DISGUSTING. My friend informed the waitress and apparently staff are aware of this problem, have reported it to the landlord, but the landlord has not taken action. Love the place but will probably never eat here again. Disappointing.
author: Arlene B.

description: We had sangria, jamon iberico, anchovies stuffed olives, paella turista, and arroz con leche for dessert. The jamon came with aioli topped bread. The sangria was one of the best I've had. Paella was very good, dessert  very satisfying. The restaurant wasn't very busy when we got there. Service was efficient and food was prompt. There was a mariachi singing at some point. It was a charming place. Will definitely go back!
author: Sunny C.

description: I went there for the first time 14 years ago did not come back because of the bad service food is ok but 14 years later they still have the same bad service I'm not planing to go back there as much as I enjoyed their paella I did not like the way we were treated
author: Narda D.

description:
Came here on a Friday night, got seats after 25 min waiting. It was close to 9pm already. This is a very hot restaurant in the middle of mission district. The deco and people there reminded me Mexico city, and I love it. 

We had: 
Mejillones a la Plancha (grilled shrimp)
Morcilla (Sauteed Spanish black sausage)
Champinones al Ajillo (Sauteed mushrooms with garlic)
Mejillones A La Vinaigrette (Steamed mussels)

And of course Sangria. 

Mussels are tasty. Shrimp is fresh. Don't like the black sausage. Our neighboring table had Spanish cured ham, looks very good to us. Next time, will try that.
author: Emmy P.

description:
This place is delicious and affordable. My friend had her birthday here and I've come on several occasions since then - its great for celebrations as well as casual dinners.

The sangria, tortilla, and grilled jumbo shrimp were amazing. We also really enjoyed the patatas bravas and croquetas de pollo. I highly recommend all these plates.

I have been to a couple other Spanish places in SF but none of them compare to Esperpento's in terms of quality and price.
author: Gaby A.

description: The food was great!! The ambience wAs really nice because of the nicely decorated walls. The food was really good too! The amount of food served and for the price?? It was really worth it! I would recommend this restaurant to people with Spanish cuisine taste buds! This place is worth a visit!
author: Samantha C.

description: Came with my mom bc she has been and raved about it. We walked in the busy restaurant with the OPEN sign flashing only to be told it's closed with no explanation or apologies or even a "please come back". The guy was so rude he barely looked our way. Fuck you and your culturally appropriated hipster food.
author: Annie G.

description:
Mmm. Me Gusta!

I think I will make this a tradition to go here every time I visit SF :)

-There has always been about a half hour wait the 2 times I have been here - which implies that they are yummy and worth waiting for.
-You can cross the street and grab drinks at the Latin America Club while you wait (beware of their strong margaritas) ahaha
- Atmosphere is dim & cozy
-Chorizos, asparagus, clams in some yummy sauce (good for dipping bread), calamari, potatoes, sangria = all good :)

-My person and I like to order 5-6 small plates and share! Yum. ok Bye.
author: Amy L.

description:
Horrible service. Sat at a table for 15 minutes with no one coming to the table. Ask for assistance and was told someone else would attend to us. One waiter or server even start waving her hands back as I was asking for someone to take our order. Then she just walked away. On the verge of walking out until someone actually came to the table. People that don't have basic etiquette should not be in the service industry. They need to seriously train some of their staff with customer service. 

My advice, if u want hands waved in front of you and shoo you away then by all means come here.
author: John L.

description:
Came here for the first time last night and it succeeded my expectations. At first glance, it seems like a hole in the wall place, walk in and it's 2 stories with spanish art and decor. I was a little hesitant about coming here since I am a vegetarian. I didn't think that I would end up leaving full but I was plenty full! They give you all you can eat bread. We ordered the grilled mushrooms, artichokes, rice, and potatoes with the brava sauce (to die for)!!!! I would definitely reccommend this place. looking for a little spanish spice in your life? come here! there is also this very cute man that will sing to you and your friends if you ask him to. We had him sing a spanish version of happy birthday to my friend. Good Times!

oooh and i almost forgot to mention the sangria with bits of orange slices. It's a Must Order.
author: Ashley C.

description: Love this place... So many amazing dinners and memorable moments. Food is good and always packed at night. Roomy upstairs for fesistas!!!
author: Bebe W.

description: Sister treated here for my bday and the food was delicious!One of my favorite is the Paella De Mariscos, Seafood with calamari, shrimp, clams and mussels
author: Emy G.

description: Best tapas I have ever had! I went with a friend who has had been many times and she ordered tons of food! Nothing was disappointing. We ordered many of the tapas plates such as; spicy potatoes, artichoke, mussels and more! We all shared all the plates and it was such a pleasant experience.They even have some tasty sangria that complemented all the flavors :)
author: Amber T.

description: I love this place.  The food is delicious and a great value.  The service has always been ehhh but where else can you feed a family of four, eat seafood and only spend a little over $40?  Granted the bread is filling and you can end up eating a lot with all of the delicious sauces but I haven't experienced what another Yelper commented on that they're now charging for bread?  That's whack.  But that won't keep me from going there.  Mussels are delish and so are the patatas bravas.
author: Rebecca M.

description: Went here for a birthday gathering and fell in love.  A small lively, joyous place.  Felt like Christmas.  Loved the patatas, the asparagus, the blood sausage, mussels.  The tortillas are absolutely perfect laden with delicious aioli.  I cannot wait to return and get the langostino paella.  I was completely happy here.
author: Julie J.

description:
I'd give this place 4 stars for the food, 1 star for the service. Average out to 3, I suppose. 

Went into the restaurant knowing that we were going to get the lobster paella and that this would take at least 30 minutes. It took 50 minutes actually, but when it finally got to our table, we devoured it. It was delicious. The lobster was perfectly cooked and so juicy and succulent. So good! 

But aside from the paella, we also got two tapas to tide us over, the patatas bravas and the chicken croquettes. The croquettes were decent, and the potatoes were decent too. Nothing spectacular. But we did have to wait half an hour for our patatas which was bizarre. Potatoes don't take that long! 

When we tried to flag down our waitress, she just blazed right past us, refusing to stop or make eye contact. Finally, we asked another waiter if he could please check on our order and this prompted our own waitress to finally get us our patatas. We also had to wait a solid 10-15 minutes to even get her to take our order, despite repeatedly trying to do so. She kept breezing by telling us she'd be with us in a moment while going to other tables to refill their sangrias. 

And not once in our entire meal did she check in on us. Every time we needed anything we'd have to flag her down, and even then, she would just ignore us or tell us she'd be with us in a moment after which we'd wait another 10 minutes. 

Awful awful service. 

But I really loved the paella and it was a great deal at $28 for two people. Would definitely go back just to try it again!
author: Hannah S.

description:
Seafood paella?! Spanish tapas? Yes and yes.

Walked in at 6pm (apparently they don't take reservations anymore) and was seated right away upstairs in the corner. Space was tight but it was very cozy. Service was very prompt and plates came out fast. 
 
Started off with a carafe of sangria which was super rich in wine flavor with hints of fruit. It was one of the best sangrias I've had in a while. We were able to get 1.5-2 glasses each between the 4 of us.

Pinchos Marunos: skip. In fact, skip everything with meat in this place and just stick to the seafood. They DO NOT do pork or meat well here. Extremely gamey and tough.

Patatas Bravas: so addicting we ordered 2! Even though the potatoes were advertised as "spicy" this was something you could eat plates of and not taste the spiciness. The sauce was a mixture of liquidy cheese and what tasted like Tapatio.

Alcachofas a la plancha: WOW! Loved the grilled artichokes with its smoky, soy sauce flavor. So delish.

Ropa Viejo: just ok. I've only had this one other time in an authentic Cuban restaurant and this was no competitor. Could've arrived warmer. The sauce was perfect for dipping bread into.

Meat and seafood paella: again, skip the meat. We ordered the 2-person size and wondered whether they made a mistake when it arrived - it was big enough for 4-5 people but hey, we weren't complaining! Crunchy rice bottom, a mix of mussels, clams, squid, shrimp... flavor was nailed to a T. I can't wait to come back and have it again.

Mariscada: Seafood heaven. Almost similar to paella but different presentation and less rice. 

$120 (including tip) for 4 and we were perfectly satisfied without being too full.
author: Liana L.

description:
One of my good friends from Madrid came to San Francisco for the first time in more than 15 years. He asked me to take him to a Tapas restaurant. Not that he was hungry for tapas but he wanted to check the quality of the food. He told me that in Spain he read several reviews about top Spanish restaurants in the city. We started off with sangria, everyone agreed that it was a must. It was alright, I think I liked it more than he did. He did not complain though but he pointed that it was to fruity. Anyway, we were hungry so we got several dishes. We were impressed to see how fast the food arrived to the table. We had olives, morcilla, calamari and a salad. Calamari was the finest. We had to order a second one. For main course we got a paella and it was good, the only problem it was that it was barely warm. It had Spanish rice, clams, shrimp and mussels. It was quite dry, probably because it was not warm enough. For dessert we got flan and it was great, we order a second one and then a THIRD ONE!
The food was above average, service quite rude, it looked like they needed to turn the table fast. I'll probably come back, probably not during the rush hour.
author: Jessica R.

description:
I have come here a few times, before smart phones were smart enough to accept Yelp apps.  Yes, it is very loud and noisy during dinner.  They bring in at least one singer that can belt out three restaurnts down.However if you want to treat you and your guests to a giant plate of paella with sangria all around you should head here right away.  The paella options include non-seafood (like rabbit and chicken) if seafood isn't your thing.  Full disclosure:  I am deathly allergic to seafood.  Also this is the best place to grab jamon (thinly sliced salted ham from the foodie deities) while waiting for your paella order to finish.

If you somehow have room for dessert grab the flan.  Creamy and delicious.
author: Christine L.

description:
I have been coming on an average of 2-3x each year for the last 5 years or more.  I've always like how they have a large selection of tapas to choose from.

So why the low rating?  The last time I came here with a party of 4 we ordered a variety of tapas and the seafood paella.  The tapas came out good as always but the seafood paella came out sandy.  We found a dead clam filled with sand and told the waitress.  We only had a bit each but about half of the paella was scooped out on our dishes.  She didn't offer to make a new one but to bring out another appetizer and just took the paella and our dishes away.  After the sandy paella we didn't feel like eating anymore and asked for the bill.  When I got the bill, I was actually really surprised to see we were charge for the paella (~$30).  

Would I go back? I'm not sure.  I've been a loyal customer and told/introduced many friends to this place but the last experience has left a bad taste in my mouth....
author: Mac S.

description:
Went last night for dinner with my friend and it became my less favorite place to have tapas in the city after the rude experience we had with the person in charge of the front. 
My african american friend and I asked the lady for a table for two... She took a look on us and told us we had to wait for one hour  which I understood but then she told us " at least that  you want to sit outside" even though it was cold in the city... and then, she gave us her back and did not come back again until my friend approached her and told her "Ok. We will sit here" since we were super hungry! I told my friend the lady wasn't being nice to us but my friend didn't notice that  until the next 10 minutes.... Guess what? 10 minutes later a couple came, no reservation no noting and she sat them right away, then two friends, same story and then two more same story.... She found a table for all of them right away between the time we were sitting there waiting for our food. Why then she couldn't find a place for us?? I'm giving Esperpento 1 star for that incident. You have to treat people the right way no matter the race. We left the place and I'm not planning on coming back again.
author: Zonia N.

description:
I went to Esperpento tonight because Lolo across the street didn't have any seating at all for the whole night. So we crossed the street, got seated right away and had some really yummy food . It had been ages since I had been there. like maybe 15 years. The food did not dissapoint. We got 3 tapas, artichokes, aspargus and mussels. The artichokes were way better than I could cook (and I can cook!) I do not eat fish but the mussells were gobbled. Then came the paella. yum. next time I would get the vegtsarian version, but yum none the less. 

The place gets mixed review for service. Our server maybe said 10 words to us. She asked if we were ready to order. answered a question. Then brought our plates without another  word. The other staff were friendly and helpful.
author: Laurie A.

description: One of surprisingly few restaurants that are open in the neighborhood for lunch, so the place wins points for that.  (Nearby there's Boogaloos and a sketchy looking Chinese restaurant) They also have a steady flow of customers (some of them clearly regulars).  There's a lunch special which is a pretty good deal- options include grilled salmon, beef, chicken adobo, etc.  I ordered the rabbit stew, with sides (included) of rice and stewed zucchini.  It was tasty and nicely cooked, although it was chopped up too much as I spent most of my meal spitting out small bones.  Service was good.
author: Vivian W.

description: Only stopped by for dessert. The chocolate mouse and flan were really nice. Our server Paula was really sweet. Nice casual spot
author: cindy G.

description:
Went here with a reservation for 4 on a Friday at 9PM and were seated promptly when we arrived. We got 2 pitchers of sangria, 8 tapas plates, and the lobster paella for 2 to share. The black (blood) sausage was the highlight, amazing flavor! I'd go back for more of this alone! The patatas bravas were also really tasty. The lobster paella was good, but I think next time we'll elect for a few more tapas instead. Everything was very reasonably priced, with the whole meal coming to ~$120 before tip. Considering all 4 of us had plenty of food and drinks, that's a great deal in my book. Service was extremely friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere was fun... can't ask for much more for a night out with friends! Highly recommended.

Edit: a lot of people on here are raving about the garlic shrimp. They were good, but in my opinion nothing too special. I'd recommend being a little more adventurous with your order.
author: Steve P.

description:
THIS is one of my top 10 cheap fabulous eats in SF.  I will say right away YES SERVICE SUCKS...just like in any true European eatery, but the quality of food and fun , upbeat vibe  make up for it. 
If you feel like getting your loud , fun group of friends together  , drink yummy sangria , have endless delish tapas while yelling over each other and laughing  this is a perfect place for you and you loud friends

Cheeerzzzz!!!
author: Masha M.

description:
This has been one of my favorite restaurants since I was about six years old. Back then I would only eat one item on the menu... the chicken croquettes, but it was still my favorite place to go with my family. As I got older I expanded my ordering, at ditched the croquettes for spicier more interesting flavors, but now when I go I still have a set of tapas which I ALWAYS order:
-Patatas Bravas
-Tortilla Española
-Gamabs al ajillo (1 order per person, they are just THAT good+ don't forget to squeeze the lemon juice on them!)
-Alchofas (be careful no to eat the spiky insides of the artichoke)
-Grilled Asparagus
+ a new  recent addition ordering the meatballs in sauce

I've tried many things on the menu, but there are the all stars, I've found the paella to be nothing special, and many of the other tapas dishes to be equally uninteresting. However the garlic shrimp and tortilla are always phenomenal and I keep going back time and time again to get my fix!
author: Sophie C.

description: This place is AMAZING. As a vegetarian, I always love it when Spanish restaurants have veggie-friendly paella. The sangria is delicious and all of the tapas are very authentic. On top of that, it's a casual environment with great customer service. I'll definitely be going back!
author: Tejal T.

description: Delicious tapas and paella! Price is reasonably price. Sangria good! Takes reservations which is awesome! Will keep on coming back for my Spanish food cravings!
author: Michelle T.

description: Food is mediocre at best.  Added 1 star for the artichoke hearts dish.  That wasn't bad.  Servers were too busy to be able to provide good service.  I don't think I will go back.
author: Kelly N.

description:
It was a Thursday night with a party of 6 at 8pm and there was no wait at all. Granted we did choose to sit upstairs where it was stuffy on a warm day but we didn't mind too much. The worst part was that it was difficult to get our server's attention from up there and it took a while for our order to get taken. I guess that was kinda our fault but at least the food was above average AND affordable. I love tapas places for the fact that I can try a bunch of different dishes and Esperpento had tons of options! Now on to what we ate:

sauteed garlic mushrooms ($5.25) - Big chunks of mushroom with lots of garlic flavor. This dish was gone fast! We used the sauce for dipping our bread in too. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=Jso-rnKSMgbKkcDs_YuUTg)

spicy potatoes ($4.50) - Mmm one of my favorite plates of the night! The potatoes were cooked perfectly so that they weren't mushy or too firm. The spicy sauce was awesome! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=bw42o1VjAnN-6NfzpiFeHQ)

roasted eggplant, peppers, and onion ($5.75) - Nothing special about this dish and was drenched in oil. It came with a section of a hard-boiled egg too which I thought was out of place. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=nsT6WbjgnYJ--m1PUBxxEg)

chicken croquettes ($5) - Crispy, fried pieces of yummy mashed potato but where was the chicken? Maybe it was minced so fine that I couldn't taste it. The spinach dip on the side was good too. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=NsosRB_HEyfx8zBoVaHbiQ)

fried calamari ($6.50) - This was one of the smaller portions even though the rings of calamari were bigger than normal. They weren't breaded enough and the aioli was just OK. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=tdtbnLHPpOAMJ0h9BF7kdg)

seafood paella ($68 for 6 person order) - WOW...this entree was humongous and could have fed more than 6! It came with succulent pieces of lobster, shrimp, clam, and calamari. The rice was delicious and flavorful too...might have been a tad over-cooked though. Prepare to wait about 30 min if you order paella. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=AOv2DMSCLUkdy_HRDKESWQ)

creme brulee ($4) - Bleh! This was pretty horrible creme brulee. First of all, the dish wasn't even filled to the top like it usually is. The layer of torched sugar was non-existent and the cream underneath didn't taste remotely like creme brulee. Don't order this! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/b3mmxh_9aw25vkMmujG9jQ?select=iOTH9CN44UBezER6FWsyrQ)

That was the perfect amount of food since the tapas portions were adequate and we even had leftover paella. Overall, I would say pass on the roasted eggplant and fried calamari, but definitely skip the so-called creme brulee. I would come back to try some other tapas and for their paella!
author: Karen Y.

description:
This was my first visit to Esperpento Tapas Restaurant.  My friend lives in the Bernal Heights area of town and had wanted to try this place for some time since he has a music studio in the Mission district and passes by several times a week.

After hiking on the beach for about 6 miles, we had worked up quite a healthy appetite and were prepared to fill up on tapas.  

Having had tapas before, I was hesitant to order too much initially not knowing the size of the portions.  Traditional tapas come in small sizes.  To begin, we ordered the grilled calamari, abodo spicy chicken, and spicy potatoes, and a side of rice.

The portions were huge - more like a serving for 4 people...and I was especially glad we stuck to only 3 tapas.  When I mentioned to the server that I thought tapas were smaller portions, she acknowledged that tapas really are suppose to be small, but they had 'americanized' their portions to satisfy those not familiar with tapas.

Their menu should list traditional tapas...and super-sized McTapas to satisfy those who think bigger is better :-)

Nice house Spanish red wine and reasonably priced menu.  I suspect I'll be back again.
author: Diane E.

description:
I've been to this place twice, once a couple years ago with my Dad and I enjoyed the salmon combo dinner plate. 

However my return a few weeks ago greatly disappointed me. I wanted to take my girl out for a nice dinner and decided to try this spot again since we always go to Picaro. 

We craved some patatas aoli, while it was very tasty the big slop of aoli on top of all of the potatoes ruined it. It should've been placed on the side of the plate.

We ordered the pork skewers which had really inconsistent cooking times - the stick my girlfriend got was basically raw...they insisted on us sending it back to grill some more and it came back over done. Kind of disappointing. 

They also have the worst Spanish rice I've ever eaten. Some of the rice wasn't even cooked all the way and you can tell that they used frozen vegetables that made the dish extra bland and unappealing. The waitress was a bit deceiving when we asked her how big the rice plates were, she said it was small so we ordered two for the both of us and it turned out to be way too much. 

I do have good things to say though. The Almejas A La Plancha (grilled garlic clams) were phenomenal, I wish the plate didn't have to end. The grilled baby artichokes were also amazing. I just wish that the rest of the plates we ordered were consistent!

I will be staying at Picaro from now on!
author: Rachel W.

description: Great Mission tapas bar with plenty of vegan options, cozy dining room and close to public transportation.  Great spot to go with friends so you can share lots of different dishes.  How can you resist patatas bravas?
author: Jenn C.

description: Wonderful! Delicious! Went there for late night tapas and sangria. Was the greatest. Everything you expect to experience out of a tapas bar at 10 PM at night. Famlies eating dinner, couples enjoying a nice conversation, there were three birthday celebrations while I was there! Didn't get the paella, but everything else was great.
author: Stefanie S.

description:
Tapas, Paella, and Sangria are the three things that come to mind when I go to this place. If I ever feel like getting some of the three, I go to here or Cha Cha Cha. It is a good mom and pop shop filled with tasty food. I came once were they even had a mariachi band singing their hearts out as I enjoyed my food.

Paella- So good, takes awhile to come but worth the wait. I normally get the seafood
Fried Potatoes- I always get this  
Sauteed Oysters- OH YEAH!
Calamari- Fried goodness
Sangria- always makes the meal better

I have tired many other types of tapas here that were very tasty. I would recommend ordering foods that you enjoy and you should not be disappointed.

Great place for food!
author: Elliot T.

description:
Esperpento is totally my kinda joint.  Super casual, lively, tapas, sangria...how can you go wrong, right?  Under normal circumstances, I would have offered 3 or 4 stars.  

But admittedly, I'm a service snob.  

I *only* dish out the single when they really F-up.  And Thursday night's service was atrocious.  It wasn't even 10:30pm when our waitress threw down the check without even offering us anything else.  I had to ASK for a dessert menu.  Then she replied, "Well, the kitchen is closed already but I'll ask".  WHAT?  What happened to checking in with your guests before the kitchen closes?! 

When she served the dessert, she replied, "Well, I guess you guys got lucky."  Um, I don't think so.    I think you'll get lucky if you get a tip.

To top off this mounting pile of 'ish, she came back around while we were eating dessert to collect the money.  DANG, WOMAN!  If she had to take off, then send over one of the other FIVE waitress to close us out.

WHERE DID SHE LEARN TO WAIT TABLES?  SO FREAKING UNPROFESSIONAL.

Well nobody pisses in my Wheaties.  I was really happy that my friend invited me to eat here (Thanks M!) and it was good times for sure.    

I am a Mish-chick at heart; so for that reason ONLY, round two awaits...
author: Angella S.

description:
I had to knock some stars off for the slow and uneven waitstaff service. 

After we poured the last glass of  watered-down sangria we discovered a piece of plastic wrapper in the glass. It looked like a cigarette box wrapper, uh yuck. When we let our waitress know she just offered another glass of sangria. The replacement glass tasted better.  I could make a better sangria. 

We were a party of 12 people. Tapas dishes we ordered never materialized but were on the bill.  Some of the dishes namely the Gambas al Ajillo were over cooked.  I did enjoy the Spicy Potatoes Patata Bravas and the Chicken croquettes.  

I wonder if the food is consistent. I don't know if I will be back.
author: Infodiva B.

description: skipped the Easter eggs and went straight for the rabbit! the Rabbit Stew is a must for me here. mussels, clams, anchovies, shrimps, grilled cabbage and paella are all good but I have to have my stew lol. good and friendly service as well
author: Tony M.

description:
I am no expert on Spanish food, so all I can say about this place is that the food tasted good.

Sangria: Sweet and strong, the fruit bits were nicely soaked and tasted good.
Mushrooms: succulent.
Potatoes: Fried, well cooked came with a spicy sauce that had a nice punch.
Asparagus: No complaints.
Vegetable paella: Really liked this one, the spices and saffron were well balanced adn not over powering.

Will go again if I am in the area.
author: Anupama C.

description: Sangria is bomb.  Their known for their famous paella.  This place is a great date spot!  They have tapas.  I recommend their chicken mole.  That's if you like mole.  Calamari was kind of greasy and over priced but all the other food made up for it.  Thursdays are very busy.  I recommend going on Mondays where they have discounts on the paella.  They also sell imported products from Spain.  Very good service.  Place can get crowded and you may have to wait outside.  People do take their time eating here.   Its just one of those great places that you don't ever want to leave and stay in the moment.  Have a great conversation or if your girlfriend is upset with you?  This is the place to amend all that!  LOL  Although the decibels on the noise can get steep here, we all know that's the sangria creeping in.  I highly recommend for groups.  This is as good as it gets folks.
author: Chris S.

description: The reason this place gets a 1 star from me is because of the jerk host. It was a beautiful Saturday night and we were a table of 6 people. We ordered plenty of food so his behavior was not justified. Three quarters a way into our dinner, he began circling our table like a shark, waiting for our next move to see how long it would take us to get up and out. We saw him yelling at our waitress to tell her to get us to leave. We certainly did not appreciate the pressure and push to get the hell out of there so that he could seat more people and get more $200 tabs paid. The  infuriating part is that our lovely Mission neighborhood has so many of these small, quaint restaurants that have been overrun with very rude staff. It makes us less inclined to dine out in our own neighborhood! Not Ok!
author: Den M.

description: decent tapas, moderately priced. one thing i will say about this place is that before last night i haven't been there since eight years ago. EIGHT! that's a long standing restaurant establishment for SF if you ask me. i consider that quite an accomplishment.
author: Regina C.

description:
girls night out a month in the making

ordered:
-veg paella: the rice could've been more burnt on the bottom, it was ok

-garlic shrimp: clear winner of the night, we ordered more

-clams: in spanish " marinara " sauce, with sauteed onions, garlic, parsley and white wine.. ok

-fried calamari: good

-scallops brochette: good

-grilled of strips salmon: served with romesco and aioli..another overall winner

-jamon serrano: spanish cured ham on toasted french bread served with ripe tomatoes and olive oil.. good

-potato and onion omelet: the texture reminded me of quiche, it was good

-cabbage sauteed with garlic and paprika: good

-house salad with butter lettuce, tomatoes and cucumber: standard 

-grilled asparagus: cooked perfectly

-quail on rosemary potatoes: a little dry, but the girls that never had quail before liked it.. i wouldn't order again

-meatballs stew with saffron and carrots: ok but wouldn't order again

-pitchers of sangria: sweet like juice



this place is a-ok, i'd want to try their sister restaurant-picaro
author: Raquel T.

description: My go-to spot for tapas in SF. A pitcher of Sangria and 4 tapas for usually around $75 (including tax and tip). Great service, can be a bit loud, and amazing food. Give it a try!
author: Eric P.

description:
If I could give this place 10 stars... I would. They seat you quickly (even when the sidewalk is littered with hungry people waiting for a table), bring Sangria quickly, take your orders quickly, and deliver the food quickly. 

But beyond the quickness is the DELICIOUSNESS of all the food. I have yet to order a dish I did not enjoy in the 5+ times I've been. 

Must order the potato pancake, lobster paella and chocolate dessert. 

We already have plans to come here again this Friday!
author: Jane N.

description:
My 2 friends and I came on a Saturday night around 9:30PM for a late dinner. Luckily we were seated within 10 minutes. We ordered the shrimp and soaking the sauce with the bread is a must do because it's delicious. I love that there's a live spanish musician singing and playing during dinner, it just makes the experience more authentic. 

We ordered the lobster paella, typically takes 30 minutes so make sure to order this when you first hit the table when the server asks for drinks. This lobster paella was the best I've ever had. YUM, I can't wait to have it again when I visit SF.
author: Jeena L.

description: Be ready to wait! It's popular but worth it! Where else can you get delicious Sangria! Blood sausage! Tapas that rival the Spanish variety!   SUPER prices and great for small groups.
author: Jill D.

description:
Great place with a nice selection of meat and vegetarian dishes... Really worth a try... get their chicken and potato dishes... outstanding!

It gets a little crowded so plan accordingly .. parking can be difficult as well
author: Dale S.

description:
3.5 Stars

Tip: Paella, sangria

a solid 3.5 stars. Paella is done really well with a lot of seafood for the seafood lovers. The rice is crusted at the bottom of the dish which adds a really nice texture to the paella.  Sangria is pretty decent, nothing amazing or spectacular but always a preqrequisite for a spanish tapas spot.
author: Roth S.

description:
Holy smokes I love the jumbo grilled prawns here, I could eat them for days!  
The trout was amazing.....as was the grilled calamari....as was the blood sausae....as was the chorizo.  We decided not to fill up on rice and skipped the paellla and got a bunch of tapas instead.  Everything was simply season....lemon, olive oil, garlic, and it was perfect.  The olives I'd skip....not bad, but there are so many other yummy options.  I hear the rabbit was perfectly done (sorry, I just can't eat a bunny!)
The grilled artichokes were yummy, but I did peel off some outter leaves as I like my super tender.  I'd recommend making a reservation.  It's pretty loud in there, but you'll be eating so much you won't want to be talking anyways :)
author: Q L.

description:
My sister, brother, and their SOs joined me for a dinner at Esperpento on a Friday night.  My brother-in-law had a craving for tapas and we were celebrating my new job, so we ended up here.

As soon as I walked in, the owner looked me and said "You're with the Adrian party, no? They're upstairs!"  I was quite impressed, as I literally did not say a word when I walked in, but perhaps because my sister and I look so alike he figured it was a right match.  Maybe he just got lucky, but in any case, it made me think he really pays attention to his customers, which is great.

We ordered Gambas al ajillo  (shrimp w/ garlic sauce), jamon serrano, patatas aioli, spinach bechamel, grilled asparagus, chorizo, white bean salad, and sauteed anchovies on bread.  They bring you a big basket of delicious bread and a ton of packets of butter to start.

Honestly, I loved every bite of food I had.  The chorizo was super flavorful, the aioli on the potatoes was great, and I loved the garlic sauce for the shrimp.  The white bean salad was nice and refreshing with its slightly acidic dressing, which helped cut the richness of a few other dishes.    I could pop those chorizos in my mouth all night long.  Same with the shrimp and potatoes.  Awesome!

The most amazing part is that with those dishes plus 2 bottles of wine, the whole bill came out to less than $90.  That's right, feeding 5 people comfortably for under $90?! That's really unheard of in most places.

The service was really friendly, and I liked that the owner came by a couple times to ask us how things were going.  The place is a bit loud so if you're looking for a romantic evening out with your date or something you're probably better off elsewhere.  Otherwise, the food, wine, and prices are hard to beat!
author: Naoko M.

description:
"Vegetarians go nuts for this place"...hmmm really, Yelp, are you sure about that? They know this is a Spanish restaurant, don't they? 

While I'm not so sure of Esperpento's vegetarian offerings, their tapas are excellent and very reasonably priced.

Recommended:

Croquetas de bacalao (like fish sticks!)
Jamón Serrano con pan de tomate
Grilled artichokes
Gambas al ajillo (garlic shrimp), spicy and full of flavor
Albondigas (meatballs)

Not so much:

Mejillones (mussels) came out very overcooked, so much so that they were the size of peas or nonexistent by the time they came out. 

Most of their tapas are in the $4-6 range, so it's best to just order a bunch of them and share. Their wine list is excellent and one of the least expensive I've ever seen at any restaurant. $17 for a great bottle of white Albarino is hard to beat.

Service here was very good, no complaints there. Be sure to stick around for the guitar player later at night. If you're looking for somewhere to eat late in the Mission (open till midnight), be sure to check out Esperpento!
author: David P.

description:
Meh, ive experienced better. Atmosphere is upbeat, lively and made it a good time. But for everything else, Cha cha cha is definitely far superior. We were asked to move tables half way through, the food was nothing fantastic, server was good. We ordered about 10 tapas, four of them were a solid yum, the rest were a solid eh. They gave us free flan for a friend's birthday which was delish. 

If youre not a huge food snob, this place will do. But i won't be back, too many other places to try.
author: Diana S.

description: Amazing lobster paella! They make it to order, so make sure to get a few tapas while you wait. The fried anchovies (with red onion and lemon) and the garlic cabbage are great choices.
author: Elise P.

description:
Still a 3 star because service is still slow and ventilation is still bad.  And parking sucked, we took half an hour to find a space three blocks up.  

Our table was on the tiny balcony and it was packed with people, and it was hella hot!  

Took forever for the waitress to give us then menu, and then took forever to take our order, and took forever for the food to come.  

So why do I keep coming back to this place after so many negative experiences?  

Well their paella is pretty good, and the tapas are cheap, my favorite is the sauteed calamari.  But I should really look for another Spanish tapas place though.
author: Tadaa T.

description: We were here on a Sunday afternoon and enjoyed sautéed mushrooms with garlic as an appetizer. Sangria was super smooth and delicious. We had no clue how many we had but we were very happy with out food and drinks :)
author: Aparna K.

description:
I had reservations for twenty people at 8:45 on a Saturday night.  We were seated at about 9:20.  I kind of have mixed feelings about Esperpento.

4 stars for the service, 3 stars for all around experience.

We were seated upstairs at a table that was setup for about 18 people to sit comfortably.  They had setup 14 chairs and we had to wait a while for someone to find us a few more chairs.  Upstairs felt like a sauna and everyone was feeling the heat.  Our waiter was excellent.  I had ordered the paella ahead of time as it takes about 45 minutes to make.  I put in the order for the tapas after we had got comfortable.  The waiter recommended we order three of each tapas along with the two types of paellas and one meat platter.  We ended up ordering a total of 21 orders of tapas; 7 dishes, 3 of each.  We also had a total of 5 pitchers of sangria. The amount of food was PERFECT for the 20 of us.  I think we could've eaten more, but it was way too hot.  The food came out in a timely manner, which we were happy about.

Tapas (I don't remember the correct names on the menu):
Spicy potatoes: 5 stars.  This is one of their popular dishes and it was definately the most popular at the tables.  Fried small pieces of potatoes smothered in a buffalo wing type sauce.
Potatoes with garlic mayo: 4 stars.  Prepared just like the spicy potatoes but with a garlic mayo sauce.
Oxtail:  4 stars.  It was tender and the consistency of the gravy was perfect.  
Garlic shrimp:  5 stars.  This was another favorite.  Small shrimp cooked in a garlic butter sauce.  Spicy and salty and delicious with the house bread.
Deep fried snapper: 3.5 stars.  Typical fried fish served with a creamy sauce
Calamari: 4 stars.  calamari sauteed with a tasty sauce cooked to perfection
Clams in spanish sauce: 3 stars.  Small clams cooked in a orange sauce.  The sauce tasted good with the bread.

Paella: 
Seafood: 3 stars.  Most of us didn't like it too much.  It was too fishy.
Meat:  3.5 stars.  It was decent, but not the best we've had.

Meat platter: 4 stars. Huge platter of meat ranging from grilled chicken to kabobs to chorizo. It was a lot better than the first time I came here.  All the meat was cooked perfectly.

Sangria: 4 stars.  We all thought it was a lot better than cha cha cha's sangria. Sweet and not watered down.

We brought a cake to have for the birthday boy.  I didn't know how Esperpento handles cake so I brought my own plastic forks, plates, and knife.  They charge a cake fee of $1 per person.  You'd think they would cut your cake for you right? WRONG.  Instead, they brought up the plates I had brought, kept my plastic forks and brought up their own spoons, and didn't cut the cake for us at all.  Why is a cake fee charged if there is no service for it?! Totally not cool.

Anyways, our total bill including gratuity came out to be about $510.  After dinner, a couple of my gf's and I used the bathroom.  As we stood there waiting, the workers would gawk and stare as girls walked in and out to and from the bathroom.  Pretty uncomfortable.  Oh, there's also guys who come in singing and playing traditional spanish music on their guitars.  It's cool when they come in and sing and we don't mind when they ask for tip, but it gets a quite uncomfortable when they just stand there for a few minutes at your table waiting for money.
author: Cheryl Q.

description: Walked right in on a busy Thursday night. Seated right away. Drinks and food came super fast. Tapas was great. Everything tasted delicious. Good Sangria too, fast and friendly service, gave great suggestions.
author: Marc M.

description:
Feels amazing when you have a satisfying and fun-filled night out!  Esperpento is a place that will offer you both good food and a lively atmosphere.  The place gets crowded over the weekend so make reservations....
Fooood:
Tapas - grilled trout, garlic shrimp, grilled jumbo shrimp, grilled mussels, grilled clams were so scrumptious - the french bread which we were avoiding initially totally disappeared... perfect for soaking up the flavorful garlic/parsley sauces in these dishes!
The chorizo were perfectly sized bites and yes they were so good, we ended up getting two orders.  OMG the seafood paella - cooked to perfection and seriously loaded with the goodies...they don't go easy on the clams, shrimp, calamari, and mussels (**paella takes time to cook, so just be patient :))
Sangria - yumm, two pitchers between the 5 of us and we were happy! 
Chocolate mousse to finish off the meal... am still drooling......

Food is delish, portions perfect for sharing and sampling a variety of dishes, price is right, vibe is great...can't complain...Esperpento - you will definitely see me back again!
author: Bhavnak K.

description:
I found nothing special about the tapas here.

We ordered standard fare -- gambas al ajillo (which at Barlata in Oakland is AMAZING), oxtail stew, asparagus, and a carafe of sangria. I think I liked the bread the most!

The shrimp was not seasoned well and it tasted like sauteed shrimp with maybe one slice of garlic. The oxtail was okay but felt like it was missing something. The asparagus were decent enough-- crunchy and flavorful.

I would rate the tapas at 3 stars and the service takes away one of those stars. I was catching up with an old friend and they kept coming over and pushing us to leave. They came and tried to clear up the plates when food was still left on them. TWICE! And then they brought over the check but we didn't look or pay yet and they came to grab it without even asking if it was ready. After about 5 more minutes I think some guy who's probably the manager came over and said there was a reservation and we needed to leave. Just like that. No "sorry" or "excuse me" or "please" at this restaurant!

So we left and I won't be coming back.
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Pretty disappointed.  We went for lunch on a Thursday and arrived at 11:35 (early)  We were seated right away with menus and water.  It took a bit for our order to be taken even though our menus were put down.  We ordered paella for two.  The waiter told us that paella takes 25 minutes.  We were okay with that.  ONE HOUR later we finally received lunch.  No one stopped by to apologize for the wait.  Water was not refilled.  With a wait like that, I'd expect a small complementary appetizer.  Nope...nada.  We received the paella and at that point our waters were finally refilled.  And that was it.  No one stopped back by our table to check on us.  The paella was ok.  Nothing to write home about.  There were two large groups there and it was very noisy.  I won't be back.
author: Lynda R.

description: Just like other Tapas places around the mission...nothing impressive. The spot is tiny and always crowded. The food is just ok, you can probably find better dishes at one of the local taquerias around the neighborhood. It was not horrible, but for Tapas I think there are better places in San Francisco.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: This was a great place to go to dinner with a large party (if you call ahead of time). My friend called and reserved their exclusive room for large parties and it was very cute and cozy.  We had about 12 people and got a ton of sangria and tapas. It was delicious and surprisingly affordable! I HIGHLY recommend trying the paella!! If you have a group of 4 or more, it;s a great deal.
author: Liza C.

description:
I was excited when I looked at the menu because I had a craving for Spanish food, and they had things that I remembered eating in Spain. But when I described the food later to friends of mine, there were no memorable dishes. Pretty much only the names of the dishes were familiar. It was as though the cook took a Spanish food menu and just made the dishes how he wanted, paying no attention to style or flavors.

Not bad, but the most mediocre tapas ever.
author: Amanda S.

description:
I happened upon Esperpento last Friday night while the bf and I were navigating the mob scene that is Mission restaurants on Friday night :P.  We were pleasantly surprised when they said they could seat us in 5 minutes!  They took us the smaller side room (you actually have to leave the restaurant and walk outside) where we sat right next to the window.

After perusing the menu, we decided to order a few different tapas to share.  This was a GREAT choice.  We ordered five different tapas, which was more than enough food.
