Whoa.  This place is popular.  WAY more popular than I am.  But generally, Esperpento delivered and justified the numbers that crowd their sidewalk every weekend.

We had a big group so we called ahead and got a reservation.  HA!  That meant nothing.  I think we were finally seated 45 min after the time they told us.  With that said, the host was an absolute doll and he gave us some sangria on the house to hold us over as we waited.  In general, the waiting atmosphere is friendly and had my stomach not been digesting itself, it wouldn't have been so bad.  

Once we finally got seated (and treated to ANOTHER free sangria!  Thank you!) we ordered a bunch of tasty dishes.  The mushrooms are great, I liked the calamari, the croquettes were awesome.  

Overall B+ food, would definitely come back.  A little bit cooler/younger scene than Cha Cha Cha (with the same wait-time and similar food/prices).
author: Kristin P.

description:
Spicy potatoes, yum. Mussels, a must try -- dip the bread in the buttery sauce afterwards. Asparagus, could've done without. Calamari, a little bland but good.

Our group of 4 got the Lobster Tail Paella for 2, and it was more than enough food along w/ the above tapas. The paella gets served in this huuuuge plate, so it looks like a lot of food, but it's really not that much. All the food was so flavorful and delicious.

I got to dinner late on a Friday night, so I didn't have to wait, but the wait looked monstrous. It was also super packed, and we sat at a table smushed against the wall upstairs. But overall, cool atmosphere, nice service, and great food.
author: Catherine C.

description:
I hadn't been here in ages, but I was having dinner with one of my friends, and this is "our place" (perhaps a close second to the House of Prime Rib).

We made impromptu dinner plans, so we didn't have a chance to make reservations anywhere.  We walked in to Esperpento, and it was surprisingly packed on the Thursday before Christmas.  We waited for about 25 minutes - unfortunately, it looked like they were pretty short staffed with one hostess (who doubled as a waitress on a occasion) and one waiter.  Maybe because of the low staffing levels, they couldn't open up the upstairs...or maybe it isn't open anymore?  

We finally got a table, and as soon as we sat down we ordered two carafes of sangria for two of us.  The waiter refused to let us since the second carafe would get warm but promised to bring out a second one as soon as we finished the first (he did).  

The menu at Esperpento is extensive - almost too many choices.  We stuck with tapas and ordered seven dishes.  Yes, I realize that was too many, but my friend insisted that we have a wide variety to taste and try.  The waiter repeatedly warned us to reduce the number of dishes we ordered - we didn't listen.  We plowed through ~2/3 of our food and were absolutely stuffed. We ordered the stewed rabbit, pollo adobo, mini sausages, patatas bravas, garlic shrimp, green beans and chicken croquettes.  Of those, I think my favorites were the pollo adobo, stewed rabbit and patatas bravas (mostly because potatoes with yummy aioli-like sauce is almost always tasty).  The meats were juicy and yummy.

Even under the stress of being short-staffed, the server was nice and friendly.  It was sometimes difficult to get his attention but he apologized for the situation.  The prices at Esperpento are pretty good (not as much when you over-order!) and generally not too bad of a wait considering some of the other places in the area.
author: Wendy L.

description: Honestly, this restaurant has the best Spanish food that I've had.  It's so good I had to submit another review just to let everyone know: it's that good.
author: Adam A.

description: I love this place, food is good and it's cute. However it's crowded and you have to wait a long time to be seated. And I don't think that they take reservations.
author: Kira B.

description: i normally do not write reviews of places unless I've been there multiple times or my one visit involved lots of time and food.  Although we only stopped in for desert and drinks, nothing worked: the flan never came (I know the waiter heard us), the arroz con leche was partially frozen and the sangria did not have much in the way of alcohol.  I'm giving it two stars instead of one as the other people in the restaurant appeared to be having a good time.
author: S M.

description:
Every food Item we ordered was literally drenched in oil! Except the salmon which was dry and tasteless. Flavors were mildly ok but the oil was a stomach ache waiting to happen, and did. Just thought I'd warn anyone slightly health conscious --- STAY AWAY!

 Waitress was rude.
author: Veronica F.

description:
I came here with a friend and we ate wayyyy too much. It could've been the food or it could've been the herbal supplements prior to our dinner.

Regardless, the food was great and the place was PACKED!

First we ordered two tapas: potato and onion omelet and chicken adobo. The omelet was lovely! Nice and fluffy served with a dollop of some sort of garlic aioli. The chicken adobo was pretty good though I wasn't thoroughly convinced.

After our tapas, we ordered the seafood paella. It was good, but doesn't quite live up to the standard of my mother's paella. I'm going to go so far as to call it a "suitable substitution" for when my mommy's paella is not available.

Then, for some reason, my friend decided to order another tapas: grilled salmon strips. Which I am so happy he did. I could not get over how good this dish was. I'm not a huge fan of fish (other than sushi), but I seriously loved the salmon. Despite being crazy full, I wanted more of it.

And as a nice little end to our meal, a serving of chocolate mousse. Smooth and decadent served with fresh whipped cream.

Overall, I would say that the paella is overrated and stick to the tapas, but am definitely willing to come here again. Even for just that damn salmon and chocolate mousse.
author: Gabbie G.

description:
So I came here with a friend and he said he's been here a couple of times and liked it. I thought I'd give it a shot and come along with him since it was President's Day. I came in and the place looks Spanish, which was a good sign. Now there are a lot of things on the menu and that's another big up. The foods arrived and they were amazing. The shrimp was cooked beautifully, the cod was cooked until tender and the potatoes and mushrooms were amazing. What I didn't like about this place was that mayonnaise was their specialty on every meal, or almost every meal. When you eat the fish, don't eat it completely because you'll be swallowing some fishbones, and the shrimp still has it's shell on it.

Overall, I'd come here again, despite those cons. Pretty good place!
author: Bryan S.

description:
OMG!!!

The sangria and patas bravas are YUMMY!!!!!!! The mushrooms, calamari, and chorizo are also note worthy. Just try not to fill up on the bread beforehand *the bread is pretty good too*

The paella is good, but certainly not the best. Love coming here!
author: Jackie F.

description:
I love their Paella. It is very good and the service was the best! Drinks are great, I have not 1 bad thing to say about this place. Since I was not paying, I did not even note the prices or I would comment on them.

One more place to add to my list of "must repeat".
author: Bella B.

description:
This is my go-to place for tapas in SF. Relatively inexpensive but good sized portions for each tapa. Great for sharing. Love the huuuuuge paellas and strong sangria. This place makes some of the strongest sangrias I've experiences. So drink with caution!

I've loved everything that I've had at this place. My favorites include Estofado De Conejo rabbit stew, Rabo Toro, Ox-Tail Stew , and Trucha A La Plancha grilled trout. I am a meat lover and hence prefer the flavorful Paella "Matanza". I've heard the Seafood paella is awesome. The exotic chicken really isn't that exotic. The staff is great at making recommendations specific to your party's needs as well. 

The location is super easy to get to from Bart, although parking is somewhat difficult in the mission area. I've never had any problems with the service here. Usually no long waits, food comes fairly fast, and the staff is very attentive. 

Tips: Come here during/after sports games or holidays for Spain and it gets quite rowdy and fun! They also street musicians play for donations (could or could not be what you want during dinner)
author: Yue Z.

description:
Me gusta tapas, paellas, sangria, y amigos de yelp!

Ok, that's all I can think of after 3 years of college spanish.  But the food.....  MUY BUENO!  And the service.....  EXCELENTE!

The server was very accomodating and friendly.  He gave us his recomendations which were amazing, he walked us out when we were done as if he was hosting us in his own home, and he took pictures for us outside!

And the food.... Oh, the food was amazing!  We ordered a large array of tapas as well as a HUGE lobster paella which was phenomenal!  Calamares fritos, jamon serrano canapes, patatas bravas, gambas, etc...... It was all tasty and delicious.  Somehow, all the plates gravitated towards me at the end which I didn't mind at all.

And the best part, economically friendly.... The tab was broken down to $20 per person and we walked out stuffed!  Now, that's a successful UYE!
author: Danny L.

description:
I was here for a friend's birthday.  It's a little different than the places I normally go, but I found it charming.  Cool if you want tapas.  I like Cha Cha Cha more, but said friend had a traumatizing group experience there so we came here instead. 

I'd have the meat paella and the potatoes dish again.  Sangria was okay.
author: Erika C.

description:
We arrived 20 minutes before our 8:30 reservation  and we were sat at 8:40. Unfortunately we  had to stand outside the restaurant during this time as they have no waiting space. 

There were eleven of us and they sat us upstairs. Unfortunately, we were sat at a table that would have been more comfortably accommodating for eight people. We were literally shoulder to shoulder in mismatched chairs and one of my friends was sat uncomfortably on the corner of the table as the ends weren't available due to the cramped nature of the upstairs area. 

Service was decent. Our server was around to take our order, responded promptly with our first round of beverages and appetizers, but never seemed to be around when our water was depleted which was often due to the warmth of the restaurant and how cramped we were into our table.

The food was good - we had numerous tapas including the grilled artichokes (yum), garlic shrimp (tasty - dip your bread into the buttery sauce), grilled mussels and potatoes with aioli (sinful but delicious). They all arrived around the same time and were portioned well enough for many of us to share (3 people per plate). 

The paella requires about a 30 minute advanced notice. We ordered  a couple of meat and seafood, an all meat and an all seafood. 

I only had the opportunity to try the meat and seafood but I will say, it's definitely more seafood than meat. There were (i think) four chunks of chicken and beef each  but many muscles and shrimp scattered about as well as calamari bits. The beef was quite disappointing though - seemed more bone than actual edible parts. 

It might be different for a smaller group - the party of six crammed in right behind us seemed to be doing okay, and the parties of two around the restaurant seemed to be having a great time. But we were uncomfortable and that distracted from an otherwise fairly enjoyable evening.
author: Jessie L.

description:
I have eaten at several tapas restaurant before, so my expectations for a good paella are fairly high. Esperpento has certainly met my high expectations. 

The entire staff (especially the guy working the door) was extremely friendly and the food was excellent. The one thing I didn't like about the place (hence the four stars, not five) was the size of the restaurant. I felt suffocated and uncomfortable at the top. 

Although, the food was a bit pricey (total came out to $40/each), the wait was well worth it. Our party had ordered the lobster paella after our awesome waitress had suggested it over the "Turista". I guess, from what she had told my sister, that although the Turista *is* good, it is not as good as the Longosta. Reason being, that the Turista has different flavors mixed into it (pork, lobster, crap, chicken, etc). I suppose she was right because the lobster dish was pretty good.  

We ordered several tapas. Some we're good. Some we're great. None we're bad. They served an eggplant tapa (I forgot the name) that was my favorite of all of them. 

We also ordered three pitchers of Sangria (one was just not enough). The guy at the front was so nice he even let us order in advance for the sangria and we drank it while we waited. 

Overall, the sangria kicked ass. The food was pretty good. The service was good. The seating arrangements sucked.
author: Iris-Bianca H.

description:
Oh I am such a fan of this place! 

This was the first restaurant I went to in San Francisco back when I knew nothing about the city. But damn, its still just as good. 

Do yourself a favor and bring a bunch of friends so you can  just order a bevy of great and delicious food and try a little bit of everything.

Great food that won't make a dent in your savings, fun live music, and a great attentive staff. I have never waited more than 10 minutes to be seated at a walk in at this place either.

Oh and don't you DARE miss the sangria here!
author: Myles T.

description: Came here on a Monday night  (Paella Night!) with a friend for a late dinner. The place was packed, but we were seated within 5 minutes. Monday night consists of choosing any type of Paella (seafood, chicken, meat, etc.), 2 glasses of Sangria each, and flan for desert. We opted for the Paella "Matanza" Or "De Carnes," which included chicken, pork ribs, chorizo, morcilla, and outifarra. The portion was great for two people, Sangria was refreshing, and the flan wasn't bad... all for ~$30. I would definitely come back here! Monday nights seem to be popular, so come early or late to avoid a long wait.
author: Alex H.

description:
Quote me on the following items:

Sangria
Spanish Omletes
Asparagus
Clam in garlic parsley sauce
Grill Artichokes
Lobster tail (!!!!)

These are the ONLY things i ever order from here and they are FIVE STARS!!  

I LOVE THEM!! 

The paella has been consistently bad...either undercooked or overcooked or too saucy or too dry... I'd stay away...

P.S Service is decent or I'd say, European. The staff here are unpretentious. They do their job and are efficient and attentive. But they are not going to go out of their way to compliment that pink dress you bought from good will just to get a better tip...

This is definitely my all time favorite tapas place!

The Ambient is lively and warm, brightly colored and nicely laid-out. Lots of people drop in to play live music on the weekend. It gets packed on a warm day.
author: Xiu L.

description:
Came here for my birthday dinner because I came back from Spain and was craving sangria and tapas and paella.  Originally I was debating between this place and another place up in the marina.  The main reason I ended up choosing esperento was:
1) Great for large groups (there's a back room that fit all 14 of us comfortably)
2) Atmosphere: Really chill vibe (especially if you have a large group) -- you can get loud (not rowdy) and not feel bad about disturbing other patrons
3) Price: I think the prices are very reasonable (if not cheap) especially compared to other tapas places I was looking at.

And of course most importantly...  the food was really great:
1) The sangria was so good although I was bummed they didn't have white sangria
2) We ordered a bunch of tapas and everything was so great!  The patatas aioli (LOVE aioli sauce), Champinones Al Ajillo, Chorizo Salteado "Cantimpalitos" were the tapas that I remember most... but pretty much everything we got was great
3) The paellas were also really amazing (we got the seafood and meat paellas)

I'm definitely coming back here again whenever I get my tapas cravings!
author: S R.

description:
Friday was my first visit to Esperpento and I went in thinking, oh its like Picaro part II but I left enjoying it even more.  The prices were very reasonable, the garlic shrimp was tasty and the Sangria was delicious.  The host was even kind enough to hold a table by the door until I got my slow butt over there.  For two people, 4 drinks and 7 plates our bill came to $55.  I should note the Spicy Chicken Adobo is less spicy and more sweet (tasty nonetheless) and the clams in white wine sauce actually come in a redish sauce.  

If you want some casual mission dining with outdoor seating be sure to check out Esperpento and then walk across the street to the Latin American Club when finished.
author: Kristin Marie S.

description: simply fantastic, the tapes are great.   the artichokes are amazing and potatos with garlic mayo divine.  the paella was just okay, mushy rice and not crisp on bottom.   I still love this place
author: Troy C.

description: Great ppl, excellent food n when the host makes my daughter fall in love with his humor I'm head over heals too!! Busy busy,but always worth the wait! We have had the best Parellada and a variety of tapas such as patas bravas, Salomón, and calamarí a la plancha to name a few.
author: Esmeralda A.

description: The two main things I loved about this place were the sangria and the price. The quantity and quality of food you can get for under $12 is solid. Sangria was excellent. Overall, a chill, enjoyable tapas experience at a good price.
author: Michael M.

description:
I am SO close to giving this five stars, but some of the dishes were a bit bland. 

The reason it would get five stars is because of the price, atmosphere and I thought the service was quick and great. $50 for a bottle of wine and five dishes? That is insanely cheap - you check out any other tapas place, like Andalu, and you are going to be paying double. I think the most expensive bottle of wine they had on the menu was $23. 

The artichokes are to die for and also get the potasas bravas - so spicy and delish. Also, the little chorizo sausages are amazing. I would avoid the clams, overwhelmingly boring. Last thing that bugged me slightly was they kept checking our bill to see if we had put money in it, but then would say, "don't worry, take your time". That drives me NUTS, especially when we are still working on our bottle of wine. 

Either way, four stars, worth it. Try it!
author: evan Y.

description:
Went here for my lovely girlfriend's birthday party last night. Called in at around 3:00pm the day of to make a reservation for a party of 10 @ 8:30pm.

We arrived at 8:00pm and were seated in the amount of time it takes to wipe down 3 tables.

Tapas came out fast! and hot!

Chorizo was tasty.

Patatas bravas were excellente. We put in another order after we finished the first...

Green beans were perfectly seasoned with fried garlic and salt.

Albondingo(meatball stew) was ok.

Clams in Spanish marinera was a solid dish that was greatly assisted by the prevalence of bread to soak up the broth.

Sangria was better than its brethren at Cha Cha Chas.

Seafood paella was mediocre.

Overall, it was a very enjoyable meal...and the food here is a fuckton better than what they serve at Cha Cha Chas...
author: Jeffrey D.

description:
My friend decided to celebrate his 21st here. Reservations were at 7:30. My bf got there at 7:20 and told them we were waiting for my friend. At 8 the owner saw the name on the birthday card on top of the gift I was holding for my friend and said that he reserved the private room next to the main restaurant dining area. I'm pretty sure that room was empty the entire time. Why did they not seat us earlier!? It was freezing outside =( 

The owner was super nice and friendly. My bf and I sat and waited for everyone else to show up. There was a huge moth crawling all over the wall which was gross and later there were little flies flying around our food. 

Our waiter was completely, completely, completely, useless. I ordered the clams in marinara because I wanted something with marinara sauce. Obviously its different in Spain or wherever because they came in a tomatoey watery broth. The clams were pathetic by the way.  They were the tiniest things I've ever seen and every single one had sand in them. My uncle cooks really cheap clams all the time and somehow his doesn't have sand in them so it can't be that hard to remove it. I also happen to be allergic to shellfish so when I do eat it, I like it to be worth my weeks worth of suffering that will ensue. What a waste. 

I also ordered the garlic shrimp, something I read the chef was known for. I was halfway through eating the oily shrimp when I realized a lot of them weren't deveined. So fucking gross. Are you kidding me? I sent them back and this was mid meal and when the bill came, the waiter still said nothing. We asked him about it and all he said was that the chef doesn't like to devein them because they are so small and they will get smaller if he deveins them. Wow. Basically the chefs are conning you into thinking the shrimps are bigger by not deveining them. I can see why they would do that because the shrimp was super tiny to begin with. I can't believe he didn't say anything to begin with, didn't replace it, didn't comp it, and took my plate away even though there was still a few deveined shrimp on it. Why would he not say something?!? He was so incompetent. He is lucky it was a birthday dinner that had preadded gratuity and we didn't want to make a scene. 

It doesn't help that everyone decided to split the bill 8 ways even though my bf and I ordered far less food than everyone else and I didn't drink any of the sangria they ordered. We way overpaid for something we never would have paid for to begin with.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
I was hungry and a little cranky by the time I walked into Esperpento. I had spent more than 20 minutes circling the area for parking. It was painful... 

But I finally found parking right in front of the restaurant, and my friends had already ordered and there was lots of bread on the table so everything was great once I was inside. The place is pretty dark and loud, so seeing and hearing was hard at times.

The bread was actually really good, or maybe I was hungry. Refills came often and quick. But the bread tasted even better with the sauces from the tapas. They were not light on the garlic, oil, or the salt. I love garlic so no complaints there but everything was a bit too salty for my taste. The fact that it was so salty was why it was great with bread. I especially liked using the sauce from the spicy potatoes for my bread.

The sangria was really good, very sweet. Overall the experience was pretty good, a little pricey in my opinion but nothing extreme.
author: Angela T.

description:
I actually came here a few months ago when a friend from Japan came to visit. So many Spanish tapas places to try in SF and I've barely shaved a tiny corner of the iceberg!

For the life of me, I cannot remember what I ate or what we ordered. I do remember the food was good, and something with potato. There were 8 of us in total and we went through 6 pitchers of sangria! Esperpento has one of the better sangrias I have tasted and I would've had more if I didn't have to drive! Definitely coming back for more next time~

Aside from the food, atmosphere was pretty nice. Low light setting, tables were a situated a bit close to other patrons, and occasionally there are men walking around performing songs, too!
author: Jenny M.

description:
SEAFOOD PAELLA, Spicy Potatoes, Oxtail, Sangria, oh my!

To be greeted by a gracious host is always key and Esperpento aces this small but important deed.  A wait? The sweet yet potent sangria calms your nerves and primes the pump. You'll be thinking It tastes like fruit punch!

You cannot go wrong with their selection of tapas - there is a dish for everyone. To top it all off there's an intensely flavorful, slow-cooked, buttery paella dish - which I love with seafood.  

It's cozy, it's lively, it's tasty, it's only $$. 4 stars.
author: Helen L.

description: *BEWARE* CREDIT CARD THIEVES* i love the food here and have visited this place over 20 times in the past few years.  my 1 star rating is because I WAS STOLEN from by the older Hispanic female SERVER.  she overcharged my credit card by more than sixteen dollars.  i called several times to talk with the managers, but i was always given an excuse and was unable to talk to them.  i will never return based on their dishonest behavior and horrible customer service.  if you must visit this place, protect yourself and only pay with cash.
author: Johnny O.

description: Patatas Bravas and their sangria are things I could live on. I really can't come here enough. Pass me another carafe ...
author: Max K.

description: Love, love this place.  We arrived to the restaurant early on Saturday and  they were able to sit us, which was good since our original reservation at 6pm would have left us waiting for our food longer due to the crowd.  The food was great. The service was fast, though kind of confusing. But to the food.  The rabbit paella was delicious a bit more than two people to share. The mussels were great in taste. The blood sausage was not what I expected. It was fried so the iron taste was not there. Overall, it was a good place to visit and crowded, as it it seemed as we existed the restaurant.  Good tasting sangria too.   :)
author: Marck N.

description:
I went to meet up a few friends at this joint a few weeks ago. We were seated in another area away from the main crowd. I guess this more quieter area was for folks with no reservations and it was totally disconnected with the main dining room. Now for the food. The food was ok and reasonably priced. The paella came out a bit dry as if it was put in the oven a little to long as if reheated. The oxtail, though, was very tasty, but not so much the sloppy calamari. The croquettes were good.

The service was ok, but it was hard sitting at the end of the table where the service staff had to squeeze through to get to the back of the kitchen with a 10 inch gap between the end of our table and the wall. Yeah, that was a tight squeeze for sure. The sangria must have been great b/c my friends ordered 2 pitchers.

All in all, I'd maybe come back here again and try the other items on the menu.
author: Joseph C.

description: Yum yum yum! Paella, sangria and a band! What more can a girl ask for!!! Parking is horrible though! But we will back for the food:)
author: Maria A.

description: Can't believe I've never been here before! Such a cute little spot in the heart of the Mission - comparable to Cha Cha Cha but more reasonable prices and more cozy. I'll definitely be back again and again and again.
author: Katrina R.

description:
Love love love this place!

Went in one afternoon w/a girlfriend just on a whim and boy were we happy!

Tortilla De Patata, Croquetas De Pollo, Gambas Al Ajillo all so yummy!

Such a cute spot too. Need to drop in for dinner one note soon and have some wine too.
author: Stella D.

description:
Had the sangria, which was decent. Also ordered the blood sausage, mussels, oxtails, quail and rabbit paella, iberico ham, sauteed mushrooms. My favorite was the blood sausage. I was expecting something irony like blood but it was very palettable. Its stuffed with rice and some other ingredients, then deep fried, YUM. 

I saw this program on the food network about eating Iberico ham. They said its the best kind of ham in Spain but it just tasted like ham to me.
The paella was OK. I was expecting something a little more. I guess I'm used to eating paella mariscos or chicken paella so the taste was a little more exotic as it had rabbit, quail, and asparagus. 

Overall, really good. I'd come here again and would recommend this place to a friend. But definetely you should try the blood sausage.
author: Kenson K.

description:
I was a little disappointed with the food. Ordered Chorizo small plates which had a tough texture. Chicken adobo was sweet and a little dry for my taste. Rabbit was good, Paella was average.
We ordered Crema Catlana for dessert which tasted like cerelac with milk pudding.
author: Philip T.

description: I'm sitting here at Esperpento waiting for my Paella Negros. The sad part is I made reservations at 7:30PM and pre ordered my food over the phone. To top it off there was no manager on duty. An employee by the name of Laura wasn't helpful at all and said that they don't take pre orders over the phone because sometimes customers don't show up and the employees end up paying for it. Why wouldn't I show up if I made reservations? Why does Esperpento provide take out orders? Obviously something is wrong here and in other words Laura is saying that I, a customer is wrong. you NEVER, ever, ever, ever accuse a customer for being wrong. As I'm yelping this message Jimmy's eating his food before me because obviously his food came out first. That's the whole purpose of me pre ordering my food. Our waitress is front if me right now as I'm typing my message and she didn't flinch at all about the fact that I'm sending this horrible review. I haven't yelped in a very long time, two years to be exact. But this is something that the entire world needs to see. I've considered my favorite restaurant and recommended to family and friends. I wouldn't any more. This may be the last time I'm coming and I'll be taking my business else where.
author: Christy-Ann O.

description:
So, I checked this place after driving by it at least 100 times. I ordered the Seafood Paella absolutely delicious, The Spicy Potatoes absolutely delicious (better than the Garlic Mayonnaise), Fried Calamari (Yumilicious), 3 pitchers of Sangria to die for! I was having a great time and was "feelin myself" so I decided to tip the cute guitar, single mariachi man a few extra dollars to play Mexican music (in a Spanish restaurant, hmmm) for us after like 3 songs everybody was staring at our table and seemed annoyed. Whatever!! So we decided to start clapping and chanting the Mexican Grito (ahuah!) Haha. The waitress kept coming to our table asking is there was anything else she can get us and you know how annoying it is to get interrupted over and over again when you telling somebody you "love" them after just meet them (too much sangria). Over all it's a great place to eat and drink fabulous sangria. 
To all of you complaining about the parking HELLO!! San Francisco, Mission District, Bars etc...
author: Carla F.

description: Third time here, and still loving everything we've had so far. This time, we tried the rabbit and quail paella, calamari, clams and roasted eggplant. Two thumbs up! Calamari batter was not too thick and melts in your mouth with the calamari, and the clams were fresh. The paella was delectable, as usual, and a portion for 2 can definitely feed more than that.
author: Rosanna C.

description:
I've been here twice, once on a first date and once with a group of friends.

I'm not a huge tapas eater, so I can't compare the quality of food to the rest of the tapas places around (though my Spanish co-worker thinks Esperpento is one of the best in town), but I will say that the food is good, the prices very reasonable, and the staff attentive and helpful. It's the kind of place you can go to and know what you're going to get and how it will be; the type of restaurant you make your standby when you aren't in the mood to fight for a table or try something too crazy.

Ironically, though they can accommodate groups very easily, I wouldn't recommend it as the restaurant is so loud it's hard to hear what is being said more than 2 chairs away from you. 

Great place for a first date, though! You both can find something you like and eat as little or as much as you want without being obvious about it. You can also be as fancy or as casual and you want without standing out.
author: Ryan R.

description:
My fave tapas restaurant in all of SF!

This is a cute and lively spot in the heart of the Mission and it serves up the best lobster paella and sangria I've ever had since Barcelona.

Tip: Try everything! It is all super delicious, especially the spicy potatoes, grilled asparagus, garlic prawns, chorizo, grilled calamari, paella and SANGRIA. Mmm.. My mouth is watering as I type!
 
The service is great, the conversations get loud and the music drowns you. A fabulous spot for a fun night out with friends.
author: Shahirah I.

description:
This is my most frequented restaurant of all time. I really love this place and it continues to be one of my favorite places in the city. I've been coming here for about 5 years, so please trust my judgement on this. This might not be the fanciest, most delicious, best service and best decorated place in the city, but it is so well rounded in all those aspects that it makes for the ideal place to frequent. 

Location: It's in a great location; walking distance from bars, shopping, a movie theater and events. Tons to do before and after dinner. Pretty easy to get to, too. Since it's right off bart, it's a good place to have dinner with non-San Franciscan Bay Area dwellers.

Ambience: Such a mixed crowd, you really never know who the hell is going to be in here. From birthday parties to dates, from homos, hipsters, and annoying Marina people and everything in between, this place calls to many types.

Space: I actually really like the decor. The walls are filled with Miro, Picaso, and Dali. The tones are really warm, but at the same time, there's something grungy and authentically edgy about it, very Spain. The tables are waiting with carnations and the plates are colorful. 

Service: You might have to get used to the service. I personally love the staff here, specially Maria Jose. They are humorous and you have to be able to keep with them. They're pretty attentive.

Food/Drink: There a very wide selection of tapas. Something for everyone. You can literally bring anyone here because they will find something they like on the menu. The tapas are not artisan and they're not the best ones you'll ever have. But they're delicious, brought out pretty fast and have good servings. They are definitely worth the price. The Sangria here is some of the best I've ever had, and I'm including Spain. It's dark and sweet and gets you wasted before you know it.

Price: This is one of the main reasons I go here. It's some of the least expensive good dining experiences in the city. If you want non-diner experience at a good price and have fun, come here. Everything is priced very reasonably (if you're a San Franciscan). Brunch time is particularly affordable.

Overall: Pretty good place to go, specially with a large group of friends. I really enjoy coming here every time.
author: SF N.

description:
The whole clamshell of what we ordered and their own appropriate ratings:

Patatas Bravas - I no longer partake in carb love, and so avoided these.  However, from previous outings to Espy, these things are the shiznit.  Reconfirmed by the four stuffed faces who couldn't actually verbalize it.

Mushrooms - So yummers.  Perfect amount of doneness.  Like, between just picked at Joshua Tree and just picked up a can at Grocery Outlet, matched perfectly with a little oil and garlic.

Olives stuffed with anchovies - Surprisingly little 'chovy saltiness.  Well done.

Grilled Trout entree - Fish was super yummy, with a crispy skin.  You can't get all of the bones out of a trout.  It's inevitable that they pass through your lips, as those of you who are avid trout eaters like myself will understand.  There weren't that many, so it was obvious they tried.  A for effort.

Rioja (bottled of red wine): Very mellow and delicious.  Not overly fruity, with a hint of caramel finish, it was lovely.

Shoot, I forget the bottle of white that we had: At first sip, it was super cold and crisp.  As it opened, however, I thoroughly enjoyed it.  Recommend highly, er, this whats-its-name white wine.

Some tortilla thing puffed with egg:  Looked good.  Didn't eat it.

Mole beef something or other: Went like hotcakes.  Looked absolutely delicious in a thick and creamy sauce.

Atmosphere.  If you can, sit downstairs, where at least you get cool air coming in from the numerous folks finding their way to a table and the ceiling fans.  Sitting upstairs is hot, with little air circulation.

Oh, and MINUS one star to the host/seater dude who had the nerve to ask us how much longer we thing we'd be, as there was another group waiting for our table.  Um, how about when you see that both wine bottles that we paid for are empty?

Okay, my carpal is getting tired.
author: Tamar D.

description:
Service quick and friendly, food fantastic - comparable to the tapas I've had in Spain. The portions are large and start at $5.

If you haven't been, start with the sangria, patatas bravas (mildly spicy), and pollo adobo.

It gets very loud in there even when it's not crowded.  There's something about good conversation over tapas.

Bottom-line: Woohoo!
author: KyNam D.

description:
Love it; tasty, unpretentious and inexpensive.

The Chorizo is excellent, the Sangria is pretty good, only the quail and rabbit disappointed.
author: R O.

description: Eserpento was just what I was looking for upon returning from Spain.  With a longing for tapas, I headed here and ordered boquerones, jamon, tortilla, and paella.  All of the dishes were tasty however, I found the paella a little too salty for my taste.  The sangria was potent and refreshing.  The crowd was lively and the live music was on-point.  I will definitely be back.
author: Stephanie V.

description:
I cannot believe this place only got 3.5 starts on average! I LOVE this place!

Things I love here, in order of preference:

1. Spicy potatoes - my favorite dish here, the sauce is just perfect; I always tempted to order two even when we only have 2-3 people eating
2. Sangria - if I can only order 2 things, I would get spicy potatoes and Sangira. The Sangria is better than any where else I tried in the city. Cha Cha Cha etc etc
3. Garlic shrimps
4. Seafood Paella
5. Garlic Mushrooms, Chicken adobo, scallops, cabbage all tie at 5th place

Warning: service might be slow. But it worth the wait!
author: Ling T.

description:
We went here for a special event.  The place's name precedes its reputation.  The ambiance was appropriately quaint as enjoying family get-togethers.  As we came in, a mariachi was going around serenading which, in my opinion, stimulates an enjoyable and quasi-nostalgic surrounding.

Service was awesome.  They never had us waiting while we had our bread served and replenished as we transitioned to the patatas bravas (spicy potatoes, which I would definitely try again next time - sauce was mesmerizing for taste).  After that, choice of entree for the evening was seafood. Had the shrimp tapas (gambas al ajillo) and they were scrumptious.  You can start ignoring the butter and dip the bread into the tapas' (patatas y gambas) mouth-watering sauce.  I'm glad I saved my tummy for the next dish as we tried the lobster paella.  Palatable; shrimps, squid, oysters, green beans over lemon and good carbs?  Totally hit the spot.  They keep up to their word, the price is absolutely enough for 2 or more.  And they're one of the best deals you can try from this restaurant.  

I must have had one too many sangrias, but I actually enjoyed it.  Next time when I come back I may want to try their version of calamares fritos (being a big fan of calamari) and the other paellas.  There is enough serving for every entree, and this joint would definitely be a preferable place to bring good friends to wrap the evening up (or start for some of you party peeps).   Among other things, food and company are what make up for a delightful meal.
author: Fred T.

description:
My first time trying Spanish food and I like it! :D  I like the noisy, laid back atmosphere and our waitress was very nice.  We ordered the jumbo shrimp, chicken croquettes, potatoes(with spicy mayonnaise?) and potatoes and onion omelette.  Everything was pretty solid!  We left with happy tummies(we were so full!) and there was still food left!

oh yeah, to the couple sitting next to us...RELAX..you guys looked like you were in a five star restaurant with pearls dripping from your champagne glasses, giving everyone else the eye because they were having so much fun.
author: Kat D.

description:
Lively place!  Delicious food!  Fast, friendly service!  

Great for groups, great for meat-eaters and vegetarians alike (though, probably not for vegans).  

Try the spicy potatoes, the artichokes, and the garlicky mushrooms....YUM!
author: Dori S.

description:
We got here 12 minutes late and they had given our table to another party.  We were fine with that because we were being pretty relaxed about getting together this evening and my mom said I think 'it's ok to be late'.  So I was like whatever I'll just take a shower after being at Lake Anza especially with the outbreak of Swimmers Itch.  I digress, anyway after we came late, they asked the seated party to move, which was pretty awkward for us because we didn't care where we sat and it was fair to give the table away.  And of the people in the other party was speaking Spanish which made me feel even worse about the situation.eek


(5/5)***Trucha A La Plancha grilled trout***-good fish but somewhat tasteless.  I added salt and the sauce from the dish below.

(5/5) ***Almejas A La Marinera clams in spanish " marinara " sauce, with sauteed onions, garlic, parsley and white wine***- Get this!

(5/5) ***Morcilla sauteed spanish blood sausage***- Tried not to think the color was 'blood'.  Taste like falafel.lol 

(4/5) ***Asparagus Ala  Plancha***- it wasn't cooked enough I think. Wouldn't order it again.

(0/5)***Aceitunas Rellenas De Anchoa olives stuffed with anchovies (imported from spain).***-Really bad quality.

(0/5)***Grilled Quail (one per tapa) on a bed of rosemary potatoes.***-Disapointing, tasteless, quail was tiny, practically all cartilage.  I taste no rosemary on the dry potatoes.

(5/5)***Paella De Mariscos Or Seafood with calamari, shrimp, clams and mussels*** We got the one for 2 people and it was enough for 4.  We couldn't justify paying $48 for rice and average grade seafood for 4 people.
author: Pimms H.

description:
Great food and sangria, affordable prices.

Pros:  
- Sauteed calamari - name is misleading, its actually seafood combo, best dish of the night
- Jamon 
- Grilled shrimp - good garlic, full of flavor.
- Live band (many people seem to complain about them, but I actually liked their music. They created nice Spanish vibe)
- Lobster paella 

Cons:
- Pollo Croquets - the least impressive dish
- Parking in the area can be spotty. 

I will become a frequent customer
author: victoria c.

description:
Torn between giving Esperpento 1 or 2 stars...guess I'll be nice and give 2.  I went there with a few friends on a Friday night ~ 7pm.

Service: 0.50 star 
- Waiter was impatient.  I went there with a few friends, my first time there and we were deciding what to get. I got the "hurry the f*** up" vibe from the waiter
- Poor timing of food.  The dishes could barely fit on the table because they didn't time the food right - we ordered 5 tapas + 1 paella.  We had to eat fast just to make room.
- Got not-so-subtle hints to leave.  I was there with friends who I hadn't seen in a while, we wanted to sit and chat after dinner and dessert.  The staff would rudely reach across the table while putting his/her arm in front of my face and totally interrupt our conversation.  This happened a couple of times - first while removing the dishes, and again when they started to take away our glasses.  The waiter didn't bother to ask if we'd like anything else and just plopped the bill on the table.

Food: 2 stars
- food was ok, nothing memorable, but nothing horrible. 
- Lobster Paella - tasty and generous portions
- Championes - ok, but would've liked more garlic flavor
- Patatas Aioli - ok
- Croquetas De Pollo - couldn't really taste any chicken
- Rabo Toro (Ox-Tail Stew) - a little bland and the meat was tough
- Espinacas Con Bechamel  - ok
- Sangria - good

Ambience - depends what your looking for - good to go with a group a friends b/c it's lively and busy; probably too noisy for a romantic date.

Overall, I was really disappointed - I was looking forward to having tapas and was expecting more based on some of the rave reviews :-(
author: T G.

description: Had a great brunch here!  While everyone else was waiting an hour to get into mission brunch places, we were sat right away at 1230 on a sunday.  We ordered patatas braves (the spicy sauce was SO GOOD), various bivalves, and a few sausage dishes.  Everything was quick and tasty.  SO MUCH GARLIC YUMMM!!!  The server was cool and friendly, the whole staff was tatted up and low key.  When the bill came, it was only 40$ for 5 dishes and a few sangrias.  Such a good deal!  Def coming back!
author: CC C.

description:
Everything we ordered tasted great! The seafood paella, potato tapas, and the asparagus tapas. I've wanted to come here for dinner since the beginning of the year and it did not disappoint. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

My niece left her iphone on the table but fortunately, when we came back 20 mins later, it was behind the bar.

We came on a Friday night around 7p which was the perfect time to go. It got really crowded and people where lined up waiting for a table after we arrived.
author: arleen r.

description:
This place is definitely my go to place for celelebrations such as birthdays. Been here several times already for a birthday celebration and a graduation celebration. 
Food here is good, but not great. My favorite one is definitely whatever that has the aoli sauce, their aoli sauce is goood, never disappointed me everytime I order it. 
The rabit stew is not that bad, the rabit was cooked perfectly, had good flavors, it was good. My other favorite would be the chicken croquette, always cooked perfectly, love it. The paella is good, not great, since I had better ones, and the ones I make taste really similar to it. Their sangria is good, it could probably get you buzzed if you order 3-4 pitchers for 4-5 people. 
I would say service is o-k, that's where i'm giving -0.5 star, it's super loud here so that's another -0.5 star and the food, another -0.5, since it's just o-k it's good but not great. 
Also, if you'll be bringing a cake for a birthday, they will be charging $1 cake fee per person, which I think it's kina too much, so that would be another -0.5 star, so that gives it 3 stars for me. 
Other than that, I would recommend this place. Good for big groups, portion is reasonable for big grouops, I like how they have different sizes for the paella and price is reasonable for the quality and portion. You have to call for reservations, and all of your party doesn't need to be present to get your table (thank god, since parking here is HORRIBLE).
author: Toni Rose M.

description:
I don't know why I never reviewed this spot but it is the best spot hands 
 down from the Sangria to the Tapas

 I love the Asparagus,Calamari, Battered Snapper,fried calamari,patatas Aioli homemade garlic mayonnaise

The food is hella good and wayyy better food and service then Cha Cha Cha any day
author: Kim R.

description:
Love that place! Been coming for the last 7 years and it's great to come with a big group of friends!
Try their sangria, fried calamari, spicy potatoes, clams and spanish chorizo!
author: Rositsa K.

description:
I met some yelpers here and it was fun. I was short on time and only had a couple beers but the food smelled amazing. Even though I usually think Tapas are a scam to get you to pay more for less food the prices seemed reasonable. The decor was a little too busy for my taste, damn that borderline OCD! 

I'll update this review when I've had a chance to try the food for now I give them the benefit of the doubt with four stars.
author: Manny F.

description:
I've been here multiple times and every time I've left satisfied. This is honestly the best Tapas restaurant I've been to in San Francisco. The prices and serving sizes are reasonable and the food is absolutely mouthwatering. I highly recommend the cheese potatoes, seafood paella, the shrimp, and of course, you can never forget about the sangria.

This place is pretty popular and its not very large so the seating is very crowded and the restaurant gets very noisy. Some people may see that as a cozy and lively atmosphere, but it really depends from person to person. You may have a bit of a wait, but I promise you that it will be worth it.
author: Tian X.

description:
You MUST order the Tortilla De Patata (A+). On the menu it says "one of the most popular spanish tapas." It tasted HELLA good and I'll def go back to Esperpento just. for. that.

My friend and I almost ordered a whole carafe of Sangria, but didn't because we had plans to drive to get some ice cream for dessert later on. [Attn: Do not drink and drive. ;)] We both enjoyed our own glass of Sangria.  Oh and let me tell you, the Sangria at Esperpento is a winner! Very yum + plenty strong. I had a light buzz going on in the early afternoon. Win! (But it def wore off after the Paella, which was perfect so we could proceed to our dessert destination safely.) :)

We also ordered the Pollo Adobo Tapa (A-) and it paired really well w/ the Tortilla Patata. (I was thinking that the Pollo Adobo might have also tasted good w/ some rice. But... that might only be the Filipina in me thinking that. lol. We Filipinos like rice w/ almost everything, especially w/ something as saucy as the Pollo Adobo. Mmm...)

Our main course was the Lobster Paella for 2.  The portion of this dish is HUGE. Definitely plenty of food for 3 or even 4 people. (Note: We were a little full from the tapas, but even if we didn't have tapas, the paella would have been plenty of food, and we still woulda had leftovers.) I give the Lobster Paella a B+. It was a bit salty for my taste, but my friend liked it a lot and didn't think it was salty. Then I realized that she had squeezed like 3 lemon wedges on her plate of paella and I on the otherhand only squeezed a little bit. The lemon definitely balances out the flavor, but I didn't think it should've been as salty as it was.

Service here is good. Our server/waiter was very polite.  She even exchanged my dollar bills for quarters for the parking meter. Which reminds me, parking around this area kinda sucks.  We found a meter (1 hour limit) that was about a block away.  So halfway through our meal (right before the Paella arrived) I walked to the meter to feed it more quarters for an extra hour.  A little bit of a hassle, but it was a nice day, so I didn't mind.

Next time I go back, I hope I can find a good parking spot w/o a meter. Or one that is longer than 1 hour. 

Oh ya, FYI: we went around 2pm on a Sunday and it wasn't packed at all.
author: Grace G.

description:
CHECK YOUR CREDIT CARD STATEMENT!!!!

Our server tacked on extra tip to our bill!!
author: Pebbles And Bam Bam A.

description: Hands down my favorite Spanish tapas place on the west coast. No other city can tout as many great tapas places like SF. I love the seafood dishes here! They make the best potato dish ever that's serve with their house aioli. This place is cozy and fun! In the summer it's a great place to suck down sangria. I love their squid in ink sauce. The people here are great and you can't beat the mariachi guy who comes to play in the restaurant during the evenings!
author: Josie V.

description:
Lobster / seafood paella!

I was craving paella recently, and realized I'd been to Esperpento.  Actually, I didn't recall the name, but I recognized the inside of the restaurant from yelp photos.  Go yelp!

In any case, went for an early dinner here.  The food was good.  The paella was great.  It's rather a family atmosphere; kids will be there, so it's not date-y.  Service was good, and it's in a convenient location with street parking even.  Although, you'd probably be advised to just use the nearby parking garage that another reviewer mentioned.

Definitely a decent place to get paella.  Would come again, after I tried a few other paella places ;)
author: Timothy Y.

description:
We were asked to wait 30 minutes for a table for 6- at 9:30pm on a Saturday. Fine by us! At a Spanish restaurant, its appropriate to eat at Spanish times ;-) Plus the Latin American Club is conveniently located across the street to get you going on drinks.

We waited....and waited.....and GOT FREE GLASSES OF SANGRIA!...and waited...AND GOT A FREE CARAFE OF SANGRIA! ...and were finally seated around 10:30. One of the management staff, or possibly owners (?), was super attentive to our group given that we were held up by the party before us. He checked in on us with sangria in hand, constantly updated on the status of our tabel, and gave us another free carafe of sangria upon being seated. We really ate Spanish style in a fun, bustling, albet a little bit cramped, space. 

Food was pretty damn good- though nothing every really compares to cuisine in Spain. We shared a few tapas and the Paella de Mariscos. Everything was excellent! My only disappointment was in the bread. It was pretty tradition Spanish style- white baguette- but bland. This is San Francisco people! Don't tell me you can't get good european white from ACME or NVB or Boulange. Ay dios mio, por favor!! 

On a 4 star scale:

-Paella de Mariscos- quatro estrellas
-Patatas Bravas- tres estrellas
-Asparagus  a la Plancha- quatro estrellas
-Calamars a la plancha- quatro estrellas
-Gambas a la plancha- quatro estrellas
-Pan- dos estrellas
-Sangria- dos estrellas
-Staff & atmosphere- quatro y tres astrellas
author: Raquel C.

description:
Sangria, tapas, Yelpers....OLE!

This is my spot to get my Spanish food fix.  Going to Esperpento is like taking a 12.5 hour flight to Madrid, only you didn't take a 12.5 hour flight to Espana.  The walls are adorned with replicas of Salvador Dali to the infamous Pablo Picasso.  The smallest details make the experience-all the way up to the sign that reads ASEOS for the restroom.  I had the pleasure of joining fellow Yelpers Daniel L, Paul K, Tom R, Kent P, Brendan H, and Amy C for dinner at Esperpento.  For tapas we settled on rabbit stew, which I didn't know was rabbit at the time and thought it was chicken.  It was pretty good.  In addition to the rabbit, we had rabo toro (oxtail stew), patatas bravas (spicy potatoes), calamares fritos (calamari), and gambas al ajillo (garlic shrimp).  All were excellent choices, with my favorite being the patatas bravas.  You must get this when you go! No questions asked. Just get it.  For paella we select the Paella Turista which pretty much has everything in it: mussels, clams, shrimp, pork, chicken, and calamari.  And yes, the paella here is made in a paella pan with socarrat (the crust at the bottom of the pan from the rice).  

Thanks to everyone for joining the dinner at Esperpento that memorable evening!
author: Maybelline C.

description:
Jose was our waiter.  He was very nice.  We gave him a slice of cake and hopefully he didn't do anything to my food despite the fact that I kept singing "Jose can you see" half the night.  Parking in the Mission is the suck.  I don't understand how there can be such a concentration of yummy restaurants in a place that has no parking.  It just seems to defy all the rules of business ... but then again, so does www.woot.com and don't we all wish we came up with THAT business plan.  

I forgot to write a review about this place until I went to read Seong's reviews and her review reminded me that I had dinner here the other night.  Sadly, most Spanish restaurants don't leave much of an impression on me ... though it could be that after cursing the parking Gods, I suppress Mission area restaurants from my memory (it's a self preservation thing.)

Anyway - I came here for a birthday dinner - Seong's as a matter of fact.  The company was great and our friend Gail did a great job of ordering food and flirting with the waiter ... "Jose can you see?"  I got my fill of seafood, spicy potatoes and meat.  The sangria was delicious, but as I was pouring the carafe of it down my throat, all I kept thinking was "this is going to give me a hangover tomorrow with all the sugar / juice they put in this ..."  We sat in some back room - so I can't really comment on decor or noise levels - but overall, I thought the service was very attentive and the food was tasty.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
Hard to really mess up a sangria and it's quite good there.  Food is wonderful and very affordable.  If you're not a heavy drinker, you can have $20 pp or less (tax & tip included).

Good dishes:  
- gambas aljillo (very very tiny shrimp and I mop up the garlic oil with bread)
- Paella.  Try to get seafood.  The meat one was ok

Questionable dishes
- I think it's chicken adobo or something like that.  I can only tolerate skin on a chicken if it's crispy.  Not flappy ones soaked in sauce screaming "Just eat me and get it over with!"
- Their salmon didn't taste very fresh

They have limited dessert but the flan's very good.  Creamy and heavy. 

Host is very friendly and apologizes for any wait.  He gave us free wine after a 20 min wait.  One of the waiters seems alright.  I feel like he always hovers during tipping time.  He looks slightly like Borat with more subdued hair and no moustache.
author: Yvonne Y.

description:
Service was... [quizzical face, tilted head] well, why would you give a group of three two menus?  

But regardless, I have to like this place for the selection of veggie tapas and reasonable prices.  Portions are a lot bigger than normal tapas, and the patatas bravs were especially yum.  

I'm not usually that into the idea of tapas, but this is where I'd head next time I'm craving small Spanish plates.
author: Dana S.

description:
Let me preface my review with a little admission...I got pretty drunk off the jar of sangria here.  With that said, I really enjoyed the environment and the food.  I visited this restaurant with someone who lives in the 'hood, who knows the waitstaff and jokes with the owner.  We stopped by here in FEBRUARY 21, 2009.  That tells you HOW FAR BEHIND I AM IN WRITING MY FREAKIN' YELP REVIEWS.

Luckily, I keep notes on my receipts and napkins.  SO NEVER FEAR FRIENDS, I'll try to keep true to what I remember (which you read my preface...) of the food and drink, as possible *HAHAHAHA*

This can be a hoppin' place in the evening.  I've wanted to try this place on several occasions, but I've always diverted to other nearby restaurants b/c I hate to wait!  I'm glad that we were able to get seated rather quickly.

For three people, we ordered 1 jar of sangria, 2 paella, 1 iberico, 1 bravas, 1 calamari plancha, 1 croqueta and 1 ensalada mixta and we ate family style. 

My favorite were the croquetas de pollo....YUM YUM YUM....oh and the paella...I wouldn't say it is the BEST paella that I ever had, but it was decent...

The food was average...but I think that I really enjoyed the SANGRIA (for obvious reasons)
author: Hiromi N.

description:
This bustling establishment entertains guests with a packed house on a Friday night.  Tables are very close together so be ready to get comfy or awkwardly get to know your neighbor.  Street musicians come off the street and play loudly to the diners in this restaurant.  I must say it was entertaining at first, but when they come around asking for tips I was only mildly amused.   

Salted Cod Croquettes (This tapa piqued my interest, but alas that's as far as it got.  The taste was quite mild and wasn't every amusing to my taste buds.  Salt was what this dish needed.  The innards consisted of mashed cod with the consistency of instant mashed potatoes.    

Ropa Vieja Stew Of Beef, Chicken, Chorizo with Cabbage Sauteed With Garlic And Paprika and Grilled Potatoes.
(I found the cabbage to be very tasty and the potatoes were pan fried to perfection.  The stew on the other hand was a little dry.  When I think of stew I think of everything being wet, not parts being wet and other parts being dry or out of the soup base.  

We had a pitcher of Sangria to ease into the night.

In summary, if you want a place that serves decent food at decent prices, then this place is superb.  If you're wanting to try the paella, then take this review with a grain of salt, since I didn't try it.  The service is decent, but with the tables being as packed in as they are I can't say it can get too much better. 

Decor:4
Food:3
Service:2

Would I go back?  I might be willing to try again if someone else suggested and I couldn't come up with anything else in the area and I wanted paella.
author: Kelson H.

description: Loved this place when I lived in the bay. I still call artichokes "artichofas" bc they were so good here.
author: James M.

description: Walked in without a wait before the dinner crowd at 6:30 on a Friday. Food was average but definitely affordable at $5-$8 for tapas. The sangria was great - not too sweet and plenty of alcohol. Decent service compared to some of the other restaurants in the area. I'd go back for a casual nosh.
author: Sharon C.

description: Went to Esperpento on a Saturday night, day 2 of our trip from LA. Though the wait was a little long, and the service a bit slow, the food 150% made up for it. 4 words: Lobster Paella, Patatas Bravas. DO IT.
author: Jordan L.

description: I visited this restaurant with my family. We were a party of 5. Walked in at about 2pm on a Sunday, we were seated right away and service was great. All the food was great for what we ordered. The only complaint I have is that on the Paella, the shrimp wasn't deveined. When I explained this to my daughter's boyfriend, because he has never had shrimp, he was ready to throw up. My family wasn't too happy about this either. Overall, though, this a good restaurant.
author: Tony N.

description:
The food is good. Not great, just good. Meat and seafood paella was nice, though I thought the calamari and shrimp were overcooked and tough. The sangria is very delicious.

But the service, oh dear - the service was despicable. Our waitress never once gave a damn about us. It took her several minutes to acknowledge that we were even there, and for the remainder of the evening if we wanted something, we'd have to flag her down. We stacked our own dirty plates and glasses, hoping that someone might notice we had long finished our meal, but no. She never even bothered to look in our direction - hollering and waving our hands seemed to be the only way to get her attention. She'd roam around dragging her feet, seemingly hungover and living entirely inside her own head, sometimes sitting down to rest at the table behind us. The bus boy was equally as bad. He'd stare at tables piled with dirty dishes but do nothing. He'd lean up against the wall, or sit with the lazy waitress. He was even once asked to pick up some dirty glasses and he rolled his eyes. 

I'd like to return to give the place another chance because I do like the atmosphere and it is close to home. But this was easily some of the worst service I've had in a long while, and for that I probably won't recommend it.
author: Zara E.

description:
Yeee.
I went here two days in a row.
Day 1:  I was hungry as balls, it was late (9:30pm), and I woke up to cruise through Yelp with my zip code and the "open now" option.  I found Esperpento, which was three blocks from my house.  I demanded my manfriend and I go to this place, because it was cold and I was craving warm, filling foods.  I also looked at the online menu, and saw that you can get dinner combos for $10.  YES.

We went in and the place was cozy and warm.  There were lots of other people there, which was nice.  I'm not sure what people on Yelp have with the servers here, because ours was nice and prompt.  

Anyway, we ordered two tapas (the serrano ham/toast/olive oil and the fried snapper with garlic mayo) and two dinner combos.  
He got the beef milanesa and I got the chicken adobo.  
I HATE bones with my chicken, so I scraped away the pieces of white meat and gave the rest to my dinnermate.  The chicken was very tender and delicious though.  His milanesa was tasty too, and I would definitely order it in the future.

Day 2:  HUNGRY again, went with my friend Tbone.  Ordered the Spanish meatballs combo dinner with two tapas (spicy potatoes and garlic shrimp).
The sides are tasty.  The spinach here is almost as good as House of Prime Rib, and the rice was delicious, especially with the meatballs.

Damn tasty.  I love this place.  There is a very good chance I will be back today after I get off work.  Yum.
And ya dudes, the staff.  Last night was CROWDED as hell and super busy, but everyone that worked there was super gracious and kept an eye on us.  Good work, Esperpento staff!
author: Meh M.

description:
While visiting SF from SD, a friend decided to show us her fave restaurant. She brought us here for lunch.

We had 3 tapas: grilled asparagus, grilled artichokes and papas bravas. All were great, especially the papas bravas. We also got Paella de Mariscos for 2. It was delicious and fed 3 with a little leftover. I will certainly come here again next time in SF.
author: José C.

description: I would give it 3.5 stars.  The place was really loud b/c there was a live band upstairs.  Service was friendly and prompt.  We had the paella, the sangria, and numerous tapas including the jamon iberico (highly recommend).  The place is small, busy, and lively w/ cute art on the walls.  It's probably the best tapas place I have been to in the bay area (though I have only been to 4).
author: Brenda L.

description: Yummity yum yum yum.  Yum.  For an inexpensive treat, I head to Esperpento for some pitchers of their sangria and platefuls of yumminess.  Yes, the place is a little lacking in atmosphere...and the upstairs is the worst on a warm night...but the food and drinks more than make up for the ambience.  The food is fast, delicious, and oh so yummy.  Get the morcilla sausage and the patatas bravas.  And here's a hint, ask for more brava sauce on the side and dunk all your other dishes in it.  Bread, chicken, kabobs, car tire...it makes everything taste like heaven.  The only reason this place doesn't get a 5 is their service.  They have some pretty poor servers here.  In fact, of the 5 or 6 times I've been I've never been happy with our service.  Oh well.
author: Ali L.

description: Pleasantaly surprised - so gluttonous that we had every other item on the menu, but definitely worth it!  delicioso!!  Crowded, loud, comatose feeling walking out - that's how tapas shoud be :)
author: Ang H.

description:
I went here last week on a first date at the date's recommendation. It's one of his favorite neighborhood spots, and I love local spots, so I was glad to give it a try. 

We weren't in the mood for tapas, of which there are many, so we each went for a main plate. He opted for a breaded beef dish--not my sort of thing--and I chose the snapper. The mains come with two sides, so I chose zucchini and potatoes, both of which complemented the fish nicely. My waiter seemed a bit disappointed that I didn't slather my potatoes in the accompanying sauce, but I did eat some of it, dipping my potatoes as I went. It's not that it wasn't good, I just didn't need that much.

The date said the chocolate mousse was excellent and ordered us up a bowl each. He was right about it being good--the generous helping of whipped cream and sprinkled almond slices on top helped. I ate every bit that was in the bowl.

All in all, it was a good, reasonably priced meal and I would go back again if I was in the area--just not with him.
author: Katie I.

description:
Yum, any place with good sangria is ok in my book.  I had calamari, rabbit stew, ox tail stew, spiced potatoes, shrimp, seafood/pork/chicken paella, and 2.5 glasses of sangria.  I left really full and really satisfied.  Thanks to Maybelline C. for taking us other yelpers there because it was delicious.  Definitely would go back to try everything else.

Pros: great food and it's tapas-style so you can try way more items.

Cons: a little loud inside.
author: Amy C.

description:
This place was good, but nothing to blow my mind over.  Had the lobster paella which was pretty good, garlic shrimp, which i thought was the best, patatas bravas, jerk chicken, calamari, and the potato omelette.  

I love the area though and the man who came in singing..
author: Natalie L.

description: I LOVE this place - it's been a favorite for many years. The tapas and the paella are to die for, and I love the warm friendly atmosphere. Recently I was here with a very large group for a birthday party, and even though the restaurant was really busy and short on staff to deal with such a big group, they nonetheless took great care of us. Wonderful place for great food and great times.
author: Holly P.

description:
My sister and I had just traveled to Barcelona. So we both were missing the zesty tapas and sangria. We found this spot on Yelp and were so happy that it was purely authentic. Even our waitress was Spanish. But, warning, if you're looking for a chic and modern Spanish bistro to don your new outfit, you won't find it here. The attire is casual.

Esperpento is also located on a very happening corner and was even busy when we dined on a Tuesday night. So I suggest making reservations or arriving early. The Mission bars surround the place so it's great for pre-eating and drinking.
author: Jackie D.

description: Pretty good tapas,  spicy potatos were really good.   Pork kebab pretty tasty.  Good spanish beers (bottled).
author: Michael E.

description:
I prefer Picaro (same owner) for only 2 reasons: 1) Picaro is bigger and has more seatings; 2) I really don't like this Hispanic waiter who doesn't really speak English and is also grumpy like his wife just left him for another guy or something.  He was literally grunting the last time I was there trying to order food.

The food is just as good as Picaro though.
author: CalBear H.

description: yum. Small dishes, lots to share and lots of options - I wanted to try everything. The menu is intense - you can read it for days but they categorize everything so you can try to make some decisions. Everything we tried was really tasty and the service was fast, and they were hospitable. Overall, good place to go out with friends or on a date -fun and casual, cheap and delicious. It's a go for me. (Only reason I knocked them one star is because the bread was stale and some dishes can be oily).
author: S. M.

description: I came here for lunch today. I ordered salmon with rice and salad and a glass of sangria. Everything was around $20 or less. Good food and price.
author: Lu G.

description:
One of my girlfriend's favorite places to eat and drink. The patatas bravas and the lobster paella were out of this world and perfect for a party of two. We drank Tempernillo and sangria which were bargains at around $5 a glass. The paella is a healthy portion for under $30 for 2 ppl. I love cheap delicious eats. They have various combinations from the meat heavy to the seafood lovers. ALL are yummy. 
Service is fast and friendly without being interruptive. 
There is often a mariachi band or traveling singer to add to the ambiance and it is family friendly. Bottom line is that its a great place in the mission for unpretentious tapas.
author: Stacy T.

description: Yum!  I love their garlic-fried artichokes and their fried snapper with aioli.  Plus, their sangria quenches my thirst every time;-)
author: Yvette T.

description:
A huge list of options to choose from at a very affordable price - about $5 a dish. Nothing fancy here - just nice, simple, and delicious.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
Esperpento is still one of my favorite restaurants. My client took me here for lunch not too long ago and we both enjoyed what we had. She ordered the salmon combo and I had the chicken adobo combo- both served with french bread, potatoes or rice, stewed zuccini, spinach, and cabbage w/ garlic and paprika  or salad- I picked the potatoes and cabbage. The portions, even just for lunch, were huge- we both left with to go bags. I was expecting just a tiny side of cabbage but it actually came on a separate plate and was really good!
My chicken adobo was really tasty and I was totaly satisfied!
author: M W.

description: Food was amazing got 5 tapas all bomb as Fuck
author: Chris A.

description:
On a recent trek to the Mission to check out the Skechers Outlet sale and stock up at Lucca we decided to checked out Esperpento as well. I haven't been here in seven years and it looked just the same.

I recommend this place for a very reasonably priced big lunch. You get bread, soup and two sides with your entree. The soup of the day was really good and spicy. There were three of us and I was the only one who made the bad dumb lunch choice. Do not order the pinchos marranos here. I usually love this dish and they did something awful to it. Should have known better because even the waiter hesitated and flinched when I asked him if they were good. What the hell was wrong with my mental radar. 

Enough with the bad and on to the really good. 

The salad was so fresh with bright greens and a light dressing
Salmon entree, perfect and a generous portion
Tender beef milanesa
Potatoes
Spinach Bechamel
The $18 bottle of Spanish Tempranillo 

The grilled artichokes were good but some pieces were over grilled and tough. The tender pieces with garlic and parsley were very tasty.

 I asked for aioli on the side and added it to the pork to try and save it. It almost worked but sadly I was the only one who didn't completely clean their plate. You should ask for some aioli on the side anyway because it is so good on everything especially the potatoes that come with the entree. I even spread some on the bread. 

Service is laid back and pleasant.
author: Eileen H.

description: Everything about this place was great. The prices are super good and so are the portions. Sangria was sweet, the way I like it, and only $4 a glass; a definite steal. Plus, there was an excellent mariachi band that played for about 10 minutes. Wonderful! I've been to a lot of tapas places (including in Barcelona). This is one of the best I've been to.
author: Emily M.

description:
Edit: I gave this place 2 stars initially because I thought the food was too good to warrent a 1 star review. I changed it because when I opened my leftovers today I realized that the seafood paella we originally sent back likely just had most. Of the seafood picked off and replaced with meat because I found tons of calamari in it. Again, ONE OF THE PEOPLE AT THE TABLE COULD NOT HAVE SEAFOOD, which I tried to explain to them! Find the full story below. 

To start, we had a reservation and didn't get seated for an hour after our reservation time, despite the constant stream of reassurance that ours table was being cleaned and was almost ready. Once in, we ordered paella and tapas. We were brought our tapas and our drinks fairly quickly- and that was the last we saw of our waitress for the majority of the night. No, " how's everything?", no asking if we needed more drinks, nothing. And what about the paella, one might ask? I was wondering the same thing. An hour had passed since ordering and we had finished all our tapas, but still no paella. Our waitress made her 2nd appearance of the night to bus our plates and tell us our paella would be right out. So we waited. And waited. And waited. We waited so long part of our party had to leave. ANOTHER HOUR PASSED- FINALLY our paella was brought out. Or so we thought. In front of us she laid a giant seafood paella- NOT the one we ordered. When I brought this to the waitress' attention she argued that that was the one we ordered and tried to convince us to keep it, despite the fact that  one of the people at the table cannot eat seafood. The only reason I did not cancel the whole order and leave right then was because I was with a friend who had their heart sat on the paella, so when she said it would be 5 more minutes for the correct one I reluctantly agreed. Eventually the correct paella was brought out( which
I'm pretty sure wasn't even the right one still since I later found seafood in it!), but not before the rest of our plans for the evening were ruined for having spent over three hours at this place. Since part if our party had already left and the rest of us felt so full from sitting there so long the highly anticipated paella had about two bites taken from it before we packed it up for leftovers. 

When I went to the host to voice my displeasure with the service we had received my complaints were met with nothing but arguments and defensiveness. They offered us dessert, but I explained that we had spent long enough there and wanted to leave. I asked if they could do anything else for us and was met with a b.s. story about how they didn't have the key they would need to adjust a check but we would receive a "big gift" the next time we were there. When I tried to explain that that would do us no good because we don't live nearby he retorted with a rude comment about how he doesn't live nearby either but he managed to be there. 

I've never before had such poor service, never again!
author: Marissa C.

description:
It was a chilly Friday night in the Mission, roughly around 8pm and 2 little girls were circling around looking for parking.  Ehh, not my favorite thing to do...but wait...

"Ooooh! found it!" *in a sing song voice*

Now I know tonight's gonna be a good night :)

After parking in our spot 2 blocks away from the restaurant, we started our trek towards Esperpento.  As we walked towards the restaurant, we were greeted by tons of laughter, people and an overly-annoying Mariachi band.  Blech.  Luckily I made reservations so in no time, our party was seated.  This was an all girls dinner - hard to come by - so drinks were definitely in order.  We ordered our favorite, Sangria.  

O.
M.
G.

That crap was disgusting.  I could barely finish my own glass.  This was unheard of in the world of Lisa Wong...but I digress.

The menu looked so appetizing I almost wanted to eat it...OKOK, I was really hungry. Geezus.  Anyways, we then ordered:

Mejillones A La Vinaigrette-steamed mussels in picaro's vinaigrette
Calamares Fritos-fried calamari
Tortilla De Patata-potato and onion omelet
Patatas Bravas-spicy potatoes
Rabo Toro-Ox-Tail Stew 
Ropa Viejo-beef, chicken, and chorizo stew
Repollo Salteado-cabbage sauteed with garlic and paprika
Paella De Mariscos-Seafood w/calamari, shrimp, clams & mussels
Flan

Highlights:

The spicy potatoes were to die for.  We had to get 2 orders because they were THAT good.  Crispy, little brown potatoes slathered with a spicy orange sauce.  Hmmmm...

The mussels?  OMG, what kind of vinaigrette was that?!  The mussels were swimming in an ocean of sweet and tangy waters that had my lips smacking.  Too bad there was only enough to go around. hmph.
