The cabbage was nothing like I have ever tasted in a restaurant.  I mean, who orders cabbage?  Well, at Esperpento...I DO!  Crunchy cabbage sauteed with garlic and paprika, so fragrant you forget you're eating a vegetable.  

The seafood paella was also very delicious; it was actually my very first paella!  I'm not sure what the normal consistency is but I wish it was slightly creamier....Just to warn you, that dish takes 30 minutes to prepare so order that first!  It's a HUMONGOUS dish btw - so big they had to clear out the area before plopping it on our table.  

The rest of the food was...mediocre at best.  I wasn't blown away at all.

The potato omelet? It was dry and needed some kind of sauce.

The oxtail stew?  I've had better.

The beef stew?  Ehhh.

The calamari?!  Don't even get me started...that thing was NOT fried, and not seasoned at all.

Even though there were a few misses, this restaurant is definitely worth visiting.  The ambiance, the people, the servers were all very pleasant to be around.  All in all, a great dining experience for my good friends and I on a random Friday night in the city.

I do look forward to returning...maybe this time, the Mariachi Band will not be serenading our table ;)
author: Lisa W.

description: Great food!! The Spanish pancake to the calamari and iberico ham!   The fresh made chorizo is a true game changer!  Everything we ate was amazing with great flavor.  Good atmosphere with live music!
author: Slow C.

description: The Sangria is one of the best I have had here in the USA. Easy to drink, but be careful, can get you tipsy pretty quick! We had paella Turista, all paellas are made to order, and the wait did not seem that long! Service was great!
author: Patricia C.

description:
Went to Esperpento with my Couchsurfing friends and had a blast  We shared food together and split the cost on the food with more than 20 people. We ate up the stair and I must say it was a little cramp getting in and out of the table. I give this place a 5 star and I would repeat.

1. the cleaniness
2. Yummy to your tummy
3. staff memeber are friendly
4. not far from BART
5. menu is good for the price.
author: Mat Z.

description:
Holy crap this place is so good. I went with 3 other people and we ordered miscellaneous tapas, a seafood paella and sangria. Everything was great and fresh. I think it's leaps and bounds better than Picaro, and when the menu says spicy they mean it. 

We came on a Friday and there was quite a long wait for a table, so I'd recommend reservations. They have outdoor seating but there are a lot of people loitering about waiting for their tables, and foot traffic, so it's probably pretty noisy. Also our dishes came out pretty haphazard so don't order tapas for your entree unless you want to watch everyone else eat.
author: Beth D.

description: One of my favorites restaurants in SF. Try the paella. To die for. Love all the toad. Sangria is very good too. Go for it!!!!
author: Eduardo M.

description:
I've eaten here twice this month - the exact same two dishes - and they have been fabulous.  Both times I went, the place was almost empty - once for dinner about 5PM, today for lunch at 11:30AM.  Each time, my friend and I shared the two dishes ( plenty large enough for us - and, probably, a third person could have joined us!  ).  

Since both of us were trying to eat healthy, we opted for the Grilled Vegetable Salad - grilled assorted vegetables with "ali-oli" on the side - a wonderful dish of broccoli, carrots, onions, mushrooms, stringbeans, grilled in the most aromatic and flavorful Spanish olive
oil, with plenty of garlic.  Besides that, we ate a mariscada -  a griddled seafood platter with calamari, jumbo tiger clams, mussels, scallops and snapper - also redolent of that delicious Spanish olive oil.  It was served on a bed of rice.

We indulged ourselves in a glass of very nice sangria as well.  We were too full to try dessert.  

I'll have to return soon to try some of the other offerings on their extensive menu.   It will be hard, however, to pass up these two favorites.  They do have Parrillada De Carne - griddled meats of chorizo, morcilla, chicken, pork kebabs, & carne asada that I would have definitely added had there been a third person with us.
author: Carmen H.

description:
This place is really freaking good!!! Rustic-style tapas--in each dish, they manage to really bring out the main ingredient's natural flavor in a seemingly simple yet super delicious way, doesn't get better than that.

FOOD:~THE CABBAGE IS THE BEST THING!!!! Amazing, right? I'm a carnivore & was totally surprised at how well-seasoned and tasty the cabbage was. Couldn't get enough.

~Not sure if there's more than one squid dish, whether I had the calamari, but it was simple sauteed squid, not breaded, and I thought they did an amazing job of bringing out the essence of the squid's flavor. Juicy!

~Blech, I cannot stand those big oysters in any format! Reminds me of testicles (sorry, patooey).

~Garlic shrimp is helllllla good. Must order..along with the cabbage!

~I don't think the potatoes were that good. I'm pretty picky about potatoes.

I'm eating there for the 2nd time in a long time tonight, and came to Yelp to see what new things I should order. Everyone has to try the cabbage next time! Thanks to everyone whose reviews are on the first page, I'm gonna try the artichokes, which I've heard are rrrreally good, the oxtail, and the spinach. I want to eat it all! Can't wait to go with two of my favorite people, my couple friend K&J :)))

SERVICE: Eh, but whatev. For this decor & prices, what do u expect? The girl on the phone was really nice!

DECOR: Rustic

BATHROOM: n/a

OVERALL: Definitely my FAVORITE tapas place in the city!!! I'd say Esperpento for a good group meal to share everything family-style, simple rustic food, clean, hearty, filing, delicious. I'd say Bocadillos for fancy, high-end tapas. & Andalu for out-of-town visitors when you don't know where else to go.
author: miss b.

description:
WOW! I am more or less speechless at how amazing everything was! It's a whole day later and I have still been reminisciening over how wonderful our night was. This was an experience. It brought back so many memories from my trip to Spain. All of the food was very authentic. The patatas bravas were SO flavorful. The cabbage, didn't taste like cabbage and had the most incredible flavors. Then there was the Ox tail stew. Let me tell this was delicious!! When I was in Spain we went off the beaten path to this small village and obscure family restaurant and had oxtail stew...this one was just as good if not better! The grilled muscles were mouth watering. Then we ordered the Mixed Paella, "Turista" style blended with Arroz Negros. I have never seen this on a menu since I was in Barcelona. It's rice stained with squid ink. The paella was yummy! The presentation of it is just so eye-appealing. Next time I would probably to make sure to have the garlic shrimp rather than the jumbo shrimp. I really want to try the Lobster paella, I bet it is amazing! You can't beat the prices. Our waitress was right on point, really friend and perfect timing for nearly everything. The management was awesome as well; they're really doing a great job. 

I was glad I had read another yelp review that the mariachi band comes and asks for a tip, because if I hadn't of known that it might have irritated me a bit more. The management explained to us that because the neighborhood is highly Latino, they go into all the restaurants whether it be Italian, Mexican, etc... and all the restaurants let them. I mentioned a soft spanish guitar in the background would be nice. When I said that he sent us over to their other family owned restaurant, Picaro, for Flamenco and dessert. We headed over and although the place was packed, they made sure to get us a table.  They took great care of us. That was a lot of fun! Talented dancer and musicians. 

Hope to come back the next time I'm in the Bay Area.
author: Miss Mel D.

description:
I went here with 2 friends on a limb, heard the spanish tapas were good. So we walked in and were seated immediately. We ordered the sangria which was fairly good, not the best sangria but not overly sweet which is a good thing. As for the food, it was quite tasty. Good jamon, good patatas bravas, and we tried about 4 other tapas each tasty in their own right.

Everyone seems to be complaining about the service, honestly it wasn't that bad. Sure they did not stand over your shoulder at all times with water, but they leave you alone to have dinner with your table. Maybe if you are a large party it could be bad, but if you are a table of 6 or less you will not have any problems.
author: Sebastien D.

description:
Was in the mood for another tapas experience and my bestie selected this place since it was convenient for us to get to from her work & my hotel.  We struggled to find parking on the busy streets but eventually got lucky a few blocks away.  

The restaurant is moderate sized and has a 2nd level with additional seating.  Despite being an early weeknight, this place was pretty full by 6ish.  Not too long after we were seated & served cocktails, a 3-man mariachi band strolled through the door to serenade us.  They played & sang with their hearts, entertaining the dining room with melodic tones that inspired warm feelings in the hearts of the crowd.  

Their extensive tapas menu allowed us to try a smattering of small plates that were fantastic:
Lobster tail--served with lime wedge & butter.  Mmmm.
Cabbage--braised in a flavorful seasoning of what tasted like all-season
Asparagus--garnished w/a rich cream sauce
Torta de patata--also w/a dollop of the cream sauce used on the asparagus
Pimentos rojos--sauted lightly in oil

We grazed on these little delights for a few hours and still didn't finish everything.  At $4-6 per plate, the price was great, the food was wonderful, & the service was fantastic.
author: Michelle O.

description: Outstanding food, lovely service, fun atmosphere... I recommend this restaurant whole-heartedly. I've taken my friends from Spain to this restaurant, and they agree it's the best in San Francisco!
author: Greg Z.

description:
I have been a frequent and happy diner of this restaurant for a few years. But on my last experience with some friends, First of all, they ended up squeezing around 20 of us in their tiny private dining room (which was a fire hazard). We kept asking to be placed on their second floor or even to split up the group, but they insisted that we would all fit. 
Secondly, with such a large group, there ended up being some billing discrepancies (one of the card users noticed an overcharge of $30) but it was corrected while we were all there. A few days later, I get a phone call from a friend saying that  the staff at Esperpento had charged an additional amount on her card. They claim to have never received the cash, that some of us gave. So, even though, she had her signed receipt for X amount, I continue to feel stumped as to why she was charged one amount at that moment and then a few days later she see's an additional charge to make up for the "missing cash". I work in the hospitality industry and I'd hate to say it, but it seems that the staff have pocketed the cash and are getting away with it. 
Suffice to say that neither I nor my friends will be returning. 
In the mean time, I hope my friend is able to get this cleared up.
author: Evelyn B.

description: Nice little place to get together with friends and hangout drink sangria and they they have yummy tapas
author: Brownie B.

description:
Great place for Spanish food, I've been here a bit of times.  My dates usually enjoy the Sautéed calamari, so be sure to order one of these for your tapas.  The sangria here is great also, cold/sweet to the taste.   Order the Paella Valenciana, don't forget to serve your date and squeeze some lemon on her serving.  

Order all the fish not so typical appetizers, anchovies get a good reaction, makes it more interesting.  

The food here is over all great, When I was in Spain I recalled this place and it is very similar.
author: The Wing Man V.

description:
I first started going to Esperpento in 1996 when I lived in SF. I now live in Oakland and rarely make it over to the city but I did last night and stopped by my favorite tapas place to satisfy my craving for some of my old faves. We weren't that hungry so only got three dishes: spinach bechamel, potatoes aoli and clams in garlic sauce. I also had a glass of sangria, which was sweet but good.

The food was as good as I remember it - the potatoes were cooked perfectly: crispy on the outside, soft in the middle and lovely aoli sauce. The clams were kind of small but the sauce was nice. This was my husband's first visit to Esperpento and he said he would go back, which says a lot because he's very picky, especially when it comes to Western food.

I think last night was the first time I did not have to wait for a table, which was great. But I have fond memories of waiting for a table on the sidewalk with friends sipping sangria from our first carafe. We also got a great parking space one block away last night which I thought was a miracle. I guess everything just went right for us and made the dining experience extremely pleasurable.

I'm impressed that Esperpento has kept its quality for 14 years and I think the menu is exactly the same! (Which is a good thing.) They have a lot more selection than other tapas restaurants I've visited. I'll definitely go back the next time I make it to SF!
author: Deborah L.

description:
Just as good as I remembered! I love the food here. Everything I ordered was really good. I highly suggest these items: (I loved all of them)

Grilled shrimp
sauteed mushrooms
butter garlic shrimp (great for dipping the bread)
spicy potatoes (MUST ORDER)
anchovies in olive oil
olives stuffed with anchovies (Best olives!)
clams with butter garlic broth
fried calamari
and seafood paella

2 bad things.... House salad, was suppose to be made with butter lettuce but it was red leaf lettuce. Maybe they ran out??? If so they should mention it. The worst is that singer that goes to every table. Super annoying and LOUD when you're trying to enjoy your dinner. I use to come here a lot and I totally forgot about the annoying musicians. They stand there even though you are obviously trying to talk to your friends. Then they walk around waiting for tip. They should just invest in a MP3 player and get rid of those guys. They are great but maybe play at the corner of the restaurant and not in your face when you're trying to enjoy your evening. 

The food is great here and I'm craving to eat there this week but I'm dreading the band. ugh~~
author: Karen L.

description:
basque restaurants around san francisco are very special. the last time i had basque cuisine was at bocadillos on north beach, but bocadillos (small plates) is just a tapas bar...no paellas.

me and 3 of my closest friends planned to eat here today... unfortunately, we didn't have 'reservations'..maybe we had to since it's weekend, but the 'bouncer' was kind enough to sit us at a decent table by the wall. 

it was their (my friends) first time to have paella, but it was my first time to have an authentic basque paella...clearly, we were here for their paella---very communal and good portion. we had the PAELLA DE MARISCOS (seafood paella)... let me TELL YOU.. FOODGASMS! yes, totally. never disappointed as well as my lovies. we were very satisfied...and everyone laughed and cried. well maybe not cried. lol

next time, i would like to try their tapas plates...SOON! (: they all sounded and looked great!
author: Marc K.

description: We stumbled into this place and were utterly delighted. The food was great, came quickly,was hot and tasty. As were leaving a wandering mariachi started playing it put the finishing touch on the evening.
author: jennie C.

description:
Ugh. 

Just...ugh.

We went for some tapas, some paella, some wine. We came away with a running joke. "Hey guys, we could always eat at Esperpento! ha ha ha...?"

First of all, paella is paella because it has a crusty bottom. Otherwise it is crappy risotto served in a pan. Guess what this was. Just guess. If you guessed crappy risotto served in a pan, you were right. The calamari was way overcooked, and the price was way too high.

Second of all, if there is an item that is not on the menu there are some options for how a server should handle things:

The extraordinary way - Before we begin to peruse point out what items are unavailable.

The acceptable way - If a member of the party orders something that the restaurant is out of tell them immediately and offer recommendations for an alternative.

The Esperpento way - When a member of the party orders something that the kitchen is out of, leave as if to place the order, do something else, and then come back 10 minutes later to inform us that it's out.

I repeat: ugh.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Food prices went up, food quality went down.  I only like my inversely proportional relationships when they go the other way.

Blame it on the economy.
author: Benjamin T.

description:
WOW... I normally go to another Tapas place, but stumbled on Esperpento and will keep this as my go to! 

I had family in from out of town and wanted to take them to a good restaurant. We found this place while we were walking and what a find. Good food and good service! 

The place is small and quaint, seriously.. you're rubbin elbows with the table next to you around prime dinner time, but we enjoyed ourselves none the less. .

We started off with a pitcher of Sangria and ordered up one of their Paella dishes. it looked and tasted great. I think we could have stopped there, but had to try other dishes to make sure more than just one item was worthy of a four star. We ordered up some  Patatas Bravas, Albondigas, Morcilla, Jamon Serrano, and some Queso Manchego.. and have to say, everything was good. Definitely a fan!
author: Sandra L.

description:
I've been here too many times to count.  My family loves it and everyone I bring here loves it.  The sangria is the best I've tasted in San Francisco, and the cheapest.  Way better than ChaChaCha's.  The tapas are all delicious and nicely portioned.  I haven't tried something I haven't liked.  My favorites are the patatas bravas, albondigas, ensalada mixta, pork kebobs and grilled lobster tail.  I also love any dish that comes with a sauce, to dip the bread that is given. The seafood paella is my favorite.  Not to mention the reasonable prices.  On my most recent visit, 3 of us ordered 4 tapas and a carafe of sangria for $41.  By the way, we were completely stuffed after that meal.

I had my graduation dinner here on a friday night with a party of 16.  The staff was so friendly, accomodating and helpful during the night of the dinner, as well as in picking dishes for the dinner in advance .  The service was fast, food was (consistently) delicious, and water/sangria were filled continuously.  

No doubt, I'll be returning here.  

Parking sucks, but the restaurant shouldn't be docked a star for that.
author: Lesliegh H.

description: Was a regular night, NOT an overly busy night. The Lobster Paella too dry. The paella took 1+ HR from time of ordering to arrive at the table. When it appear it was too dry...meaning waitress too busy to drop off at table. there's a helpful busguy they should train. not the best service or food, especially at these prices.
author: Chris M.

description:
First of all, this place is known for its paellas. I wouldn't say their paellas are entirely authentic but for the price and the size, definitely worth the time, money and effort. 

I've been a fan ever since I found out a year ago.. not a regular as the parking situation is difficult.. but one of my top choices when choosing a dining spot before bar hopping on Valencia.

I wouldn't suggest the lobster tapa, as they are tiny, barely larger than a tiger prawn. I would, however, suggest their seafood paella, their potato tapa, fried calamari and the paella using angel hair noodle as opposed to rice. Just keep in mind that the paella for two really feeds three to me. 

The place is always full everytime I visit, no matter if weekday or weekend.. so perhaps you should go a bit earlier, say 6ish..
author: Catalina C.

description:
Really crowded place, a little difficult to maneuver, but interesting decor and good wait service. Live music comes around and busts your eardrums once in a while, but adds to the flavor of the experience. If you're here on a date try to get the alcove in the back - it's super private and romanticky! 

We saw everyone around us having some sangria, so we ordered some too. It was pretty good sangria; I would say comparable to Cha Cha Cha's.

Run down of the food:
Paella de Mariscas (seafood) - pretty salty for my taste. 2/5

Gambas Al Ajillo (garlic shrimp) - 4/5

Butifara Con Judias Blancas (white beans with Catalonian sausage) - sausage sits atop the same French bread that comes free at the beginning. Beans were hard; not cooked. 2/5.

Patatas Bravas (spicy potatoes) - 5/5

Patatas Aioli (homemade garlic mayonnaise) - 5/5

Champinones Al Ajillo (mushrooms sauteed with garlic) - Hmm, didn't really bring out that real mushroom flavor, couldn't taste the garlic, really. 2/5

Like I said, 3.5 stars if I could. I would return to give this place another shot. The ambiance was great, and I had fun here. The potatoes were outta this world. The main course wasn't. Normally I wouldn't return to a tapas place because TWO were good, but in this case, they were soo delicious, that I'd be willing to come back and try ones I didn't get to order. Hopefully, I'll be able to get the bunny images out of my head and try some rabbit!
author: Christine Y.

description:
Short and sweet will this review be!

Tapas, both cold and hot, was good. And, so was the Sangria.

The Paella. Oh boy, where shall I begin?!...I ordered Seafood Paella for our table and a Rabbit Paella to-go. The Paella came out under-cooked even when I asked for a crispy bottom layer. I gave our Server a spoonful to taste and he took it back to the kitchen. When the Seafood Paella returned, it had the right texture but the taste was a bit bland and disappointing. (For reference, I prefer the taste of Paella at Fresca-Fillmore.) I did, however, came to Esperpento with high expectation of excellent Paella. Paella turned out to be not great but edible!

The Rabbit Paella, on the hand, turned out to be Quail Paella. Nice try but no cigar, Senior! In this biz, it's a carnal sin to substitute major ingredient(s) without inform paying customers. It's at best misrepresentation and at worse, lying and cheating your customers. Very poor judgement on the part of the kitchen, serving staff and management!!!

OK, short for the issues at hand but not so sweet!!!

=(
author: DAVID N.

description:
Delicious, inexpensive tapas with fast service and several reasonably-priced wines by the glass. 

My fave dish was the beef, chicken and chorizo stew. 

My only compliant: Rabbit on the menu. It's disgusting and made me a bit queasy to see they were serving up a companion-style pets in a stew!
author: Sadie S.

description:
Yummy! Is my 1st thought of when I thing about this place.
iHeart the Paella and Sangria for dinner. The lunch menu's are such a deal, you get a meal with soup only at lunch, which I highly suggest since you beat the crowds and enjoy the get day light atmosphere in the Mission
author: Monica O.

description:
Garlic Shrimp - Bomb.  Save the oil as a bread dip.

Fried Sardines - Pretty good.  

Blood Sausage - Now, I hate any blood product, but this stuff was great.

Spicy Potatoes - Yummy

Oxtails - So good and tender. 

Clams - I could eat these all day

Seafood paella - Amazing.  Everything was perfectly cooked/grilled.

The only thing I didn't like was that the restaurant was extremely loud.
author: Gene A.

description:
This is certainly a very authentic restaurant.  The tortilla española is delicious, and their varied tapas selection pretty closely reflects the realities of the Spanish culinary scene (well, maybe they could add a few more ham dishes, but I'm not complaining about that)!

I like how vibrant and noisy the physical space is--good people watching, feel-good atmosphere, and a Spanish-speaking staff set the tone for a terrific meal.

I've been there twice, and the second time around, I was sitting at a table next to four older women who easily downed three "jarras" of sangría.  Needless to say, it reminded me of nights I've spent on the Madrid metro filled with buzzed older people having the times of their lives.  It was charming, and made me smile.

You should come to Esperpento for the tapas: the broad range of options provides a huge sampling of absolutely delicious plates.  The paella, though tasty, does not live up to the same quality.  Nevertheless, Esperpento is a really great find and a fabulous place to have a nice sangría and some tapas.
author: Matthew W.

description:
Are you one of those people who can't ever choose just ONE thing off the menu? Sometimes I do, and Esperpentos tapas selection is a great way to be able to order multiple dishes at once to satisfy your eye's craving. Each tapas dish is between $4-8 and for 2 people 4 dishes is plenty. I recommend the patatas bravas - the potatoes are cooked just like I like them, soft with a crispy outside and the spice level is perfect for me. The restaurant is cute and colorful and I think it's a great place to go for a casual talk over food kind of evening. 

Downside is that they seem understaffed, for the entire restaurant there was only 1 waitress. While the place wasn't full it was plenty busy and getting any attention as far as getting water (the food is a little on the salty side) or asking for the check it's a bit slow. So go here when you want a chill meal but aren't in a rush.
author: Nicole L.

description:
3.5 stars.

Some things Esperpento does really well. Others are just okay.

Patatas bravas and the amazing sauce are unbeatable. I think we ended up ordering 4 orders of it. Garlic shrimp is also great...the shrimp was sweet and the sauce was flavorful and tasty.

Other highlights (from a mostly vegetarian/pescatarian): white bean salad and artichoke hearts.

Lobster paella was good too.

We had made a reservation for 8 and still had to wait 30 minutes when we showed up.
author: Lina L.

description: The parillada is the best! Combine it with sangria youre in heaven. Parking sucks though.
author: Annabizelle D.

description:
We came here on a random weekday right when they opened. The staff was nice and the place is charming. 

The spicy potatoes were tasty and the roasted pork was good. We had a rice dish that was standard. We had a seafood stew type dish that was really good. We liked it enough to bring a large group here before a night of big time drinking. 

We got a reservation for 8 folks on a Saturday night and we were taken to the upstairs area. The staff realized that we were cramped and offered us the private room. We took it and had a great time. All the plates were good and fun to share. I think this is a good place for 2-6 people.  Good date spot.  

 If you want huge portions so you can stuff yourself then this is the WRONG place. Tapas means light, small plates. (Great when you need to save room for alcohol!). 

I hope this review helps. Give this spot a shot.
author: John K.

description: Paella is very tasty but it is not cheap !! Fried potato with spicy sauce is good .
author: Anita J.

description: Loved it here! Had dinner here last night.. a group of 9 of us were able to sit curbside, as they set a table for us to eat outside to enojy the warm indian summer night weather! The food came out very timely, dish after dish with sangria. The chorizo was awesome!
author: C J.

description:
*do not sit upstairs* you will suffocate!!! 

So I've been to Esperpento's sister restaurant, picaro, and I think Esperpento is the less talented/uglier sister. 

Sangria: I didn't actually have any because I was hungover from the 2 nights before, but my friends said it wasn't chilled enough. I'm not sure if sangria is suppose to be chilled or what, but we're asian and that's the way we like it.

highlights: 

Potatoes bravas: I want to find out the recipe to this sauce and douse EVERYTHING in it. EVERYTHING. Creamy, spicy, and mouth-watering. Damn it's tasty, oh and the potatoes are coo too. 

seafood paella: yum. Spanish fried rice with seafood. tasty. I love how moist the rice is and all the fresh seafood on top.

I can't put my finger on it but I like Picaro's better. Maybe I've already given Picaro's loyalty since I've been there about 3 times before coming to Esperpento but anyway, both are solid places to go for tapas. Or perhaps, it was the fact that I was hungover from the past 3 days of drinking and got seated upstairs where it was a furnace. either / or
author: Grace Y.

description:
We came here on a warm and sunny day in the city. Tapas sounds just about right; there's nothing like eating light on a day like today.

We shared the Rabo Toro, Ox-tail stew (good), the Brocheta De Vieiras scallops brochette (this was just okay), and the Tortilla De Patata potato and onion omelet (pretty good). Three tapa dishes was perfect between the two of us. 

The dining experience is good. Clean, airy, restaurant with a few tables for outside dining, as well.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
This place is delicious! Every dish ordered was not a disappointment...we (my family and I) couldn't get  enough of it. And the paella...where do i begin. everything about it was flavorful and the meat was so tender. we were lucky enough to bring our leftovers home but it didn't last...the hubby killed it that evening. 

as for the service...everyone was very friendly! i do have one complaint..it took about 3 requests before we got our water! my daughters were not happy campers. 

overall though, i would love to go again!
author: Cherina A.

description:
Food: My friend and I split some awesome tapas! We had Jamon Serrano canapes of spanish cured ham on toasted french bread served with ripe tomatoes and olive oil AND Queso Manchego spanish ewe's milk cheese. It wasn't enough to feed for a meal, just a perfect late New Years day treat. They were so simple yet just right. I even wrapped the ham around the cheese which was delicious. We ordered a chicken dish too but they were out - are they that good or did they just under order for freshness? We ended with flan which was great. My friend insisted it was more Spanish than Latin American style but I wouldn't know the difference. What I do know was the flavor was simple and not over powering with sugar. 

We didn't have them but we saw some pretty hefty dishes that looked ideal for groups too.


Service: Fast, friendly, attentive

Music: A mariachi played two songs which was perfect. It wasn't too crowded and it was nice to get in a few songs then get back to conversation. Its a small place but somehow the music wasn't too loud. I felt terrible I didn't have cash to tip them! Before and after the band was good - maybe Yucatecan? - dance music. Best I've heard in a while and good for eating and talking over.

Decor: Colorful, fun, easy on the eyes

Prices: Totally reasonable! My friend and I split it right down in the middle on separate cards with ease too.

Website: Slow and doesn't represent the atmosphere of the restaurant.
author: Mary F.

description: came here a few times already. can't get enough of their paella and sangria. bear in mind, this place gets really crowded and busy, so in those times i came in it was after lunch or before dinner, otherwise i'd rather pick another tapas place. just cause service gets lacky by that point. food is yes a-ok. not bad but nothing spectacular either. price was average just like most tapas places in the mission.
author: Pam Y.

description:
I give esperpento four stars, because its relatively inexpensive, tasty, has a fun environment, and friendly staff. Ive been there three times, and only once with ONE dish (the oysters) have I been unsatisfied. 
The patatas Bravas are excellent. Get them if its your first time going.
That is all.
author: nathan z.

description: This is one of my favorite spots to grab tapas and paella in the Mission. The atmosphere here is pretty cool as well. Fun spot for a date night or a group of friends.
author: Matt R.

description:
This place is yummy! We arrived a little bit before 7 and was seated right away.  We order everything below and wanted to order more, but the waitress stopped us (thank god that she did) because it was a lot of food.

*Mejillones A La Vinaigrette:  steamed mussels in picaro's vinaigrette
*Almejas A La Marinera:  clams in spanish " marinara " sauce, with sauteed onions, garlic, parsley and white wine
*Jamon Serrano:  canapes of spanish cured ham on toasted french bread served with ripe tomatoes and olive oil
*Queso Manchego:  spanish ewe's milk cheese
*Aceitunas Rellenas De Anchoa:  olives stuffed with anchovies (imported from spain)
*Patatas Aioli homemade garlic mayonnaise
*Albondigas meat-balls stew with saffron

Everything that we order we finish! That is how good it was.  The only complain that I do have is the patatas with aioli sauce was a bit salty for my taste, but I tend to lean toward food that isnt so it is a personal thing.  In addition, I got sangria (which is refreshing and not tart) and Ed got some blood wine thingy that I cant remember!  In addition, there was live music and everyone was getting serenaded!! Hey, its about atmosphere and being with friends and strangers alike, especially when everyone starts singing! =)

The reason that I am giving it a 3 is because the waitress gave us the check without us asking for it and I really wanted dessert. =( 

I would come back again and try the rest of the menu! =) Happy Eating everyone...
author: Winny L.

description:
Not only is this one of the best tapas places I've been to, but it's one of the least expensive for the extraordinary quality of the food. The low price will definitely draw me back. Luckily I was there with a huge group, so we tried a variety of dishes. The manchego cheese was delicious, the paella with blood sausage and the paella with mariscos were both generous and delicious--and heavy, which is how it's supposed to be--and the sangria was refreshing. Our vegetarians were even happy, since the vegetable dishes--notably the spicy potatoes, spanish tortilla, sauteed mushrooms, and artichokes were quite tasty. The service was quick, and the servers were very attentive. We also got to hear a couple pretty good singer/guitarists make their way through the restaurant. I would highly recommend this place, and I will definitely take people here in the future.

OH WAIT--and the DESSERT!!! Flan, rice pudding with some cinnamon sprinkled on top, chocolate pudding...I can still taste it...well maybe because I just burped.
author: Justin M.

description:
I was so looking forward to this place after all the great reviews. Went on a Monday night for a birthday dinner. 

I love Tapas more than just about any type of food and my friends and I found the food to be quite mediocre. Top that off with the absolute slow and horrible service (ordering, getting served, getting the check, paying the check) and the random musicians they let in off the street to "serenade" you way too loudly and obnoxiously and I just can't bare to go back. Even if I had been on a date, it would have been neither subtle nor romantic.
author: Mike T.

description:
Upon arrival, I thought this meal would be phenominal.  The dipping sauce for the bread definately led that hope on, however when the lobster paella showed up, I was marginally dissapointed.  It's not that it was bad, I still ate it very willingly, however it wasn't the knock out I thought it would be.  

The paella was very salty, which was okay but didn't meet my expectation.  I'd recommend trying this establishment though, it's still quite good.  However it's "not the bomb" as it were.
author: Jeff W.

description:
The food at Esperpento deserves at least 3 stars but their service (or the lack thereof), made me not want to return ever again.  My cousins and sister arrived a little after 7pm on a Sunday night (yesterday).  A table had just left so we were seated immediately.  Everything went downhill from there.  It took our server at least 10 minutes to come and take our order.  Our drinks came out a few minutes after but then he disappeared for another ten minutes or so before finally bringing us the tapas that we ordered.  However, he never brought us any bread and butter and it wasn't until we were almost done with our tapas that we got tired of waiting and was finally able to flag him down for some.  At least another 15 minutes passed before our paella finally came out.  During that time, most of our drinks were empty or nearly empty and he could have probably sold us another glass of drink each if he bothered to pay us any attention!

Anyway, the four of us shared the following:
~ Gambas al Ajillo (Garlic Shrimp): a-ok...nothing special and I can definitely make better garlic shrimp, 3/5 stars
~ Patatas Bravas: mmM...the potatoes were cooked perfectly and crispy on the outside...loved the spicy sauce (which wasn't really spicy at all), 4/5 stars
~ Tortilla de Patata: decent..3/5 stars
~ Lobster Paella: I really liked how they cooked their rice and it was flavorful.  The lobster was way overcooked though...way to ruin good seafood!  Good thing there were pieces of calamari and clams in the paella or I would have been even more unhappy with that place..overall 3/5 star dish
~ Sangria: I'm not a big fan of wine or alcohol in general but their sangria is really fruity and delish! 5/5 stars

Esperpento is way understaffed and should hire a few more servers if they don't to piss off their customers and lose more business.  I'd rather go to Cha Cha Cha and wait an hour for a table.  At least then, I know I can expect good service when I am seated.

Overall, 2 stars for Esperpento.  Sorry guys, the service left a really sour taste in my mouth =(
author: Katelynn L.

description:
If I can get at least a buzz off of your sangria, YOUR ACE WITH ME!
E-chan and I stopped in this place while we were walking around the Mission one weekend and it was destiny.
We were seated quickly in the intimate archway and as soon as we saw the menu we knew exactly what to order.
Paella & Sangria. The two lovers who cannot escape destiny. One cannot live without the other. AMOR!
We ordered, we ate and we drank until I felt a nice dizzyness that one can only hope for. @.@
Definitely worth a try for it's affordable price, great food, friedly environment and buzz-worthy sangria!
author: Keika L.

description:
We were looking for a different restaurant in the Mission when we passed by this restaurant. Since it looked nice from outside (Saw a lot of people enjoying the food with good vibe through the glass wall), we changed our mind and decided to eat here. 

We ordered, Fried calamari, Fried potatoes with white garlic sauce (Forgot the name...), Sauteed eggplants and peppers, and chicken croquette. Everything was great! I loved the tasty soft calamari! 

We would come back again!
author: M Y.

description: Wow!  The lunch combination plates were fabulous and reasonably priced.  We had good service and very tasty food.  We will return.
author: Neil L.

description: Yummy in my tummy! This place is so delish! The only negative thing i have to say about this place is the annoying parking and random sketch areas. Other than that the lobster paella makes up for everything.  I thought Cha Cha Cha's was good but this place is beyond amazing! i have been to this place 3 times this month alone. Another plus was the sangria, so fresh and tastastic!
author: Crystal I.

description:
I tried this place a couple of weeks ago and it's my favorite place for Tapas in SF...ChaChaCha is a close second. 

The food is absolutely delicious.  My favorite menu items include the Asparagus, Patatas Bravas (spicy potatoes), Espinacas Con Bechamel (spinach bechamel), Paella De Mariscos Or Seafood with calamari, shrimp, clams and mussels, and Paella Hortelana with vegetables only.  If you want a Paella make sure it's the first thing you order because it takes about a half hour to arrive. 

I'm not a fan of the random musicians that walk in and start playing at your table ... it's just a little awkward.
author: Jessica P.

description:
Great place to enjoy food and a festive environment with a group of friends or a significant other.

I've been her a couple times, and both times the food was flavorful and (what I believe) authentic to Spanish food/tapas.
Paella for 2 is HUGE! Can be shared with actually 3-4.

Serving sizes were appropriate.

Staff was welcoming, helpful and attentive.

Sangria was rico!

Price was well-worth the experience and food.

Thank you Esperento for representing Spanish food and spirit wonderfully here in our Mission District of San Francisco!

I'd recommend this Spanish restaurant by far over "that other Spanish restaurant around the corner on Valencia".
author: Luna R.

description:
The food here is very good and the prices are reasonable.  Their veggie paella is esp noteworthy - I think it might surpass the seafood paella in taste.  The saffron sauce in the albondigas was great.  Sangria is excellent as well.

My only beef with this place is that they misreported our total bill amount.  I have NEVER seen a restaurant do this (I fastidiously check all of my credit card statements) - I've always had the bill perfectly match what we wrote in.  We had tipped around 15%, and they padded our credit card bill to reflect a tip of 18%.  I sincerely hope it was an honest error and not a reflection of poor integrity.
author: Ana L.

description: I was in the area and was craving some tapas.  The combinations plates were the best and you get much more for the buck.  We also ordered the grilled garlic artichoke and grilled calamari. And don't forget the sangria.  It was delicious.  I think I can down the entire pitcher.  The owner said he uses a special mixtures and a bit of sugar.
author: Poboy U.

description:
We must have had everything on the menu, yummy!  The sangria was pretty good as well.  

The only thing I caution against ordering is the Paellas.  It took over 1hr and 34 minutes to arrive, hence why we ordered so many tapas!

Also, RSVP.  This place gets busy, and good luck finding parking!!
author: Rob J.

description:
You don't find many experiences like it!~ Stanley K

One of the truly magnificent Spanish cuisine I've tasted and they just keep coming. Of the many times, I' ve been here, I tried several types of dishes, always order two to three types of small tapas or small appetizers when dining with two or more. 

The Croquettes are average in taste although a few drops of hot sauce will make it better, almost anything. The mushrooms were amazingly good with garlic. The potatoes are a must have, but be sure to ask for a extra side of sauce with your entree or just on the side. The zucchini would of taste better if it was lightly cook or grilled giving it an extra crunch. The salad is great although small in portion.  

The grilled trout is the best dish so far although the snapper was just in the running, be careful, (WARNING) you might find seven to ten little pieces of bone.  

Although this place is in the mission district and parking can be hard, I suggest coming here during the week for lunch. Weekends can be a hit or miss depending on the service and wait.

The weekday lunch service is the most amazing, the menu prices are the same except the lunch entrees are about a dollar less but they include soup which is nice. The service is at best during this time (1pm -3pm). You won't leave here hungry, that's for sure!
author: Stanley K.

description:
I love this place! Great tapas! My absolute favorite!
Always packed but very efficient. Great service and very friendly staff.
Been going here for decades and always very consistent in the quality and service.
I also been to their sister restaurant (picaro ) just a few blocks on 16th Street
Where they can accommodate bigger parties with the same service.
A plus!!
author: Martin F.

description: We went today with another couple and the four if us had a great time.  We had the sangria (not sparkling but very good), loads of starters including the albondiga soup (yummy) and then we ended with paella with seafood and lobster.  Our friends had just gotten back from Spain and said that it was very like the kind they had there.  I'm keeping the name of this place handy for another day. On the down side, the service was slightly slow (but polite), which was actually fine since it was a holiday and felt more like Spain!  :-)
author: Martin Evan H.

description:
I love tapas, and this place hits the spot.

Small, totally rustic feeling, and fresh. Their lunch specials are reasonably prices, and there's hardly a wait for a table.  For dinner, the menu's amazing with a wide selections of vegetarian and meat options.  and the PAELLA!  Like all places, paella takes a long time to bake in the oven--at least 45 mins.  However it's incredible here. Crispy rice at the bottom and fresh seafood/meats on the top.

The wait is long on Friday and Saturday nights, so come before 6:30 to get seated faster.  I've experienced good service here despite the crazy crowded room, so that's always a plus.

The sangria is delicious, and my fav tapas are the spicy potatoes, grilled mussels, spanish tortilla, and the grilled green beans.  Simple and so well seasoned!  The garlic shrimp is always good too, but the most recent night I went they were a bit overcooked (well, they were small lil shrimps, so I can see how they were mistakenly overcooked).

Support this place for it's great food and small town restaurant-feel.  If you've never tried tapas and sangria, this is a great place to go!  It's also not badly priced (as long as you don't order paella), so going with a group of hungry people won't break the bank.
author: Marissa N.

description:
Although I was impressed that the person that sat us was Spanish, I wasn't too convinced of the food that we ordered.  We came here after having drinks at Revolution Cafe so just wanted to snack.  We got boquerones, tortilla española, champiñones and croquetas de bacalao.  Food came out quick but nothing really stood out to me.  The croquetas would have been nice with actual pieces of fish.  Perhaps I've been outside of Spain for too long to remember how they are. 

I felt a little mislead that they didn't have pimientos  de padrón because they were out of season.  Do they really have a specific season?  Hmmm...
author: Christopher W.

description: Very mediocre food and not very flavorful. The paella that we ordered was bland and didn't live up to the expectations. I say this after tasting tapas in various parts of Spain last year.
author: Ssbk B.

description:
Best tapas & sweetest sangria in the area. Quite a selection of tapas. Try the grilled oysters, asparagus, artichoke... Can't decide? They have preset meat & seafood platters, too. Split the paella with your group, also! 

Close to the 24th St BART with an upstairs room for a private party. Don't mind the random mariachi musicians that walk in to play you a song or too.
author: Anna R.

description:
Can I just say how stoked I am that my good friend Max has moved to The City? And even better to this neighborhood? After a year and a half I am finally going to have a reason to come down here and try things.

One of the first expeditions featured a visit to Esperpento. Which all in all was a decent experience. I ordered the garlic shrimp and the zucchini saute thing, both of which were quite good. The rabbit stew also looked delish and the salmon was OH MAI GAWD so ridiculous good. We also ordered a bottle of house wine which was decent. Not my fave but whatever, it's house wine. 

Our waitress was lovely though. Very sweet and helpful and just made the experience all it could be. 

Overall, the food and service was good and the company even better. :)
author: Alexis B.

description:
For the price, it's hard to find anything to complain about.  5 plates and 2 sangrias for $45?  Hell yeah!
The calamari was fantastic - incredibly tender, not chewy at all, and not over battered either.
Chicken croquettes are very interesting - they look kind of like mozzarella sticks, but are smooth and rich, and come with some creamed spinach.  Tasty and hearty.
Albondigas were just a bit on the tough side, but the sauce was fantastic for dipping bread in.
Garlic sauteed mushrooms were only ordinary mushrooms, but with all that garlicky deliciousness, they're pretty excellent.
Manchego cheese plate was also great - 5 big slices of cheese in a light olive oil.

Sangria is definitely on the sweet side, so you don't want to drink too much or your hangover will be horrible, but it was pretty tasty.

How would I sum it up?  You pay very little, and get noticeably more than you pay for.  I think that's a pretty solid recommendation. :)
author: Don H.

description:
Simply stunning Tapas food. Must haves include the Potato Bravas, and the exotic chicken. 
The sangria is absolutely awesome, and the service is great. It tends to get a bit cramped, so be prepared for a wait. 
Theres a parking garage right opposite it too, so its easy to get to.
author: Gurpreet S.

description:
Esperpento is a colorful Spanish tapa place locates in the Mission District, What makes me instantly like about Esperpento is their sangria. My friends and I make some mean sangria whenever we get together, so far Esperpento is the only tapas place make me go...yumo.

We were lucky to get seated at the window seats, it was sunny and warm, on the top of that there were Spanish singers performing. We had; Grilled jumbo shrimp, Clams in spanish marinara sauce cooked in white wine, Jamon Serrano canapes of spanish cured ham on toasted french bread served with ripe tomatoes and olive oil, Morcilla sauteed spanish blood sausage, Ox-Tail Stew , Deep fried anchovies and so many more. The food was okay, fresh, and inexpensive. Sangria however is the star :) well...for me it was.
author: Bruce L.

description:
I went here last night for a work meeting and, boy, am I glad that we decided on this place. The service was quick and we were seated almost immediately (7ish on a Saturday night). Our waitress did not take long with the bread, menus, and ordering, which was nice. I was afraid we would be lost in the bustle of the birthday crowd next to us.

To be clear, the food is definitely 5 stars for me, but the service DID begin to lag as the evening progressed. Our water glasses weren't kept full and ordering dessert was like waiting for the movie Titanic to end. Not fun.

But back to the food... really delicious. The vegetable tapas were not overcooked. The flavors were simple, but very fresh. LOVED the chicken croquettes!!! Spicy potatoes weren't that amazing except for the spicy sauce, which i pretty much spread around on the rest of what I had. 

For dessert, we had the chocolate mousse and the crema catalina.  Both excellent.

Although, the best part of the evening was drinking the sangria! I've never had it before... and I am sad I haven't had the opportunity to drink it sooner. Fruity and not too sweet. But if you are a lightweight like me.... a glass and a half will get you a tiny bit buzzed. I was also sporting the Asian glow pretty early. Pink from my ears down to my knees. Hahaha.

Plan to come back soon.
author: Donna K.

description:
great fresh food!

garlic chicken was very nice, trout was very good, spanish ham on french bread was great

waiter was a little anoying and lacked patience

will recommend though

nice place
author: Jony G.

description: This place is pretty good.  They can get crowded but take reservations.  The mussels are great as are the potatoes with the spicy sauce.  I LOVE their sangria more than Cha cha cha's. I've been meaning to try the paella but always end up getting a bunch of small plates.   It is a cute place with some live Spanish music sometimes which is awesome!
author: Julie B.

description:
I am not an automobile. I do not require an oil check every 3 months. Had I been born with metal parts and an engine, however, I might as well have had my oil check come with 'grilled' calamari and aioli at Esperpento. 

My first visit to Esperpento did not result in this realization. I went with my friend from Barcelona who took charge of the ordering. She warned us that you had to get the right things at this place and got us the chicken croquettes and the Spanish omelet. I am not familiar with Spanish food, but I thought it was tasty.

My second visit was a different story. My friend and I got a table immediately and were given a warm greeting. We ordered what were some pretty cheap and decent glasses of wine ($4.50 each), and decided to get the Spanish Omelet, the garlic potatoes aioli, and the 'grilled' calamari. The Spanish omelet was not really different from last time, and the potatoes were garlicy and hearty but the 'grilled' calamari was nothing short of false advertising (-2 stars). If you say something is grilled it shouldn't be doused in oil and where was the charcoal taste? I rarely get to eat grilled calamari (It's barely served in SF which is funny considering it's one of the thinner cities in the US) so I was disappointed when the calamari came bland and floating in a pile of grease. If that was anything it was sauteed calamari, not grilled.  I might as well have gotten the fried calamari. 

All and all, the food here is way way greasier than anything I've eaten in a long long time. Though the spanish omelet is pretty tasty (as were the potatoes) I would hesitate to return as I don't think my body can deal with that much oil for another three months - even automobiles have their oil limits.
author: Alexandra M.

description:
their paella was gooood! we tried the paella matanza for two people and it was a decent size. 

Service was a little lacking. Took our server a while to get to us and it was really annoying since the paella takes a while to get cooked once you order them. like 30 minutes while so don't come in when you're super hungry. 

also had a band come in while we were eating. it was fun! :)
author: Niko B.

description: Great food at a reasonable price. The whole spanish vintage look of the restaurant is very cool. The day I went there was a man with a guitar signing which was made a great environment. Service was good.
author: Gerardo B.

description: everything is good here; every dish i tried was full of flavour. it's tapa style so the waiting list goes by fairly quickly.
author: B K.

description:
The quick-and-dirty:
Go for the excellent tapas and delicious paella, stay for the sweet sangria.  Esperpento offers a great meal at a reasonable price and is great for group dinners on a lively weekend night.

The back-story:
I've enjoyed a couple of large-group birthday dinners at Esperpento.  In addition to the food and drink, it has a lively atmosphere.  Personally, I prefer it to Cha Cha Cha.

The food is excellent -- the chorizo is one of the best tapas dishes I've ever had.  The paella is quite tasty and everything can be washed down with their tasty sangria.

And, especially for a tapas restaurant, this place won't break your bank.  Great bang for the buck!  It's been a few months since I was last there and I hope to get back soon.
author: John B.

description: My all-time favorite get-down spot where you can find me unwinding and orgasmically smiling and sipping the magical Sangria and shlopping up heavenly tapas with sliced bread.  Rare place where you can't and won't go wrong!  Come say hello sometime ;)
author: Carmel D.

description:
Went here for a friend's get together, there were about 15 of us. We had a reservation. Table was ready on time. 

The decor is neat, interesting, but not as refined as Cascell's. We ordered probably about 18+ tapas and 3 pitchers of sangria for about $300 with tax and tip. 

We started off with bread which was okay, just plain bread with butter, a little hard though. Fell below expectations. 

Some of the dishes we ordered: 
- Spicy potatoes were pretty good
- Garlic chicken was not that bad
- Calamari was good
- chicken Adobo which was recommended by the waitress was a let down
- Chicken crocketts were okay

Tried a bunch of other stuff but was not memorable. 

The food was a notch below Cascell's. About $1 or $2 or so cheaper but a lot lower in quality. Parking is difficult, be prepared to circle for a while. Overall, the food was okay, nothing too memorable or great, not a place you want to visit again. 

In terms of service, probably one of my worst experiences ever. The waitress was rude from the beginning. We were not greeted, were not asked if we were doing okay. The waitress just seemed upset from the beginning. Her comments were as follows: 
"you want the bread now" 
"What do you want? "
with no attempt at being hospitable at all. 

5 of us stayed after lunch which we were done with at 3ish till about 5 pm during this period we ordered another $100+ of alcohol. We even moved to a smaller table of 2 where 5 of us crowded around ordering additional pitchers of sangria. A lady came up and said to two of us "you have 5 minutes to leave, you have been here since 1 pm." It was a little after 5 pm at the time. We were a little offended and my friend approached this lady. Her response was "I am the manager and I can do whatever I want to." 

This is where we were offended: 
- Yes, we had been there for 2 hours since lunch ended but we had spent another $100ish. We had not been sitting there idle. 
- There were still several empty tables with nobody waiting
- We barely occupied any space on a table meant for two which 5 of us were seated on
- And worse of all, she could have been much more polite about it and a lot nicer. 

Overall, I understand people being there too long. However, we kept on ordering and even moved to a much smaller table.

In conclusion, will not visit this place again even if service had been better, the food was simply disappointing. Being there too late I am able to understand. However, being asked to leave rudely is unacceptable.
author: Ahmed S.

description:
I like it!

After being disappointed by the need for reservations and lack of eponymous hybrid eating utensils at nearby Spork, we stumbled upon this little gem. 

It's a small place with nice decor and the happy looking crowd inside seemed to spell good food ahead.

I got the trout.  Or, in a more adjective-laced description, I got a delicious meal with succulent trout, fresh salad, and savory rice.

And the Sangria was pretty good too.

Service was fast and friendly and prices pretty reasonable.  It was a clean establishment and the menu had a nice variety.  Bueno.

See what I did there, used a little Spanish for a Spanish restaurant.  I know, I'm clever.
author: Charles R.

description:
Delicious!  

Sangria and seafood paella='Nuff said.

The paella was cooked to perfection!  The bottom rice was toasted just to the point of crispiness but not burned. Exactly the way it should be done.
author: Val C.

description: Tried this a week after returning from Spain. Was not as good as in Spain, but a nice try. The shellfish on the seafood paella could be fresher. The grilled calamari was good. The decor was very nice with the fans and shawls hanging around. 4 starts for decor. Its ok to give this place a try, since we have few tapas places anyhow.
author: Felecia W.

description:
I have forgotten how good the food is here.  We came in as a big group so we were in the back room. Service was great, food was great, prices reasonable... what more can you ask for? It's a little loud so if you want to have a romantic quiet evening, this is not the place for it. And if you don't have reservations... you will have to wait outside. And SF even in the summer, it gets pretty cold waiting outside for long period of time.

One issue we had during our last visit to Esperpento was our reservation. i knew we were going to be a big group so I sent an email to the restaurant the day before our planned dinner.  I received a reply to my inquiry a couple of hours later from the restaurant. I found out later on that the person who replied to my email was the owner. At any rate, we arrived on time, but the lady in front said we didn't have a reservation. We told her that we did, and she kept pressing - no reservation for that big a group. I had to get a copy of the email I received confirming I did contact the restaurant.  We had to show the lady in front the email and then she told us - well that's the owner that replied to you but he never told us about it.  Wow... how weird, especially after i called to change my reservation from 8 people to 10 people. Somehow, 2hrs before dinner, they had that reservation. Once we were there, they no longer had it.  Anyway, that was annoying --- but after that, everything else was fine.

So if you're making reservation via email - keep a copy of the reply.  If you're calling, make sure you have the date/time you called, and the name of the person you spoke to. Just to be safe...

OH - before i forget, must try the sangria!!! It's light, it's yummy, careful though because it'll creep up on you. It's so good, you're not realizing how much you've had.  :) Don't drink and drive!!!
author: Chris A.

description:
It's sorta like Dim Sum but with Spanish food. This was the first tapas place I'd ever been to. The food is great and the Sangria flows like water. The paella is AWESOME. A must try.

Came for a buddy's birthday party. Not ideal because we were a big group and the place can get crowded. Noisy too because we all had to shout across the table. That just adds to the ambiance of the place. If I'm ever in this area of the city again, I'd give it another go.
author: Christopher F.

description: My bf and I have been there a few times and always get the seafood and meat paella....  It is delicious!!  The staff is really nice and accommodating.  Love the relaxed vibe there. Great prices too!
author: Erinn S.

description: I've been searching for quality paella in the bay area and Esperpento's is top notch.  Their sangria is good and reasonably priced too.  Definitely coming back here soon!
author: Matt S.

description:
Great spanish food, we went a group of 10 obviosly we had to wait little bit. Sangria is a must and i would definitely go with paella. We had a dream of jamon serrano but its not like in spain so i dont recommend that. Tortilla de patata is great Along with sauted calamari.
We ordered so much and drink a lot of sangria in total we paid 29 bucks its not cheap but again it not expensive at all..
author: Ekin G.

description:
My memory of Esperpento is of fun, sangria-infused evenings back in the 90's - crowded at the weekends, with tasty Tapas-style Spanish bites. So, when the opportunity popped up last week, I was eager to revisit Esperpento.  

Sure enough, when we arrived (on a Thursday evening), the place was buzzing and festive-seeming, with a team of Mariachis lined up on the stairs, belting out Spanish bullfighting music. Very good start! I ordered a pitcher of red sangria to begin the evening. Excellent (not too much fruit, but definitely alcoholic...!) The waiter was friendly and there was a genuine fun, happy feeling in the place. We ordered a generous sampling of different tapas -- Potatos Bravas, salmon strips, Gambas, Jamon Serrano, Chicken Croquettes. And here, the feelgood factor broke down a bit for me -- the food was fair, not great - and certainly not the delicious, savory dishes I remember from before. Maybe my palate has developed an attitude, like the rest of me, but everything seemed just ok  to me, and everything was slightly cold. (And things seemed a bit chaotic on the floor - the waiter kept appearing at our table with the wrong dishes, then scampering off to get some more.) We didnt actually finish anything, but in truth, that didnt really dampen my enthusiasm too much -- the place really is fun. Certainly, the mediocre food was disappointing, but it was more than compensated with the buoyant, friendly vibe. (And the food *is* cheap, to be fair -- our entire bill -- including a huge pitcher of sangria -- came to ~$50.00. A very good deal for an evening out in San Francisco.)
author: donal c.

description: Got a seat quickly last Friday night. Delicious sangria! The mariachi band was a nice touch. Great ambience but wasn't the best tapas I've ever had. Good though!
author: Kathryn M.

description: Great experience here.  We called ahead for reservations and were seated within 10 minutes.  Although very crowded space.  We experienced good service.  The sangria was great, 2 carafes for 2 people, lol.  Prices were reasonable and food was tasty.  This was our first time here, and although finding parking is horrible, it's worth it.
author: Ivy P.

description:
First time I've tried Paella and it was sssooooooo delicious. I've ordered the seafood one and it includes clams/mussels/calamari/shrimp....the flavor blended really well with the rest of the spices and it was beyond delicious. They also give you a few slices of lemon to give it a fresh-kick. I'm a HUGE fan. 
I was a bit skeptical about $26/2 ppl portion. But they give you enough tofeed 3-4. I notice a lot of people just order the paella w/ sangria. I will be back to try the lobster one.

Rest of the tapas are delicious, good value, fried calamari comes with this garlic mayo sauce...I am so glad I've discovered this place.

So why not FIVE stars??? Service was so so, the waitress looks so mad...very cold service.
author: Maggie C.

description: I was here with a group of 8 people. We made reservations and the table was ready and waiting for us when we arrived five minutes early. We ordered sangria by the carafe for $17 and it was very good and fresh. The tapas were good portions and between 8 people we split 10 different tapas, with my favorites being the patatas bravas with aioli and the garlic shrimp. I highly recommend saving room for dessert: the chocolate mousse was light, fluffy, and full of chocolate. I can't wait to go back and try the paella!
author: Kim O.

description:
I would give this cute little tapas joint 5 stars, but I only give 1, because of the incredibly rude end to our otherwise lovely meal ...

I joined two of my dear friends for a late night meal of tapas and some sangria. the food was absolutely delicious, the sangria delightful! 

garlic shrimp - yummo-o!
spicy potatoes - I want them every day!
white beans - a nice, cool, crunchy contrast to the texture of the other dishes
fried calamari - lightly battered and fried and delicious
Spanish rice - simple, but good

our group had been chatting for about 15 minutes once through with our food, when a server came up behind my friend's back and threw on the light, then walked off in a huff. it was incredibly rude. we hadn't even been give the check!!

for a culture that generally eats later in the evening, this was a very surprising move at a Spanish restaurant. I would like to say that I'd like to give the place another shot, but I'm not so sure ...
author: Rachel W.

description:
Holy crap this food was good.  :)  I was in a euphoric food heaven that started with grilled shrimp and fried calamari that ended with a large pitcher of sangria and a platter of grilled seafood on top of perfectly cooked bed of Spanish rice. 

Everything we had was absolutely fabulous.  For me it was one of those meals that looked like it came off of some cooking show or a picture I saw in a food and wine magazine and have always dreamed of eating but never had to opportunity too.  :)  This meal was better than I could have ever imagined.  I love seafood and this was an awesome way to get a little bit of everything in one dish.

Just simply AWESOME!!!!!
author: Dustin D.

description: I can't believe anyone would possibly think this is Spanish food. It isn't. On a Monday night, we found the ingredients truly dreadful and the same mayonnaise-style sauce on spinach, potatoes and other "tapas" listed on their menu. They don't bother to update their wine list, thinking it's ok to bring something different without letting you know. Truly bad and not Spanish food at all.
author: Nena G.

description: I am a fan of the food here. I have never been disappointed with the food.  However, my last visit here was not a very good one. We came in with a party of 8, and for some reason when our food came, our server was handing us the hot plates for us to find a spot on the table. By all means, when we saw him coming with our food we tried to make space. He did this throughout our whole meal. He at one point handed me a plate that had a piping hot butter/oil sauce on it and when i reached to grab it it spilled all down my hand and arm. the waiter was in such a hurry he didn't even notice this happened. I ran to the bathroom and rinsed my hand with cold water. I had to finish the rest of my meal grasping a cold glass of ice water. My hand was burnt and red! Not sure when I will be back...
author: Gee P.

description:
This place is pretty good. I had the rabbit stew, and it was pretty delicious. Their desserts are yummy, too. I tried their creme brule and I also tasted my friend's chocolate mousse. I used to hate custard desserts, but after this creme brule... I definitely changed my opinion :)
And they also had some cool live guitar music.
author: ponch l.

description: Food was adequate. Place is really loud. Service was awful. Took forever to get someone to take our order. Then they Kept screwing up the order. FORGOT items. Took forever to get the check. Just not fun. Disappointing.
author: sal m.

description:
Their Paelias reminds me a lot of Valencia Spain, the home town of PAELIAS!
I love their grilled calamari! They have the best price of Iberia ham!
author: Jeni S.

description: THis place reminded me so much of Barcelona. Food was delicious, wine was well priced and the ambiance was charming and fun! Definitely going back :)
author: J F.

description:
Absolutely fabulous food and atmosphere.  Esperpento was recommended by a coworker, and I just have to say that someone will be getting a specialty's cookie as a thank you:)  We had:

Calamares Fritos
Patatas Bravas 
Champinones Al Ajillo
Pollo Adobo
Croquetes del Bacaloa
Sangria

my friends also got some shrimp and pork based products, but the jew in me wouldnt let me try them.  Everything was fabulous, and the patatas were so friggin good that we ordered a second plate!  Nothing better than good food with good friends accompanied by the sweet sounds of mariachi mucic:)  Btw...soooo gonna try the paella next time.
author: Rena H.

description:
Esperpento is one of my favorite restaurant in the mission area just because their food is excellent. I avoid going there for dinner because this place can be so noisy when crowded, especially on weekends when people are drinking sangria after sangria. Perfect venue for Sunday branch.

The Salt Cod Croquettes on spacial was so delicious. Hope they will keep this as a regular menu.....
author: Hide S.

description:
We showed up around 6pm ish, place was pretty empty. We easily got a table for four without a wait. by the time we left the place was packed. We quickly ordered drinks, nothing particularly of interest on the drinks menu, a light selection of typical beer and wine choices to choose from including sangria.

On to the food we ordered Tortilla De Patata (the potato and onion omelet, one of the most popular Spanish tapas). This was a bit disappointing as it had no taste, pretty bland having the texture of Polenta. Followed by an order of Mejillones A La Plancha (grilled mussels), Champinones Al Ajillo (mushrooms sauteed with garlic) and Morcilla (sauteed Spanish blood sausage). All three were tasty with the blood sausage earning the privilege of a reorder. Next we were onto the Chorizo Salteado "Cantimpalitos" (sauteed Spanish sausage), Gambas Al Ajillo (garlic shrimp), Gambas A La Plancha (grilled jumbo shrimp). The Chorizo was tasty but the blood sausage still had me in it's love grip. Out of the two shrimp dished the jumbo shrimp was the better choice with the tasty aioli sauce.

We got out of here with a moderately low bill, everything was good but did not excel to greatness. I can see where this place would be a pain because of the small size and limited seating, but luckily for us we didn't have this problem, so I advise going early.
author: Paul V.

description:
I've been to Esperpento a few times now & love it every time.  This is in large part due to their patatas bravas.  The brava sauce is DELICIOUS.  Perfect amount of spice, the potatoes are perfectly cooked, just so so so so good.  The most recent time I went we also had:

the lobster paella (good, but not as much crunchy bits on the bottom as I would have preferred)

the chicken croquettes (yummy)

the repollo salteado (cabbage sauteed with garlic and paprika- SO GOOD...probably my favorite dish of the evening).  

We also, as usual, had the Sangria.  I'm a repeat customer & don't plan on stopping anytime soon.
author: Jenna H.

description:
I've come here with big groups and we have always been well accomodated at Esperpento. This last time, we were given the private room next door to the main dining room. We got pretty rowdy with the help up beverages and sincere hunger and felt not a twinge of guilt from all the noise that we were making; the main restaurant gets really loud anyway.

So we started with pitchers and pitchers of sangria, copious amounts of tapas dishes and ended up paying only about 30$ per person. That was an excellent surprise to us all. 

So with regard to what Esperpento has to offer... The sangria is sweet, but no one could stop drinking it. It's some of the best that I've had here and in Spain. It was so difficult making the tapas choices; there is just too much to choose from on the menu. If you are a vegetarian you can manage here but this is a meat-lover's paradise after all. I highly recommend the ox-tails, rabbit, grilled calamari and "meat-lover's" paella. 

A word of strong suggestion: if you want paella, order it the second you are seated. Do not wait. It takes about 30 minutes to make it. By the time our pan of paella had made it to the table, we were pretty much stuffed from all the other foods and drinks. But we made a valiant and greedy effort to try it out anyway. Also, I was happy to learn that Esperpento recently added black squid ink seafood paella version that I fell in love with in Barcelona. That's for the next time at the restaurant. I can't wait.

The only drawback to the private room seating is that you have to go outside and then enter the regular restaurant entrance next-door to access the restrooms. Minor issue. Thanks to the sole hostess who took our orders; she's a saint to put up with our juvenile behavior. Warning: we'll be baaaack!
author: Jen A.

description:
Everyone does dumb things during their late teenage years that they later regret. Lindsay Lohan does coke or "gets exhausted" a lot or whatever. The Olsen twins dress in layers and layers of loose-fitting rags.

I used to be a vegetarian.

I have nothing against vegetarianism. I could even imagine doing it again, correctly, at a more mature age. But for me, vegetarianism was basically an excuse for eating only beer, cookies, and the occasional orange for about four years. 

Eventually, I decided I should strive for a more balanced diet, and I don't have any serious lasting health effects from the 4 years of beer and cookies (at least that I'm aware of), but I do sometimes run into trouble when I try to eat meat.

For example, a group of my friends came to Esperpento and ordered the paella. We couldn't decide whether to get the fish paella or the meat paella so we ordered the "every non-endangered animal in the entire world except chorizo" paella. (We also ordered the chorizo, which was yummy.)

Paella, according to the menu, is a stew served over rice in a pan. Typically, when I order something like stew, I expect to just be able to stick a spoon or fork in it and eat away until it's finished.Oh, how wrong I was.

My first spoonful of paella contained a clam in a shell. I knew better than to eat the shell of a clam, so I just kind of set it aside.

Then, I encountered a shrimp. I really like shrimp, so I shoved it in my mouth without looking. Crunch! I was forced to demand that all my friends look at the mariachi band so that I could safely extract the entire tail from my mouth and hide it inside my clam.

Finding a shrimp tail in my stew freaked me out so I just stuck with rice and squid (no bones!) for a while. Then I got bold and grabbed a piece of pork. It looked safe to eat, but when I took a bite a little shard of bone wedged itself between two my teeth! 

Owww. Try taking a pointy object and shoving it into some skin that has never been touched by anything ever. No fun.

These animals clearly weren't going down without a fight. And the only animal I hadn't eaten yet, the chicken, was absolutely littered with hard, sharp bones. The paella wasn't tasty enough to be worth all the effort and pain. It was time to walk away with the remaining shreds of my dignity.

Also, they had run out of bread. Who does that? 

Esperpento is a great place to go to sit outside, drink sangria, and scope out hot Spanish waiters. All the tapas I've had are tasty. But if you plan on ordering paella, I suggest a mouthguard.
author: Liz G.

description:
So I started spanish classes 2 months ago, and the teacher decided to have our final class at Esperpento, where we would only speak Spanish during dinner and practice things we learned during the session.  Que una buena idea!  I thought about writing this review in Spanish to pay homage to the progress I've made in the language over the past few weeks, but let's just say I need a few more classes before I start Yelping in another language.  

 I enjoyed all of the following:  spinach sausages (Que sabor!), both the patatas bravas with white and red sauce, the roasted asparagus with garlic and lemon was fabuloso, and the gambas (shrimp) with garlic and parsley were wonderfully addictive.   The only thing I wasn't really into was the paella, but I don't know if that's Esperpento's fault.  I've tried paella at several different restaurants and I just don't think the flavors of the dish and the texture of the rice really appeal to me.  

Overall, the prices and serving size of everything we ordered were more than reasonable.  I would have normally given this place 4 stars, but I bumped it up a star because our waitress agreed to only converse with the 6 of us in Spanish, and I thought that was pretty cool of her, considering our limited speaking abilities.  Very much enjoyed dinner here and will be back again.
author: LaSha G.

description:
Okay at this place you just have to remember...dip baby dip...

Patatas Bravas - sawcy!!
Oxtail soup - broth-erly love!!
Garlic Shrimp - oil'nt you glad you ate here?

So been coming here for a while now and this place has great food, a lively atmosphere that is punctuated by occasional wandering mariachi bands.
