Haven't had such a wonderful mix of food in many moons. I would do this again without a question. Only issue I really had was parking and it can be kinda packed.
author: Jess C.

description: I like Esperpento.  There are a lot of choices on the menu, so everyone can find something they like.  My favorite tapas are the salmon, spicy potatoes and the asparagus.  They all have good flavor.  However, the same mayo-based sauce (garlic aioli)  accompanies almost everything, which gets sort of boring.  If you have had real Spanish tapas, you will not find these comparable.  They are definitely for an American palate, but because of the variety of dishes, it makes for a good place to take out-of-towners.  Plus, the sangria is good.  Parking is tough, and the place can be really crowded, however, I have always been able to get a table.  The staff is also really friendly and attentive, and I have never received bad service.
author: C W.

description: Good service, tasty seafood paella (and I haven't ever enjoyed shellfish before, but I'll have this again here!) and warm ambiance with semi-low lighting. We did have to talk into each others' ears at some points because it got loud with the birthday parties going on around us, but it was just part of the experience and we liked the excuse to be close. Thanks for hooking me up, Esperpento!
author: Heather M.

description:
My stand-by tapas place in the Mission.

Only complaint is that most of their food is greasy - I would prefer my food to be a little bit on the healthier side.

Portions are huge for paella, grilled meat platter, and grilled veggie platter - I usually go with a big group and order these as a filler while we sample other foods.

Tons of choices, and their sangria isn't half bad.
author: Mary M.

description:
Nice calamari and shrimp with garlic tapas, with the "nice" weather outside-thankfully we got to sit outside since it was hella hot inside.  

The seafood paella was excellent as well (Mom, you got competition, j/k Mom's will always be the best) with the Sangria.

I don't know if I would call this place cheaply priced since the servings of the tapas are kinda small for what you pay for.
author: ronzilla x.

description:
Average food compared to other Tapas places.

Service is not one of it's strong points. We were promised one table, then switched to another smaller table (For 8 people) and later switcfhed back to the original table that just opened up.

All in all our reservation took an extra 30min before we were seated.

Drinks were ok. Ambiance is loud so be ready to shout.
author: Eugene L.

description:
So, I went to this place at the suggestion of a friend... who is a non-Yelper. It just goes to show you that non-Yelpers have great suggestions too!

This place was great. Good prices, great (and helpful) staff, awesome tapas.

We each picked 3 tapas. Here they are (listed in order of goodness):
1. The best garlic shrimp ever. Buttery little tender shrimp, some chilies in the butter, a lot of garlic, and some dipping bread to soak up the remaining garlic/chili/butter. YUM
2. Garlic mushrooms. Small, tender 'shrooms with a hint of garlic.
3. Saffron grilled potatoes with a mole-like sauce. The potatoes were cut like home fries, and grilled. Nice.
4. Mussels with tomato, basil and garlic. The mussels were small, which I prefer. But my dinner mate thought they were anemic.
5. Chicken croquettes. What? Huh? These were bad. Bland, mushy, a bit tasteless. With some unidentifiable white and spinachy sauce on the side.
6. For the life of me I can't remember the last dish. Grrrr... It must not have been memorable.

Anyway, nice place. I'd go back again.
author: Douglas T.

description:
I was here almost three years ago with a group of 18 people. We had reservations, but they weren't able to seat us at that time since there was another party still in our place. The owners set us up with pitchers of sangria and patatas bravas while we all stood outside waiting. They were even cool enough to bust the random guy who wasn't with out party yet still helped himself to our sangria.

We had loads of food. The dishes that stood out were the adobo and blood sausage. Overall, the food was good and service was great for our large group. Considering how large our group was and the amount of food and drink we had, the price was very reasonable. 

If I'm back in the area, I'd go back.
author: Kittenheel S.

description:
I came here with five other friends last Saturday night, some time around 8PM.  We were able to find a seat no problem.  

Since paella takes a while to prepare, we first put in our order for the Seafood Paella before deciding what tapas to order.

The tapas we ordered were pretty good: Grilled Calamari, Scallops Bruchette, Deep Fried Snapper, Potato and Onion Omelet, Stew of Zucchini and Onions with Tomato Sauce.

The Seafood Paella wowed me when it landed on our table.  We ordered the portion enough for six people, but we weren't able to finish it.  It was very yummy and I would definately order this one again!

Our server was friendly and helpful with the menu and the other servers had the patience to take time out to take several group pictures of us with our three cameras.

I'll be making this place a regular stop when I'm in the Mission.

Note: Parking can be limited.
author: Lorace R.

description:
Most authentic Spanish food I've encountered since leaving Spain oh so many years ago. Yes, tortilla espanola is a comfort food! 

I've been here numerous times over the past two years and have yet to be disappointed. I like everything on the small plates menu. The patatas bravas are awesome and the save the bread to dip with the gambas al ajillo. Paella is good but I think B44 and Zarzuela have better versions.

The prices are reasonable and my friends and I usually walk out having spent less than $20 bucks including a couple pitchers of yummy sangria. It's good for groups of less than 10 because the restaurant isn't that big but they can probably manage bigger groups. I think there's a private room a couple of doors down for a large gathering.
author: Y C.

description:
Good basic tapas. My faves are the patatas bravas, sauteed mushroom and the garlic shrimp. 

Their paella portions are a great deal and definitely big enough for double the people than suggested. Digest it all down with some sangria!
author: Heidi L.

description:
The tapas would be 4 stars, and the prices are reasonable.  

But I found the paella "soggy" and without that toasty crust that you scrape off the pan.  - 1

And! the waitress added on about 19-20% tip to our bill and we were only a party of 4.  I was not the one who paid but that left a really bad taste in my mouth.   That was not cool, and reeked a bit of sneaky cheatery and I dont think I would go again for that reason.  -1
author: Mia G.

description:
Very lively environment, great for a friday night out. Sangria was pretty good here. For four people, we ordered a ton of food and were prepared to gorge.

Potato & Onion pancake - tasty, slightly on the saltier side

Fried Calamari - delicious, can't go wrong here

Exotic Spicy chicken - juicy chicken cooked in a type of adobo/curry like sauce. A slight spice kick but very mild.

Sauteed garlic shrimp - tasty, lemony, nothing far from expected

Paella with seafood - Huge dish of paella. We were so excited. Rice was cooked well and you taste a hint of seafood as they were not stingy with the shrimp. 

Paella with meat - Mixed with chorizo and another type of sausage made with bits of rice in it. This dish is a winner! The juices from the meats were infused into the paella. Not too salty, just right.
author: Mary H.

description:
I've been to this place twice now. Its a nice local spot for spanish tapas in the mission area. You walk in and it makes me reminisce back to my trip to Spain. Its not too big or too small and the decor is definitely spain-like. Also you have some of the local entertainment walk in with a guitar to sing spanish songs in hopes for tips. Its adds a cute feel to the place.

The first time there was for a bday dinner group and I wouldn't say this place is a great place for more than a group for 4. But we did order the Paella for 6 people and it was so good, we ordered another one... Pitchers of sangria to share with everyone is also a great way to gulp down the meal.

We went back again recently because we were craving paella does not disappoint and it was as good as the first time. You should also order the potatos brava and the garlic mushrooms tapas. So yum!

As for the service, seems to be hit or miss. The last time we were there, the service was actually disappointing. We kept asking for water and it only came after asking about it twice and the paella took forever...
author: Bernadette L.

description: Better than my mom's Paella! Had the Paella De Carnes Y Mariscos "turista" with chicken, pork ribs, shrimp, calamari, clams and mussels. It was allll gooood!  I'm a sangria lover and I approve of theirs. It's a must when coming here!
author: Miss B.

description:
Had dinner here with friends on a Saturday evening a couple of months ago and had a good time. I have been to Spain and have had my share of tapas at some of the best tapas bars and even though this may not have held a candle to my tapas experiences in Spain it was decent. 

The scene: On a busy street in the mission, small restaurant, small tables pushed pretty close together, dim lighting, crowded and loud. Definitly. a bustling restaurant on a Saturday night! We had one of the tables by the front window which was perfect. 

Service: Surprisingly attentive given how crowded it was and our waitress was very nice. Although I do have to make a comment about making reservations. We made reservations about a week in advance for Sat at 8pm. The day of a call was made to confirm the reservation and everything seemed to be set. A call was then made on the way to the restaurant letting them know that we might be early for our reservation and was it possible to be seated a little earlier....well at this point all of a sudden they could not find our reservations....what?!?! Given the fact that a call to confirm was made the same day and all of a sudden they couldn't find it.....it was strange but we were thankfully accommodated. 

Food/Drink: 
The Sangria was actually very good, nice flavor and lots of fresh fruit. 

We had the following tapas: 

Tortilla- It was good but tasted quite different from what I have had in Spain and what I have made on my own as it had chives in it which changed the flavor of a traditional tortilla. The texture was good but the potatoes were a little dry. 

Serrano- Unfortunately it was gone before I have some but others seemed to really enjoy it. 

Fried Squid- It was OK, nothing out of the ordinary 

Grilled Squid- This was definitely the high point of the meal for me, authentic and delicious!!!! 

Grilled Artichoke- also wonderful and a must order if you like artichokes. 

Pork Kebabs- Nice flavor but very dry 

We also had the Lobster Paella . The flavor was decent but it was a little too salty for everyone in our party. The rice was cooked as it should be as were the vegetables, the fish in the dish (including the lobster) was not under or overcooked but it did lack a little bit of flavor. 

The bread at the table was also decent. 

Overall: Even though it was loud and crowded with a huge line waiting to get in .....it was in no way annoying ....it made it a fun dining experience. The place had a lot of energy but yet had a coziness about it. Also, the prices here were pretty reasonable we had a pitcher of sangria, a beer, 6 tapas and paella for a little under $100 for four people....not bad. The food was OK and I wouldn't say no if someone wanted to come back here but I would make sure to either come on a different day or at a different time because parking is a nightmare in the mission.
author: L L.

description: The food here is okay, not amazing and not bad. The service is eh and it's gets pretty packed and crowded on the weekend. Anyways, I tried out their Escalivada (roasted eggplant, peppers, & onions) & their Vegetable Platter (stewed zucchini, ("pisto") cabbage sautéed with garlic and paprika, spinach bechamel and battered cauliflower) and sangria. The escalivada was greasy, the sangria just tasted like red wine. My favorite item was the spinach bechamel. It went deliciously with the complimentary bread. Overall the food is alright, but this place is pretty vegetarian friendly and the serving size is pretty good. My vegetable platter left me stuffed but I stupidly ordered a tapa also. Parking in this area sucks, it was pretty hard for my carpool ride to find parking... Overall okay food and mediocre service.
author: Irene L.

description:
I've been to this place twice. Both of them to celebrate friends' birthdays. I must say, it is ALWAYS fun.

We had to wait, for both times, to get seated even though we made reservations prior to getting there. It was really annoying, but I guess it is because it is a pretty small place.

They start you off with bread and butter... always a good choice, but when they ask if you want any apetizers, get the potatoes with the spicy sauce and the potato cake. CALAMARIIIIIII! Our group (for both parties) gobbled down the appetizers in less than 20 minutes. Also... Sangrias. Really good, really tasty, and really strong. I learned my lesson the hard way... just don't down a pitcher and a half of those before the main course arrives cuz in the end, well, lets just say the paella was wasted on me. Haha. We went here (twice) for the paella. Out of this world. No other place in the world that I know can serve paella as good as them. Seafood, Chicken all so good.

Aside from the waiting before getting in even with an reservation, I think this place is pretty good. Servers are nice and chill. The food is outstanding. The prices - somewhat up there, but it is worth it. Definitely would come back here again.
author: Gabe R.

description: When ever I'm in San Fran I always make the effort to stop by this place for a bite to eat. Their food is SABROSO (spanish for delish!) I always order the Grilled Calamari and the Potatoes with spicy cream sauce. Their paellas are a bit pricey, say about $55 for a paella to suffice for 4 people. However, this is a Spanish restaurant and what else would one order if not a paella. Their paellas are awesome. The staff isn't the friendliest in the world but they get the job done. I would recommend reservations since I've seen this place get super packed more often than not.
author: Yara R.

description:
This is the second visit here in two months.  
The first time was at the end of October. There was a group of us (8) and we got paella for all with tapas on the side.  First the fried calamari [Calamares Fritos fried calamari], it was cooked to perfection with a crispy outside and not rubbery on the inside. Then the spicy potato wedges [Patatas Bravas] which are drizzled in a creamy salsa.  They have a little heat and a wonderful flavor. I believe you can by this jarred to take home. Finally, for the tapas, a plate of mini chorizos.  Chorizo Salteado "Cantimpalitos" is what they are called and were a big hit at the table as well.  The main dish, Paella De Carnes Y Mariscos "turista" with chicken, pork ribs, shrimp, calamari, clams and mussels had the most marvelous flavor.  Presented at the table in a cradled paella pan and cook to order I'm told (expect extra time for this).  It is a beautiful dish guaranteed to get your mouth watering on sight.  Unfortunately, a second visit, New Years Eve, was not as impressive.  We were only two but ordered the same things as the first time.  Upon getting there sharply at 5:00p (opening), we were greeted and led to our table by a guy in a parka and Jimmy Hendrix t-shirt.  My wine glass arrived with lipstick on the glass and cork floating inside.  I returned it back to the bar myself.  The calamari came looking white and oily. I suspect the cooking oil was not up to temperature.  The other two appetizers were up to par, and the paella was excellent.
We thought the waiter was a little disheveled, bringing us things in a strange order, but was pleasant and efficient otherwise.   
I'm lenient on the place because I wont judge a restaurant on a holiday as being its norm, but was hoping for a perfect start of the New Year celebration.  I'll definitely go back at some point and give it a 2 out of 3 test.
author: John W.

description: Don't eat here if you are a vegetarian.  I asked multiple questions about whether their vegetarian items really were (i.e. what kind of broth used for rice, etc).  I ordered the vegetable paella, which they assured me was completely vegetarian.  It came with a piece of pork in it.  They offered to make me another vegetable dish.  I said no; I don't trust them any more.  In sum, don't eat here if you are a vegetarian.
author: Anya R.

description: I am sad to have discovered this place the day before I moved out of the Bay. This is the best Tapas place I have ever been to. The food is cheap and very good. The location is small and always full. I had the Patatas Bravadas, garlic shrimp, among many plates. We practically ordered everything on the menu. I wish I was there right now.
author: Laura M.

description:
My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place because we were on Valencia street and starving.  We had never heard of it before and had no expectations but it turned out to be amazingly good! 

Nice staff, nice ambiance (though a bit loud), and really really delicious food. They have a style of grilling that keeps things juicy, yet crispy. I think the lobster tail was the best I've ever had. And even the green beans were notably delicious (even though it seemed like they must have used just simple ingredients). 

This place was a great find!
author: Noelle M.

description:
Esperpento is a great place for groups so you can order and try a bunch of different dishes.  The atmosphere is bustling with live music and sangria fueled conversation.

The seafood paella with shrimp is delicious and comes in different serving sizes to fit your party.  The paella usually comes out later during your meal as it needs time to cook.  In the meantime, enjoy the sweet sweet sangria and tapas selection.

The oxtail stew is great with all the tender meat falling off the bones.  I went through 2 baskets of bread to soak up all the stew and sauces.  A lot of folks enjoyed the spicy patatas.  Beware of ordering too much because you'll have to make room for the home stretch paella dish.
author: Jeff P.

description: Best seafood Paella I've had thus far. Lots of lemon on top! Jumbo shrimp, Spicy potatoes with the aoli on top. asparagus is good. The live music from random guitarists is cool. I like the atomosphere, which compliments the food. A cool little spanish villa in the heart of the country. (I've never been to spain). But, im guessing.
author: Tiffany L.

description: While it's a different style of tapas (Spanish vs. Caribbean), the prices are very much comparable to Cha Cha Cha. And though I do enjoy Cha Cha Cha, I have to say that Esperpento is far better. We went here for a huge group birthday party of about 11 people, and they didn't care that most people arrived late. We ordered just about everything on the menu and stuffed ourselves sill. We were scared when the final bil came, only to find out that with everyone picking up the tab for the birthday girl, people owed $21 each, despite getting gallons of sangria, lobster, and Iberico ham. While I can't say there were any dishes that blew me away, there were no duds either, and it was a great way to celebrate my friend's birthday.
author: Mark A.

description:
Perhaps a few pitchers of sangrias would have changed our impressions but we found Esperpento 's food completely unsatisfactory. The only tapas worth eating were the quail and fried artichoke; the salt cod croquettes seemed devoid of salt  cod and were weirdly squishy; the fried anchovies were barely warm; the ox-tail stew was mostly gristle; the fried calamari were gooey instead of crisp. The two paellas were burned dry.
The place is so crowded it is difficult to move one's chair and so noisy that conversation most be at a shout. If the management took out a few tables and invested in some sound-proofing and then hired better cooks, Esperpento might be worth a visit. Until then, forget it.
author: Elmer G.

description:
"Donde es mi amor perdido?" The mariachi belts out tunes on a Saturday night and, no matter how loud he yells it is barely discernible over the general din that permeates this lively tapas restaurant.

Despite the general chaos one feels while dining here the food is shockingly simple, fresh, and precise. 

Grilled salmon, white beans with clams, rabbit stew, fried sardines (tail and all), fried calamari, spanish omelette, manchego cheese, grilled trout. All great. Dessert can be skipped (and I love dessert).

Try it. Like it.
author: Monty B.

description: Grand food, not-so-grand service, low prices. The server seemed distracted. Julio -- I take pains to get names -- took my order, then forgot one thing and served something I hadn't ordered. When I reminded him of the former, he informed me that they didn't get their salmon that day. This would have been better noted when the order was placed. He did serve me dessert, which I had not ordered. To Julio's credit, he took it back without question -- it didn't appear on the bill. Instead, he handed me a menu and raised his brows at me when I ordered a third tapas plate as if I were nuts. That look is not one I'm familiar with, nor expecting from waitstaff. So one star off for that, but the food more than made up for it.
author: Hasan D.

description:
Deals:

Lunch/Dinner Platter that includes 2 side options.
I got the trout with potatoes and salad and a friend got the chicken with the same side options. Pretty authentic dishes. 
A great place for a relaxed ambiance, good spanish food and affordable prices. It's worth making a reservation. Park down on San Jose, more parking options. Sangria is nice, especially for those that don't drink much alcohol, but want the buzz. Two of the wait staff were Spanish, one from Barcelona and Granada. Very friendly, as are the Spaniards. Love it!
author: Sanaz E.

description:
I think that this would be a great place to go to late at night with not more than four people, none of whom are very hungry.

It is not the best place to go to at 7pm with eight people who are very hungry, two of whom are very preoccupied with seating arrangements.

The food is super tasty; best paella I've ever had, for sure. Usually paella is not thrilling to me because it is just a couple of yummy things on top of a gigantic, boring bed of rice. Not so at Esperpento; this paella was a million yummy things piled on top of a surprisingly moist and flavorful bed of rice. The artichokes, the clams, the shrimps in the spicy sauce...really, everything that arrived at our table was delicious. 

However, we had a bit of a snag with our paella; we ordered one, and it came surprisingly fast. Not giving a second thought to the speed at which it arrived, nor the fact that it was much bigger than we expected it to be, we dug right in. About halfway through, a girl who worked there but who was not our server approached our table and asked, "Did you order this?" We were of course like, "Shit yeah we ordered this!" And after a while of back and forth of this "did you or didn't you" business, it comes out that it actually belonged to the table next to us. For some reason, even though we'd already eaten half of it, the servers were ready to take it away from us! We were like, "Well, we ordered *A* paella, how were we to know that this wasn't it?" 

They let us keep it. Phew.

Also, I thought I ordered mushrooms, but they never arrived. It was loud, she may not have heard me, it's OK. But the food we did get was daaaaamn good.
author: Julia L.

description:
Out of all the tapas bars in San Francisco, this place reminds me most of when I lived in Spain.  So whenever I look at the wall clock set to Central European Time, I think of what I would be doing if I were there.

The food isn't incredible and the service is no where near impeccable but it's Esperpento's package and it's truly spanish.

Unfortuantely, you have to actually pay for tapas not like in Granada where they're free when you buy a drink.  However, if I want to complain about that, I'll just have to go back to Spain. *sigh*
author: michelle s.

description:
Have you been to Barcelona?  If not, you should reevaluate your life.  It is like a Catalonian San Francisco on the Warm Mediterranean.

If you can't go this week, then go to Esperpento.  Tapas and only Tapas.  The grilled artichoke hearts are an unusual treat.  Sliced thin and grilled in  fresh garlic they are seldom found anywhere.  

The Tortilla Espanol is as good as the best from Spain.  The food portions are good sized for a tapas place and reasonably priced.  I have never failed to leave here stuffed, happy and wishing I had a stomach the size of a competitive eater.

It's even cool when local guitarists and singers come and serenade the restaurant.  

Service is typical of a place where the food mimics the slow, musical lifestyle of Barcelona.  If it takes a while who cares.  The meal is the most important part of your day and here it is also the most vibrant.

Slow down.  Sit down.  Eat like and adult.  Savor like a child.  Walk away like a glutton.
author: Dan W.

description:
First time to go dine at this place with a group from work. Great food especially their paella selections - vegetarian, beef, seafood. Food are served in larger plates to be shared with everyone in smaller plates.
The noise level was quite high that it felt like we were yelling at each other while sharing and consuming our meal. Parking was quite tricky especially on a Friday night.
author: Chad B.

description:
I love this place. Although it is very busy and can get loud in the restaurant, it is worth it for the food. Great Sangrias and delicious selection of tapas. 

The first time I came to Esperpento's I was with a party of 7 and we kept calling to change our reservation on a Friday night. They were totally cool about it and once our party showed up, we were sat pretty quickly even though there was a line going outside of the door. I was pleased they were so willing to accomidate us. We tried almost everything on the menu and split it between all of us. It was delicious. 

The last time I went here was with a small group of two people and the guitarist played special requests... 

Great place, would definitely go back again.
author: Ashley s.

description:
Location: good.
Tapas a little greasy, but the menu is more extensive than ramblas.
Decor good, ambience a trifle noisy; you can get serenaded if that's your bag (it's not mine).
Prices: good value.

Basically, if you're looking for tapas and wouldn't mind going a little down-market to save cash, this is for you. If you want really excellent tapas this place isn't a patch on Ramblas, just a few blocks north.
author: Laurie V.

description:
Ok... the parking in that part of town is horrid.  The space is cramped and super loud. 

But overall, I like their tapas really and dig their sangria.  alcachofas, butifarra, jamon serrano, gambas, calamari, paella... i like it all.  I liked that the food was heavy on the garlic.  Service is quick... not always the friendliest, but they get those dishes out in great time.

I do admit I want to give it four stars... but you have to mentally prepare for the crowded space and sometimes... yes, on a beautiful night... everyone is out... and the wait can be long.... but i guess san franciscans find this place for a reason.
author: Alex D.

description:
I went here with a couple of friends on a Saturday night.  We had reservations, but it seemed that the wait wouldn't be too bad.  Anyway, once we got in they sat us upstairs.  For about 20-30 people, it was pretty cramped up.  However, it was all worth it once we got those sangrias.  If you go here, definitely order a pitcher.  It complements with your meal very nicely...

Food tasted great, especially the calamari and the potato dish.   Go here if your looking for some great spanish food witthout spending any big bucks.
author: Dedrick S.

description: This place deserves the high rating. I actually had better Spanish omelette here than Spain! The potatoes and eggs were cooked till there were fluffy and really tasty. Definitely a must for your order of tapas. You have to have the Paella. It was really well done. If you are hungry order the Paella earlier. I had the Sangria and it was a great compliment to my dinner. Overall the food was spectacular and i can't stop praising the food!
author: Meredith C.

description:
Esperpento is my new favorite tapas restaurant in SF!

My fiance and I came here on Monday night...it was a HOT day in SF (maybe 90 degrees or so!) and we wanted to enjoy a nice dinner out in the Mission...We were originally going to eat at Lolo, which is down the street from Esperpento, but we walked further more and went to Esperpento instead...We had been wanting to try this place for soooo long, but it was always too packed and we'd have to wait long to get a table. But on Monday evening, we were seated right when we got there, and once we were seated, more people started coming that they had to put more tables outside! Our server was friendly, and we didn't have to wait too long for our food and drinks. We ordered sangria, which was refreshing and delicious, patatas bravas, which had a good kick to it...for those of you that don't like spicy, this isn't for you, but its soooo good! And then we ordered the lobster paella special for 2 which was $28...it had clams, lobster, and calamari...this had to be one of the best paellas i've ever had!! we couldn't stop talking about how good everything was. There was also a guy playing guitar singing around all the tables for entertainment. This place is loud and fun, so if you want something quiet, then this isn't for you. We can't wait to come back to Esperpento and try everything else on the menu!!
author: Jenn Z.

description: Tapas Tapas Tapas! If you're into sharing a ton of little plates with food that tastes like heaven on each one, go to this place and have at it with a group of your best foodie friends!  The place is cozy so get here early and enjoy a glass of sangria while you wait, that is if you wait at all.  Don't forget to order a paella for the group too, we ordered the lobster one!  The service is fast and friendly, the food is spectacular, and the surrounding areas around the Mission prove to be a good walk back to the car to talk about how delicious the food experience was.
author: Myke Y.

description: This place is a nice neighborhood spot.  Stopped here for lunch, and pretty much enjoyed all our dishes. The service was spot on, the wait staff wasn't overly aggressive, and for a weekday lunch, the place was practically empty. If you're there, definitely check out the bread, jamon and white bean toast! The white beans were light fried, and offered a great contrast in texture. A must get is the spicy potatoes, they're awesome! Bon appetit!
author: David M.

description:
I wanted to give this place a higher rating but the quality of the food just didn't cut it for me.  The tapas and paella are good at best but you can't beat the price.

I will come back again but will not order anything with shrimp.
author: J S.

description:
Before tonight I didn't know what Tapas were and had never had a Tapa; therefore the menu was a bit foreign to me. Luckily, my friends that invited me had been here before and knew how to order. We had a group of four people and we ordered a whole slew of tapas and it was delicious! They have a wide variety of tapas including meat, seafood, and veggies. The group I was with had croquetas, exotic chicken, sauteed artichokes, chorizo, patatas bravas, queso manchego, mushrooms sauteed in garlic, and the tortilla de patata. The Tapas are fairly small, so I suggest ordering multiple. We ordered about two per person and it was a good amount; it didn't leave us feeling hungry or too full. 

Try the sangria, it is pretty tasty. As for atmosphere, I wouldn't go on any first dates here. It was busy and LOUD. Although two young men came in and played the guitar and sang towards the end of our dinner and it was very nice to listen to them. Some of the louder people had left so we could actually here them and they added a nice touch to the restaurant. I don't know if this is a regular occurrence, but it was nice.
author: Carly W.

description:
I couldn't even begin to do justice to this tapas restaurant. Big portions, and sensations like good head. The potatoes!...the prawns in garlic butter!...the adobo chicken!...the ice cold sangria! And come with plenty of tip money for the great staff. San Francisco restaurant-goers know, a great staff carries you over the finish.
*SECRET*  If your plans were to originally brunch across the street at *B's* but the wait is obscene as usual, go to Esperpento's. It'll rock you.
author: E.Mo. ..

description:
I went here with 5 girl friends for dinner we had 3 pitchers of sangria and 5 tapas plates and one paella it was only $25 each! super cheap and great food! 

Definitely make reservations b\c it gets packed, the serve is slow but if you have good company then you don't even notice it!
author: Jen S.

description:
Esperpento:  I wouldn't NOT eat there.

I arrived at 7:30pm for a dinner date with the roommates and we were immediately seated.  The waitress came by and asked if we were waiting for someone to which we replied 'yes' and then walked away.  We had to call her back to take our preliminary drink orders.  She would leave and return with water and then not return for what felt like :30 minutes to actually take our order.

The menu was extensive for tapas including rabbit and other delicacies.  They also have a selection of paellas and dinner/lunch combinations.

We opted for the fried calamari, garlic sauteed mushrooms, asparagus, spicy potatoes, chicken adobo and rice.  All was tasty, but not star-studded--I actually prefer the potatoes at Cha Cha Chas.

Another :30 minutes and we finally get the check, even after asking for it, so I have no reservation in saying that the service was HORRIBLE.  The whole experience took so long that we opted to pay cash to avoid having to wait for the waitress to run our cards.  Total bill for 3 people came to $50 without tip.

Looking around, the place was pretty full for a Thursday evening so they must be doing something to people's liking.  Probably the sangria.  Or the default of its mission-central location.
author: Amanda C.

description:
We went on a Tuesday to try the tapas we'd heard about and we didn't wait, but the food was not worth even the drive.  The pros are that Esperpento is in the Mission just across the street from the 21 St garage and they have a reasonably priced menu and good house red wine.  The cons are - 
* all 6 of our tapas came out at once (for a party of 2)
* all of the tapas were very salty and oily
* bread was nothing special and was served with butter.  When we asked for olive oil, we were brought a plate with a bit of light yellow colored oil on it (looked and tasted more like vegetable oil).
* the croquetas were not even flavorful enough to eat and were served with a wierd cream spinach sauce.  They also only had chicken, not jamon, croquetas.
The Mission is so packed with good restaurants that we were disappointed to waste a night there on this one.
author: Leslie R.

description:
Not a date location, because it is really loud (well unless your date is your partner for many years and you do not feel like talking!) but the food is GREAT! 

I personally like the service; it is slow, but I expect it to be slow, so I think it is good! They do forget to bring in some dishes-- sometimes, and do forget to take them off the bill-- sometimes, but it is purely unintentional because they are SOOO BUSY! You have to check your bill, and they always gladly change it for you! 

Once you start drinking your sangrias or your rioja, you won't feel the wait!

It's an amazing place for big parties... you will love it! 
 
Hmmmm patatas bravas, seafood paella, trout, I think I want to go there tonight! 

I adore their grilled calamari!

Excellent food, great prices! and the service is very friendly even when it is slow!
author: Maddy S.

description:
Great food, great price, great location- off the beaten path.  Everyone else can go to Cha Cha Cha...

I love every food item on their menu. The service is really good. There was one incident when my party of 10 had to wait for about 40 minutes even after I had made a reservation. Clearly, they had overbooked but the staff was very apologetic and accommodating. They gave us many glasses of free sangria.
author: I love t.

description: After my four friends ate their classy, moderately sized share of the seafood paella, I ate the rest of it by myself in one sitting.  'Nuff said.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I would rate this place somewhere between 2 and 3 stars, but I'm giving it the benefit of the doubt since I've only been here once.  My wife and I started with the champinones al ajillo tapa.  It was...meh...like pretty much everything else we got, not great, but not terrible either.  The mushrooms were well cooked, but the sauce was very watery and running all over the place.  The champinones al ajillo at mi lindo peru are probably our favorites.

Next we got the ropa vieja (chicken, beef, and chorizo stew) and the milanesa plate, and both were OK.  

The service was pretty sporadic.  It looked like our server was stressed out.  He got our side orders wrong, but it wasnt a big deal.

The place was REALLY loud, especially when the mariachi band came in from off the street to play for tips.  We had to yell at each other, and even then we could barely hear ourselves.

We didn't get to try the paella, which is apparently their specialty, but I'm not sure we'll be going back.
author: Brian S.

description:
I came here one night and the host was nice enough to find us a seat before the restaurant was closed. 
  However it was sooo loud and crowded, I don't even know why we decided to stay!! Finally When the waiter got to us, she tells us it is too late for us to order Paella!! WTF!! thats the whole reason we decided to eat there!!! so we just decided to order Mariscada. 
  Paella takes around 30 minutes to make... Mariscada took around 30 minutes also and it was the same thing only difference would be that Mariscada had more seafood than Paella. That doesnt make any FREAKING sense!! but watever I start eating it and then realize it had onion.. it didnt say it had onion on the menu.. 10 minutes into eating it i find out the whole plate is FILLED with onion!! I should have just ordered onions with seafood!!
  I hated the fact it was completely filled with onions, I couldnt even enjoy the plate because i had to keep pushing onion to the side.
  I Usualy go to Picaro Cafe cause I love their Paella but the only upside to this restaurant was that there was parking found in like 2 minutes.
author: Andrea C.

description:
This was my first time to this delicious restaurant. We ordered 6 dishes (cherizo,mushrooms,cheese plate,steamed muscles, cheese omelet and spicy mole chicken.) as well as a pitcher of sangria. The sangria was spot on, as were the rest of the dishes we received. Nothing on the menu is expensive and the whole table was satisfied. This is the kind of place you want to go to with a few friends, share a few dishes and not worry about stacking up a huge bill. The service was a little slow but if you taking time to enjoy the food it makes little difference. Thus far this is the top of my tapas list. 

~ Fresh 
~ Affordable 
~ Fun
author: Ryan R.

description: We went here for a group party.  It was decent, not great but not bad.  I tried blood sausgae for the first time ever and I think that was may favorite thing.  I also liked the potatoes bravas.  The seafood paella was good but the seafood was overcooked. The sangria was just ok.  I prefer Cesar's in the East Bay to this place but a good stand by.
author: Amy F.

description: Patatos Bravas (spicy potato) was to die for!  The skin was crispy and the sauce was spicy and creamy.  We also got lobster paella which came with two lobster tails.  While the lobsters were very good, paella itself was bland.  Their sangria was one of the best i've had in the city.   I will definitely be back here for more potatoes and more... but probalby not paella again.  It was a little disappointing because this place is known for their paella.
author: Jessica N.

description: Food was great, ordered grilled fish salmon and was very happy. A very cosy restaurant with a wonderful atmosphere. Will definitely come back here again!
author: Gwen A.

description: I wandered in here for lunch one day while traveling the neighborhood. Enjoyed a rich chorizo sausage, fish, and Jamon Iberico. Definitely on my list of places to go back to.
author: ryan c.

description: My favorite spanish place in the city. Eaten here dozens of times and never get tired of it. Have had big parties, small dinners, etc. and it has never disappointed. Sangria is great (but deadly), the sausages are amazing as are their fish tapas. Staff is friendly, food comes out quick, and the price is very very reasonable.
author: G L.

description: Long wait but the food is on point. They have the most delicious sangaria. Potatoes are to die for. Check it out when in the neighborhood. There are tons of bars to go to after.
author: Ms B.

description:
i came here for my birthday with 16 people in tow- and had 2 others show up sans invite. we were tucked away in the back 'private' room, which probably would have been great with the original 17- a bit tight, but doable. they say they can accommodate a party of 20 in there. i am suspicious of this claim. 

regardless, the energy was bouncing off the walls, and made for a real party scene. 

a friend was our server, so naturally, the service was spot on. bread was on the table when we arrived, and was refilled until the end. sangria also kept coming at our request. there wasn't a dry glass in the room, which was great.

we ordered family style- which is to say i, as the birthday girl, ordered 8-9 plates, two of each, to start the table.

notable dishes include the lobster paella, which was on special. also, the rabbit stew was just awesome, especially when we used the bread to drink up the sauce. i'm certain there was more food, but those were the show-stoppers for me. 

the cost is going to depend on how you rock the food selection- as a large group family style just made sense, and we were able to order more selection. this is a place for a group of friends. 

all in all a great experience, and i will certainly be back, hopefully more sober so i can remember more!
author: Brooke B.

description: Simple tapas that arrive to your table fresh. The only downside to this restaurant is the noise level which becomes extreme on a friday or saturday night. Otherwise, the sangria was great, good amount of wine in it, paella is amazing, great seafood.
author: Miles D.

description: That night back in 2010 clearly was an off night.  We have since gone back to Esperpento once a month or so for a spread of our favorite tapas, during either the late lunch or dinner hour.  For the variety and price, we keep coming back to that place for their sidewalk seating and delicious mix of Spanish classics (patatas bravas, tortilla Española, ensalada mixta) accompanied by an ice cold Estrella Damm or two.  We have never attempted the paella again, and don't particularly feel a need to.  Why mess with a good thing?
author: L. S.

description: I like Spanish tapas, and the food's pretty good here (though not outstanding) -- but the service is inattentive and it always feels understaffed, even when it's not. :/
author: Elika E.

description:
I really like the food here.  It's been one of my favorite tapas place for over 8 years.  I order the  sangria, the tapas (clams, scallops, potato, fried calamari, asparagas) and the dinner plates (salmon is fantastic and carne asada).  

Minus 1 star for:  letting this 'musician' harass people for money.  He goes around playing a few songs way TOO loud.  Then interrupts each table's conversation and asks 'did you like my music?'  GEEZ!!  I wanted to say NO and please go away.  So he ends up collecting money from every table.  I don't go to restaurants to get harassed.

Warning for those who are prone to heartburn:   I've been there twice in the last month and both times I ended up with heartburn.  I've never had heartburn before so the first time this happened, I had no idea what was happening!  I thought I just had an upset stomach and tried to sleep through it, but I was in pain up till the morning and finally called the urgent care nurse who explained that I'm having heartburn!  Unfortunately, it happened again the second time I went there...  but at least now I have the right medication for it.  Maybe it's the garlic, but I love the garlic!  I 'll have to go to another tapas place and see if I get the same reaction there.
author: Mimay W.

description:
This was the perfect place for a relaxing Sunday night meal. Sharing tapas, sitting outside, drinking sangria.. most excellent. 

What I tried: Patatas Bravas (spicy potatoes), Patatas Ajillo (Garlic Aioli Potatoes), Meatball stew (forgot what it was called), and the Garlic Chicken. All the food was good. The food was rushed but friendly and  let us take our time with our food and sangria once we got it. 

Go early, eat outside, sip sangria, eat food and relax. Ain't nothing wrong with that.
author: Alex O.

description:
Okay, so in truth it would probably be more like 4.5 stars if that was possible, if only just because sometimes the service is shaky.

Otherwise, I love this place and keep coming back. I'm actually a big meat eater, but this is a place where the vegetable tapas are so good, I usually prefer them. I could eat plates of green beans all day long. The patatas bravas are so yummy in their spicy sauce,  the asparagus is amazing, it's all so good. I love the garlic shrimp too. I'm really disgusting and I like to dip the bread in the buttery garlicky sauce. The sangria is really good too, it 's very dark and good, so far second only to Andalu (Although ironically Andalu isn't necessarily authentic tapas). I love this place, and I am a picky restaurant eater.

The atmosphere is nice too. It's kind of cozy and homey, but clean. I don't really feel comfortable in stark, antiseptic restaurants. Bonus points for Dali on the wall. I love him.

By the way, I wouldn't suggest it for people looking to embark on a huge makeout session afterwards though. They are serious with their garlic. Bring a pound of gum.
author: Rylie S.

description:
Food was 3 stars + 1 extra star for convenience and service.
We were wandering around the mission at 7:30 pm last night without a reservation, anticipating a group of six. Yes I know, a bad idea. I didn't think we had a chance for a nice sit-down place when we walked past Esperpento. They welcomed us in and sat us right away. Turns out we showed up at the right time because around 30 min later, the restaurant was packed. 

The food was good, though not especially outstanding. We ordered the seafood paella, which was tasty. The squid and clams were especially good - the shrimp less so. The other tapas we ordered (grill quail, chicken croquettes, tortilla de patatas, white bean salad, sauteed green beans) were nice. All was washed down with sangria - if you like sweet sangria, here's the place. I agree with another poster who recommended that they slice their fruit instead of dicing it b/c the first glass got all the tasty bits.
author: GS M.

description:
Ok, so I freakin hate that super loud singing guy who asks each table for tips after he makes it impossible to hear your date talking!  Blah!

Tapas is good....love the spicy potatoes and anchoa olives.  Sangria is actually tasty and gives a good kick.  

Service is not that good....expect to wait for them to take your order and bring your much needed sangria.

I would go again.....but.....

I miss Spain.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I heart this place. 
It's becoming my go-to for a few reasons.
1. They know how to make paella the RIGHT way (tasty, flavorful).
2. I am a total blood sausage fan and their dish is F-ing awesome.
3. All their veggie dishes are fresh and never over done. Plus, they don't skimp on the garlic!

I go here with my Papi often because it's close to his place and it's not too pricy. They're usually pretty quick with the service and always friendly. 

The place echo's a lot so if you can't deal with noise, maybe take an outside spot. My lil sis digs the Flan with two thumbs as well!
author: Heather O.

description: Yummy tapas, and mr server that sadly, i don't remember ur name, u were very friendly, nice vino verde :) and the paella??  deliciosa  y riquisima!!!!
author: Karen P.

description: Sangria anyone? I'm not much of a wine person, and sangria has never tasted good to me. However, Esperpento's sangria is delicious. The food is good, the environment is a cute quaint, and the sangria is a must order. A good place to take a date. There is outdoor seating, which is lovely on a nice summer night.
author: Jannet V.

description:
TO ALL YOU HATERS ON YELP! Quit whining! 

This place has the best tapas in the city!

The bravas, calamari, and paella are FIRE! 

The only place w better value for your money....is costco..

The service was as good as possible. You cant expect the servers to b there every 10 seconds to wipe your dirty as s lips.  so all you complaining about service. JUS STOP IT!

They do a great job w how many people come in every night. Ask for the big homie Carlitos, hes GOT YOU

All in all. 5 Stars. NasaFast
author: Cam K.

description: Small plates but tasty. Bring people to share cheese potatoes yuummm
author: Darren C.

description: Ok, so their Paella...off the hook, I've only had the meat one and I like it so much I can't bring myself to try the other ones.  It has this really dark colored meat in it, that is just delicious.  I was a huge fan of Paella before this place and they have officially made me a fan.  Their Sangria is also really good, I have to say I'm partial to Cha Cha Cha's Sangria, but not by much.  It's atmosphere is very alive and is one of those places where you take a moment to sit back and listen it sounds like a sea of voices.  Great if you already know the person you're going out with or with some friends, wouldn't recommend it for meeting someone for the first time...like your significant other's parents in my case! LOL
author: Ashley J.

description: Love this place for authentic Tapas in the Mission District.  Prices are right and the sangria is great.
author: Melissa P.

description: i been coming here for over 5 years now and it is one of my fav spanish spots to eat...good menu good food good vibe...perfect for dinner with friends or date nite...dishes under 20$ and a lot better then most over price places...ill keep coming back till something fails...hoping it never happens...
author: Ivan C.

description: I am definitely a fan of this place that keeps coming back when I want a good, authentic Spanish meal!! Tapas, tapas, tapas!! I have tried lots of their dishes but some of my favorites are the Garlic shrimp, fried calamari, spicy potatoes, chicken adobo, chicken croquettes, and the garlic sauteed mushrooms!! Yum!! Makes me hungry just thinking about it!! They also make their own sangria but I wasn't too impressed with it. I still believe that Chachacha's has THE best sangria! However, Esperpentos prices are very affordable and will give other restaurants a run for their money!... The environment is great as well. Sometimes they have people (street performers) that come in from the streets with their guitars and start playing music all around the restaurant. You can tip them if you like but you are not required to do so. My only complaint (and I do not complain often) is that it's a pretty small establishment. The tables are small and they are not even that they rock back and forth. Lol.. Friday and Saturday nights get really packed so arrive early or call and make a reso! I'm sure you'll see this place with 4 stars or more in the other reviews so you know that this is a MUST go too place!! Salud!!
author: Cesar N.

description: Amazing what can I say! Although I order take out on occasion this is a great place to sit down and eat if you have the time.  If you like garlic you will love the garlic chicken and you must try the garlic mayo on the potatoes.  The ox tail soup is a great meal on a rainy day.  Best chocolate moose I've had in a long time.
author: Sarah O.

description:
disappointed, none of the dishes were halfway decent.  party of 9, ordered about 10 different dishes in pairs.  one chicken dish came out cold, sent it back.  they forgot our mushrooms, took off the bill.  the main event paella lacked flavor.  sangria was just ok.

the bread!  we all stuffed ourselves with the comp bread.  they kept refilling it, great.  i dunno... bread and butter really was the highlight of the meal, wat can i say...  8(
author: Ethan L.

description: My third time there and I really had a good experience. The service was excellent. The wait was short for two.  But shortly they asked us to switch tables and they gave us free sangria which totally upped our experience.  We odered seafood paella for two and a mushroom dish.  Both were excellent.  Really like this place.
author: ray s.

description:
a few numbers:
1 pitcher of sangria.
2 kinds of potatoes:  tortilla de patata and the patatas aioli.
5 people.  
6 dishes.
17.60 dollars each (including tip).  

a few highlights:
- the seafood paella (for 2) was a MONSTER of a dish.  pretty tasty.  we actually had a bit of trouble getting through it.  ...almost like trying to get through jimmy fallon's attempts in being a talk show host.
- the chorizo salteado "cantimpalitos" (sauteed spanish sausage) reminded me of longaniza, a filipino dish that i haven't had in a LONG time.  (no pun intended.  really.)  caused an immediate overly satisfied and very audible grunt, followed by a silly grin.
- the grilled quail laid on a bed of rosemary potatoes, uncut.  a bit of a weird presentation.  ...as weird as seeing the roots as jimmy fallon's house band.  i know.  i'm at a loss for words too.  

pretty good for the price.  make sure to get here early or to make reservations, as the space fills up rather quickly.
author: Ting A.

description: yummy and delicious. third time there and liked it just as much as the first time...plan to go back. This time we got there early and it was a good call. Not as crowded even though it was Friday, we actually left as it was starting to fill up. We had the langostino, mushrooms, artichoke, and pollo adobo. Good combination and ended with chocolate mousse and coffee. Recommend going for anyone who wants inexpensive yet delicious food.
author: Michelle W.

description: We had dinner the other night for my boyfriends birthday. That place was amazing ! Great food, their paella was to die for. We were 6 people and with apetizers, wine and food, the total came up to just $40 a person ! Which is cheap for a dinner out in the city ! I would totally recommend it. The staff was very friendly too. Only thing is parking : we had to do street parking pretty far since it was a busy night. Other than that, great place. Will definitely go there again !
author: Lexi B.

description: Pro: tasty food. Con: limited options (for non-seafood eaters). Pro: very cheap! Con: slow, kind of strange service. I'd give it 3.5 if it were an option.
author: Anonymous F.

description: Undoubtedly the best Tapas in SF. Lunch is easy because it is not crowded. Dinner if you are less than six, not too much of a wait, but it can get noisey DIN DIN! But the food is excellent! Garlic string beans, delicious mushrooms, potatoe pancake and Calamari are off the charts! Whatever you get here will be DELISH!!!. Do not wear your best clothes, because you will reek of this place tomorrow (is that good or bad?) it's actually good and once you've been there u will go back for MORE
author: Adrian L.

description: Not one of my favorites by any means. We did get seated right away which is normally impossible. I think we just lucked out on that one. I do give them props for carrying Heineken Dark Beer - one of my favorites. So we ordered a lot of food. More than we needed and my boyfriend did a good job eating through it. The one thing I did like and we were fighting each other for was the spicy potatoes. They rocked. All of the other dishes I found to be too salty. Not just normal salt but tons of salt. We got the following: pork skewers, Stew, Chorizo, Exotix Chicken (sweet and strange but not exotix). Next time I think I will stick with the potatoes and try a main meal. Who knows. Service was good but was disappointed by the food.
author: Doreen D.

description: Try the grilled artichoke.. it won't disappoint. Service isn't the quickest, but staff is always polite. Affordable!
author: Alison T.

description:
Wandering around the Mission, we happened upon this place and the aroma and price drew us in.  We sat under a rendition of a Dali painting in a cozy cave-like nook in the back.  The atmosphere and the vegetarian selection were worlds better than at Cha Cha Cha.

We got the patatas bravas, the eggplant and the zucchini simmered in tomato sauce, and everything was ridiculously yummy.  In particular, the patatas bravas stood out like a baboon's ass.  We were thinking of next time ordering the patatas, and some patatas and then the patatas on the side.  The other dishes were damn good, too, but we were fixated on the potatoes.

The dry sherry and the sangria really put the whipped cream on the stripper's nipples.  At $3.50 and $4.50 they were very reasonable, but our only complaint was that they were out of Soju, and therefore we were denied our mo-(k)hito and mos-(k)hito--a soju based mojito and a fortified sangria.  Not a big deal, though.

For desert we had the flan and the cream sherry (cream cherry on the receipt), and the smooth creaminess balanced the savory dishes nicely.

Next time we're going to try the vegetarian paella (how often do you find that?), and definitely are going to get the patatas bravas again.
author: Nicole and Kayvon B.

description:
I had been to this place one before and enjoyed but went last night and was really very disappointed.  Dont, get me wrong, the atmosphere is great but the food QUALITY is not there.  The paella that we ordered was filled with mushy shrimp, really fatty pork and partially cooked rice.  In addition, the chicken croquettes had pieces of chicken bone in them, which was not appetizing at all.  To top it off, I told the waiter and sent back almost the entire paella.  He came back to tell us the manager said was not willing to do anything.  

Very disappointing.
author: icon p.

description:
Good, solid tapas. 3 stars because they were out of the rabbit, the sangria was far too sweet (eesh), and one of the street performers who came in and played was so loud we couldn't talk to ourselves or waitresses - he walked around, playing in our faces and ears, yelling instead of singing, for three songs! It soured the experience until another guitarist came in playing nice classical Mexican guitar (without singing, phew) who was very talented and polite. Anyways...

The tapas were solid. The spicy exotic chicken was heavenly and decadent, as were the scallops - the two best of the night and highly recommended. The rest of our tapas - some cold cuts, veggies, grilled quail - were good. 9 tapas + 2 flans fed 4 of us to completion, and the total bill was only ~ $25/person incl. tip, so it was a very good deal.
author: Sari C.

description: After a long day and only breakfast at early a.m. in us,  we went to the city for a book reading. Afterward, we met up with friends to go out for dinner. We wandered to various restaurants to check on the varied dietary needs, and I suggested that we go to Esperpento.  We had eaten there several times over the years with a few friends, and with crowds.  Even though it was not a comfortable environment and very crowded, the food always made up for that. We were told by the server to wait for a table.  Ten minutes passed and the server decided that we were not going to be seated after all, and rudely told us so (even though there was space for us).  We hadn't done a thing to deserve such treatment!   Among our party was a project manager, teacher, three book publishing company executives, and other professionals. Yet we were treated as if we were street urchins.  For some reason the server must have had a very bad day to make the decision to refuse to seat us.   However, we soldiered on to another restaurant that was gracious to their customers, had delectable cuisine, and was spacious! Thank you Esperpento,  by denying us service in such a rude manner, it lead us to find a wonderful new regular city hang out!   I intend never to go back again. Nope! No "esperanza" for you!
author: Spring S.

description:
I think my taste buds died and went to culinary heaven last night. I went to Esperpento with two friends who were more experienced with Tapas, than I - being a Tapas virgin. First came the Sangria... which was very good. Then came the food... first up were Gambas A La Plancha, Calamares Fritos, Mejillones A La Vinaigrette, Patatas Aioli. The Gambas - shrimp- were great, but you had to work them out of their shells, worth the effort! Fried Calamari, pretty self explanatory, but the garlic aioli is REALLY good. The mussels were good but a little to brusque and fishy for me. I can't enough about the potatoes. They were in a word phenomenal. We were still hungry after that (there were three of us) so, some anchovies in oil with lemon - not a fan of anchovies but I did try them (they weren't as fishy as they usually are), some Ropa Viejo, and some Champinones Al Ajillo found their way to our table. The Ropa Viejo was pretty tasty but the mushrooms were on the same level as the potatoes! 

Some Jamon Serrano was involved too, and it was very good as well... 

All in all, definitely worth any wait or travel!
author: Elizabeth D.

description: We really had a great time,,,the food was good,,,not like oh my god great but very good.  I would go again,,,bring a bunch of friends and get a little wacky on their yummy sangria.  The manager was very nice to us as well,,,thank you folks.
author: Nicole q.

description: This was our second visit.  This time we didn't have the paella, just six tapas.  Yum, everything was good, except for the jamon serrano, which is just a ham sandwich.  I recommend tapas with sangria.  Forget the paella--it's dry and cannot compare to the real thing from Spain.
author: C L.

description: Salmon slices, spiced potatoes, eggplant with veggies, and a big bowl of Spanish rice, along with bread slices.  All for $22. Great portions and a fabulous Date on a budget.
author: Mark C.

description: People are right about the bad service.  Waitors don't care and stand around talking to each other.  Otherwise the food is decent.  I really liked the grilled clams. I might just try this place again.
author: H. A.

description:
Ladies and gentlemen, I have found the legendary Monty Python Cheese Shop, and it is here in San Francisco.  It is called Esperpento, and attempts to be a legitimate tapas/paella joint on the Valencia strip.  Beware, however -- just because the cheese shop sketch is funny on your TV, does not mean it's particularly pleasant when actually experienced.

I came here with a couple of friends one night, looking for a good couple of tapas.  They had a nice, if not particularly inspired set of menu choices, but did have one fantastic special that involved fresh anchovies!  Music to my ears!  To boot, I found a unique and delicious white wine on their list that they were offering both by the glass and by the bottle.  Fantastic!  My friends ordered their tapas, and we added a paella for all of us to share.  The waitress disappeared with our orders, and we sat in eager anticipation.

From there, it was all downhill.  After a few minutes, our server came back and informed me that they do not offer my wine by the glass.  I told her it was on the menu by the glass, SHOWED her it was on the menu by the glass, but was forced into ordering a rioja that I really did not want.  Five-to-ten minutes later, she reappeared to tell me that they were out of anchovies for the evening.  My god, is there anything this place DOES have?  Look, if you're worth your pay as a server, you will know immediately if the kitchen is out of something, or if you do not offer a wine by the glass, and you will tell your guest so at their table, before they've ordered.  To boot, you will suggest another item or drink, instead of leaving your guest to come up with another order on the fly.  I ordered some tapa that was so generic that I've forgotten it by now.  At this point, I was just praying that the paella would save my night.  Ah, how dreams are dashed, because the paella was average at best.  The shrimp and shellfish were fresh-tasting, but the rice was sloppy and THERE WAS NO CRISPY LAYER FROM THE BOTTOM!  What's the point of eating paella if the crisp from the bottom of the pan isn't part of the meal?

I might try this place again.  If I want to live in a state of disappointment.  If I'm a self-hating masochist.  If I think the Valencia strip isn't upsetting enough.
author: Nick B.

description:
Great Papas ali ali... o aioli???? Anyway... mmm... yummy!
Gambas Alajillo, didn't last over a sec. at the table! =) Delicious!
Parrilladas! well... no words! For a meat lover... WHAT CAN I SAY!?
Price... DECENT!
Vibe... COOL!

Gotta check it out!
author: Daniela D.

description:
The evening started on a high note. The place was jampakced on a Saturday evening with people waiting out the door - however, they honored our reservation and sat us in 10 minutes.

Overall the food was tasty enough for the price.

However, the service was awful.  I have worked as a server before so understand the pressure and difficulty working around tight spaces on busy nights. However, at one point they were shifting chairs around and at one point HIT ME IN THE HEAD with the corner of one chair. They non-chalantly apologized but did not seem to really care.  

As for dessert, we were planning on getting some but the a bill was set on our table feeling like we were being kicked out. Guess no dessert! Water was never filled, we were never asked if we wanted more wine. Pretty much ignored the whole time until the bill came.

I could say if we were pushy assholes than that sort of behavior would be acceptable. No server should deal with a pretentious a-hole. But I know my friends and I always do our best to be respectful and patient. But at some point I give up and lose patience. This was the night.  

I'd go there on a quieter night because for the price the food is pretty good. But not when it's jammed pack and they don't know how to manage the customer service and taking good care of customers.
author: Junebug L.

description:
A couple of weeks ago I finally had the opportunity to try this place.  We decided to use Bart instead of driving around looking for parking space.  We got there at 7 PM and found that the place was crowded. Earlier in the day we tried numerous times to make reservations, but to no avail the phone was never pickup.  We later found out that the place has been so busy that they don't have time to pick the phone, and so if you have party of 8 or more, I would suggest to keep trying otherwise, you just have to show up a bit early and wait.  We were told that it would take 15-30 minutes for a table for two and waited outside.  We asked if we can order something to drink while we were waiting and they brought us sangria which was fabulous.  The sangria had cubes of oranges with its rind and apples.  Very enjoyable and wanted to order another glass. We were careful enough not to drink the sangria too fast so that we can enjoy our tapas.  

We were finally seated indoors and so excited to try so many dishes but unfortunately on that night the lights went out and had to use candles in which you could not see what was on the menu.  We decided to have the house red wine, to our surprise the wine was really good and good paring with the food we ordered.  We ordered the following: Chorizo Salteado "Cantimpalitos" sauteed Spanish sausage, Queso Manchego Spanish ewe's milk cheese, Patatas Aioli homemade garlic mayonnaise, Rabo Toro, Oxtail Stew , Gambas Al Ajillo garlic shrimp, and Ropa Viejo beef, chicken, and chorizo stew.  The food we selected were all good, but I wish we had better lighting so that we can see the rest of the menu. The Rabo Toro, Oxtail stew was okay, nothing to brag about, the meat was tender but it was lacking something.  I really thought I would taste the richness of the of the meat in the broth but it was just ordinary.  The Queso Manchego Spanish cheese was good, but too plain.  I thought they would add something to the cheese to elevate the flavor more.  But now I know not to order these two items in my next visit.  For sure I would go back to try the seafood and of course the Paella.  

When we got our bill, we noticed that they did not charge us for the sangria and for the amount of food we ate, it did not break the bank. So inexpensive and you get to try different dishes.

This is a fun place to go especially if you are with a large group.  I'm looking forward to coming back for more tapas.
author: Janette S.

description: This is a solid place to bring a bunch of people and have a pitcher of sangria. The tapas are good, if not mind blowing. But the patatas bravas are crisp tender with a bright orangey flavorful aioli and the paella is crisp on the bottom and moist with lots of nicely cooked seafood. A neighborhood fav.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I recently visited Esperpento on a Saturday night with a friend. Everything sounded great so we decided to stick with Tapas (though the paella looked fantastic as it made its way to the tables around us.

We started with a pitcher of Sangria, which was very potent and refreshing. We tried:  
Garlic shrimp: good, but nothing special. I could just be saying this as some of the sauce dribbled on my handbag and I spent the rest of the night smelling it.

Mejillones A La Vinaigrette:Excellent, fresh and spicy

Manchego cheese: you can't go wrong with that
Spicy potatoes I need to know how to make this sauce, these were delicious! 

chicken croquetas:the only part of the meal that wasn't memorable.

The space is very cozy, and our waitress was very helpful. The only downside of the meal was feeling a bit rushed by the people waiting inside the doorway shooting visual daggers at people at tables, which was compounded by having our check delivered at almost the same time as our last plate of food came out. 
I'll certainly be back!
author: Kate O.

description:
A 4.5 actually.

I've been to this restaurant many times now, and last night's food was good, as usual.

Some of the dishes we had were grilled calamari, grill mussels, steamed clams, grill artichokes, sauteed mushrooms, etc. etc.  All were good, but the spinach was a little too creamy and lacked favor.  The eggplants were a bit too oily.  The fresh bread was great to mop up all the sauces!

All the tapas run around $6, so it's a nice price and allows you to try many different dishes.  The paella, on the other hand, is kind of pricey -- around $28, and it was surprisingly only OK.  I've had better paellas at other Spanish restaurants.  For $28, I would recommend ordering different tapas.

Their sangria is good, and the service was efficient.  The price is wonderful!

This continues to be one of my regulars in the Mission area.
author: L C.

description: One of my faves in the city! Best tapas & paella I've had to date! The patatas bravas are to die for, and the seafood paella, I swear I wish I could swim in it, so yummy & full of flavor in every bite. Although it's been busy every time I've gone, their customer service never fails.
author: Claudia M.

description: Hands down, my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. I've been frequenting Esperpento for over 7 years now, and every time I am met with consistent quality, friendliness tand the BEST service ever. Whenever I go, I almost feel like I'm a part of the Esperpento family (can't help but love being surrounded by Dali and Almodovar posters and artwork as well -- so this is my kind of place). This has also become our birthday spot -- and just an FYI, the entire restaurant will sing to you (beware if you get embarrassed easily...), but we love it!! Carlos is one of the best owners, and many of his staff seem happy and to have been there a long time which is a strong testament to a good business! Try everything on the menu, but must haves are: patatas bravas, alcachofas a la plancha, chorizo, gambas al ajillo, asparagus ala plancha, seafood paella, and lots of SANGRIA! The bill is always very reasonable which is also a plus. This place gets five stars to the max.
author: Shayna C.

description: Maybe my best tapas experience yet. I tend to hate tapas restaurants- mostly for their overpriced dishes. But Esperpento proved suprisingly affordable; our party of 8 shared 2 dishes of 10 items and a HUGE pot of pallella, a glass of white wine, and the split bill came out to about $35 per person. Each plate was generous, with more than enough food for four people to share. I still cannot believe I left a tapas restaurant 1) full and 2) not broke. Standouts were the white bean and salami dish, the pallella, the patatas bravas, the serrano ham, and the chorizo dish. We had a large party and made reservations on Saturday afternoon for the evening and they accomodated us in a private room just a few doors down from the main dining room! So excellent accomodating service, reasonably priced food, great times.
author: Lydia C.

description: Great tapas place and surprisingly, veggie friendly...they had several veggie options besides the standard patatas bravas. Everything we tried was good - the potato omlette was ok. Nice ambience - I liked the split level design. Friendly and quick service. They don't rush you even though it's a busy place.
author: Shweta V.

description: Amazing Spanish food! Their spicy potatoes might be one of my favorite dishes now. And this is from a guy from PEI, we know potatoes, lol.  I recommend ordering extra of the sauce to use as a bread dip. The calamari was exceptional as well.  Get the sangria for drinks. Service was very fast, with a relaxing atmosphere.
author: Mitchell M.

description:
Love the food, fast service, nice place, very reasonable price, I hope 
they keep the price that way. Meat & sea food paella are delicious.
author: ELEANOR T.

description: Excellent and reasonably priced tapas. Good wine and sangria. Great place for a date, relaxing meal, or catching up with friends and family.
author: Jessica O.

description: Place rocks! Had the lobster paella, deep fried anchovies and fried calamari. All was really good. Paella was the tastiest I've had in years and best one in the city. Better than Alegrias on Lombard but they make a good one too. Service was fast and accurate. Fair prices too.
author: Carlos N.

description:
having heard of this place for so long, i was happy a buddy recommended it for dinner. we went out for a bromantic dinner together. i must say, i was pretty happy with this choice. 

FIRST, SECURED PARKING ACROSS THE STREET. 

i avoided the mission when i was younger because of the surenos and nortenos shooting each other all day and night.....

but things died out a bit and calmed down since then. 

even with this rash of "recent" violence in sf, things are nowhere as bad as they were in the late 80s and early 90s. 

nowadays, i avoid the mission partly for skinny pants wearing, bike riding hipsters telling me my music selection suck but mainly because of the god damn crackheads breaking into your car. 

theres secured parking across the street? awesome. 

i wish i knew the paella took 30 minutes to make, i wouldve called ahead, but looking at other reviews here, well, i need to try for myself. next time. 

we tried a varitey of dishes, none of them really standing out nor any of them being bad. it was all tasty and pretty much what i expected.  with so many items on their menu that sounded good, i wish i came with ten more people. 

i wished they had a bigger varitey of wines, but meh, its cool. 

3.5 rounded up
author: Euge L.

description: I have had a lot of Tapas, from Paris to Puerto Rico. It is one of my favorite foods. With that said, I love this tapas restaurant. I have been going for years. Why do I love it you ask? Good question! I love it because it is always good simple country tapas. Nothing fancy just tasty. I imagine if my mom was from Spain this is the kind of food she would lovingly prepare but she is a W.A.S.P from New England, so that is not the case. Luckily I have Esperpento instead.
author: Kent T.

description:
Tasty tasty tapas with good prices and more variety than what some other restaurants have. The people who own Esperpento also own Picaro, but I'm told that the food at Picaro is not as good, and Esperpento is just slightly cheaper for some reason. 

My boyfriend took me here for a birthday dinner and we ordered the lobster paella ($26 for two people) and 4 tapas (which was probably too much). The paella came adorned with two whole lobster tails (each cut in half), some calamari, clams, and some peas and sliced red bell pepper. The rice was al dente, but didn't have the crust paella is supposed to develop from the contact of the heated pan and the rice (can't say I've been to any paella place that really gets the crust right though).

We ordered the spicy potatoes, sauteed muchrooms, garlic chicken, and garlic shrimp. The potatoes were very tasy. Seemed like they were parboiled, then pan fried and drizzled with some kind of a chile aioli, The mushrooms were surprisingly good. Garlic chicken was just ok. I thought they had a fairly mild flavor for being labeled as "garlic chicken." I don't know that I would order this on a return visit. The garlic shrimp were also a bit of a miss for me. While the combo of garlic butter sauce and shrimp is a no brainer, the shrimp tasted gritty/sandy because they hadn't been deveined. 

Oh, and the sangria is great. $4.50/glass or $12 for a carafe. Solid tapas, good prices, tasty sangria, and not too crowded. I'll be back soon.
author: Crystal L.

description: Food is great and affordable. Everything was so tasty, loved the potato dishes and the blood pudding. I am not a fan of the wait staff though. We walked into the restaurant mid afternoon when it was empty and had walk toward 3 or 4 staff members just to get seated. I am kinda used to a smile and someone welcoming us into an establishment.
author: UT V.

description: Love this place, tapas are great, service is friendly, atmosphere is fun! Super busy on weekends- make reservation.
author: Maria F.
