Still, when I ask for bread and they tell me "we're out" and then two seconds later I see warm crusty bread floating by to tables all around us, it makes me feel like I shouldn't be wasting my money on a place that cares so little for its clientele.
author: Kelly M.

description: I'm a huge tapas fan, but this just didn't do it for me.  Very reasonable prices, great sangria, but only so-so on the food.
author: Mitzi C.

description:
the food was really good.  even my nieces and nephews, who are picky eaters, liked it.

we went on a friday night...try not to sit upstairs.  it was hot as hell, and they only have a ghetto fan to cool off.

however...the only shitty thing is the wait.  i made reservations.  AND i got there early.  BUT, i still waited for 1 hour and 5 minutes.  the only reason i didn't leave was because i had 3 hungry kids with me.  i was visiting from out of town, and didn't  know the area to just walk off and find something new that they'd like.

the almost saving grace was that we got 2 pitchers of sangria for free while we waited.  so while it was cold outside, i was warm on the inside.  that didn't help me young, hungry, and cranky nieces and nephews though.
author: Ross M.

description: I often choose to make meals out of appetizers, so tapas are right up my alley.  Unfortunately, the plates served up by Esperpento were majorly lacking.  The artichoke was tough, the calamari somewhat flavorless, and the potatoes were only saved by the mayonnaise dipping sauce.  With Ramblas just down the street, Esperpento won't be getting my business again.
author: Rachel B.

description: I think this is owned by the same person who owns Picaro. You can really tell, but I think this place is even better. The calamari tastes fresher and their jamon serrano and manchego cheese was pretty good the last time I had it. I think there was this bean thing that was pretty delicious as well. Overall, it's one of the better Spanish restaurants in the city!
author: Gina R.

description: Best sangria *and* tapas I've ever had. And it's cheap! For a while I was going here every week.
author: Allison B.

description: Probably the best sangria I've had at a restaurant. The mushroom dish was real good. My boyfriend felt that the snapfish was more like fish-sticks but he liked the artichokes. I'd go back again.
author: Anita C.

description: Great food. Neglectful service. No water refills no drink refills... but good food. Lots and lots of vegetarian options.
author: n s.

description: Went here with a friend a few weeks ago. The place was alive and jumping around 9:30pm. Very cool atmosphere, a little loud but everyone was so involved in conversation they just kept on talking. It was really packed though, luckily we walked right in and got the last open table. Ordered the artichoke hearts and spicy potatoes. They were very good, a little too much garlic on the hearts, but too much garlic is never something to complain about. The service was also very good. The only thing is that the bottle of Anchor I was drinking, could have been a little colder. Other than that it was a fun experience. I would definitely go back there again.
author: D J.

description: Thank god we were spared the cave hovel table. Get some candles for godsakes. My friends and I ordered various tapas and seafood items that had amazing flavor. The sangria was nice and sweet. So why 3 stars? Perhaps if I were going to a rowdy sports bar, the shouting din of voices would be appropriate. We ordered multiple things but left feeling like we could still eat another meal. And then there are the cramped tables, when not only do people's asses constantly brush by you but you are also subjected to the awkward fluffy conversation of the couple next to you because you are practically sitting on top of them...The interior is colorful and the food tastes great, but not enough to save this place.
author: Faye P.

description:
mmmmmmm

i love spanish food!

my parents use to live in spain, a long long time ago, in a galaxy far, far away.  So while there, my mom picked up some spanish dishes.  mainly, the paella and the potatoe and egg omelette (can't remember).

she tried making them again....after ohhhhhh, i dont' know.....30 years!!  and she admitted, she lost it.  it just didn't turn out the same.  she told me to go to a spanish restaurant and try it there to see what it's suppose to be like.

fast forward to this past weekend.  one of the guys we went with knew the owner's son, who so happens to manage/run this place.  maybe it's cuz of our hook up, but man, the food was good.  and seated promptly too!  

we got the paella with everything in it!  and man, tasty tasty.  the egg and potatoe omelette was scrumptious, the jamon and bread thingy, beef stew, ox tail...mmmmmmmmmm.

also to note, their sangria was perfect.  just sweet enough with a kick!

they ran out of creme brulee that night, so i take it that it's quite popular.  instead i got the rice pudding.  my gf on the other had was disappointed, since she had quite a bit of sangria, she'd been chanting "creme brulachala" all night long in wait of it (it's actually pronounced something for more like "creme bru-catalana").  anyways, instead she got the chocolate mousse, which was actually pretty darn good too.

all in all, a good bustling place to come for tapas.

sorry mom, but your home cooking this time isn't gonna cut it.
author: Tadd L.

description: it was a sad day of misinformation for me - a day bereft of brunching due to the Last Supper Club's website purporting serving such a meal 'til 3 PM on a saturday. alas, my grumbling belly was disappointedly informed that brunch actually ends officially at 2 PM. SAD! but wait, what's this I spy out of the corner of my eye?! it's Esperpento to the rescue! well, I know that 2:15 PM is hardly brunch time but hey, I had a hankering for brunch so there! fortunately, a lovely combination of stewed oxtail, spinach in bechamel sauce and cabbage with butter and paprika all washed down with sangria made my day alright. granted the spinach was a tad on the bland side and the oxtail maybe a hair salty but heck - why complain about an $8 meal? Ole!
author: ray e.

description: Average tapas. Had the giant grilled shrimp, spinach, blood sausage (dry!), some kind of meat stew, and the spicy potatoes. The sangria is above average. Nice ambiance, but the in-house entertainment (guy w/guitar who walked around the restaurant) was a bit loud and actually came up to us with hi hat upside-down asking for a tip (which we obliged anyway).
author: Maximillian M.

description: I love this place. Spanish food always seems to satisfy me, but Esperpento is definitely one of the better Spanish tapas joints I've had in SF (MUCH better than Alegrias). The tapas were all delicious (I loved the spicy potatoes & the pollo adobo), the paella was good, and the sangria was perfect. Even better, everything was really reasonably priced (our bill came out to be a total of $18 per person, including the sangria, tax, and tip)! Sure the restaurant was extremely loud and rowdy, extremely small so its hard to walk to the bathroom, but c'mon, who wants to get drunk and eat tapas at a boring, old-people restaurant such as Alegrias? I'm definitely coming back here next time I'm in the Mission.
author: Roy C.

description: Place is fairly good.  If you are craving tapas and don't want to wait a helluva long time like Cha Cha Cha's them come over here.  The food is pretty good.  Potatas bravas, mushrooms, grilled trout, and the artichokes  are all pretty good. The Sangria is also really good too.  Service is fast and friendly.
author: Adrian D.

description: Their tapas aren't very memorable and their flan wasn't that great and I've tried flan in very many places.  They do get a 1/2 star for being inexpensive though.  1 star for fast service on a busy Friday night!  And 2 stars for their sweet and lovely sangria.  It's a lot better than, dare I say, Cha Cha Cha's.  Okay, so maybe then another 1/2 star for looking like an authentic Spanish eatery.  I was expecting to see some kind of bull fighting break out in front of the restaurant at any second.
author: Jean A.

description: I have very fond memories of Esperpento.  This was my first experience with tapas way back in 1999/2000.  I like the ambiance and the coziness of the restaurant, although the place can get quite crowded and loud during peak dining times.  The food is very good.  I LOVE the sauce that accompanies the complimentary bread and served on top of the best patatas bravas I've had ever.  I'd skip the fried calamari though, since I don't think the garlic aioli that is served with it is a good compliment.  I love their garlic prawns, albondigas and pretty much everything I've tried.  Best part of all, it's reasonably priced, unlike many of the other tapas places you find in the city.
author: Lucky T.

description: Ah, reminds of home!  Jamon Serrano, grilled calamari, garlic shrimp, red table wine, sangria, etc etc. Great place to take your first date there. I do that all time and most my first date love them so we continue dating. Some don't like them and that first date is actually the last.  You don't want be with a woman (men if you're a woman or gay man or, oo dear, I'm confused) that don't eat well, do you?
author: Pepe W.

description: Decent food, good sangria. Worst. Service. Ever. Hopefully we hit it on an off night?
author: Lorin M.

description:
food was ok, had high hopes for it.

seafood paella was not especially impressive for the cost $25 per two.

vegetable platter was zesty

service was responsive at 22nd and valencia
author: Sam L.

description:
It's not the best tapas place I've ever eaten at but it's not the worst either.  The sangria is great and the patatas bravas are the best that I've had anywhere.  I can more than make a night out of these two things but then I'm a die hard potato fanatic.

Jamon Serrano - pretty good

Chorizo Salteado - just ok

Queso Manchego  - not the best manchego I've had but still pretty good.

Tortilla De Patata - needs a bit more salt and spices for flavoring, a bit bland

Patatas Bravas - by far their best dish.  I generally get 2 orders for myself.  Damn, I love this dish.  Highly addictive.  Perfectly cooked potatoes with a nice spicy kick.

Croquetas De Pollo - tasty but not earth shattering or anything

Albondigas - good but not great

Pollo Adobo - I was disappointed in this dish.  I had such high hopes since I've had so many good Pollo Adobos over the years at various places but this was sad.

Sangria - Yay!  I order this by the pitcher and get several of them.  By the end of the night I'm feeling fine!
author: Ginger K.

description:
I used to love Esperpento's...then I went there last week and my friend meeting me for dinner was late. The waiters ignored me for 45 minutes until she came! It made it an uncomfortable experience. 

The food still wasn't bad though. Pretty oily, but tasted ok. Plus I just read the review about the owner taking tips from the waiters to pay the cooks...that's just not cool!
author: Tracy B.

description:
Been here a few times over the years and it's been pretty decent, but then......
3/29 - arrived on time for 6:30 reservation for a table of 5.  Table not ready.  Had to wait 10 minutes while they prepared an unworkable table next to the window.  Waiter arranged 5 chairs in a cramped semi-circle as half the table was up against the window....no way we could all fit in there without being jammed shoulder to shoulder.  One of the chairs was already in contact with another patron's chair at an a adjacent table.  We kindly refused the table, but the waiter said they had "no other table to give us," and simply walked away and went about his business.  We were subsequently ignored, so we left.

Phoned owner/manager the next day about the problem - he was not sympathetic.  I explained to him that the restaurant clearly failed our reservation.  He said a reservation is more like "notice that you are coming" - not really a reservation.  He defended the table by the window saying it was big enough for five - when I disputed this, he did not argue.  When I identified the waiter to him, he said that this particular waiter "really doesn't know how to deal with customers"......  In the end, all I got from the apathetic manager was a half-hearted - "sorry it happened...what can I say?"  When I stated that it was obvious he didn't care and that we would not be back, he calmly replied "OK, thats' fine."

Must be high times at Esperpento, where customers are clearly expendable.
author: Pietro S.

description:
Well, maybe it deserves a 2.5.

Their food is mediocre.  They seem to rely on the novelty of it being tapas, but small portions, mushy olives, fishy smelling fish, and slightly overdone rice.

The most novel part about their wines is that I haven't had them before... extremely mediocre.

If you really enjoy bad mariachi bands barging in, playing loud music in your face and then coming around extorting money from you in front of a date, then this is your place.

The prices seem low, until you realize to get a full meal you've run up a $80 bill, because, of course, all the portions are soooo small.

However, the worst part is the bridge and tunnel crowd, which might explain the amount of people giving it 4 stars.

Oh, yeah, this is owned by the same owner as Picaro, Carlos Muente.  Picaro is even more expensive... and more crowded.

Bueno Gusto!
author: Earl S.

description: Funny how having reservations for 7 means squeezing the one person in a table for 6.  I know that sharing is a common theme in this restaurant with "tapas" and paellas, but I was not happy sharing one fork and one plate with someone else. When we finally got an extra plate, we kept cleaning it off and hanging on to it for dear life b/c we weren't sure if we'd get another one.  And eventhough our party was squished into a hot teeny corner in a room upstairs the size of my bedroom, at least we weren't being moved around like other parties were mid-meal.  Although many people seemed to work there with aprons on and everything, most were just ornamental by serving bread every once in awhile, without BUTTER!  The food, on the other hand, wasn't half bad.  The tortillas de patata were excellent and others raved about the other plates.  The atmosphere is really positive and light, although the service is atrocious.   If I hadn't been with person's that I am close with, sippin on sangria, and celebrating my best friends bday, I would have had to walk out.
author: Claud M.

description: Damn good food for the price.  We ate and drank 'til we were blue in the face, and we still only paid $40/person, including tip, tax, etc.  In response to everyone's comments here about service, we had excellent service, especially considering we had a party of 15 high-maintenance people to serve.  As for the food - good!  Some were more "normal" than others, but overall, tasty.  I'm not a Sangria fan (at least after 4 pitchers), but I discovered a damn good Spanish sparkling wine there for only $14/bottle!  Needless to say, we emptied their "cellar" of champagne by the time we checked out.
author: Jeanne J.

description: Me and some of my girlfriends came here to celebrate a birthday. When we go there around 7 it wasn't busy at all. But soon after that it got packed. The food is very good..I just wish they had more meat options. It isn't just tapa's either they also meals. I totally recommend the calamari and the potatoe's with garlic mayo :) YUMMO!!!
author: Jazmine S.

description: Excellent paella and very tasty tapas - this place is a favorite.  The patatas bravas are fantastic as is the chorizo and just about everything that I have tried there.  Much better than the other tapas places in the Mission that I have been to. . . .
author: Jon K.

description: The restaurant is really small and seats were arranged too close to one another. Although food was good and reasonably priced, it was just too loud to have a normal conversation. Practically had to scream. On top of that, they had a mariachi playing the guitar and singing. Back to the food, I ordered several tapas dish which I do not remember the name, a potatoes dish, a mushroom dish, a meatball dish, and a fried fish. All, I might say, were very delish except for the fried fish where it falls flat on the taste, it was pretty plain. Service wise, I ordered a mint ice tea but the waitress never refilled my tea or even my water. But on the lighter note, after we left the restaurant for some ice cream and needed the restroom, they were kind enough to let us use it even though they were closed.
author: Peter L.

description: I haven't eaten at that many tapas places but I thought this was very tasty, so I give it a thumbs up.  We had the mushrooms in garlic sauce, the garlic chicken, the chicken croques (I'm going off memory- should ball park be the name or description of the dish) and the patatas.  Oh, the sangria pitcher was good too.  We went around 2pm on a Saturday so it was very quiet, don't know what it's like yet around dinnertime....probably won't know because I have two kids and don't want to push my luck.  Anyhow, mid day, I'd highly recommend this place.  I think I saw someone else say it was greasy, that wasn't my experience.
author: Kirsten F.

description:
5 star

for Paella de Mariscos
for prompt service
for affordable and reasonable price
for warm and homey service...when they ask "if everything ok is?" they meant it.
for being accesible (2 blocks from where i live)

plus I went here with Deon.
author: Malou C.

description: It's pretty crowded in this place but the food is great and I can get my favorite spanish beer here.  The paella is almost as good as what I had in Spain, the service is warm and friendly, and the atmosphere is always pretty cool.  Love this place!
author: H B.

description: Yay!  I found a new favorite place in the city that will not bankrupt my wallet.  Came here last weekend to celebrate my girlfriend's 50th bday.  We had the lobster paella for $28.  If there's 4 of you, get the size that's good for 2 because it's actually really for 4 -they lied!   It's their specialty.  We also had the ropa viejo - it was so good that we ordered another one!  We also had the kebabs - very tender and juicy.  I also loved the sauce of the patatas bravas - a little spicy but I couldn't stop eating it and we ordered another one as well.  The leche flan was firm and semi-sweet which is exactly how I liked it.  They also sell authentic chorizo (not cured) from Spain & I bought the one with garlic for only $9.  And before I forget, I enjoyed the musicians who came in and played Spanish music for tips.  They made our birthday girl feel so special!  All that for a whooping (hold your breath) $89 - for four.  They definitely give ChaChaCha a run for their money!
author: Sharon C.

description:
I came here to celebrate my 21st birthday with 4 friends. It was so much fun! We got a big bottle of sangria, which was soooooo goooood!! it was perfectly sweet and oh so yummy!

We ordered a whole bunch of delicious tapas: mussels with vinagrette, grilled scallops, tortilla de patatas,chicken croquettes, jumbo shrimp (which weren't so 'jumbo'), and patatas bravas ( to die for!! absolutely delicious!! we had to re-order some more because i was too obsessed!)
Then I ordered two desserts to share with my friends, chocolate mousse and flan. the mousse was so good, nice and rich, just how i like chocolate. i can't remember how the flan tasted because i mostly ate the mousse.

To top it off, the waitress was fantastic! I didn't get her name, but she was blond with a big flower tattoo on her upper back. She brought the desserts with candles on them and got the whole restaurant to sing happy birthday to me, i was so surprised but really happy! i mean, even people upstairs who didn't even see me sang! 

Overall, a great and fun night, and I will definitely come back here just to eat more patatas bravas!!!!! haha
author: Fat Wifey Z.

description: On a casual Sunday afternoon, my friends and I thought we'd check out Esperpento - since they were open at 4:30pm and it was just about time for a happy hour. The sangria was good, although only the first to pour got the fruit in it. We ordered several dishes, but the only two which stood out were calamari and paella for me. My friends and I had a little too much sangria that day and we could tell others were staring, but we had tons of fun!
author: Janet R.

description: Authentic, yummy Spanish food in generous portions. Staff doesn't speak much English but why should they? Time to break out what you remember from 7th grade. Try to sit upstairs if you like a little privacy.
author: Jane F.

description: Had a return visit here on my birthday. Still my favorite tapas spot so far. I like the many veggie options too.
author: Kay M.

description: Ok Tapas.  This place was nothing special.  It wasn't bad, just very average.  We got about 5 different dishes and while they were all good, nothing really made us go wow.
author: Pele N.

description: Really cool - if you go with a large group try to get the special separate room. Loved the spicy potatoes, garlic chicken dish and the chorizos. The Sangria was excellent as well but the flan didn't do much for me
author: Debby C.

description: I would like to thank the other reviews for leading me here...We had a really good and CHEAP dinner here last night!!  Walked in around 7ish with a group of four and waited about ten minutes for a table.  Got drinks super quickly, and our tapas came out as they were ready.  The steamed mussels were very tasty....My only complaint was that the sangria was a little sweet for my taste, but hey, that's just me.  The wine I had after made up for it.  Their staff was very attentive and friendly...over all a good experience, though not a place I'd want to go on a date.
author: Emma H.

description: You will find San Francisco here! There is a great mix of people, from families, couples, and friends hanging out and eating the wonderful tapas and of course the sangria! I came here on a Saturday evening around 7ish and the wait was about 20 mins. Please allow yourself time to find parking (if you drive) and to wait for a table. There are so many tapas to try. If you're with a large group, try ordering one of everything! Also, if you love garlic, this is the place. I will definitely come back here again.
author: Phillip T.

description: After being featured on "Check Please- Bay Area", this place is always busy.  Having frequently traveled to Spain on business and pleasure, places that capture the flavors, value and energy of a local tapas bar are a find.  Esperpento has great food and wine selections.  Some favorite tapas are the grilled artichoke hearts, the grilled (not fried) calamari, the shrimp in garlic, the ox stew and the mushrooms.  Lovingly prepared, matched with decent service and good friends, 2-3 tapas a person shared among four friends is a feast for $25 a person including wine.
author: Michael B.

description: I have to agree with many other reviewers: this place is just ok. I wandered in here for the first time last week when a friend was in town who couldn't decide what he wanted to eat. I've walked by this place many times on a weekend night, when it seems to be bursting at the seams with tipsy tapas-eaters, so I always wondered how the food was. I have to say, it is shocking how fast the food comes out; our order was barely out of our mouths when they started bringing things to us. I can't say I remember thinking "this is amazing!" at all during our meal, but the grilled asparagus was good, as were a couple of other dishes. I was disappointed with the fried calamari. The restaurant is pretty noisy, so save this place for a quick meal or for when you think the boisterous mood will match yours.
author: Caroline G.

description: Just went yesterday, they got us in & out in 30 minutes - super fast service, everyone was very nice & attentive.  Great sangria, calamari, recently discovered the frittata - LOVE IT!
author: Chris C.

description:
Vegetable platter, grilled artichokes, sangria. 

The potatoes were great, nice and hot and crunchy and just the right amount of flavor. The zucchini was good but tasted a little too much like pasta sauce. 

The cabbage was the saltiest thing I've ever had, the spinach was cold and a bland and really creamy, the cauliflower was OK but the sauce on it was too strong and a little salty. The artichokes were really tough and really salty. 

The sangria was smooth and sweet but not too sweet. 

The price is good and they have a lot of vegetarian options. Too bad most of the items were salt flavored with vegetables.
author: Sarah J.

description: Esperpento is one my favorite place for tapas, sangria and especially paella. Yes, the service can be slow at times but it is so worth it! The price is reasonable and the location is perfect! You can to all different bars after.
author: S.M. F.

description: My girlfriend and I ordered a bunch of stuff when we sat down. We only got about half of it. I even pointed everything out when ordering.  I think the waiter didn't understand enough English. Anyway, what we got wasn't all that great. Ended up costing more than I would have liked.
author: Brett B.

description:
not bad ... but surprisingly, for a grimy location, i was quite pleased ... 

trust me, i'm not saying i'm all cool and all, but the mission district just doesn't do it for me ... i juust have no idea what it is... ive given it many chances and yet i feel that i just can't "fit in"...

i came here for a quick nibble, but lil did i know i was in for a sweet treat with my sister.

when in need of a quick nibble, MUST GET the calamari and their patatas bravas! to die for!

!!!

i'm going to say this ONCE more ... this place is simply ... REALLY, REALLY good.
-the calamari was cooked perfectly, with lots and lots of tomatoes and onions!! there isn't any other way to put it... very flavorful with the perfect seasoning.  
-patatas were amazing! god knows WHAT it was... definitely nice! 

bonus points in being superly uberly cheap, cheap, cheap!!! i could totally come here and buy a few nibblers here and there and be a smiling for days! isn't that the beauty of tapas!?
author: Jennifer S.

description: Fun place to go! Great menu. I had some jamon for an appetizer and my friend and I ordered the seafood paella. Also great sangria. Yes, we had a sort of typical Spanish diner but so good. Fun place to start before going out on Valencia. Love El Valenciano to go dancing!
author: julie q.

description: I took my brother and two nieces there.   Although the place was small, we did not feel closed in at all.  We were adventurous and ordered both the rabbit stew and ox tail stew.   The rabbit was good, but the ox tail could have been more flavorful.  For tapas, we had the pork kabobs, patatas bravas, and grilled calamari.  The pork kabobs were a bit overcooked and dry.  But, the patatas and calamari were excellent!!  I love spicy foods and the patatas were on fire.  It was good stuff.  Overall, the food was pretty good.  We had a nice dining experience at a reasonable price.  Its a good place to take kids without worrying about some drunk fool spilling a glass of sangria on your kid.
author: Derek Y.

description: ...i live nearby and so have eaten here many times...never had a bad dish or visit...have impressed friends, family, and visitors many times...
author: Bob L.

description: Yum!  Great food, good for groups, esp to share the yummy sangria, but snug and loud.
author: Sam D.

description: This place is great and worth the wait!  Whenever I get over to the Mission I love to come here with friends. The food is great, good size portions, not pricey, live music on occasion and fun atmosphere!  I LOVE the paella!
author: Tameka L.

description:
This place use to be a lot better.  I would have given them 5 stars a few years ago.  Food is not as tasty and service is not that great anymore.  There are a few great dishes, and some not so good ones.  I'll start with the good ones.  The grilled clams, fried anchovies, and fried potatoes with aioli are must orders.  Blood sausage, ox tail, quail, and rabbit were good.  
I would avoid their seafood paella.  Not good.  Their sangria here is awesome.  Some of the best I've had in a very long time.  Unfortunately, even after all the sangria I had, it didn't help the paella taste any better.  Come, here and order some of the dishes I've listed.  You might get a better experience.  Stay away from the seafood paella.  This dish totally dragged them down by a star.
author: Nick H.

description:
We arrived here pre-dinner rush and got a table without any problem.  Wait staff were attentive but as soon as the place filled up service did suffer pretty bad.

Anyway we had the artichokes and they were killer, crispy, garlicky tender. The rabbit stew was just okay, kinda fatty and really not a whole lot of flavor.  It was a tough dish to eat due to the bones. The fried calamari was good, tender, but average served with a garlicky mayonaisse.  A plate of grilled calamari passed by our table and it looked killer.  We also order the fried seabass which came out seasoned, coated and served up with the same mayonaisse.  Okay but nothing special.  The spicy potatoes were good and they deliver the heat.  Washed it all down with the excellent  Sangria.

May go again.
author: Cindy D.

description: Fun, tasty, lively and affordable.  For me, it's like the essence of the Mission rolled into one tapas bar.  I tried most of the dishes here after about 4 visits and it's been delectable sharing them (and the sangria...) with friends.  Not one dish is going blow your mind and change your life, but these are well executed and tasty compliments to the actual focus, the drinks and friends!
author: Cat R.

description: I am here every Tuesday around 5-530pm before my business class at the City College Mission campus, 4 stars because of the outstanding service, I am almost done tasting the entire menu and while I've yet to taste some thing that I do not like I think that the preparation and food presentation is good. Tonight I had the grilled quail, small portion but overall good in taste. I have become a Tuesday night regular, and let it be said that I personally like the Sangria here better than the Cha Cha Cha's. While the wine selection could be altered I think that it is fitting to compliment most meals. And they have Anchor Steam.
author: Raul D.

description: I went to Esperpento over the weekend for a friend's birthday celebration. The place is very cozy, and gets pretty busy during the dinner hours. I'd definitely recommend making reservations even if you have a small party...I noticed some people had to wait quite a while for a table. We ordered several small plates (approx. 8) and split them among our group of 9 people. Some of those dishes included: grilled scallops, calamari, etc...it was really delicious calamari--crispy and not overly greasy. We also ordered a pitcher of sangria, which was not a disappointment. And for our last dish, the birthday girl ordered a 6 servings of paella. It was enough to feed a whole village! Our group of nine barely managed to eat half of that pan full of paella that the waitress brought out.
author: Carrie W.

description:
esperpento...hope to come here again soon!
i went here last weekend with a party of 9 and we sat in our own little section.  the patatas bravas was great as it had a spicy gravy sauce on it.
everything else was OK, nothing special.  the sangria was very sweet and not very strong,
overall, this place is packed but fun with a group as long as you get seated.  It is not the best tapas i've had (compared to my the food i had on my trip to spain), but decent.
author: Yummy E.

description: I had the sangria and the grilled artichoke while my friends had other dishes all three of cleaned our plates it was a slow night so it wasn't busy. Only suggestion I have is they could have some music
author: Jason G.

description:
It's hard to give this place 3 stars because I AM a fan of tapas, but unfortunately I have not been impressed with this place.

I guess the sangria is good but the 3 times I've eaten here, I haven't been impressed.  I would recommend one of the other 4 tapas restaurants in the Mission.

This spot is so convenient for me  ;(
If this place was better I would eat here weekly.
author: Henry C.

description: We came here sunday night for my cousins birthday, we got seated right away. thats a plus! This was the first time I came to this restaurant so I was hoping for the best. It was kinda dark, maybe a bit more lighting, but it was cozy and comfortable. The waitress was nice and was somewhat able to help us out with whats good in the menu.she said there wasnt a "popular" dish, but did help a bit. I ordered the garllic chicken with a side of zucchini and rice. all 3 items were good. i was kinda hoping the chicken had a bit more flavor of garlic. but other then that, it was very good. my cousin had an order of potatos which was to die for! crispy in the outside and well cooked in the inside.. def a plus when it comes to potatos.one side dish i do recommend as well is the rice. It was very good with just the right amount of flavor!  Over all. the service was good, the food was great, and the price was amazing. im definetly coming back!!! :)
author: Jose n.

description: Wow, love the ala carte selection.  Had the grilled shrimp and the garlic potatoes.  Lovely.
author: M T.

description: very decent place , service is ok, not too friendly but quick if you're hungry , had the milanesa with cabbage and potatoes which wasnt bad , meatballs didnt taste good at all but the sauce under it was really good , my friend had the garlic chicken barely taste the garlic ,i think i will stick to vegeterian options next time , just an okay place
author: NAEL K.

description: I can just walk here from home and get a great dinner plate. I like the Garlic Chicken, it's really good. the Carne asada plate is good too. I've had a few other things on the menu, and everything seems up to par. People I've eatin there with are pretty safisfied too. Service may be slow at times, well it does get pretty damn crowded in the evening hours.
author: Eric N.

description:
Great food for vegetarians 

My favs: Spicy potato and cabbage with garlic and of course Sangria (love the wine)

Try going on weekdays it's less crowded and service is great.

Love the pricing too!!
author: Midas T.

description:
had a great time here. attentive service - good sangria - great conversation. paid the minstrel $20 to serenade us all for a while - fun!

suggest the paiella. no I highly recommend the paiella.

nice bar across the street - but i forget what it's called. sangria kills brain cells.
author: Lawrence K.

description: For some reason, I always find myself in this restaurant on the hottest days of the year. I don't know why. But I think that is when it is at its best as you can down that yummy pitcher of Sangria quickly and have the entire evening go woozing by. I have favorite tapas that I always order - jamon serrano, chorizo, patatas aoli - and I never get tired of them. Good thing I live nearby so I don't have to deal with parking. But, I do hate-hate-hate the mariachi bands that come in and pass their hats. Somehow they just do not belong in Spain...
author: Rey L.

description: This is a cute Tapas place tucked away in a corner. The place always seems to be packed night or day. Good sangria... I like it that they put fruit in your sangria.  Try the grilled trout, it just melts in your mouth, spinach is ok, but the soup is very good - either the everpresent Gaspacho or the soup of the day. Very pleasant way to spend an evening, listening to the music
author: Belinda w.

description: Yum.  Love the patatas bravas, garlic shrimp and paella. It is almost always  busy and if you're seated in the upstairs alcove be warned that it can get VERY warm up there-even in winter time. A great place to go with a group.
author: Jennifer T.

description: it sucks that i'll never go back to this restaurant as i had high hopes for it....the place was packed, and the service was very fast- when we eventually got any after being seated for 15minutes. i do give them credit for managing millions of nagging customers with only 2 waitresses (staff better at peak hours?) Nonetheless. The food was absolutely horrid. Sorry. if you go here, whatever you do, ask for the "AIOLI" on the side. it is like gallons of fat mayonnaise covering every dish. i feel like fat molecules are floating around my blood stream from last night. if i wanted to eat fast food, maybe i could have just gone for a triple bacon cheeseburger with extra large chilli fries. if you want a spanish meal, this isn't it as every single dish is bathed in oil. The paella i did not try but everyone's review doesnt sound too poetic. the bill for 2 people for a handful of tapas dishes and a bottle of cheap sparking wine= $65. sooooooo many other options in this city!
author: Carolina S.

description: Dinner Saturday night was once again da bomb!! Have never had a bad meal and the sangria to wash it down makes it that much better!!
author: Owen B.

description: Delicious tapas- garlicky spanish small plates to share pared with Sangria. Eat here every chance I get. Love the variety!
author: Martha N.

description: No need for a Trip To Spain ... Just a Reservation! or go Early!  Instead of ordering a meal get hors d' oeuvres (finger food) and wine or their Sangria...Wow!. My Picks: Gamba's (Shrimp in Garlic), Patatas Or Papas al Oli-Olie (Fried with Garlic Mayonaise on the side),  Calamari Frito (fried in rings) "Oh My god!",  Mushrooms, Mussels Ala Plancha (grilled), Clams ... for those who don't eat Sea food ( don't ask my why they don't)  the Parilada de Carne ( all meat plate).  I'm not a fan of their Paella, but my father (from Spain) made it the right way.
author: Jerz Z.

description: Seating can get difficult when busy but overall excellent spanish cuisine. Must get the paella, the spicy potato appetizers and the asparagus. The sangria washes everything down perfectly and i can't see how people dont like this place. Es Delicious!!!
author: Bowie L.

description: I have been here several times, and it's probably my favorite tapas place in the city for a combo of atmosphere, service and food.  My favorite time was my birthday a few years back.  We had at least a party of 10 people, and went through at least that many pitchers of sangria.  Honestly, the bill was huge, but we were nice and roasted by the time we left to see Built to Spill.  We had a really great time.
author: e c.

description:
This place has really gone downhill. It used to be a good alternative to Cha Cha Cha. Good prices, good tapas, etc. But now the food is terrible and so is the service. Do not order the seafood paella. I've never tasted mussels that were rubbery and hard at the same time. The shrimp was crispy and the rice was overcooked!

When we told the waiter he basically didn't care! We were also charged for a second order of shrimp although we never received it. On top of that they charged 18% service for only 5 people. Not worth it! Try some other "fun" places in the mission instead.
author: Jen L.

description:
1st of all let me say that this is the 1`st time I've written a review on Yelp. It's just not something I do but I left sooo mad that I came right home and signed up. 

There were 5 of us and 3 wanted paella. I asked the owner (I assume she was the owner) if the paella for 2 would be enough for 3 if we got tapas and she said no. That didn't make sense and I didn't want to spend $46 for paella for 4 so I said we'll just take the 2 serving paella and ordered other things. My daughter and her friend were going to share it. We got 3 tapas (they were excellent) and  the meat and veggie platter, shared by the 3 adults.The meat was dry and the paella (that I tasted) was tasteless and it did not seem to be indiviually made since it came out in about 15 minutes, not the 30 minutes as stated. When the bill came and I saw that we were charged for a 4 serving portion, I asked the waiter about it and then he got the woman/owner. She agrued with me and said my 17 yr old daughter told her that we'd take the 4 portion. So she takes orders from a 17 year old when the adults clearly gave a different order?

I would NEVER go back-EVER!!! To have an owner argue with a customer not to mention having to pay alot for tasteless food is irritating and a waste of time and money. There are too many excellent restaurants in SF to go back to a bad one. I read some negative reviews on Yelp about Esperpento but ignored them-wish I had saved myself $$$ and time!
author: Beth K.

description:
The following sums up my experience at Esperpento last night:

-- Had a reservation at 8:00, was not seated until 8:45.  We were told that the restaurant was overbooked by 150%.  I will give the host credit for bringing out sangria (we had to wait outside in the cold) to appease everyone.  This worked until...

-- When we were finally seated, we were put at a makeshift table in which 4 out of 6 of us were staring at a wall.  We were told that we would be moved to a better table, which never happened.  

-- Food came out, we ate.  Nothing special here.  Would not have bothered writing a review except for the fact that...

--A waitress trying to squeeze past our table with 10 glasses in hand, dropped one, which broke next to my feet.  She laughed it off, didn't apologize, and I didn't really get a "sense of urgency" from her about cleaning it up

--Despite speaking to the manager, nothing was taken off of our bill.  

For better food and service, I would highly recommend Ramblas.
author: Kimberly H.

description: I haven't been to Esperpento for a while and decided to go there again yesterday. I really liked this place because of its food combined with the busy but festive atmosphere. It was cheap and good, a combination you don't get too often. The blood sausage and the rabbit stew were excellent and the staff was quick and attentive (even at very busy moments). Unfortunately this praise has to be written in past tense. Last night sucked!!! The head waitress wanted to seat people, which arrived 10 min after us, ahead of us and was pissed after THEY told her that we were there earlier. They then got their food earlier, we never got our water or bread refilled (even after the waitress asked us if we want more of either) and the food was undercooked. Not something I want done to any blood sausage or ground beef meatballs. All together a lousy restaurant experience.
author: heiko g.

description: Wish I liked this place, it's in my hood, but man, lunch here was waaaaay overly greasy and left me feeling ill all afternoon. And besides that it wasn't even very tasty. Always perplexes me why people seem to like it so much.
author: Geddy L.

description: High expectations for this place on the basis of the other glowing reviews.  Most importantly, the paella was mediocre at best.  I don't remember all of the dishes that we ordered, but none of them were particularly good.  The potatoes were fine, but then again it's kind of hard to really mess up potatoes.
author: Matthew M.

description: Food is okay, service needs work. I was there with a large party and some people were ordering a picture of sangria, which the waiter took and then ignored the rest of the table (as I had wanted a glass of wine).  I had to flag down the waiter later and ordered my glass of wine, which never showed.  Luckily it was not on the bill, but I was still disappointed that the wait staff seemed completely disorganized and unattentive.  With mediocre food, I say go elsewhere where at least the staff pays attention.
author: Kelley P.

description: Esperpento has the most inexpensive Tapas on this side of the Mississippi. Okay, maybe not, but certainly the most inexpensive in San Francisco. And they're yummy. Everything is garlic-logged, so I wouldn't recommend a first date here. I think I smelled of garlic for a few days after eating here last week. The staff is accommodating (I've been here a few times and they've always been really gracious, especially when we had a big party whose size kept changing before we were seated). The shrimp, green beans, MUSHROOMS, etc. were all very garlicky and very delicious. They were kind of skimping on the bread (a baguette that tasted like it was baked at least the day before), but if you ask they will bring. This is a great place to take a party if you're not wanting to spend a lot of cash. The sangria is very drinkable; perhaps a little sweet but it goes down so well. It's a great little Mission find.
author: Lisa F.

description:
We made a 6:30 reservation, when we got there the place was full and they said reservations didn't matter. We should have left then but we were celebrating. 
I am torn because the food was average, but not horrible. The vegetable platter was above average, everything on the meat platter was dry. 
But, here is the reason, I would never go back and if you do go, please check your bill.
After a brief discussion with a woman, who may have been the owner, We ordered paella for 2. (there were 5 of us).  Only 3 of us wanted any at all. We were charged for paella for 4. Which was a $24.00 error. When we brought up the error to the server (who another reviewer referred to as useless....and I concur) he immediately argued with us and we asked to see the woman who we placed the order with. She adamantly argued and said that our minor daughter OK'd it. What? Are you kidding me? Needless to say, they would not credit us the difference.  
There are too many restaurants in this city to deal with this type of impervious attitude and inconsistent food quality. Don't bother.
author: A J T.

description: I came here on a Thursday night with my daughter and one of my girlfriends from the city. It was my first time trying Spanish food and now I'm hooked! We ordered a variety of small plates ranging from grilled salmon to the roasted potatoes w/ spicy aioli sauce. (I swear, everyone in the place had this dish at their table.) Absolutely delicious! The food was extremely flavorful, light, and comforting. The service was excellent. The ambiance was cozy and festive. I can't wait to bring my husband here...the next time I come back, I definitely will be ordering a pitcher of their sangria!
author: Angie L.

description: My favorite tapas place in the city.  Cheap, great food.  Snobs can go to Ramblas down Valencia but real tapas lovers, come here!
author: Noel S.

description: Went here for a birthday day dinner... The food is great.. Really reminds me of eating in SPAIN. If you have been to Spain and like the food you will like this place.. You cant go wrong with a place that serves rabbit for dinner. We had a bunch of TAPAS. I think they were all great (did not help that we had two big pitches of SANGRIA) The wine is GREAT.. The dessert is great as well.. Go here if you like SPANISH FOOD!
author: Matt S.

description: this is such a fun place to eat at.  bring lots of friends, order tons of tapas to share, drink plenty of sangria and be merry.  the place is a little cramped and can get a little stuffy.  oh and your clothes will smell of fried foods when you leave.
author: Leon C.

description: when I want spanish food, definetely I go to sperpento. the food is good and the service is very friendly.  it can get crowd though.  wheather you are vegetarian or not, sperpento has something for you.  recommended.
author: sixth s.

description:
paella. is. to. die. for.  DIE. 

potatoes are quite good too, as were the mushrooms (you can pass on the artichokes) but the paella...i can eat the paella everyday for the rest of my life, i reckon!

minus 1/2 a star for the waitress...she was OKAY, but service could have been better.  minus another 1/2 star for the filthy bathroom.
author: jozilla w.

description:
I went to Esperpento five years ago with a group of friends and we tried about 8-10 dishes, I remember they all tasted good. Since it was my first time having Tapas, everything seemed new and exciting. I was not uncomfortable despite the place being noisy and packed and lines of people standing outside.

     I had been wanting to go back, but I forgot the name. I kept looking for Tapas in San Francisco but went back to the wrong ones. Ended up at Ramblas.  I finally came across it recently and grab my friend to go back there with fond memories. 

     Everything is still nearly the same.  The color of the walls, the noise. The hostess was friendly and fast in seating us, but the waiter was cranky. The food that came were all cold and undercooked. The shrimp was still gray and raw, I had to send it back to re-grilled it. The eggplant was cold and filled with grease, tasteless, my friend got a stomach ache later.  After 4 dishes, I got frustrated and stopped ordering. Dinners were like going to the flea market, fighting to get table and waiter's attention, it is not worth the trouble if you want a relaxing evening. Parking also took a while. I do like a lot of dishes and wanted to try 10 of them, but after this experience, I don't know if I want the trouble again.  I took off a star for the cold, uncooked food,  the grumpy waiter who did warm up to me later.  The place is just so loud it is hard for conversations.  I guess I will wait another five years to go back. Perhaps they will improve. I really want to like this place since it gave me such good memory the first time.  I believe they are a victim of fame from recently being on "Check please bay area."
author: A Z.

description: in my opinion this is the best tapas place in the city. the group we went with had mixed feelings about it though. they have a ton of veggies options (not the case with more chi-chi cha cha cha), adorable atmosphere, bright colors, close tables, mariachis and great service.
author: Amy P.

description:
xiringuito escriba on the beach on barcelona -- that's what i am comparing all paella experiences to from now on. unfair? hmmm...once you factor in the the location next to the mediterranean, the gorgeous catalan people walking by, the sea of hot, tan beach bods frolicking in the sand, and the off the charts seafood paella that oozed with complex flavor and umami? yes, i might be being unfair. but whatever, if you're going to serve something, you should make it the BEST...or at least TRY! 

we walk out of the garage on 22nd and mission and are on our way to beretta when we get distracted by the crowd in front of esperpento. i am in the mood for italian, but think that having tapas and cava would bring back memories from my trip. i imagine i will be able to close my eyes, take a bite of paella, and be transported back to the beach in barca. "let's just try it...", I say. 

kevin is surprised I suggest such a spur of the moment change of plans. i NEVER do that. once i set my heart on something, i'm focused and will not be happy unless i get it. i'm a brat like that, i guess. oh well...there's a first for everything. but now i realize why i never change plans...

ordered a rioja while we waited for our table. $5.50 a glass? off to a good start. 

we get seated upstairs. barely any ventilation, kind of stuffy -- that's fine. it's cold outside. and it was hot, hot, hot in spain. we're still ok. the reminiscing isn't ruined yet.

ordered the patatas bravas, gambas ala plancha, and the special paella with lobster, calamari and clams. a bottle of brut is only $16! one of those, too, please. prices seem super reasonable, so i'm still a happy camper. 

then, the food comes. we get the potatoes and the prawns first. the only notable thing from these two dishes is the sauce for the potatoes which tastes exactly like the red sauce from la vic's in san jose, so nothing mind-blowing there. the prawns are tasty. they cook them whole, so i am able to enjoy the shrimp heads, but still...doesn't compare to bar pinotxo at la boqueria market where the gambas was as big as my hand and there was so much fat in the heads of the shrimp that i was able to soak my bread in it.

i am hoping the paella is better. it isn't. there is absolutely NO FLAVOR in the rice. NONE! it's like they cooked the rice in chicken stock (with no salt)...and that's it. uh...where's the garlic? where's the saffron? wth? at least the lobster isn't overcooked. i'm so disappointed with the paella that kevin orders something else -- spanish sausage with white beans. dude...this tastes like fried spam. yes, SPAM! (maybe it's short for spanish ham, i dunno.) anyways, kevin likes the beans since it's flavored with spam. he's thinking of making this at home now for breakfast the next day. eh, at least he got an idea out of it. bleh...by this time, i'm over the whole thing. i'll just have to find another $450 roundtrip flight to barcelona and go back to escriba to satisfy my paella cravings. but now i'm getting drunk from the rioja and brut and nothing seems to matter. ah well, live and learn, right? 

in hindsight, i guess i should've known better. one look at the crowd of kids eating here with their pitchers of sangria and forever 21 'fits, i should have realized that none of them have probably eaten good food...and, more importantly, never eaten good spanish food. 

BUT...yes, there's a "but"...if you're looking for cheap food, cheap drinks, and a decent ambience, might as well check this place out. it's less crowded than cha cha cha (which i cannot stand), the food is marginally better, and it's walking distance to the rest of the hot spots in the mission.
author: Nini G.

description: This was simply a terrible experience. The food was OK but is def. not good enough to be worth the treatment we received. the place was packed with tables that it was virtually impossible to hit by every passerby including staff. The waiter "Christiano" Was the rudest person I have ever encountered in my life and totally not suited to be working as a waiter, he comes huffing and puffing and demands that we gave him our order and since we had just been seated and were not ready to order and just ordered drinks he left huffing and puffing. Through our dinner was interrupted by a horrid voiced person who was playing the guitar and singing so loudly and badly and when he finished he came begging for money and sine we were actually in the middle of a conversation we did not pay attention to him that is when he looked at us and said something like "no spekee Englis" very funny. Then finally when it was time to pay we wanted to pay by using 4 credit cards, ( i have been in restaurants who took up to 8 cards) So Another girl she was nice enough took our cards and bill, a minute later our cheery friend Christiano comes, throws the bill and cards on the table and say to us "Up to two cards only or cash", one of our party spoke to the manager who was really nice and said he will take care of it, Christiano came back a minute later and threw and I am not kidding threw the bills on the table and left without a word. Oh yes, he had the gall to add 18% service fee even though our group was 5 not 6. In short the food was ok, the service sucked big time, the manager was nice enough but really needs to pay more attention to how his staff treat their guests. I would never go there again and I recommend against going there.
author: S I.

description: The service can be spotty, but at these affordable prices, you can't really complain. I love the selection, the surprise of unusual dishes, requisite garlic, aioli, tortilla, sangria, ropa vieja... It's a reliable source of good food and a great spot for inexpensive social meals when you're craving fairly traditional Spanish tapas. I actually found the tapas in Spain to be A LOT more oily, so I prefer this healthier selection. Gambas al ajillo are my favorite. Only one suggestion: beware the salt content. Tapas are meant to be eaten with a copious amounts of beer.
author: L I.

description: very good food. small dishes for cheap which add up but if you're like me and don't need copious volumes of food to satiate you it's great. good sangria. try the salad (kind of like niçoise but spanish) and the garlic shrimp. the third time i was there they had mexican mariachi, not spanish but nice nevertheless.
author: Josie K.

description: Hubby and I just came back from Esperpento and were very disappointed.  We have been here numerous times and have taken guests here as well and have enjoyed it.  But tonight, it was good-bye to this place because as we were eating our seafood paella we found a twistie in it. The paella also was not that good and we concluded this before the twistie incident.  The waitress was very kind and apologized but kept asking us if we were sure we did not want to take it home..which I felt a little guilty about and it was weird because hello, there was a piece of metal in our food and I do not want to find any more!  The owner was there and took the cost of the appetizers off our bill, which was weird as well because the appetizers were good and it was what filled us up considering we had to leave most of our paella uneatan.  So, when they were processing our bill, we downed the sangria (the best part of the evening) and said our farewell.
author: Shilpa K.

description: I had the meatballs, sauteed calamari, potatoes and I tried my friend's chicken adobo - the chicken was the only thing that wasn't completely bland. I have no idea why this place is so popular. And it's such an easy fix too - just add some flavor and it would be great!
author: Allison W.

description: Hands-down the best tapas I've had in the city - every single dish I've had here was deelish - exceptional dishes include the oxtail stew (don't say "ew" until you've tried it) and the potato omelet (can't remember the real name, but you'll find it) - and for olive-lovers, the aceitunas are ridiculously tasty.  Other upsides? the weekend host is super friendly and sometimes gives you a free sangria pitcher to enjoy outside if the wait is a bit long and there's a cheap parking garage right across the street.  Downsides? it's really loud and crowded, especially on the weekends.
author: Kylene S.

description: hellishly loud, paella, mariachis, sangria, diet sized plates, bread with butter, endless lemon, chunky waiters, and spicy potatoes. what are u waiting for?
author: ray c.

description: Sister restaurant to Picaro, although a bit smaller and busier (although other reviewers have had the opposite experience). Very similar menu to Picaro filled with cheap, flavorful tapas plates.
author: Michael H.

description: i think picaro, the sister restaurant located at 16th between valencia and guerrero is better, but this place holds its own. we found the tortilla de patata (i love that word!! say it - pah-tah-tah) to be tasty, and the grilled calamari was quite good. it seems we missed out by not ordering the sangria, but it wasn't too expensive, and tasty enough. the green beans were a little boring, but then again, there is only so much you can do with green beans.
author: monkey l.

description: fine food, service could be better, prices were good for such sizable tapas portions. overall underwhelmed.
author: Clover Dan ..

description: Great food, fast service, and not too expensive. I have to say the garlic shrimp and omlettes were my favorite. The chicken croquettes were kind of wierd. You coudln't tell that it was chicken inside. Just a bunch of white mush.
author: Olivia H.

description: i've wanted to try this place for a while. finally gave it a try last friday. the lady and i were seated almost right away. for a friday night, i was pretty impressed. we sat in this cozy little alcove in the back. the sangria here is very good. the pitchers are large too. beware! between my gf and i, we had 2 pitchers and we were on our way to getting pretty drunk! probably the best dish was the spicy potatos. the garlic shrimp was so so - but it provided for a nice dipping sauce for our bread. i'd definately come back and try some other stuff off the menu. the service is a little slow, but it didn't really bother me a whole lot. i actually like taking my time while drinking/eating. besides, it's spanish - not american ... this is how they do it in europe. dinner is not mean't to be inhaled in 5 minutes.
author: James J.

description: Good variety, reasonably priced, cute decor.   Try the grilled artichoke it was fabulous!  I never had it served like that anywhere else.
author: Khloe M.

description: Truthfully - it's just spicy potatoes and a little sangria, right... Wrong!  For some reason the cozy little warm yellow dining room of esperpento, complete with the mariachi band trolling for tips and the waitresses getting overworked just makes me happy (and hungry).  It has all the typical tapas dishes (from a veg standpoint at least, it was pointed out to me last time that there is no ceviche on the menu, so beware) - and they are really tasty and the sangria is REALLY strong.  good times.
author: Anjali K.

description: This is an exquisite dining spot to take for a date or just a great friend. The spot maybe tiny but the service and quality of food are definitely above and beyond expectation. The paella is fantastic. The sangria is delicious (could use more fruit though). And the ambiance teleports you away from the racket of the Mission and into this blissful dining experience that is one of a kind.
author: Richard R.

description: Fun vibe and great paella, but terrible service.  If you prepare yourself to ask for your drink 3 times before receiving it, you'll probably really enjoy Esperanto.
author: Tracy R.

description: Maybe they were having a bad night. Maybe the chef just quit. But when we went there someone was phoning it in. The food tasted like it was rolled right off of a Sysco truck. Unimaginative, over-salted, overcooked.
author: Randy D.

description:
This place is awesome! I don't understand why this restaurant is only getting 3.5 stars. 
Last night after shopping in SF, my boyfriend and I decided to have tapas for dinner. So we went on yelp to see which restaurant sounds good. Unfortunately, the wireless wasn't working really well, so we didn't really have a chance to see all the reviews for the restaurants to compare. We ended up randomly choosing a restaurant, which, apparently, is Esperpento. The parking was really hard to find, so we ended up parking on mission. So we got to Esperpento, and fortunately, there were 2 tables free. So we sat down and ordered the exotic chicken, spicy potato, grilled vegetable salad, ox-tail stew, fried calamari, and the special drink that everyone else is having. (forgot what that's called) All of the food that we ordered are really delicious, even my boyfriend who normally doesnt really eat vegetables liked the grilled veggie salad. He also said that for the red wine-lovers, they would definitely like that drink.
author: Gaby C.

description: We used to like this place, but had an unpleasant experience today; our paella had a metal twistie in it. That's borderline ok with me as mistakes happen. The nice waitress was very apologetic and offered us free deserts which we refused due to loss of appetite. We did not mind paying the full bill and said so, but the owner had the audacity to not charge for appetizers ($10) but charged for the paella ($26). That's like saying "We are kind of sorry". I'm never going back here.
author: Chaitresh S.

description: Mmmm spicy potatoes, spicy waitress......Not ONLY did we get our amazing spanish tapas served hot and fresh, the waitress was incredibly accommodating. I loved the fact we were eating Spanish tapas in a cute little atmosphere which included a cute little Spanish girl.....I think her name was Rocio, or Roccia? Either way, the patatas bravas were exceptionally good, and the paella was mouth watering. Thank you, for an amazing experience in both food, atmosphere, and waitstaff. We will return!
author: Diana D.

description: Nice tapa place offering decent fod and rowdy atmosphere.  The service was very friendly and the food was quite good given their price tag.
author: Matt S.

description: i loveeeee this place. fantastic food. the restaurant itself is small, but cozy. their all meat paella was to die for. also, if you like foods with a kick and lots of flavor, the patatas bravas is a must try. definetly wouldnt mind coming here weekly!
author: Jessie B.
